Can only be used with Griot's clay, you will damage your paint if you use this as a lubricant with most other clay bars.Speed Shine does not have enough lubricity or cleaning power to be used as a true instant detailer/clay lube.  The product is very "wet" and it should be more slippery.  When you spray it on your paint, it tends to run instead of cling.  If you have bird droppings or some other contaminants, I found the cleaning power to be on the weak side. The consistency looks something like "watered-down" milk when it should look like regular milk.Speed Shine is also is a terrible lubricant. It manages to work with Griot's clay but it is not compatible with most other brands of clay.  I used it with Meguiar's medium clay and I nearly damaged the paint on my car. I thought the clay was the problem but it was the Speed Shine.  My paint had clay streaks and it just looked messed up.  Luckily I didn't do more than half of the hood so I managed to clean up the mess. Even with Griot's clay, Speed Shine just seems too weak.Another problem I noticed is that the Speed Shine seems so unstable.  The product seems to separate if you don't agitate it every other day.  I had a bottle that was a year old and the product literally separated and I could not shake it up and mix the blue with the clear liquid.I am very disappointed with Speed Shine.  It is the only Griot's product that I don't like.  I only have an 8oz bottle and I use it to clean my drum set and other misc. items around the house that need a quick shine.  I would never use this on my car.  There are so many other instant detailers on the market today and most of these will perform better than the Speed Shine.  Personally I use a commercial product manufactured by Hi-Temp called Clay Lube.  It is even the same color as Speed Shine. It addresses each and every one of Speed Shine's shortcomings and I am very happy with it.  Meguiar's Instant Detailer and Mothers Instant Detailer are also fine products.  Since Griot's products are really more for special rides, perhaps Speed Shine would be more appropriate for an already clean car that only has some dust and fingerprints.  I don't like Speed Shine for daily drivers.I don't recommend this product.  Buy another instant detailer.Tip:  As with any quick detailer and/or clay, always make sure you are working on a cool surface.  These products are not designed for working in the sun.

I actually own the older yellow model.I understand the newer model has an upgraded grill and can measure the appropriate amount of car wash.That's fine and it certainly is an improvement over the model that I have but the two units still look the same and suffer from one big problem.That problem is that they are too big to be used effectively as wash buckets. They are light when they are empty but once you fill them with six gallons of water, they become quite cumbersome. Just picture a steep driveway and a runaway bucket with six gallons of water! Luckily my yellow model does not have the casters so I don't have to picture that scenario. But then again, I can't move the bucket around easily because it is heavy.I personally use a standard Rubbermaid bucket to wash my car and I use this Ultimate Car Wash Bucket to store my detailing brushes. I tried to wash my car with this bucket a few times but I just found using a standard old bucket to be more effective. In the end, car washing is not a science, you don't need grit guards and all this fancy stuff. I mean what is a grit guard going to do for you? Some debris will still make their way to the good water.As a storage bucket, it's great and it holds all my long-handled brushes and small brushes. I am happy with the product because it solves another problem for me in that it holds a lot of my detailing supplies.I'll give it three stars because it's an awkward wash bucket but a great storage bucket. Considering the price, I'm sure you could find a better alternative for either use.

I've been an avid detailing enthusiast since 1995 and I have been using Griot's products exclusively since 2003. Overall I like their products and they have certainly met my expectations.  I have been using Spray-on Wax for several years now and I will offer you my take on this specific product.First, it smells like bananas.  Seriously, I enjoy spraying the car because it makes the air smell like bananas. It's even yellow like a banana.You have to understand what this product is and what it isn't. Don't buy it thinking that it is a true spray-on wax.  This product can either be used as a high gloss enhancer or a base-wax enhancer.  If you have a coat of wax already on your car, after you wash the car, you spray this product on while the car is still wet and then dry it. The "base-wax" then becomes enhanced or rejuvenated.  If your car is not waxed, you can also use this product to enhance the gloss and you should get some basic protection and "slipperyness" for a few days.This product has to be applied to a freshly washed car that is already wet.  Do not try to apply this to a dry car as you will get streaks.  I've generally avoid spraying on glass and plastic but during application some mist does get on these surfaces and I have not noticed any streaking.  Of course, the final step for me is to clean the windows with glass cleaner so if there is any streaking, the glass cleaner will take it away.  I highly recommend you use this product with their waffle-weave drying towel.  Actually, I think this product works best with that towel as it not only dries the car faster but it spreads the wax around uniformly without any lint.  I no longer dry my cars with cotton towels as they don't work as well as microfiber IMO. Also the waffle-weave microfiber towel cuts drying time in half as you just simply have to go over the paint with one pass and it absorbs all the water.  Cotton products tend to streak and they always leave behind lint.I'll give the product 4 stars simply because it is rather expensive.  Griot's sells you 35oz with no sprayer and the 35oz gets used up faster than you would think.  Also, Griot's is still mail-order for the most part so you can't just buy this one product alone; you usually have to buy a few items to make the shipping worthwhile. I'd give it five stars if it was more economical and had more protection. (EDIT: As of 10/25/11, Griot's still has FREE SHIPPING).As far as durability, I personally use this as a gloss enhancer and I can get a few days of shine on a freshly WASHED car.  This is demonstrated by the fact that the water will still bead up after a few days. To save money, when my car is already waxed, I don't apply this product as the base wax is much stronger than this. Other than that, Spray-on Wax is no substitute for a monthly or bi-monthly wax job.  The only thing that I wish Griot's would change is that I wish they could "juice" this Spray-on Wax up as well as their Speed Shine.  I want more protection from this product and I want more durability from the Speed Shine. In other words, I would like to use the Speed Shine as a gloss enhancer and the Spray-On Wax as a true spray-on wax.Griot's products are really for garage-kept vehicles and show cars, I think they are overkill for daily drivers.  In the next year, I am planning on switching back to Meguiar's or Mothers due to price. Also I have had a few quality control issues with Griot's bottles and sprayers that are kind of annoying.I have no problem recommending Griot's products though. The Spray-on Wax is a good product when used correctly and I think you will like it.

I've actually been using this for the past few years with my Nuvi 760.  I did not like the position or the "ring" of the window mounts.  Also the window mounts will mount the GPS so far from you that you cannot operate it while driving and because it is farther away from you, the screen looks even smaller.This vent mount is built really well, it is not bulky, and it looks great.  It mounts the GPS in the best possible position for you to clearly view the screen as well as operate the screen while driving (when you are at a stop of course.)The only thing I would change on this unit is that I wonder if they could engineer it to mount/dismount a lot quicker.  You have to manually depress the clips to hook them to your vent and then depress them again to remove the unit.  I wish there was a way just to hook and unhook in one movement as it makes it easier to move from car to car.  To solve the "wobble" problem just make sure that the hinge is mounted to the lowest possible vent fin that you can use.  If the hinge is mounted to a vent fin that is higher up, you will get more wobble as it is not as stable. Also the ball mount is not fluid at all, you need to use both hands to adjust the tilt of the screen.  For the price, I don't think you could expect more.Other than that, I don't know of a better way to mount a GPS unit in your car.  My review is more like 4.5 stars.  I have to deduct that one star because after a while, install/removal does became a chore.I would buy this again in a second and I would recommend it to anybody.

I just developed an interest in gardening and this was one of the tools that I needed for my project.I bought this same tool at Home Depot for the same price.  The unit seems well-built and has the desirable squared tines. The ergonomics are also good, and it did everything I wanted it to do.  I might have even over-abused the unit by trying to get under some heavy weeds and raise them.  The handle stood up to this abuse with no signs of giving or stress.  The only problem I have is that the plastic D-handle has now become loose.  Not really loose but it definitely is not tight anymore.  I think the hole where the metal rod goes through in the wood has become enlarged due to the constant up and down pressure that I placed on it.  There is no way I can tighten the handle because I believe it is riveted on.I used this tool to dig up and turn over a 20x4' area and this tool made quick work of the job. I was actually trying to do the job with a round-point shovel but I noticed it was taking too long. Once I bought this tool, the job was much easier.  I actually have all Ames garden tools and they seem to be of the same quality as this fork.If you are looking for a spading fork, I have no problem recommending this one. I just have to deduct one star because of the handle as I don't think it can be fixed and I don't think it should become loose even with the abuse I dealt it.Overall, this is a great tool at a reasonable price.

I bought this book because I am a student and I will be taking Intro. to Financial Accounting this summer.  I just wanted a head start before the semester begins as I don't know anything about accounting.  This book was very easy to read and comprehend and I actually finished it in just two days.  If you have a whole day to spare, you can easily get through this in a day with extra time to spare!What I liked about this book was that it makes a point or a statement and then re-emphasizes that point or statement many times until you get it.  As a result, I did not get lost in this book.  There were one or two points that didn't make a whole lot of sense but I scored a 90% on the end of book test. Accounting sounds pretty boring but this book really did make it seem somewhat interesting.The writing is in big print and heavily spaced with color charts.  I would say it is engaging and the chapters are short so you don't get frustrated. The book is definitely not intimidating like a textbook.After reading the book, the accounting principles make sense to me and I can now understand why things are the way they are.  If anything, the fact that I learned that the "Left side has to balance with the right side" has helped me to understand the purpose of financial accounting. Also for a basic book, I was surprised that the book talked about prepaid expenses.  The prepaid expenses used as an example in this book will give you an understanding of the adjustment concept. This book also does get into FIFO and LIFO but again, it gives you the overall picture.  FIFO and LIFO in a textbook is much more in depth.This is by no means a full course in accounting.  I flipped through my school textbook and there are things in there that you won't learn here.  The purpose of this book is to give you the "Big picture."  I think after reading this book you will be less intimidated by accounting and you will feel comfortable learning it.The one part of the book that I wish they could change was that for certain charts, you have to constantly flip back to previous pages or chapters to get the information.  That's a little too tedious for me.I will try to update this review once I finish my class to let you know how much this book has ultimately helped me.Overall:I liked the book, I learned something, and I will recommend it.I'll give the book four stars just because I think the authors could have thrown in some extra material in the book without making it much harder and the fact that you still have to flip back to complete some of the charts.Other than that, the book is worth buying.EDIT: July 7, 2011.  It is now July and I have completed my Intro to Financial Accounting class.  I am happy to report that I received an A in the class. I can honestly say that this book played a part in that because I was prepared for the class before it started.  In my initial review I gave it four stars because I thought it was too basic.  I'm going to change my review to five stars because I think it is probably better that way.  If this book was harder, than you might get confused.  I think this book keeps it simple but gives you the main ideas that you need to really understand.  After reading this book, either take an accounting class or work through a textbook to understand all the other concepts.*****I want to strictly emphasize that this book is a great introduction to FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING ONLY. Managerial accounting is totally different.  This book has NOTHING to do with managerial accounting just in case you were wondering.*****Overall, highly recommended.EDIT: August 4, 2012.  After taking Intermediate I and II, I can tell you that this book is in every sense of the word only a "basic" introduction to accounting.  Once you get to Intermediate II where you are calculating leases, bonds, etc., you will begin to see how hard accounting really is.  I still highly recommend this book but just be aware that accounting is not just simple debits and credits like you see in this book.  Once you have to start calculating the debits and credits, that is actually real accounting --and it is not easy.

You can get this same item at Home Depot for thirty five bucks.  The price is inflated on Amazon because they are going to get you for the shipping as this is a cumbersome item. So just stop by at Home Depot and pick this one up yourself.I needed a wheelbarrow for a gardening project that became bigger and messier than I expected.  I went to home depot and picked this one up because it was the cheapest one that they had.  It is sold (or shipped) in three parts.  You get a parts box which is not too big, the plastic bin itself, and the wooden handles.Setup was fairly easy and I did it by myself.  The only tool you will need is a 13mm socket.The unit looks really good and the plastic bin is pretty strong and I don't think it would crack unless you seriously go out of your way to compromise it.  I went ahead and loaded the bin to the brim with soil.  Moving the wheelbarrow was surprisingly pretty easy.  The wheel/tire can make or break a good wheelbarrow and the wheel on this unit is very good and navigates well through different terrain.  I didn't have a problem with wobbling, any sense of imbalance, or moving from grass to concrete. The wheel is of good quality and certainly makes using this model very easy. Unloading is pretty easy too with a fluid up and down motion.I did notice some flexing when fully loaded with heavy weight but then again I could have always made two trips.  I wouldn't load this wheelbarrow up with that much weight on a regular basis as I think you could possibly break the unit.  If I could change one thing, I would swap the plastic "levelers" (those black things that keep the red plastic bin level.)  I would swap them with metal pieces because that would make the wheelbarrow at least twice as strong.  The plastic "leveler" things are the weakest link on this wheelbarrow and if they crack or become loose, you would be in trouble as the whole unit will be rendered useless. I had to deduct the one star because I think they could have given you those metal parts without increasing the price too much.Overall, considering the price, I have no problem recommending the unit as it will do the job. Until I bought this wheelbarrow, I didn't realize how much I needed one.  If you are planning on doing heavy-duty work or if you need a wheelbarrow for daily use, you probably should spend the extra money for a metal unit.  Other than that, for gardening and occasional heavy usage, this unit is a great buy. It also looks good too!

I take pretty good care of myself to begin with. I thought this book would go above and beyond the most basic of grooming and hygiene and teach me some tricks I don't know. I was wrong.This book is small and the advice given is very basic. You are probably doing most of the stuff here already. I actually got the impression that this book was intended for slobs or people who have little to no manners or sense of style.The only part of the book that I found interesting was the natural deodorant recipe because you could spray it on your whole body. But then again, you could find this on the internet somewhere. Other than that, I know how to wash my face, trim my nose hairs, shave my pubes, get a haircut, check for bad breath, and wipe my mouth after I eat. After about a few pages, I knew this book was not going in the right direction for me. After I finished it, I didn't come away with any tips which were that much different than my current grooming habits.This book gets one star because of the high price to useful information ratio. The advice contained in this book could easily be added as a chapter in a book on "Manners for men" or any other "Men's style book." I'm not trying to knock the author for his efforts, it's just that the title leads you to believe one thing but the book delivers something totally different. Honestly if you want grooming secrets, all you have to do is subscribe to a men's magazine or just talk to your girlfriends and even your fellow guy friends.I found a USED copy on eBay for 99 cents. I actually decided to sell it back because it was not something I would keep on my bookshelf.Take my advice, you can pass on this title; it's not an ultimate guide to anything. Just flip through some men's magazines and you'll be good.  Or better yet, get a girlfriend and she can give you some advice for free.  Do not buy this book to meet women.Also beware of the five star reviews on this site as they are from the author. Nobody in their right mind would give this book five stars...only someone trying to push the book.

These are good, no frills, basic,  fast deflators. We've used this type od deflator for many years. You can screw them on quickly on all four tires and then make the rounds with your tire gauge and remove them subsequently as you hit your desired air-down pressure. We keep/store them on the Jeep key chain(s) so they are always handy and ready to use. All four deflators screw together for safe keeping. No need for fancier more costly versions/designs.

The 2015 OxyLED BTL-10 Rechargeable LED Bicycle light is reasonably priced and offers multi-mode red LED rechargeable bicycle safety light functions with both red rear facing LEDs and down facing red bike"safety Lane/line"  LEDs. With a full charge the bike light operated for ~four hours with both light features operating in rapid flashing mode.Light Mode Details: The light has eight (8) rear-facing LEDs and two (2) laser safety line projectors, each controlled by separate buttons. The multi-modes  (controlled by additional successive button pushes) includes solid eight LED on, flashing 8 LEDs on, multi-pattern three LEDs flashing. The laser line safety line LEDs offers solid on, slow, or fast flash modes via a separate switch.Recharging details: A two-prong wall outlet mount 120v to USB power adapter with power LED and USB-to-mini plug power cord is included (see as-opened review photo) view) to recharge this Li-Ion battery powered light. There is no "charge complete" feature in the system. The light comes with a one-year warranty. Specs indicate an internal 1000 mAh 3.7V 14500-type (~AA sized)  Li-Ion battery.Mounting details: The thumb screw bracket plastic mount required no tools for mounting/removal of the bracket and allows for easy mounting and removal of the light. A retaining clip on the mount, makes a positive lock with the slide on-off bike light. The mount will accommodate a seat/ frame tube as small as ~23mm up to 34mm and allows for pivot adjustment to horizontal orientation for proper light projection. The mount is of moderate strength construction - recommend being gentle/careful with it.The safety lane/laser lines are a nice idea but bright vehicle headlights would likely wash out the thin LED lines so they are not likely visible to drivers from a distance. They look great from the bike in the dark, and would be visible to pedestrians other nearby bicyclists at night.The case has a has a solid precision made look and is finished with a flat black rubberized finish. The finish or case edges may get marred if you carry the light unprotected in a tool bag or drop the light on rough pavement. Because it has an LED element design, vice fragile less efficient incandescent bulbs, it should withstand vibrations and small drops well.Disclosure: this product was received as an evaluation unit for review purposes from vendor hisgadget.com and is available for purchase on Amazon.com, with Prime shipping available. We have purchased other OxyLED products and they have worked well for us.

Find a new home for your tiny 1 amp USB chargers they just don't have the power capacity need by larger smart phones or iPad tablets. With today's larger smart phones ("phablets")  and mini-tablets the old 1 amp low watt USB cube charger adapters simply do not put out enough power to properly or quickly charge these larger devices, and many larger cube adapters have only one 2.4 amp port, and can only charge one high demand  item at a time. This can charge two 2.4 amp devices simultaneously.The attractively priced well built iClever 2.4 amp  x2 (4.8 amp) USA 2 prong 120VAC 24 watt dual cube is the size of an OEM Apple iPad/tablet  USB power adapter and has soft blue (unobtrusive) LED lighting inside the USB ports to let you know it's properly connected in the wall outlet. It can charge two high-demand (2.4 amp) devices at the same time. It is available in black or white housing color.This SmartID power adapter cube (allows safe rapid charging for devices that support this tech) charged a large Samsung Galaxy "phablet" smart phone and an iPhone 6 Plus easily. The fit and finish is smooth and precise. The fold-able power prongs function smoothly as they disappear into the housing for travel transport in your pocket, a briefcase or a suitcase, and appears very solid mechanically. This item is highly recommended.

Of all the compatible, non-OEM USB/data cables we've purchased over the years, the Amazon Basics USB cables for Android and Apple products have been the absolute best. They are well made and a good value which is BTW the marketing goal of the Amazon Basics brand. They are made with strong connector housings that are strongly bonded to the wire/cable portion, and don't separate from the wire, and the connector elements stay intact. We've has several cheaply off-brand USB cable come apart either at the connector end or the cable separates for the connector. Amazon Basics cables are highly recommended

CREE XM-L2 generation element. This is a nicely made/well finished premium LED flashlight. Very bright high output light 920 lumens in turbo with 18650 Li-Ion, and 1000 lumens w/2xCR123A batteries. Has a claimed 160 meter/525 foot beam range. 2 to 720 hour battery life based upon brightness high through moonlight. Claimed waterproof to IPX-7 (1 meter depth).Nice product but not a huge value so gets a 4 (pretty darn good) vice 5 (wow!) star rating. Warranty: 30 day return to original retailer, and 5 year repair/replacement warranty from Olight Technology Co. Shenzhen, China not sure how practical that would/will be. There is a USA Olight site at http://www.olightusa.com but it was down for maintenance at the time of this review.The vertical (standing) USB connector powered magnetic charging stand (750 mA rate) with USB pass through is convenient/effective and does not require battery removal. Charging stand LED glows red when flashlight in in position and turns green when charging is complete.Not having the typical end-cap on-off switch (has a magnetic charging mount)  does require some use adaptation techniques, we use the pocket clip mounted 180 (other side) from the side located on-off switch position as a "locate by feel" reference point. Memorizing the button click pattern to get to all the modes (brightness and strobe) takes some deliberate thought, but is not difficult. Has a nice battery saving low moonlight setting (claimed 720 hours), and also a "memory" position.Our Olight package included a 18650 battery, a belt holster, a 12volt auto USB power adapter, and two bonus night light LED light sticks.

Product replaced lost OEM adapter for a MacBook. Works as expected. Appears well made and finished.Hard to get excited about an Ethernet-to-USB adapter but when you need one,  you need one - for better connectivity speed than what wireless can offer.

Complete kit, screen digitizer high quality no issues, good quality tools. We were worried by the quality control issues/poor reviews of the lower priced screen replacement-only screen parts on Amazon. The instruction booklet was very thorough and the magnetized tools were a higher quality than previous iPhone tool kits we have purchased vis Amazon/others. Highly recommend the "splunger" tool set available elsewhere on Amazon.Over the years, I've replaced two iPhone 4 screens, Li-Ion cell batteries, one iPhone 5 screen, and a power supply in an old iMac all-in-one flat panel desktop that Apple no longer supports/services - great fun.It is within the capability of nearly any patient semi-technically adept person with good eyesight (the screws are TINY)  to replace a cracked screen or replace the Li-Ion battery in an iPhone 5/4.Replacing the screen in the 5/ / 5s is MUCH easier than the previous generation iPhone 4 which was opened from the back. The iPhone 5 is opened from the front. Give yourself 45 minutes to an hour to accomplish the task in a clean well lighter area. Recommend a large sheet of white paper to position the screws and parts you remove/re-purpose carefully.

Excellent USA made OEM substitute. Replace these struts in pairs (qty two).  Simple "two minute" install. Get a narrow tip flat head screwdriver to release old strut's retaining clips. Procedure: While holding up the hood, on one side loosen old strut's retaining clips and pull off old strut from two ball pivot pins, match positioning of new strut as the old one was, snap in new strut on both pivot balls, repeat on other side.Basically after ~12 years our original nitrogen hood struts on the F-350 simply pooped out as these struts will do after a decade plus. The old ones would just barely hold the heavy hood up on a warm day, but  not in the cool of evening/night. We've read of folks getting thwacked on the head by a falling hood. Didn't happen to us but we were not going to take a chance...These struts are made in U.S.A. by AVM Industries Inc. in Marion County, South Carolina. The Strong Arm #4339 fits F250, F350, and Excursion models basically 1999-2007.

We had several 3.7v 18650 Li-Ion batteries that needed homes and bought these flashlights-only  for them. These larger flashlights are longer battery-life companions to the convenient, powerful and smaller AA sized 14500 Li-Ion powered flashlights available via Amazon Prime.Brightness: The CREE LED OEM website site lists the output of their single XM-L T6 LED element at 1,040 lumens (at 10 Watts maximum, driven at 3 amps maximum.These Cree XM-L T6 element based flashlights are bright (~1050 lumens) and the 18650 batteries have greater capacity/ a longer life than the smaller 14500's. The flashlights are MUCH better than the Techlite 3-Pack 3-AAA Alkaline powered flashlights sold by Costco because they do not have the annoying shelf-storage battery drain-down problem the Techlites have.  After replacing AAA batteries every ~6 months we're simply done with those.The 18650's are a loose fit but our flashlights came with a plastic tube sheath that prevented 18650 battery from rattling in the tube. These come with a triple AAA battery adapter cartridge (3x1.5v=4.5v)  to you can use conventional (AKA primary) batteries if necessary/ desired.Size: Size wise, these fit nicely/comfortable in the average size man's palm (4" across) but are NOT the diminutive size of a 14500-based Cree LED flashlights that fit so nicely and unobtrusively in a pants pocket or small purse. Weight wise, the 18650 based units weigh about 2.6 times the weight of the smaller AA/14500 sized LED flashlights.Dimensions & Weight: To be specific, these larger single-cell 18650 units are 6.85 oz 1.5" in diameter and 5.5" long, much larger and heavier (relatively) than the 2.6 oz 1" in diameter, 3.5" long 14500-cell units (weights are with a Li-Ion cell installed).Modes: While we generally prefer the simplicity of operation of single-mode (on-off) LED flashlights, these units feature a fully acceptable and unobtrusive 5-mode operation. Full single-click button actuations will bring the flashlight to life in "the last mode used." Partial actuations with subtle releases will cycle through the modes - high , medium, low, flashing/strobe, and finally SOS (Morse Code).We have seen videos on the Internet that claim that counterfeit/clone/bogus UtraFires do not support "the last mode used" memory function described above. These did - so they must be "authentic" UtraFire units.Focus: The focus function of these flashlights is also a nice feature. The broad beam gives a uniform and comfortable lighting area suitable for trail walking, or illuminating a night-time work area.Water Resistance: These units are splash/rain resistant but are not 100% waterproof because there is no O-ring seal behind the front strike bezel or in the area of the LED circuit board mount. It is also unknown if there is a O-ring in the Lens head zoom mechanism. There is clearly an O-ring seal at the screw-on base cap. We would not recommend giving these a full-immersion/dunk test.Again, great value and performance for the price. Amazon Prime shipping is a plus.

This is a relatively costly product but it works well for us. This is re-order. We were introduced to this product at a firearms show (leather goods). It is excellent on all natural leathers (not for synthetics). Cleans and shines to a medium luster with a few wipes. No buffing required. Nourishes the leather and lightly seals the surface until the next applications.

The 3.7v 18650 Li-ION batteries work OK and so does the charger. It is a relatively cheaply made Chinese product but appears to work OK with charging indicator lights than change when charging cycle is complete. This is a good accessory for Cree-based Li-ION flashlights.The 18650 cells are normally sized and not too long/too thick like some 18650 cells can be.

The 3.7v 14500 LI-ION batteries work OK and so does the charger. It is a cheaply made Chinese product but appears to work OK with charging indicator lights than change when charging cycle is complete. This is a good accessory for Cree-based Li-ION flashlights.

The 3.7v 14500 LI-ION batteries work OK and so does the charger. It is a cheaply made Chinese product but appears to work OK with charging indicator lights than change when charging cycle is complete. This is a good accessory for Cree-based Li-ION flashlights.

This was a very convenient buy with quick shipping via Amazon Prime.This Propane orifice is required for proper conversion of a large LG / Kenmore natural gas dryer to use with Propane which has a higher energy content.
Bought for its higher performance 100% copper core center conductor. Most home-center sourced coax has lower-quality copper-clad steel center conductor.

Bought for use with a single battery 14500 Li-ION Cree-based mini LED flashlight. The holster case is nice looking and well made but a very snug fit (almost too tight for use) for these flashlights especially with an strike face bezel or base.If you have a wrist lanyard on the flashlight it helps in pulling the flashlight out of these holsters...  e.g. COSMOS  10 pcs Black Nylon Hand Wrist Strap Lanyard available via Amazon.

Not an insignificant price but a good product that supports *both* new Li-ION and older NiCAD vs. NiMH batteries, unlike older chargers. The LED display has multi-function information like charging rate voltage and ends the charging process when complete.
Light duty unit with odd brand labeling but it appears to work with a  Syma X5C quad copter power pack.

These are your usual PPC Ex6xlPlus Rg6 Snap & Seal Outdoor Coax we also bought the multi-cable RG59 RG6 RG11 Cable F-Connector Compression tool available elsewhere on Amazon, to install these connectors on RG cable.
Bought as a gift. This knit hat is well made and looks good. The leather logo patch make it look like a more expensive product.  It is a normal looking off-white color.

Well made trail cam security box fits all Moultrie M-Series game cameras as well as 2012 and later. Excellent fabrication, smooth edges. Box, cut outs match Moultrie M series camera illuminators and lenses.

Reasonable price, works well. Requires a single 9-volt battery. Single button operation. Small square sighting mark with vertical and horizontal LCD reticles appear when ranging button is depressed.Reads in meters or yards, units selectable when battery is changed and retains unit selection with subsequent button activations until battery is either disconnected or replaced. Single screw and tab retains battery door.

Ordered six of these. Uses single battery - all six work great with either rechargeable AA 3.7V 14500 2000mah lithium ion (brighter) or standard alkaline AA (very convenient, but less bright). Did not want a multi-mode flashlight just a single mode on-off. Silicon cover on on-off switch is orange colored.
Perfect fit. Cleaner looking than the two-piece glass tube option it replaced.

The Pit Bull CHIS801 Pit Bull CHIS801 Hole Saw Kit with 12 Saws, 2 Mandrels and Case, 16-Piece is a basic light-duty hole saw set from 3/4" to 5" diameter. This set is available for an additional $10 with white-painted saws (vice oiled saws in this set) if desired at a big box home center on-line. Shipping was prompt.This is not a commercial duty saw set. It is fine for occasional home owner use.

This is a value-priced an unbranded 13.75 inch diagonal digital panel from China. It comes well packaged in a unmarked white box with no instructions or documentation, and in our case, the mentioned 2GB memory card was not present. Since 2GB cards are so cheap ~$3-$5 not a huge deal but note that.This digital panel is available elsewhere for $89.99 including shipping from a USA (New Jersey) warehouse, shipping label stated N&K Trading (~one week cross-country shipping time).This panel has reasonable brightness with good side-to-side horizontal viewing angles, and more limited vertical up down viewing angles. It has internal speakers and can play digital video files with sound. It can also play background music, and present slide shows.

This output voltage/amps info from the Pure-gear website is shared for those who requested it:a) 17 Watts / 3.4 Amps total outputb)  will charge one 2.4 Amps on Apple Lightning connector & 1 Amp device on USB port, simultaneouslyc)  "rapid charges two devices."d) "Let the Car Charger with Lightning connector rapidly charge your iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6, iPhone 5S/5/5C or iPad 4th Gen. and another USB device on the go."e) "Compatible with iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6, iPhone 5S/5/5C, iPad Air, iPad (4th gen.+), iPad Mini, iPod Touch (5th gen.+), iPod Nano (7th gen.+)"f) "Apple Certified"The item appears well and thoughtfully made upon close inspection but a bit concerned about reported failures after a few months use (reported in other reviews).The coiled un-stretched coiled cord is 16 inches long (from plug to lightning tip). It will stretch to 4.5 feet if necessary.
We absolutely do NOT recommend this unit at all. Produced very little ice. Used in a well ventilated under-bar application but output was almost non-existent,  1 tray a day at best.

A useful but hard-to-find specialized outdoor/garden device that is highly effective and harmless non-toxic to critters that you don't want near your garden, lawn, or fence.Adjacent plants benefit from occasional brief irrigation intervals caused by unwanted  "visitors."  Uses common 9-volt battery for powering sensor head.  Battery life depends upon use/number of solenoid actuations.Motion actuated momentary-on impulse/"Rainbird" type sprinkler head with controllable dial-set spray intervals. Spray arc and direction are fully adjustable as with any impulse/"Rainbird" type sprinkler head.

Needed the additional 5 / 2.5 amps output (2.5A / 12.5W each port) of these iOttie RapidVolt 5Amp/25-Watt Dual Port USB Car Charger for higher draw smart phones/tablets.Not as small as the 1-1.5 amp chargers but that's unavoidable for the increased power output.

We came back to GTO can't love the price but you end up paying more than that in failed, short-lived clone units. Many of the clones either stopped working after a year or began draining their batteries. We have only had one of several GTO FM135's over the years die and none of them drained batteries.These GTO OEM units while a bit larger, are more durable and reliable (longer lived) than a good number of half-price 2nd/3rd party clones/knock-offs models of these GTO 318 mhz gate operator transmitters we have purchased and used.

Compatible with/replaced a 8-year old model F310 unit (square top). This newer style (round top) has new electronics that do  not require setting internal security dip switch codes as in the older-style unit did, it can "learn" the security code from a transmitter placed next to the keypad unit with appropriate key pad set-up input.

These ARGTeK 1,000mW/1 watt 2.4ghz amps worked well for our extended WiFi setup. You will need the appropriate SMA cables and high-gain antennas to complete your WiFi point-to-point set-up.These 1 watt amps worked better than the (surprisingly) cheaper sunhans 2,000 mW / 2 watt amps also available on Amazon. More power (e.g. 2x) is not necessarily better, and more importantly you need the correct amount of power boost for your coverage application/attenuation loss conditions but need to avoid overloading receivers. Also remember that the power-out on your computing device's WiFi card/USB device may also need a boost to reach your the router/access point repeater unit.

The clear cap of our old SHURFLo Twist-On Pipe Strainer crazed and cracked with age and we no longer trusted it. This helps strain out the larger bits of debris and protects your pump head from needless wear/damage.

Perfect, exact fit, quality OEM SHURflo quality replacement for the worn original pump head that could no longer self prime. Not a bargain but cheaper than replacing the whole pump and we try to be "green" and repair/fix things before we contribute needlessly to the waste stream/landfill.

The round black top/covered 20 oz versions of these sold at the big box store who's name begins with "S" seal significantly better and are more stable on surfaces than than these square bottomed units. Recommend holding off your purchases until next spring/summer shipments of the round insulated tumblers become available again.We found the tops of these tumblers to be much less tight sealing than the aforementioned tumblers. These are nice looking and colorful, and will work but in our experience, they are not the best choice and we already managed to break one in a knock-over on a granite counter top.

Works well. Quick, easy set-up via Netgear Genius GUI app.  Replaced a more affordable but lower-powered EnGenius ERB9250 (~39 mW) range extender paired with a 1,000 mW (1 watt) 2.4 ghz amp. AC1100/EX6200's 700 mW (0.7 watt) output eliminated need for an external amplifier.If you are planning to use this NETGEAR AC1200/EX6200 range extender with an external amplifier, ensure that your external amplifier (input) can handle the 700 mW (0.7 watt) output of the AC1200. Has the desirable SMA antenna connectors for higher-gain after-market antenna/cabling connections. Labeled in Vietnam.The AC1200/EX6200 case/enclosure is quite large (just under 7"x10")- the size of a large router and has a well vented case for its two internal amplifiers, and comes with a comes with rubber foot pads and also a vertical clip-on stand stand.Oddly, it has NO wall mounting holes (for flush-mount) like many routers including other Linksys products. The reasin likely being  that the circuit board is mounted too close to the red plastic bottom panel to accommodate any mounting holes/penetrating screw heads in the back/bottom or even mounting any short screw-in hanger type hardware. The unit is not that heavy so double sided tape or adhesive velcro strips could work, but there's always the adhesive reliability uncertainty.

This is a large, Made in USA belt drive floor fan/air circulator. Belt drive units are slightly more expensive but are more durable than direct drive units that can translate fan blade vibrations to the motor shaft/bearings - that eventually leads to premature motor failure. This unit has two speeds low and high, it's very quiet on low and not that noisy on high. Tt is mounted on sturdy wheels that assist in moving the fan, and has sturdy handles on the outside of the drum body. Color was red not our first choice but the Amazon Prime price (w/shipping) was right compared to other vendors. Has a 2-year warranty.This unit arrived in excellent condition (its a large box, this is a 42" diameter fan) but that depends upon the shipper's handling of the item. If the fan/its box is subjected to rough handling or sustains box damage in shipment it is very likely the fan inside will be damaged or bent because there is little padding or packing material around the drum body - so immediately upon delivery, inspect yours carefully and plug it in and operationally check it.

Outdoor Pan/Tilt Wireless IP Camera, great price on Amazon, but the wireless side didn't work well. Wired side (Ethernet) worked fine. Identical in appearance and function (nearly) to Agasio A622W and FOSCAM FI8919W only the software differs.Nice clear true daytime colors. All units Agasio, FOSCAM and DB Power have/will have internal glare inside the dome for nightime operations. Recommend turning off internal IR LEDs if your security software allows it and installing an external IR illuminator of proper wavelength (not a "black" IR unit) to use this camera.Returned this DBPower VA038K unit  for a refund, and purchased a FOSCAM FI8919W Pan/Tilt Wireless IP Camera.
Well made hoses. Using part of this kit for a vacuum pump set up  on a winery corking machine.
A necessary tool for Cowboy cooking and dealing with cast iron Dutch Oven lids. Well made, nicely finished (smooth surfaces)

A slightly modernized style/version of the Casio Data Bank classic that has been around for over 30 years. Has a nice non-grabbing, non-pinching stainless steel link band that can be sized with a little effort/adjustment (jewelers screwdriver and mini needle nose pliers). I did notice the "count-down" timer so useful for alarming/monitoring parking meter time remaining is no longer there... still has military 24 hour time, a stop watch function and normal alarm available. Long 5-10 year battery life is a plus over the older models. Most folks will see this in your wrist and mistakenly say/think this is the older version and say "My dad had one of those decades ago!"The calculator function is what I have always valued the most. Of course cell flip-phones and Smart phones have all but replaced the phone number data bank function, and calculators on Smart phones have also replace the wrist based calculator of this Data Bank. Oh yes, now as years ago, you still have to have excellent eyesight to see the small markings on the keypad buttons...  The LCD display is clear and bright.

Drill in a clean 1/2" hole at the top of your fuel container (in a semi-protected location) and pop these vent plugs in - to make your CARB or other non-functional present-day fuel container work like it should - like back in "the good old days."

Work well. Has a nice easy to use broad-beam pattern not a pencil-point/spot bean that required more head movement to place the light where you need it. Same design tri-pack as was sold at the big box warehouse (CC) last year.Uses a pair of longer life, economical, easier-to-find AA batteries rather than the typical shorted lived double or triple AAA battery configuration.The two clasp tabs on the end of the battery compartment (2 AA's) are delicate so do be gentle with them.

Ordered a FOSCAM but was shipped an Agasio 603W. These are nearly identical units but the antenna connectors are reversed. FOACAM uses standard SMA connectors the majority of off-brand IP camera manufacturers (including Agasio) use RP (reverse polarity) SMA connectors. Either are fine but your cables, antennas etc need to be the right SMA polarity to connect properly.The center SMA connector pin in the camera we received was loose and didn't make good contact with the antenna which made the wireless side of the camera inoperable. The Ethernet (wired) side however worked fine. We had to return the camera for a refund. and we ordered a two pack of the FOSCAM FI8905Ws which appear to be working OK on wireless. If the wireless side of this camera worked, we'd be fine with the Agasio 603W because we have one that worked well outdoors for ~5 years.

Well made. Nicely finished/polished stainless steel mini-tool. A bit heavy bulky for the size on a key chain but you must weight the convenience of having an array of Phillips and flat tip screwdriver points (no hex or Torx points) and a mini-plier at your disposal whenever you need it. When closed up/collapsed, the plier head clamps to a key chain and stays there.There are no knife/cutting blades to get you crossed up with the TSA agent at US airports. I still miss my oh-so-handy mini Swiss Army Executive key chain knife of pre-9/11 days...

Setting up wireless IPCAMS is always a chore. These FOSCAM FI8905 units work well as outdoor nightime illuminated cameras. They slightly more costly than the nearly-identical to the Agasio 603W that served us well for ~5 years until the wireless (RF) side went bad. Apparently FOSCAM USA (Texas) and Agasio USA have merged or at least have a business relationship.These FOSCAM/Agasio units  have a slightly wider than normal 73 degree field of view and significantly better nightime IR illumination that is bright and effective than the older slightly smaller Asgsio M105I camera.WRT IR illumination, these cameras are not/do not have the newer/more expensive invisible "black" 930-940nm (nanometer) type IR LED illuminators so they do have a red glow (780-850NM) that is visible to humans and animals at night. Some customers believe cameras should be seen at night, others prefer the stealth of the "black" IR illuminators.Note the FOSCAM uses standard SMA connectors on their products and not the Reverse Polarity SMA connectors more common on other products - you have non-FOSCAM IPCAM accessories (cables/antennas/amps) you will either need to use the FOSCAM OEM antennas that come with the FOSCAM cameras, buy FOSCAM antennas, or get standard to RP SMA adapters of the appropriate gender to use your existing cables/antennas/WiFi amps. Adapters introduce some degree of signal loss so that is a consideration. And of course after-market WiFi antennas, cables and adapters are of varying quality and effectiveness/dBi gain ratings.

Functional and well made for the price. Used to support a sound system amplifier mixer unit. Double cross construction is more rigid than single cross designs. members. The additional tie/hold down brackets are a nice touch/feature.Has a gloss black finish rather than a satin or flat black finish if that patters to purchaser.

Hard to get excited about twist ties. These are cleanly and uniformly cut (at 7 inches long, 1/8" wide, single strand of wire) and at time of purchase on Amazon, significantly cheaper than black plastic ones. Theye were purchased to tie power cords/cables but are highly suitable for use with gift treat bags.

We have two of these IXCC chargers. They seem to charge at a higher rate than the common small 1 amp charging cube (~1"x1"x1"). The folding USA 120vAC power prongs are convenient for traveling/pocketing the charger which is understandably larger due to the higher charging rate for two USB devices ~4x size of the small cube chargers. The charger has a blue LED indicator indicating that it is charging properly.A problem has  but one of our chargers has developed an intermittent charge connection when folding out the prongs, the second charger is fine one is fine. We are not thinking folding prongs probably were not a good idea for reliability.

Produced highly iridescent (colored sheen) bubbles. This is a very thick solution and can be diluted a bit for better value. Works well in the Turbo 16 Wand High Output Automatic Bubble Machine sold elsewhere on Amazon.

This is a good value and very effective/prolific bubble machine. We use it at a winery tasting patio to add some fun to an afternoon or an additional flair to whatever is going on. Be prepared to have a lot of soap film in the immediate area in front of the machine so that area needs to be soap/water-proof water resistant. It sometimes develops a bow-wave of foam in front of the machine.We have used it with both commercial bubble solution as well as home-brew recipes. It works well with either type of solution. It has a well-made, silver painted metal case.

We purchased these Mocha Brown covers from Amazon Prime for our flame tube heaters. In the Past and they were thinner/lighter duty. These are an improved, heavier-duty fabric with a waterproof coating on the inside surface. These will likely last longer than the original covers an improvement.
This is a basic kitchen tool for the bread maker... not much more can be said. Affordable price, and convenient Amazon shipping.

You'll have to put in some elbow grease/effort compared to a heavy professional type "rocker" pizza cutter. Otherwise good. Nice that's it's 100% stainless steel - no wood or plastic handle parts to break.These also make great gifts for family / residential pizzaiolos / pizzaiolas.

Strongly recommended for wood fired pizza ovens to get an accurate pizza stone surface temperature. Well-built case, clear LCD  display. Oven is available on Amazon too.Of course it can be used for Automotive applications too!

Works with newer BaoFeng UV-82 transceiver but only supports one PTT channel whereas the UV-82 PTT button supports two channels which is one of several nice features the UV-82 has.Should work fine with the older UV-5(x) transceiver variants.

Works as designed. Good for using handheld in a vehicle w/o worrying about battery charge state. This is for the BaoFeng model UV-82 which is a newer radio. This had a different shape from the older UV-5(x) models. Can be used with a 120vAC to 12V socket wall adapter.

After several months use, in the end, we'd have preferred 100% cotton in a tight luxury weave.These are "OK" and we purchased based upon reviews and appreciated customers answers to questions.If you're really picky about pilling this product displays a very minor amount after washings/dryings.

Haynes manuals have been a shop mainstay for decades. They are generally based upon actual tear down/repair work so their tear-down steps and photos are "real-world." ATVS require maintenance and repair. this is a good repair for a Polaris ATV owner. Takes the edge off any blind/seat-of the pants repair job.

This book has a wealth of information about those who con and those who are conned.  Its also easy to understand.  But its not organized in the readers best interest.  Its organized in a way that best suits the author, who has no problem continuously jumping around from century to century, and who can easily remember every con mentioned in the book.  Thats a shame, too, because Ms. Konnikova's book could have been a better help to the general public.  Although when it comes right down to it, most people are not conned in their lifetime in major ways.  Yes, everyone will buy lies here, there and everywhere, but not the type of lies that end up costing them substantial money or alter their lives.  No, we dont fall for it  . . . every time.

You only need a little of this cleanser to clean your face, so this tube will last you a long time.  It does an excellent job of cleaning, too, and leaves your face feeling soft.  The scent isn't too strong, either, and it doesn't linger.  I can't quite place the scent, but it is pleasant. This product is so new, it doesn't seem to be on the L'Oreal website, yet.  Check out the website, though, if you haven't already.  There are all sorts of interesting things there about skin and hair care.

I wasn't expecting much from these 100% cotton dishcloths, but discovered they are actually very good in the kitchen and for dusting.  They do a far better job of cleaning countertops than microfiber dishcloths.  Their only drawback is they are suppose to be washed in cold water on the gentle cycle and dried on low heat. Sorry, I don't coddle dishcloths.  They need to be washed in warm or hot water and dried on high.  After a warm water wash on the normal cycle and a high heat dry, they did shrink to 12x10 inches.  But that's okay.  They are still brightly colored and still do a good cleaning job.

The Tin Snail is one of those stories where something that actually happened in history is turned into a children's book, where a child, who never actually existed in real life, becomes a hero.  Personally,  I don't think it's a good idea to create such stories, because it's teaching fake history to children. But this story has enough real history in it, plus incredibly intense feelings about what happened when the German army rolled into France, that I can't help but think it's an exceptional children's book.Our young hero, thirteen-year-old Angelo, is living in Paris in the 1930s with his Italian parents.  His father is a car designer, but is in need of a new design.  Angelo desperately wants to help his father, because things seem to be falling apart in their family, and comes up with the idea for a new type of car. The car is created, but ends up destroyed, thanks to Angelo.  There are lots of vehicle crashes and wild rides in this book, which makes it seem very much like a children's book for young car enthusiasts.  Yet, after Angelo then comes up with the idea for the Tin Snail, which in real life was the Citron 2CV, and they have to keep the car out of the hands of the invading Nazis, the story no longer seems only for young children.  In fact, I'm not sure why it's not being suggested for teenagers, too.  I'm not sure it wouldn't be too intense for 9-year-olds.  Angelo's fears of what the Nazis might do if they don't get what they want are very real.By the end of the story, I had forgotten my irritation about all the vehicle crashes, and my amusement that French and Italian individuals were often using British expressions.  Instead, I was thinking that I had just learned a pretty good history lesson, and had read a book with very well-developed characters. What started off seeming like a simple, if not often silly, children's story about cars, turned into a serious and complex story about life in France during the 1930s, that even adult readers could appreciate.

The first five ingredients of this food are meat broth, chicken, chicken liver, beef liver and beef.  Not bad.  Dog food purists, however, may be concerned it also contains chicken-by-products, meat-by-products and wheat gluten.  Since those things are way down on the ingredients list, they don't concern me.  The food is also a nice chunk one with lots of gravy, and all dogs I've given it to love it.

As a lifelong Peanuts fan, I wish I had liked this book more than I did.  Its well researched and very readable, but I wasnt as interested in the main topic as I thought.  Author Stephen J. Lind covers both Charles Schulz personal religious beliefs, as well as how religion, particularly biblical references, appeared in the Peanuts comic strip, the TV specials and the movies.  In addition, he explores Mr. Schulzs personal life, particularly his family life; things I had never read elsewhere.  Interestingly, even though I remembered when he died, I also had never read much of anything about his illness, death or funeral, until now. (This was the second time I cried while reading a book in the last few months.)  What Charles Schulz was thinking and feeling, when he knew his illness was terminal, clearly showed you can spend your whole life, or most of it, thinking about God and faith, but still end up not totally knowing what is the meaning of life and death?(Note: I received a free e-copy of this book from NetGalley and the publisher in exchange for an honest review.)

While looking at Krusteaz Double Chocolate Supreme Muffin Mix, 20 Ounce at the grocery store, I decided to get this mix, too.  I've had it before and remembered how delicious it was.  There's a few extra steps to mixing the product, but it still takes only a few minutes.  I used a 8x8 pan, instead of a muffin one, and the kitchen still smelled like cinnamon the morning after the night I made the cake.  Krusteaz is a great brand for boxed mixes. You wouldn't know they weren't made from scratch.

Being in the mood for chocolate, I came across this mix in the grocery store.  Krusteaz is not as well known as Betty Crocker, Pillsbury and Duncan Hines, but, in my opinion, their mixes are a notch above those.  I baked this in a loaf pan, using cooking olive oil instead of vegetable oil, and the cake was delicious.  Just a small piece will satisfy anyone's craving for chocolate, and if you heat it up a little in the microwave before eating, the chocolate chips in the mix will be melted.  Watch out for the chips, though, after baking in the oven.  If you use a toothpick to see if the cake is done, you may hit a melted chocolate chip and think it needs more cooking, when it does not.  I baked it for 55 minutes.

Even though I have the Fire HD 6, 6" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers, Black, I recently got the NuPro Fire Standing Case (5th Generation - 2015 release), Pink to use strictly for horizontal reading.  It turned out to be great for that, and even is good for vertical reading, since the HD 6 can't fall out the bottom of the case.  Thus, I thought I'd try this NuPro slim case for reading, too.  It unfortunately doesn't work for a 6" Fire at all, since this is a hard shell case and the Fire must be snapped in to keep it from sliding out while reading.  So, three stars for a neutral rating.  I don't understand, though, why this case is more expensive than the NuPro case I previously got, since that one seems to me to be a much nicer case and stands much better.

Up until seeing this cat tree, I had only seen cat trees in the typical sand color they always seem to be.  I always wondered why they were always that color.  Maybe sand shows hair less?  This blue tree may very well need vacuuming more, but that's okay.  It's a very pretty blue cat tree.  Makes me want more cat trees in different pretty colors.  This is a good tree for playful cats, too, which mine don't usually seem to be these days.  I guess playing is for the younger cats and kittens.  They love to sit and sleep on the cat trees, though. So, with this one, they have to go all the way up to the top perch, which gives them climbing exercise.  They also love to do their nails on the sisal posts.  The blue tree was easy to put together, too, as long as you ignored the way the directions made it it look like you were suppose to start with the middle perch first.  I started with the base, as usual, and had it assembled in minutes.

I tried this out on some set-in drink stains on a somewhat plush sand colored carpet.  The directions say to spray on, agitate and then blot dry with paper towels.  Not knowing what was meant by "agitate", I used a small, new scrub type brush.  It worked, too.  The stains were gone in just a few minutes, and the scent of the cleaner is nice.  When I use it on additional stains in the future, I'll update the review.  Right now, like often, when I get a new product to test out, suddenly what I need to test it out on is not around.

This is the second book I've read this month by a writer associated with The New Yorker All Access.  The first one was Lillian Ross'  Reporting Always: Writings from The New Yorker.  I found that both books had stories that were interesting, and stories that were not interesting.  Nothing in either collection struck me as being special, however, as so many people like to describe articles from "The New Yorker".  Thus, I'm finished with such collections, with the exception of Joseph Mitchell's writings, which I intend to get around to reading one day.

Since I usually abhor contemporary quirky novels and often cant finish reading them, I was happily surprised this one made me laugh, and I had no difficulty sticking with it. Not all the humor was great, mind you; like most contemporary quirky novels, some of it was juvenile and tasteless. Nevertheless, there were enough laughs, as well as enough major happenings, to keep the novel afloat.  In addition, there were enough subtle reminders throughout the story about the human need for families and fathers to make much of what was happening seem downright important.  However, after reading the epilogue, I began to wonder if the book wasnt meant also as a  comment about how downright unimportant marriage was where love and families were concerned . . . which was odd . . . but then, what can we expect from a "quirky" novel?

This pink case looks a bit more mauve to me, and definitely isn't the same shade of pink as my magenta Fire.  It's also made only for the 7" Fire, whereas I have the Fire HD 6, 6" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers, Black, but that's okay.  I did not get it to use as a secure case, since I never take my Fire outside of the house.  I wanted it strictly for propping up the Kindle to read on a table, and it does that wonderfully in a horizontal position.  I also can read vertically while holding it, because the Fire can't slip out of the bottom of the case.  The case is a nice imitation leather on the outside and suede on the inside, too.P.S. It's interesting to note that the print on a web page when reading horizontally is larger than the print on a web page when reading vertically.

I have an older 13" Toshiba laptop and didn't think for a minute this sleeve would not fit, since all laptop sleeves I've gotten in the past always had at least a little bit of extra space.  Not this one.  This Case Logic will only fit a laptop no larger than the following measurements:  13.0 inches long, 9.6 inches wide and 1.1 inches high.  Well, my Toshiba is 13 and a fourth inches long, 9 inches wide and a tiny bit over an inch high, and it can't fit in this sleeve.

Bosch probably had builders and other such professionals in mind when they released this item.  After reading all the warnings in the manual, you have to wonder if maybe it is best left in the hands of professionals, too, and not for those who simply want a swift and nifty way to measure things around the house.  The biggest warning is about the laser causing severe eye injury or blindness.  Hence, you should never stare into the laser beam or direct it towards any other living creatures, including children and pets.  Also, you should not point it at any reflective surface that might reflect the beam back to your eyes.  This of course means you really need to keep it out of the hands of young or disobedient children; as well as  have serious reservations about loaning it to an idiot relative, friend or neighbor who thinks product warnings are for sissies. (Update: Although according to online research, few people get eye damage from lasers, because the eye moves. But this laser 2 beam is stronger than the laser found in cat toys, which is usually laser 1, so don't let children play with it.)I'm going to leave all the wonderfully complex things this laser measure can do to professionals who write reviews, or amateurs who understand as much as the professionals, or to anyone who got better grades in geometry than I did.  What I've been using this Bosch for so far is measuring walls, measuring mailing boxes and measuring the distance between the garage door and the curb across the street, in case I get a surveillance camera one day.  I discovered using the "real time" measuring function with the target cards is the easiest way for a math challenged person to measure.  It's also a lot of fun.  You just put or hold the target card where you want it, point the laser at it, and there you have the length, width or distance.  Measuring the distance across the street was the most fun.  In just a minute or so, I realized the surveillance camera I looked at that shot up to 65' was not good enough.  Standing four feet away from the garage door, it was 84' and 6 inches to the curb across the street.It would have taken me much longer to get that measurement without this Bosch, since I have no measuring stick/tape longer than 7 feet.  So, this would be a very useful item around the house.  (Two other things you can use it for is to quickly determine how much paint or carpet you would need for a room.)  I did not try the Bluetooth function yet, since I do not have a Smart phone, but you cannot use this laser with Bluetooth  "in the vicinity of gas stations, chemical plants, areas where there is danger of explosion and areas subject to blasting"; as well as in airplanes; or in "the vicinity of medical devices", or operate "in the direct vicinity of the human body over longer periods of time".  I'm not researching that warning online. You're on your own.

After recently reading The Witch of Lime Street: Sance, Seduction, and Houdini in the Spirit World, I wanted to read a little more about Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.  This biography seemed to fit the bill--it wasnt too long and author Michael Coren said in his introduction that his book was a biographical study, not an orthodox literary biography.  That suited me, since I was most interested in reading about Sir Arthurs personal life and his interest in spiritualism.  This book did indeed have quite a bit about those two topics, but also had quite a bit about Sir Arthurs mystery books and other writings that were not about spiritualism. That was okay, though, but I did skim most of the parts about Sherlock Holmes.Mr. Coren also mentioned in the books introduction a short video of Sir Arthur made in 1929, where he spends about five minutes talking about Sherlock Holmes and about five minutes discussing spiritualism.  You can easily find this video online and watch it.  Its an interesting film, and quite funny when he discusses Sherlock Holmes; because he tells about letters he gets addressed to the great detective, by readers who obviously dont know they are writing to a fictional character.  Many are from women asking Mr. Holmes if he needs a housekeeper.But back to the book  .  .  .  Mr. Coren does a good job describing Arthur Conan Doyles childhood in Scotland; education, including in a Jesuit school; trips to many countries;  family life, both as a child and as an adult;  writings, both fiction and nonfiction; speeches on about everything; involvement in political and social issues; interest in all types of sports; years as a doctor, including during the Boar War; intense interest in spiritualism; and final years before his death in the summer of 1930, at the age of 71.  There was less in the book about spiritualism than I wanted, but maybe that was for the best.  Sir Arthur was such an intelligent and accomplished man, and it seemed so odd he seemed so gullible about certain aspects of spiritualism, such as mediumship and psychic pictures, like the fairy ones.Personally, I think he was concentrating on the wrong metaphysical topic.  I think he would have been far better off studying and thinking about reincarnation, instead of trying to talk to the dead.  That could have both satisfied his need to believe in the existence of an afterlife, as well as his interest in history, including making sense of the oncoming war he so correctly feared was going to happen.  Moreover, just looking at, listening to and reading about Sir Arthur Conan Doyle makes me think there was a man who had lived many times before.  A man who had acquired much knowledge and experience during those lifetimes, which is why he was such an accomplished man in his lifetime as Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.(Note: I received a free e-copy of this book from NetGalley and the publisher in exchange for an honest review.)

This epilator has 48 "rotating tweezers" compared to the 24 on the other Panasonic one I tried--the Panasonic ES-EU20-P Multi-Functional Wet/Dry Shaver and Epilator with Three Attachments and Travel Pouch.  Does having twice as many tweezers, as well as a dual-disc pivoting head, make much difference?  Yes, it does.  This Panasonic removed much more hair on the first try than the other single-disc non-pivoting one.  But it was also at least twice as painful than the other one.  I had to greatly limit the area being epilated on my leg.  (It's suppose to be less painful if using shower gel in the shower, and I will try that later on in the season when the warm weather is gone.)This model has more attachments, too, including a smaller epilator head for more sensitive areas like underarms.  I can't imagine, though, epilating underarms. As a shaver, this model works well like the other less expensive model, because it is exactly the same as that one. It does not pivot.  Do 48 tweezers justify the extra cost?  If you are seriously into epilating and want to remove as much hair as possible in a single swipe, yes.  It's faster and more efficient; although, as stated above, more painful.  If you think there is a good chance you may end up just using this Panasonic as an electric razor, however, save money and go with the other model. (Unless you want a shaver with a light, at which time you would need to get this one.)

This is a highly readable biography that left me with highly mixed feelings about Alex Haley.  He wrote two outstanding books during a time when black history wasnt exactly mainstream knowledge.  Reading about the first book, The Autobiography of Malcolm X: As Told to Alex Haley, was most interesting to me, far more interesting than reading about  Roots.  Reading about Alex Haley's second book was a bit distressful because it appears he did not write a great deal of the book.  Apparently, he was totally absorbed by the research, as well as other smaller projects, and had another man doing much of the writing.  There was also constant excuses from Haley about why the book was not finished, most of the excuses raving about how successful the book was going to be after it was published.  Fortunately for him, that proved to be true, especially since he kept asking for more advance money.Its important to note Mr. Haley  had huge financial problems at the time, which made him feel obligated to do smaller projects to get quick cash.  The IRS was after him, and he made very bad marriages.  Thats another cause of my mixed feelings--he obviously had major problems with women, starting with his mother and stepmother, and appeared to spend little time with his children.  He was always running off here or there, he said to research or write.  The irony of this is that Roots to him was not only the incredibly important telling of the story of so many black families, but specifically the story of his family.  Yet, he himself could not be seen as much of a family man, at least not where his wives or children were concerned.Roots, too, brought on some lawsuits, which is not at all unusual for a highly successful book.  One, involving plagiarism, though, appeared to be legitimate, considering similar texts found in both Roots and Harold Courlanders The African.  Another plagiarism case involved Margaret Walker Alexanders book Jubilee.  I found it quite interesting to read about that case since I recently read  Song of My Life: A Biography of Margaret Walker.  She did not seem like the type of person to falsely accuse another author of plagiarism.  In this biography, however, author Robert J. Norrell claims her charges were totally false, and were made strictly because of jealousy of the success of Roots.  I dont know if that was a fair charge by Mr. Norrell or not, but he struck me in this book as trying very hard to be fair.  Fair both to Alex Haley and to the readers of this book, by presenting an honest account of Mr. Haleys life, not a fan account; even though he has the highest regards for Roots and The Autobiography of Malcolm X: As Told to Alex Haley, and the tremendous impact both books had in the United States.

Compared to a Remington epilator I have, this Panasonic is a lot less painful.  I don't know if it's because it works at a higher speed, or because I've been wearing shorts for 6 months and my legs seem "tougher".  I can epilate my legs with this Panasonic just as fast as I can shave my legs.  No, it doesn't get all the hairs, but neither does the Remington.  Also, the epilator head sometimes pops off!  The shaving head works as well as any excellent ladies' shaver, but it's never going to be as close as a razor.  While this Panasonic can be used in the shower, I'm not sure what the reasoning is for using an electric shaver/epilator in the shower, unless it makes epilating less painful.  I only intend to use it dry, and will try this time to stick with epilating long enough to see if it's worth the extra time and attention.

Since I'm often in the mood for British things in the fall . . . books, movies, TV shows . . . I thought this memoir would be perfect to read this month.  Unfortunately,  I was wrong.  At no point while reading it could I get more than mildly interested in anything Antonia Fraser was saying about anything.  Maybe if I had been familiar with her writings before I started reading the book, I would have found her memories more interesting.  Or maybe not.

I put off getting a Kindle for years, because I've never really liked reading e-books, which I've done for years with Kindle on my PC.  But I always wondered if reading on a device I held in my hand might be different than reading on my laptop. Thus, I started looking at Kindles, but didn't like they only had black and white screens.  So, I started looking at Kindle Fires, and when this one went on sale for $69 one week, decided it was time to get a Kindle.  I reasoned that if I still didn't like reading e-books on a Kindle, at least with the Fire, I would also have a computer and a device I could use for listening to music.Well, it turns out I love reading e-books on my Kindle Fire, almost as much as reading hard copies of books.  Actually, I haven't read any Kindle books yet, but am reading books sent from NetGalley, which took me a while to figure out were under DOCS, not BOOKS. I played around with the fonts, font sizes and brightness to get my reading screen exactly how I wanted it.  Unlike books or docs, though, you only have the choice of three font sizes when viewing the internet on this Kindle Fire, which is not a problem with me; but I'm sure it's a problem with some individuals since the web print is so small.  I haven't really used the Fire much for the internet.  I still prefer using my laptop for that.I also haven't tried the camera, since I always prefer digital cameras when taking pictures, than using cell phones or other such devices.  I've listened to some music, however, and think the sound is fine. While navigating the touch screen is never a problem when reading books, sometimes it is a problem for other things.  I don't know if it's me, since I'm not use to using touch screens, or if it's the Fire. Maybe I should get a touch screen stylus pen.  It's never a big, continuous problem, though.  Hence, all in all, I love my Kindle Fire, and am very happy I got one to read books. I'm also very happy I got the magenta one.  I had second thoughts about getting such a bright color, but I really like having such a colorful Kindle.  If you love colors, get a Fire.
If you are looking for the original version of the song from the late 1960s, which had Dorothy Morrison on lead vocal, this is it!

I have a mail scale which is extremely accurate in pounds and ounces, but only goes to five pounds.  This Rubbermaid scale goes to 250 pounds so my days of worrying packages I mail will be over five pounds are over.  While this scale does not do ounces, it's accurate enough to know what pound weight to choose for a mailing rate. (I weighed items under five pounds on both this scale and the mail one to compare weight readings.)  It also has a most useful "memory lock" feature that you can use for big boxes that block the weight window.  Just put the big box on the scale, push the "memory lock", take the box off the scale, and its weight will be locked in for you to view.  The zero adjust knob is on the right side of the scale, and the briefcase design with the handle is great for easily moving the scale wherever you want it.  It's not a light scale at all, and it's not "legal for trade", but is going to be wonderful for mailing packages from home.  I never go to the post office any longer, but print labels from the internet and just put the boxes outside the front door.
This is not the original version of the song released in the late 1960s.  A male is doing the lead vocal on this much shorter version.  The original version is Oh Happy Day.

***SPOILERS***Small Moments: A Child's Memories of the Civil Rights Movement is a work of creative nonfiction.  In the Author Q & A at the end of the story, author Mary Barrows provides the following description of that genre:  The term creative nonfiction means sticking to the truth as much as possible.  The stories are true, the characters are real people, and the places are real.  However, elements used in the craft of fiction are introduced to create cohesion and to introduce ideas.  Does this creative nonfiction story work?  In some ways, yes.  In other ways, no.There are three major problems.
