Good luck with that.To be fair to the HA100, it does say for home stereo use and home stereos do demand power so this limitation is, perhaps, asking it to do things that it wasn't advertised to do. If you have a matching 12 v power supply such as available here at Amazon, you could also use it in your car, but it'd mean a rather complex mass of cabling, but it should work (not tested).Still, there are many portable devices which have 3.5mm or RCA inputs and it'd have been quite nice to have the HA100 provide the Bluetooth / NFC link to these devices but alas, it's not to be. Also that *#&*#& enormous transformer at the plug end of the power cord. I'm so tired of this that I almost want to remove a star due to that, but I won't.

The manufacturer's sample received here is a well made high quality cable with one unique feature or if not unique, I've never seen it before. Rather than being round in cross section, the cable is a ribbon. So what, you say. The rationale is that this makes it much easier and more stable to loop up for transport or storage.This doesn't seem like that much of a feature because even the round cross sectioned cables can be looped. I'll agree that this isn't some sort of thundering breakthrough idea which will make all existing MFI cables obsolete but it makes it just a wee bit better than others and in doing so, it loses nothing.So award four stars for a very well made MFI certified cable and add one for the ribbon style cable replacing the more mundane hose shaped one. Interesting color too. You won't easily lose it.

This smartphone car holder, supplied as a sample by the manufacturer, works well with some limitations which mostly depend on the target car's design. The holder uses a spring loaded hook to attach to a vent but most of the mass of the phone / holder is taken by the two legs which rest on the dash. This puts little stress on the vent itself. The downside of this arrangement is that if you hit hard bumps in the road, the holder is free to move vertically which can impede your ability to read or use the smartphone.We tested with an iPhone 6 in and out of the case. No matter how rough the road, the phone was well retained in the holder somewhat to my surprise because there is no bottom prongs to support the phone. Still, it worked perfectly in this respect.Consider, though, that adding a holder and a phone to a vent will block some car functions at least on the models we tried this holder on. Also the holder / phone combo at least somewhat blocked the vent making it a bit less effective than without the holder attached.So how well this will work for you depends on your car's layout, its controls and if you can reduce a vent's effectiveness to some degree. Like all things, this is a compromise which will work very well for some and less well for others.

This, a manufacturer supplied sample, is the third Bluetooth headphone of roughly the same design from three different manufacturers I've tried. By far, this is the best. No contest really. Here's the summary rundown:1. The sound is crystal clear. Using these headphones and watching some commercial videos, I heard little details like city background noise which wasn't audible using my alternative headphones a set of Bluetooth over the ear phones retailing for $100.00. They work equally well for voice or music. They lack the deep presence of an expensive over the ear phone but what else would you expect?2. Battery life is superb. The Bluetooth battery meters on the devices I connected to showed, after 2.25 hours of use no decrease in battery capacity which implies to me that these phones aren't reporting to the device. Still, the headphones were going strong after that time indicating very long battery life for such a small device. This crushes the competing headphones I've tried neither of which made a full hour of battery.3. Retention on ear is solid. The connecting cord is a spring which holds the phones to your head during activity. In addition, the way the phones fit is the over the hear method which affords even greater safety and retention.4. Controls. Due to the small size of these phones, the controls are likewise small and for me, somewhat difficult to locate and use. I do have `gorilla hands' and those with normally sized hands likely will have no difficulty. Even so, I was able, with some fiddling, to use the controls if not easily. Still, I blame this more on my anatomy than a defect of phone design.Overall, I'm thrilled with these headphones and feel they merit the full five stars awarded.

The first sample sent by SimpliFine had a manufacturing defect. I wrote a middling review due to this loss of function. The company sent a replacement mandoline which we've used extensively for a few days now. The results are much more favorable than the initial sample.We tried this with a variety of foods finding the function to be as expected or better in all respects. Specifically, the main slicing blade and machine worked as expected. In both the initial and this sample, the julienne operation was better than expected.The mandoline comes complete with several spacers to vary the slice sizes in the main slicing operation as well as two julienne inserts to make fine or coarse (French fries) strips. It even includes a holder for the accessories which looks and acts like a knife block made of plastic to match the mandoline.The only slight operational issue we had was when we went into high production. The angle of the device means it's comfortable to use but it also means a buildup of sliced food at the lowered end of the device meaning you need to, from time to time, break your rhythm to spread the buildup. This is a very small quibble and it's offset by the kickstand supported slant which means its comfortable to use even over long periods.If you care about presentation in you cooking, a mandoline is almost a required accessory to your kitchen. Very few people possess the knife skill to create the same uniform slicing or julienne results that a mandoline will yield. Those who do have these skills likely dont want to spend the time to get the same results as a few seconds using a machine such as this SimpliFine yields. It makes a nice gift too but be sure to use safety gloves. This is a serious tool.

I can't remember getting any product which so often surprised me in a delightful way as this Asus Chromebook. I never used a Chromebook before and had only a vague notion of what one was. As it turns out, I underestimated this laptop's capacity in a huge way. I'll hit a few of the high points below.The screen is superb. I rate it significantly better than my iPad Air's highly touted retina screen. The spec sheet may have the retina at a higher resolution but the contrast and saturation of the Asus crushes the Apple product making it better for any task from reading, to working, to watching videos. No contest.Touch screen: works well. Not quite up to iPad standards in the sense of multi-finger gestures, but not badly dinged by this lack. The screen is responsive and a worthy addition to a laptop.Keyboard: The keyboard is about the same size as the standard Mac keyboard. To me, that means it's meant for pixies but most, including my Mac using wife, find it perfect. My huge ape-like hands have an issue with it as they do with any Mac. I'd guess 90% of the population will have no issue.Printing: Chromebooks have a bad rap here and I agree that not having WiFi printing a serious omission. However, I had a ChromeOS ready Epson already needing only a firmware upgrade. Doing this upgrade and then setting up Google Print was a snap. So if you have ready hardware - it's easy peasy. If you don't,  grrrr.Flexibility: here's where the Chromebooks shine. As you likely know, you can run Google Office off or online storing files in the Cloud or locally. I went from cloud skeptical to storing my important files there to forget about backups failing or viruses lurking. What surprised me was how easy it was to set up remote desktop on both our Windows PC and a Mac. So we can run Google Office (Open Office), any Windows program, any Mac program and all storing files locally or in various clouds. Setting all this up was quick, easy and went without a hitch. I need to use Microsoft Access and doing so from this Chromebook is perfectly easy and transparent.  I also `cast many Internet feeds to my 55" LG HD TV making for no regrets about being a cable cutter.If all of this isn't enough, and it wasn't for me because I was intrigued by all this machine can do, you can flip into Developer Mode, access the Linux which underpins the ChromeOS and install another Linux shell such as Ubuntu and then run Linux programs. There is also a wrapper you can get to run, one at a time, most if not all Android apps available from the play.google.com site.  Google has been working on a way to run all Android apps under ChromeOS. By the time you read this review, it may have that accomplished.After a month using this machine daily, my only remaining question is why anybody would choose a limited laptop such as a Windows or Mac OS machine. Me? I'm sold on Chromebook.

This is a product once only found in pro kitchens. I was a bit skeptical about the claims that it could replace parchment, wax, oil, grease and cooking spray (in many situations). I've been using the sample furnished by the company for a while now and have grudgingly come over to believe the claims made for this mat.The company furnishes, free of charge, a small intro to this mat along with a few simple recipes. You'll get it at your Amazon email address a few days after buying the mat from Amazon. I tried one recipe to start. I felt a bit odd about placing food directly onto what to me felt like a soft plastic mat and then baking away but it turned out just fine. I think the biggest issue I had was my own skepticism. I was definitely expecting some outgassing from the product when new so I baked it at 350F for 15 minutes all alone in the oven to see how much outgassing would occur. None did then or in any other chore.I now find myself using this all the time for a variety of things from kneading bread (better than on the kitchen counter), baking cookies or using it as a non stick liner in place of aluminum foil. For the latter, I just did my super hot to mild oven roast recipe which starts the meat out at 425 F and then reduces it to 315 for the duration of the cooking time. I lined a cookie sheet with the SimpliFine mat and used a variety of marinades and coatings on the meat sure to leave a gooey, sugary sticky mess on the mat when done.In the past, I've lined the cookie sheet with aluminum foil because not to do so would make for a fierce clean up chore. To my surprise the mess came off the mat with very little effort. The mat was unaffected by the high initial heat as well.Overall, I was and remain delightfully surprised at how useful this mat is. I can't think of any way to improve it so the five stars. Try it. You'll like it as they say.

This holder fits into the CD slot and then a few twists of the large thumb wheel secures it in place. The phone mounts to the padded holder which will secure it against anything short of a high speed crash. In use, the holder vibrates a bit when you hit bumps but not to the point of being scary. The vibrations damp down quickly so you never lose the use of the phone for more than a second or two assuming you aren't on a road that's all bumps.The holder has two prongs at the bottom which secure the base of the phone. On the iPhone 6, the prongs clear the ports for charging and the 3.5mm phone plug. The relief may demand you insert the charge cord and/or the audio plug before mounting but once inserted, the holder doesn't interfere with the cords in any way.Tested with an iPhone 6 and iPhone 6+ both in and out of their cases. All tests showed perfect operation. Overall I can't see any defects or possible improvements in materials, workmanship or design so the five stars.

Everything in this kit works as advertised However, I'm skeptical that it offers any cleaning improvement over a standard bucket and sponge mop. Let me explain why I say this.The idea of two bucket chambers, one for clean and one for dirty water makes sense to those who don't fully grasp the concept of surfactants in detergents. Even so, clearly clean water to clean is a better solution (ha ha) than using the same water over and over until you are `cleaning' the floor with dirty gray-brown water.Here, there are two chambers as the manufacturer states. You put detergent water mix in one chamber. Press on the mop handle and the head spins picking up a huge amount of water. I'd guess it holds a full quart / liter of liquid. Clearly you don't want to flood your floor with this so put it in the spin / dirty water basket, press the handle a few times to spin it and you spin out clean water into the dirty water chamber but at least get the mop ready to mop. This is, in my mind, inferior to the old rollers where the clean water is returned to the clean water side of the bucket.OK, now mop. Then put the now very dirty mop into the dirty basket, spin, wring out the dirty water and then put in the clean water repeating the cycle. This both wastes some good detergent water and also doesn't fully clean the mop. The fibers are dirty from the mopping no matter how much spinning I did so I ended up polluting the clean water anyway just like a regular non spinning mop kit would.Did it clean the floor? Yes, just fine. Did it spin and work as advertised? Clearly it did. It did, while spinning with a saturated clean water mop head spray a bit on my legs due to that super saturation, but mopping isn't a sterile pastime so I'll let that go.  In the end are my floors cleaner than with a sponge mop / single bucket? I don't think so. The gadgets guy in me enjoyed the heck out of the spinning and the idea of two chambers but I can't see it helped in cleaning in any way. It may have, but I can't see it.One other thing, I think those with weak hands will have trouble inserting the clean out plug so it doesn't leak (it needs to be FIRMLY) and if it were in well, getting it back out. This area needs a valve, not a plug. Overall a nice idea which is fun to play with but which doesn't seem to contribute much to cleanliness.

First, to be fair, I did get a great deal of information from this book. I was a new Chromebook user and now have a good working knowing of the system partly due to reading this book. However, it could have been a good deal better than it was.The world of Chrome is moving fast and this book is a bit past its sell by date. There is little the author can do about the published book on this account but for doing this sort of writing, a Web site which updates the book's information would be nice. Even other areas, such as Windows, seems dated. The author is utterly hung up on Windows 8 and cannot say 'Windows' without appending the 8 even though 8.1 has been around for a long time now and 10 is the current version (as of this review).The irony of the author dating his book with Windows 8 mentions is that the information is not exclusive to Windows 8 but applies at least to all Windows from Vista to 10. Worse, the book fails to even mention that Macs exist. The book goes into how to run Remote Desktop from Windows so you can use Windows programs on your Chromebook but you can do the identical in a Mac which he fails to mention. We're running both here without a glitch.There are a few technical errors as well. For example, to install Crouton, he skips that you need to enter the command 'shell' after you shell out of the GUI into the crosh shell. Not doing so will result in baffling errors for the newcomer.I'd say you get your money's worth in this book but it could have been more. I'd like to see it refreshed, a bit better organized (put all the Windows / MSFT stuff in one place instead of polluting up the whole book) and have the author ask a friend to do a tech edit.Still, like I said, you get your money's worth here.

This is a set of two brushes both of which are very aggressive. Added is a water reservoir in the handle. Fill the handle with water and then turn the valve on while scrubbing your pre-heated grill and you'll get some steam. It's not like a steam cleaning of a grill, but rather water dripping on hot grates makes some steam while the brushes do all the real work.The upshot is one very clean grill but the steam did nothing I could see to assist this. I tried this on two grungy grills. One I used the water drip and one with no water. Both results were quite good but that begs the question what does the water do? I can't see any benefit to having this.I'll use this to clean my grills because I've never used a tool which gives better results than the 'scraper' brush and the regular brush, but I probably won't bother with filling the handle with water again.There is a very small and difficult (for my large hands) wing nut which detaches the brushes from the handle for easy machine washing. Well, it'd be an easy detachment for my wife's piano player sort of long slim fingers but I had a bit of a tussle.One caution if you get this. Be careful taking it out of the box. These brushes are seriously sharp and aggressive. The instructions warn you of this but of course, you can't see the instructions until you unpack the unit. For those of you in the southwest, think cholla cactus.A good set of brushes but I can't see the steam business adding any benefit.

By now, book 5, unless you've started with this from an earlier edition, you'd probably be a bit lost. So I'm writing this for those who have read 5/5.I think we're getting into a pattern which needs a bit more variation. McGill's luck, the constant treachery of the Galina and Claver, the stupid constant noise from Ortiz and the rotating girlfriends who don't grow in number but don't shrink either is getting to be repetitive.Here we do have a bit of a variation in the sense that the group rushes into engage an unknown enemy without even the slightest scouting. Really? Nobody is that stupid as to invade a planet with an enemy of unknown abilities and then to not even secure the ship not once but twice and once after an attack. An enemy drills in from outside the hull and the captain, after the battle doesn't check the hull for more invaders?These two elements harmed the book for me. They seemed stupid beyond belief and also stupid out of character for the people we'd gotten to know. Then, to go to a supposed peace conference with the intent of killing the other party under a truce flag - poor form. Well, it does work out of course and the last scene sets us up for book 6 which I definitely will buy and soon after publication.I do hope for a bit of an improvement, though.

This grill light is the bomb!  It comes with a baby screwdriver to open the battery compartment and the batteries are included.  It fastened onto our flat-handled barbecue with no effort and brightly lights the entire grill.  It doesnt heat up from the barbecues heat and it the light remained bright throughout tonights light rain.  The on/off is well located and works with a light touch.  It is much more efficient than the lantern light we have used in the past.  I highly recommend it.

This sheet set arrived quickly.  The coral color is as pictured.  All seams were stitched correctly.  The fitted sheet tucks into my 12 high mattress about 1 around all four sides of the bed.  The elastic stretched easily over the corners.  It has washed and dried perfectly.  No fading, no pilling.  The fabric is very soft.  My only complaint, if you can call it that, is that pillow cases are not offered separately.  I have a queen bed, but use king pillows.  The standard size pillow cases that come with the set are useless to me so I am stuck with pillow cases that do not match my sheets.  The Clara Clark folks arent alone in this as it is the way the sheet set industry operates, so I havent deducted any stars for my inconvenience.  Bottom line, the sheets are priced right, true to color, soft, well made, fit the bed and wash well.  5 stars.

This is a great iPad mini case!  I bought it in pink and it is true to the color shown.  I especially like that the cover puts the iPad to sleep every time.  It fits perfectly and doesn't block any portion of the screen, the camera lens, or the buttons.  The iPad locks firmly into place and doesn't shift in any direction.  My stylus fit very tight at first, but after a few uses it slides easily into the elastic holder.

My daughter and all my grandchildren have learned their colors by having a My First Colors book read to them from the time of their birth.  Every one of them could recognize and say their colors as soon as they could talk -- at 17 months, my oldest granddaughter pointed at the blue jello served to her in a restaurant and said, "boo."  And now he she is expecting a daughter who will learn colors the same way. This book is a great, timeless teaching tool that provides an easy bonding time for the child and the person who reads to her.  There are a number of pictures depicting each color - we simply ad the name of the color before each picture: red cherries, red car, red flower, etc. So much better than having just one picture of each color! You cannot go wrong with this book.

This TP gets 3 stars because it is TP and it is soft.  But these narrow mini-rolls cover just over half the width of the roller.  Ive never bothered to count the squares, but there is plenty of room between the wall and a new roll.  I can accept fewer squares for a lower price, but please Cottonelle  make your TP rolls as wide as a standard toilet paper holder!  We all love a bargain, but we don't necessarily want it to look cheap.  Undersized rolls just look cheap.

Two of my rose bushes become infected with rust each year.  And for the first time, this year I had scale on a crabapple tree. In the past I would have controlled both of these conditions with Neem Oil.  However Neem Oil has such a strong odor that it leaves me feeling sick after Ive sprayed.  The Ortho Tree & Shrub Fruit Tree Spray seems to work just as well, and the Neem Oil is cut just enough (by 30%) that the odor is far less obnoxious.  It mixes readily, is highly effective, and is in an easy-to-open container.  I really like that it does not trigger my asthma and I do not smell it for hours afterward - which has been my problem with Neem Oil.  The disadvantage, of course, is that it is not a natural product and it does contain insecticides.  So one must be very careful where and when to spray.  I waited to spray my crabapple until after the flowers had dropped, and I remove the flowers from the rose bushes before spraying  even then I spray very early in the morning before the honeybees come into my yard. I highly recommend this spray, but only for targeted use.

This is a liquid gel  not too thick and not too runny.  I have very delicate 72-year old skin and cannot use abrasive exfoliators without removing too many layers.  Even when I was young, I couldnt use them. This gel works only on dead skin and has causes no reaction to living skin.  Apply it, wait a moment while it changes from clear to slightly white,  and then very gently massage ~ the dead skin just rolls up into little balls and there is no abrasion at all.  It is a minor miracle.  Ive recommended it to friends of a like age.  I am using it twice a week and I love the way my skin looks and feels.  If I could give more than 5 stars, I would.

My fish and I love this aquarium heater.  It stays perfectly in place with suction cups and a bracket, and keeps my 6-gallon tank at a steady 78 degrees day and night - even through the winter.  My fish tank is next to a window so, even though I close the blinds at night, the air temp fluctuates during a 24 hour period.  However, the water temp in the fish tank stays steady.  I have one of those long, low aquariums without a lid, so I do have to replace evaporated water periodically since the water stays so much warmer than the air around it.  I like that the heater has a light that shows me the temp, but I keep a separate thermometer in the tank to confirm the temperature.  I started with a 25 watt heater that couldnt do the job, but the upgrade to 50 watt was perfect.

The artwork looks like what you see in the Amazon photo.  It is very pretty, but definitely plastic and not enamel on metal.  The disc itself is wafer thin.  What I dislike about it is that the back of this piece is used as an advertising platform for Dan Morris.  Four lines of advertising printed on the back of my keychain, including Made in China.  It looks like a freebie given out at a trade show.  And, even though it isnt an expensive item, it is still overpriced.  I would not buy again.

This pet food can cover perfectly fits and seals the Merrick brand 3 pop-top-cans.  The semi-stretch covers have three concentric rings.  The 3 can fits into the center ring.  It isnt difficult to put on or pull off ~ the lid easily finds which ring the rim of the can should slide into.  On the Merrick cans, the lid then overhangs the can by the width of the last ring ~ maybe  inches.  If someone would come up with a really stretchy silicone lid that would fit all cans by simply stretching and clinging, I would give it a grateful 5 star rating.  This one comes close and Id give 4-1/2 stars if possible.  These lids are expensive, so it is too bad we cannot purchase just one at a time.  Since they have a lifelong product money back warranty, I expect them to last many years.

Ive been using various Miracle-Gro products for many years and they have never let me down.  The Shake N Feed line is the easiest to use  for established plants, just sprinkle it on top of the soil following the directions for proper amounts, and every time the granules get wet, the Miracle-Gro dissolves a little more and sends nutrients down to the roots.  Every couple of months, shake out a little more around the root-line of the plants.  The All-Purpose product works well for potted as well as ground plants.  With new plantings, I mix Miracle-Gro deep into the potting soil to give the plants a good start.  At first I was unsure but, once I got used to it, I found the newly designed shaker top is easier to manipulate than the old spout design.  With the spout, I sometimes poured more plant food than I intended.  I store my gardening supplies in an outside potting area, so I like that the granules of this particular food continue to be available in a water-proof container.  This ensures the bottom never gets soggy and turns the plant food into a block of unusable stuff.  It doesnt get any easier than this, and my plants thrive on it.

My mCover case (in pink) has large cracks running up both sides of the spine after less than four months use.  The 'Leather' is paper thin and feels very brittle where it has cracked. Until the case began to fall apart, I loved it!  It is lightweight, easy to keep clean, slides easily into my handbag and, although my kindle keyboard fits loosely in its corner bindings, it has never been in danger of coming out.  I've received a lot of compliments about how cute it is. I bought polka-dot Duck brand duct tape to cover the cracks and reinforce the spine and expect to get much more use from this cover.  I'm not happy that I've had to patch it so soon (the reason for 4 stars instead of 5) but it is a great cover for the Kindle Keyboard and the Duck Tape doesn't hurt its appearance in the least.

I have one of these automatic sprayers in a closet that houses a stinky lockbox (I think it was shipped in a container that was filled with fish by-products.)  This little sprayer does a great job keeping the closet smelling fresh and the fishy odor just disappears.  The other sprayer is kept in the small room in our master bath that has no windows and houses the toilet.  It is easy to keep the little room smelling fresh and clean using the automatic sprayer.  My only complaint about this product is that the spray itself is noisy.  It is possible to hear it go off from another room when the house is quiet.  But that is a small issue which doesnt detract from its effectiveness.  My only reason for mentioning it is because someone very sensitive to nighttime noises might find it annoying.  Ive had my original Air-Wick Freshmatic for over ten years and just recently purchased the second one.  The design has changed a little, but it seems just as durable and reliable as the older one.

I received a bottle of Dr. Kings Sinus Relief for review through the Vine program and was surprised that it was a spray for the tongue instead of the nose.  I assumed sinus relief would be provided by a nose spray, so was very doubtful that this could make any difference to my nighttime sinus issues.  Ive been using it for about 4 weeks: 3 sprays on the tongue, 3 times a day.  I no longer awaken several times during the night unable to breathe through my nose.  Since I am not taking any new meds, I am confident that this spray is what has made the difference.  However, it didnt provide immediate relief.  I dont think three sprays to the tongue will immediately clear up your nose or itchy eyes, although I realize homeopathic remedies work differently for everyone.  In my experience, even though it promises to provide temporary relief for the symptoms of sinusitis, hay fever or other upper respiratory allergies, it didn't work that way.  It has a very mild taste which is inoffensive and dissipates almost immediately.  I am going to continue to use it since I think its cumulative effect has been to lessen the nighttime swelling of my sinuses.

I am electronically challenged, so was a little apprehensive when I purchased this to enable my new iPod to speak to my built-in home stereo system.  As it turns out, my nerves were completely misplaced.  The color-coded cables easily connected into my receiver and the little Bluetooth box recognized my iPod immediately.  I now have excellent quality music coming from the speakers installed throughout my house.  The box was installed and working in less than 2 minutes.  I highly recommend the HomeSpot Bluetooth Audio Receiver and it gets an easy 5 stars from me.

I am 71 years old, so there is nothing in this world that will make my skin stunningly radiant, no matter what this product promises.  When used alone, it leaves an oily residue for about ten minutes until it is completely absorbed and it takes about the same length of time for the scent to dissipate.  For me, it is just too oily to use on its own.  However, I have found that I really like it mixed with my body lotion.  Mixing the two dilutes the oil a little while it enriches the lotion, and the mixture absorbs quickly.  I have very dry skin, so am always looking for a little extra moisturizing help.  Although Im quite happy with this product when has been mixed with lotion, Im giving only 3 stars because there are less expensive oils that blend with my lotion just as easily and effectively.

Ive always eaten at least one fruit yogurt every day but recently had to stop because of sugar issues.  I switched to these little pearls about 2 months ago and am really pleased.  They are tiny and easy to swallow.  Taking just one a day delivers healthy bacteria that aids digestion and keeps the gut in balance, which improves overall health.  The Pearls come in blister packs and do not need to be refrigerated as some probiotics do.  I've had no negative reaction to these little pills -- only positive results.

I wore these during a recent trip to Washington DC when the wind-chill factor was dipping into the negative and, if you could find a place where there was no wind, the temps were in the low teens.  These ear bags are easy to put on and (while I first needed a bit of practice in front of a mirror) I was soon able to put them on or take them off while walking or riding the Metro.  Once on, they are pretty secure and never came off in the wind.  They didnt interfere with my hearing (or my hair) and I was grateful to have them because my ears never once got cold.  When I went into warm museums and offices, they were easy to slip off and put in my pocket.  I dont hesitate to recommend them.

We mounted this on a gate that the kids would open and shut without catching the latch, so that the gate was almost always swinging open.  This spring softly and automatically closes the gate and the latch catches every time.  It totally solved our problem with very little money or effort.  I highly recommend it.

I have this trap in yellow and it was so successful last summer that I purchased it in blue for my daughters yard.  Using a combination of beer, vinegar, lemon juice, & dishsoap these traps fill with wasps and flies almost immediately (1 bottle beer, 2 Tbs white or cider vinegar, 1 Tbs lemon juice,  tsp dish detergent.)  Honey bees do not like vinegar, so it repels bees at the same time it attracts wasps. As soon as I found success with my wasp bait, I sprayed their nest areas after dark with a high pressure sprayer using: 1 gal water, 1 cup dish soap, 1 cup vinegar,  cup lemon juice,  cup peppermint oil. The soap, vinegar and lemon juice kill them and they hate the smell of peppermint. If any survived, they didn't return to their old nests. I now keep small containers with cotton balls saturated with baby oil and peppermint oil near the gutter entries that the wasps favored and so far none have returned.

I LOVE Kinder chocolates.  Kinder Bueno bars are one of my favorites of theirs.  Unfortunately it is not easy to find Kinder in the states and even harder to find Kinder Bueno bars because they are imported.  When I do, they have a premium price tag.  Occasionally we go to Cancun.  When returning I buy these from the Duty Free in the Cancun airport.  I was so excited to find these on Amazon and for a reasonable price.  I was a little worried that they might be stale or have melted and cooled.  I got the 10 pack package.  Each pack contains 2 individually wrapped Bueno sticks.  These arrived in perfect condition.  They are fresh and delicious.  I love the creamy milk and hazelnut center surrounded by crisp that's coated in milk chocolate.  I have to keep myself from eating them all.  They taste good.  The main packaging and the pack wrappers are all dated with a best before date of 04.05.16 - May 4, 2016.  I will definitely order more.

It is sock season.  While I love flip flops and sandals, socks are so fun.  I have so many pairs.  I was quite happy to add this set of marled crew length camp socks to my collection.  Tho pairs of socks come in a set.  I got the one with a red pair and a black pair.  The listing says they are made of acryllic and spandex but I can't fine any information on the packaging of the actual content percentages.  They are soft with knitted texture.  The bit of stretch keeps them up and on comfortably. My feet stay warm without these socks being to thick or chunky.  They can be worn up, down, rolled, scrunched, and even layered to create different looks.  They work great with all types of outfits and shoes, except maybe fancy dresses and heels.  Ha!  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

Kansas City Royals fans will love this shirt.  The listing says the material is "tri blend" but is actually 50% combed cotton and 50% polyester.  It is super soft.  Talk about comfortable.  The trunk is blue and the 3/4 sleeve are navy blue.  Across is says "Comback City" over to crossed bats with a crown.  It's very nice looking.  I have to say it does run small though.  I order a large to get this shirt for my husband.  It fits more like a medium in the across the shoulder and body.  So now it's mine!  It's long though on me with the bottom of them hem hitting about mid-thigh.  Looks really cute with legging and jeans.  I can wear as a beach cover up or even a night shirt.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

These compression shorts only go up to a size large.  The listing currently doesn't specify waist lengths for its sizes.  Compression items are supposed to provide firm support but these are just a bit too tight for my husband's size 32 inch waist.  He can wear them but for a short while.  Like a trip to the gym for an hour or two.  He cannot wear then for hours like when playing sports.  Except for the sizing, the shorts are nice.  They are made well.  The material is smooth and strong.  They seem very durable and that they will last a long time.  I was able to purchase this product at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

Yea!  Christmas socks!  All the girls and ladies in my family love Christmas socks.  I'm totally loving this set from Buttons & Pleats.  The pack comes with 5 pairs of socks.  All have the same holiday design - looks like raindeer and snowflakes.  They come in 5 different colors though - brown with tan, pink with red, blue with red, red with tan, and tan with pink.  They also have metallic threads woven in for a touch of holiday sparkle.  The socks' material is made from 40% wool, 55% polyester, 5% spandex.  They maintain their shape, aren't too bulky, and they keep my feet toasty.  Fun, cute, and comfortable.  I wear a size 6 women's shoe and these fit me just fine.  Very well made plus they look and feel nice.  I'm going to have to get a few sets for presents and stocking stuffers.  I received this item in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

These Christmas gift bags are going to put to good use this holiday season.  There are 12 gift bags in 6 different Christmas designs.  Each bag has a fold over flap that velcros closed.  In the top are handle holes for ease of carrying.  You can also put ribbon or other tie through them to prevent curious eyes from sneaking peaks inside.  There is a little red bow on the front of each flap.  Made of thin cardboard material, the bags are sturdy and can stand upright on their own.  They are a medium size with dimensions of 8" wide x 10" tall x 4" deep.  Not large enough for an adult size sweater, but can hold a T-shirt, socks, scarf, leggings, jewelry, DVDs, console games, chocolates or other food items, book, picture frame, smaller toys, etc.  Perfect for holiday parties and gatherings.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

We've enjoyed quinoa for awhile.  When making it at home I want to use quinoa without chemicals and additives.  Nutria Organic Royal White Quinoa is USDA certified, non-GMO, and all natural.  We aren't vegetarians but we are trying to get more plant based foods into our diet.  Quinoa is a great way to do do so plus it's high in protein, fiber, flavinoids, and minerals magnesium, potassium, zinc and iron.  Some packaged quinoa is already pre-rinsed and ready to cook. This brand is not.  Makes sure you thoroughly rinse what you are going to used before cooking.  I have several fine mesh strainers so this step is not an issue for me. Quinoa is easy to make.  Use twice the water as quinoa, bring to a boil, reduce heat, then cover and cook for 15.  Once done, fluff with a fork and use how you like.  I like to add cooked quinoa to soup.  Add cooked veggies and some seasoning to make it a side dish.  It's good for meats with sauces like shrimp scampi or chicken teriyaki.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

Ok, everyone should have one of these sewing kits from Vellostar.  Whether you have a sewing machine or not, I don't, it's great to have one of these on hand.  For quick jobs, and even larger ones, this kit has everything you need:- Stainless steel scissors- 10 Needles- 2 Threaders- Pins- 3 Shirt buttons- Thimble- Measuring tape (60" Long)- Seam ripper- 12 Spools of thread in popular colors (24-30ft)All of this comes in a handy case with zipper closure.  It's compact for easy storage and is always ready for on the go.  Fits in a purse, backpack, suitcase, briefcase, glove compartment, etc. Business trip, vacation, camping, etc., we always bring this with us and it has saved the day in a pinch more than once.  My husband was able to quickly sew a button back on his dress shirt before a work meeting.  Makes a nice little gift or stocking stuffer.  I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

If you are looking to try goji berries or already consume them regularly, DureLife Organic Goji Berries are an excellent choice.  The are USDA certified organic.  I see a lot of food products that say they are organic, but aren't USDA certified.  These goji berries are, which makes a difference to me.  The quality of these dried goji berries is excellent.  They are chewy with a mildly sweet and mildly tangy flavor.  I often eat a handful straight out of the bag.  They are also good in smoothies, added to pancakes and muffins, and sprinkled on salads.  I also like to add them to overnight oatmeal where they soften up nicely.  They come in a heavy duty resealable plastic bag to maintain their freshness.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

I haven't had a shirt like this in a long time.  I'd forgotten how much I love the look and comfortable style.  Lucky Love's Plaid Flannel Shirt provides that classic piece.  I ordered the grey and white shirt.  The pattern is actually checkered, not plaid.  The stock photo shows this so I knew what to expect.  The flannel material is made of 100% cotton.  Very soft.  It's nice to cozy up in on cool nights.  I ordered the medium.  The "boyfriend fit" is quite roomy.  I could have easily gone with the small.  Although it has a full button up front and long sleeves with button cuffs, the bottom hem is curved giving it a feminine touch.  It's nice to wear alone, with a tank or tee under, or even a turtle neck or under a sweater during winter.  I think this flannel looks great with jeans.  The longer length works well with leggings and even skirts, khakis and shorts.  Very versatile.  Easy to care for, I just toss this shirt in the washing machine.  The tag says line dry but I put it in the dryer on low and it comes out just fine.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

This is a super cute blouse.  I am very pleased with the quality of the fabric and the craftsmanship.  The material is comprised of 100% polyester.  No stretch to it so keep that in mind for sizing.  I ordered the medium and fits how I imagined.  The cloth has a light sheen to it.  Feels smooth, light and cool on the skin.  It is a bit transparent so undergarments should be chosen accordingly.  The background color to me is more of an ivory than beige.  I love the brightly colored bird design. I find it unique and attractive.  This long sleeved blouse has button closure cuffs with a v-neck style with ties.  Change the look and openness of the neckline with a quick bow.  The stitching is all straight and well done.  It's very comfortable to wear.  Easily pairs with jeans, leggings, skirts, dress pants, khakis, etc. for casual to more dressy outfits.  A really nice quality top that I'm going to be using for a lot of different occasions.  I received this item in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

Carole Martin Women's Full-Freedom Comfort Bra is comfortable.  I wasn't sure if it would really fit B, C, D and even DD cups.  It really does and provides full coverage.  The material is 85% nylon and 15% spandex.  The feel is smooth and satiny.  It has plenty of stretch in all directions and provides gentle support to this wireless bra.  The wide straps are not adjustable but they do stretch for a comfortable fit.  They also don't dig into my shoulders even after wearing 12+ hours.  The front closure is a nice change.  Makes putting on and removal so easy.  I can see how this would be a benefit for anyone with mobility/reach around the back issues.  This is a well made bra.  The only con is the seam that goes from mid cup to the bottom of the band.  The stitched seam on the inside of the cups it much thicker than I would expect, especially here.  They make deep indentations into the skin the full length of the seam.  All other stitching and seams of the bra are flat.  I received this item in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

I love using chia seeds.  They provide a nice boost of plant based nutrition to to whatever they are added to.  Plus fiber and protein in them give me a more full feeling.  I like to blend them in smoothies.  I sprinkle them on salad, pancakes and yogurt.  They have a crunchy texture like sesame seeds when dry.  When in liquids they soften and swell and get gelatinous like tapioca.  For the most part they take on the flavor of whatever they are mixed with.  Otherwise they have a slight nutty taste.  Kiva Heath Food's chia seeds raw, organic, non-GMO, vegan, gluten free, and fair trade.  Quality chia seeds that home in a resealable plastic bag.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion

I was not sure what to expect from the Pomegranate Mojito Green Tea from Zest Tea as far as flavor.  Upon opening the bag the scent is very minty and green.  I was hoping it would have a more fruity taste from the pomegranate.  It does not. It's more lime and mint.  I don't mind this except it has a bit of a bitter taste, I believe from the lime.  I smooth that out with some sweetener.  It's a good green tea that has a bonus kick of 150 mg of caffeine per cup.  It definitely keeps me going throughout the day.  This tea also contains the amino acid L-Theanine to reduce the jitters and crash of caffeine.  Seems to work for me.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

It's so convenient to have a digital thermometer on hand.  Taking one's body temperature orally, by axillary underarm, or rectally is more active than the ones that go behind the ear or on the forehead.  This iProven Digital Thermometer is clinically tested and proven to be 99.8% accurate.  I've been sick the last week and I've been able to monitor high high my fever has gotten, fortunately not over 102.  It takes readings in Celsius and Fahrenheit.  It's so easy to use and completes measurement in 20-35 seconds.  Comes with a clear plastic protective storage case. I LOVE my Philips Sonicare FlexCare Platinum toothbrush.  I had no idea how much Sonicare replacement toothbrush heads were at the time. When I needed to get replacements, it was a bit of a shock.  Philips Sonicare HX6013 ProResults 4 Pack Generic Replacement Heads from Protect IT have have saved the day.  You get 4 toothbrush heads for less than 1/2 the price of 2 Sonicare branded ones.  Since these are a generic brand, I was afraid that they wouldn't work well.  The fit perfectly on to my Sonicare handle.  They just push right on like they are supposed and they stay.  They also properly fit in the UV light sanitizer.  Each one has a different colored ring at the bottom so you can have one for each family member.  The toothbrush heads work great.  The bristles have varying lengths to get around and between teeth.  My teeth feel so clean after brushing.  You'd never know they aren't actually Sonicare brand.  I received this item in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

I've tried liquid pen liners in the past.  Can't say I liked them very much.  They didn't write well or smudge easily.  Some weren't a true black but blue underneath.  Anyway, I am quite pleased with Nikka Notto Express Liquid Waterproof Eyeliner.  The body of the pen is easy to grip and hold.  The felt tip comes to a fine point.  I have no problem drawing a line at the base of my eyelashes.  I can make it very thin or widen it out.  The eyeliner goes on smoothly.  This is a quick drying eyeliner.  You can make build out your line to make it wide but you need to work quickly.  I finally made my first little wing that I was actually satisfied with with this pen.  I love that it is waterproof.  This prevents it from smudging and smearing in the hot and muggy weather we have here most of the year.  The eyeliner stays put all day and night.  The intense black color is just that, intense.  Very bold and very black.  No blue or purple undertones.  Love it!  I received this item to test in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

HSI PROFESSIONAL makes professional, salon quality products for the hair.  They make both styling tools and hair care products.  I have been using HSI PROFESSIONAL's Smoothing Shampoo with Argan Oil for over a week now.  I'm happy to say I am seeing an improvement in the condition of my hair.  This is a sulfate free shampoo.  It contains Argan Oil as well as vitamins A, B, C, and D.  Together the nourish and soft hair.  My hair dry and a little damaged.  Plus it's prone to frizz.  I notice since using this shampoo that my hair is smoother and has more shine.  I actually need less product(serums, gels, etc) to tame, control, and style my hair.  This shampoo lathers up nicely and rinses cleanly.  The pump top releases easy and is very convenient to use in the shower. If you want the water to pour, than this is the shower head for you.  This is a rainfall style shower head in a square shape. Most shower heads these days contain a flow restrictor.  This is to lesson the amount of water flow to help with conservation and utility bill.  This shower head does not have the restrictor.  So water flows just like from a faucet.  We control it by how much we turn the water flow on.  The 60 rubber nozzles create a fantastic rainfall effect.  My husband loves to put this on full blast so it's a drenching, somewhat massaging rainfall.  Fortunately he takes quick showers, unlike mine.  Made from acrylic and brass, this shower head has a very contemporary look.  The perimeter square is clear acrylic, the inner chrome finished brass square is blue around the exterior.  So you can see it through the acrylic.  I have to admit, it looks pretty cool.  I feel like I'm in a fancy hotel while I'm getting clean.  Super easy to install, the 1/2" standard outlet size just screws right on shower outlet.  Very well made to last through many long and high temperature showers, it comes with a 1 year parts warranty against manufacture defects. I have been using Retseliney Revitalizing Vitamin C Night Cream for about 10 days now.  I really like it.  The ingredients are 98.5% naturally derived and 70% organic. Skin looks refreshed.  I had gotten a bit of sun a week ago and this cream soothed the burn and helped it heal quickly.  I do believe the look of my skin is improving. Square Rainfall Style shower head from AKDY looks great in our shower.  Works well too.  It's an 8" square shaped shower head.  There are 81 evenly spaced nozzles.  They produce a wide coverage rainfall type shower spray.  I don't like to have to keep moving to get parts of my body under the water, so for me it is really nice to have have a shower head with a broad coverage area.  I also like to take hot showers.  The material of this shower head is ABS formed from thermo material which is able to handle the heat.  The face of the shower head has mirror polished chrome finish while the back is a flat matte black.  A simple yet attractive modern look that really updates the look of our shower.  Most importantly, this shower head works well.  There are no clogged nozzles.  The rainfall spray is relaxing with plenty of water and pressure to thoroughly wash and rinse clean. Helix Naturals Long Handled Toenail/Fingernail Scissors are ok. The handling is nice. The handle grips grips are ergonomically designed to be comfortable to hold for both women and men. Plus it's not so easy to get around the corners or curved nails due to the thickness of the blades.  These scissors are made from sturdy materials but they need to cut better. I am very pleased with this trivet.  It is made of black cast iron in the shape of a cat head.  Cut from one piece, it is solid and sturdy with good weight to it.  It's not going to crack or break. I am a new user of Sweet Almond Oil and I'm a fan.  Pure Body Naturals Sweet Almond Oil is cold pressed and 100% pure.  Sweet almond oil is loaded with nourishing nutrients  - vitamins A, B and E, calcium, potassium, magnesium, mono saturated fats, folic acids, potassium and protein.  Absorbs deeply to hydrate and heal dry, cracked, chapped patchy, flaky, and or irritated skin.  Does not clog pores.  Gives my skin a beautiful glow and soft and silky to the touch.  Sweet almond oil can be used from head to toe.  Excellent for the face.  Reduces dark eye circles, wrinkles and fights continued signs of aging.  I love to use it as an eye makeup remover.  Really gets off waterproof mascara.  I also use this for my hair.  A few drop rubbed into my scalp relieves itchiness and dandruff.  A few drops applied to my hair adds shine, controls frizz, softens and revives dry, damage strands.  I expected sweet almond oil to have an almond fragrance.  Instead it has a light nondescript nutty scent.  It's faint enough that this almond oil is commonly used as a carrier oil for essential oils for aromatherapy.  Excellent for massage as it's proven to relieve muscle pain and physical stress, adding a few drops of lavender makes for a truly relaxing experience.  I am surprised that the bottle is plastic and clear instead of amber glass as sweet almond oil will go rancid quickly when exposed to light and air.  I keep mine stored in cabinet that stays dark and relatively cool.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review.

This is my first experience with tamanu oil and did not know much about it before receiving it.  Personally, I would give this product 3 stars because of the smell.  I really can't stand it.  It smells awful and actually gives me a headache.  To me it has a very strong bad herbal scent.  The odor lasts too.  I can't use this on my face, neck, chest or shoulders because of the scent.  I don't think it's fair to deduct 2 stars just from the scent alone though as this is a 100% natural product.  No fragrance is added.  I wasn't expecting the dark green color.  It rubs into the skin and the color dissipates completely.  Does leave a bit of sheen behind but is not too greasy despite being a thicker oil.  Tamanu oil is supposed to be good for treating nail fungus and  psoriasis and eczema due to its anti-viral and antioxidant properties. Anti inflammatory and pain relieving properties make tamanu oil a good ointment for blemishes, burns, scratches, and bug bites.  This oil is also used for skin regeneration and hydration for firmer, younger looking skin.  I got a little bit of a sunburn on the top of my feet.  I also had a few mosquito bites on my lower legs.  I applied a small bit to both.  Both the bites and burns were soothed with reduced redness.  For those that don't mind the smell, tamanu oil has a lot of uses.  I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion in a review

I bought two of these at full price, which was a fair price, given the great reviews it rec'd.  I believe the other reviewers 100%, but my experience was quite poor. And worse, the seller represented this as a 26 cubic foot unit when it's only a 25.4.  That is a notable difference.The steel is warped in several places, especially near the hinges.The water dispenser is SOOOO old school; the lights on the display aren't lights, they are colored plastic that mimic lights!!The water dispenser only allows small glasses to fit in.The wheels won't lock, it rolls when you pull the handle to open.Please learn from my lesson!!  Seller has been wholly unhelpful - Appliances Connection.  Wow what a poor seller!

Purchased and received within 4 business days of order.  Awesome product.  No flaws or scratches.Received the full charging handle not just the latch.  I am with reviewer #2 that the product is the full item.  Very happy.

Awesome, midweight comforter that stays flat, doesn't wrinkle easily and brightens up the room!  Your daughter will really love it and it'll put a big smile on her face every time she goes to bed... at least until the next cool thing comes out!I would recommend for spring and fall.  Too thick for summer and not enough for winter unless you put another throw on top.This is a durable, long lasting comforter.  I bought it more than 8 months ago and these hold up really well.  Thanks for reading!

Since this was about $25, I figured it was a low risk item.  It was.  I installed it, which was super easy with a simple wrench, and the plumbing tape came included.Shoppers should know, the stream coming out of this is NOT pressurized.  So it feels pretty good and all, but if you want to save a ton of water OR if you want fast rate, high pressure jet spraying on you, this is not the right product.  And this thing does not save even a bit of water, FYI.That said, for "rain on your head" type showering, this thing is awesome.  Thanks for reading.

I bought the bulk pack of this item, 20 for $12.95.  I see now that it drops to even $10.95 for 20.  These are REALLY well made, really nice looking door stops that are shinier than the picture shows.  I cannot believe the price disparity between Lowe's/Home Depot and buying online.I have some 7 foot doors that are heavy, and this has no problem stopping the door knobs from putting a hole in the wall.  This is probably the best deal of any household product I've bought in a long time.  I wish I could buy $500 blinds for $80... just like this $3 stop is 60 cents each in bulk.Also, these are better than the 4" versions because those are just way too long.. 3" is plenty to protect your walls.Thanks for reading!

I wanted to test the water pressure because I had a strange whistling noise that started to occur.  This inexpensive tool showed the pressure was low, which was caused by nearby construction. My choices:1. Call plumber for minimum $125 house call2. Buy this for $11I found out there was nothing wrong with my pipes, which were only 4.5 yrs old.  Such an awesome DIY type tool.Thanks for reading!

This is a heavy, 5" in length pool toy that is just a blast.  My kids love it.  It moves kind of randomly in the water because of the fins on the back... they are intentionally not precisely angled at 90% to the torpedo, it has a little twist in them.For under $9 I highly recommend.  Very easy to see in the water, too, which was key.  Thanks for reading!
The paint comes off very easily... otherwise the weight, size and density is good.Oh why oh why did they use such a thin coat of paint?

UPDATE:  I have now had this for 3 weeks and I discovered an additional feature.  The two bumpers that are on the toilet seat cover portion are mad of rubber, not wood.  Which is good!  So no loud slamming and cracking of the wooden seat!VERY smart design, which totally changes how the seat is:1. Installed2. Removed3. CleanedWIth other products, you place the seat in place, then install the screws into the bolt, which is underneath.  With this product, you do not first place the seat on the toilet.  You first install the screw into the bolt.  THEN, you place the seat on top of the lugs on the screws, so that you can always just completely take the seat off for future cleaning, without having to remove the screws,  Very smart.And, the bolt stays in place when you're screwing the screw into the bolt, by having a wing on the bolt that keeps the bolt in place so you don't have to hold it with your other hand.I have a beef with the manufacturer for one reason: Take a look at pic #3, the hardware is so loosely packed in the box, that it moves around and in my case, the seat had a scratch.  So it looks like there is something yucky on it, even though it's just a scratch!Good sturdy wood, nice design, nice weight to it.  I recommend and if yours also has a scratch, just put a little bit of white paint on it...  thanks for reading.

Let me tell you what this book does for you (and did for me):1. Provides perspective, such as discussing the reasons in which both the investor and entity would want to entertain such options2. Gives history on how this arose, and what's really changed over the past few years3. Discusses players in the world of investing, and which ones are doing what re: crowdfunding4. Covers changes in regulations5. Discussed the investing mechanism/vehicleRather than researching on my own for 3 years, this books summarizes the findings from professionals who really know their stuff.  You have to read this if you want a fast and meaningful intro to this growing realm.  Thanks for reading my review... now go buy the book.

It's smaller than I thought, which is not an issue, but when you put the books in, they angle back and down.  I have attached a pic for you to see.The assembly is nice and easy, the material is thick and won't rip, and the colors are nice and vivid.  So mostly all good, which is why I have it 4 stars, but your books will stand at an odd angle.Thanks for reading!

Awesome, awesome, awesome.  This cord is serious stuff, even though it's dirt cheap.  Think of this as about 1.5x as thick as your sneaker shoelaces, but way stronger and more dense.I am using this to repair some chairs, but this thing is so strong it could hold up an entire dining set from the ceiling.  Super strong and a very good value at like $6 for 50 feet.  Wow.

I bought this about 3 weeks ago on Amazon.  I have used it about every other day.  I am overall very happy:1. It doesn't take as much space in my garage as I feared (about 1/3 of one car space)2. The bands are smooth, it's not like it starts easy then gets hard, which is what some people have said3. Switching between exercises is far quicker than walking between stations at the gym4. My body gets sore after each workout.  AWESOME.It does suck for biceps though, unless you happen to be 6' 4" and have short arms.  I am 5' 10" and have very regular length arms, and so what happens is that the handles you use for biceps doesn't "kick in" until you have already done about 1/5 of the bicep curl.  The handles attach to the red bar you see towards the bottom of the machine.  So you stand in the curl position, and you start pulling up on the handles.  Then you realize that you are pulling up and up, but it hasn't started to bend the bar yet, then when you are well into the curl, it'll start to bend the weight bar back.Overall though, I'm very happy.  What I do to counter the bicep issue, is keep a set of dumbbells nearby and just use those.  Take a look at my pics they show how much of my 3rd car space gets used up by the machine.  It's really not bad!  I really love this, especially for chest, tricep and shoulder exercises.  Thanks for reading!

I got this backpack for transporting kids' supplies and lunches around, as I take my kids places.  It serves that purpose just fine.  But here are my theoretical beefs, that I think you'll want to hear about:1. The interior space is only 4 inches from front to back, maybe 4.25".  It's only 5.5" as advertised if you include the front pocket + the main compartment2. There is ZERO padding on the bottom.  So if you carry a backpack in it, make sure to put it down gently!!  I'm okay with this because I don't carry  my laptop in this bag.  But if I did, I'd put some packing foam on the bottom of the interior3. Make sure to review my pic of the side pocket (mesh).  It's too small for any bottles other than the standard 16.8 oz water bottle.  Forget about thicker coffee therms, etc.It's super light, not super heavy duty or a thick material.  Here are some more positives:1. The padding in the back is perfect, not too thick or thin.  It's about 1/3 of an inch thick2. The zippers are super, super smooth3. Straps are also padded ideally, kind of on the thin side, but technically it is padded4. I paid $11.  What a very good price for a backpack.See my dimensions... the advertised ones are slightly off!  No way would I pay more than $12-13 for this, but up to that price, it's a very decent deal.  Thanks for reading.

For the price, this is a solid product.  It has some quirks, like a rough surface that has some imperfections, such as what looks like steel drippings on some of the surfaces.  But this is about 20% less than comparable, same-weight dumbbells.  So I will accept those imperfections as a fair trade off.I am happy with this product and recommend it.Thanks for reading.

I have a mattress that is 5 years old.  My kids liked to jump on my king size bed.  It had an effect, that's FOR SURE.  The bed became lumpy.  I bought this and hoped it would make the old mattress firmer and more consistent, and it did.  IT DID!Unlike a few of the other reviewers, I received a brand new, no-stain, no defect product.  It was clean and obviously new.  It expanded in about 10 minutes and fit the mattress pretty well (not ideal, but close enough).It's now been about 2 weeks and I am loving this product.  I recommend without reservation.  I paid full price for this and am not a free product reviewer.  Take a look at the pics, btw.Thanks for reading!

What an awesome book!!!!  Yes, it's true that there is not a ton of verbiage in this book, but it's meant to be fun and stir the imagination of little girls and boys that are of an age, where more than 40 words on a page are hard to retain.  It's meant for the reader (kid) to imagine their own adventures during a time of day when the rest of the world is asleep.So when you read this to/with your child, slow down and let them think over their own ninja fantasy, let them really get engrossed in the artwork and picture themselves as a kitchen-assassin, out to devour their own little treat, while others are sleeping away.If your kid likes this, you'll read it with them dozens of times. Then pass the book along!  And if they don't like it during the first read, wait a few months, then give the child another chance to imagine their little escapade.Thanks for reading and let's all read just a little more to our kids!

We have probably shredded around 500 pages in this thing now, so with an average of 5 sheets per "use" that means we've run it 100 times.  It's dependable and runs just fine.  It chops up credit cards with ease and the plastic on the credit cards is just mutilated enough where it would not be easy for any thief to put them together.Run oil every time you use this, if it's been at least several days prior to the last use, so the blades don't start gnawing on each other and you put too much wear and tear on it, too quickly.Good price at around $34 and I think it'll last me 2+ years, which is my intention.  Thanks for reading!

We have this on a 9-inch thick twin size foam mattress in our boy's room.  It really reduces the amount of dust and pollen that comes from within the mattress - the one area you cannot clean no matter what!  It reduces his runny nose from the April to June period by at least half.  That's good stuff.It's easy to wash, truly is water resistant, is firm on the top-side, so that it doesn't wrinkle and fold under the sheets (which would be uncomfortable).  Good stuff and a great buy.Thanks for reading!

This unit is pretty good, but the box itself is SOO light, that the whole thing tips over when you open the top.  AND, the top does not open all the way down.  It's pretty much vertical, so any small movement and it will slam shut.Once you get some tools in it, it won't tip over, but the cover still slams shut with any small movement.

I have both Chromecast and Fire sticks. Unfortunately, each has a key feature the other lacks, so I have to use both. (If I could cast Amazon video and music, I'd give up Fire in a heartbeat.) I really wish either device, preferably Chromecast, would allow me to listen to Audible via my TV.This device is easy to use. It is simply an extension of your mobile device. Being able to cast Netflix and YouTube is great. Being able to cast video from Chrome is amazing.The picture is fine. No problems with audio and video syncing. If you own any type of Android device, you'll love this.

This is an excellent case. It is very sturdy and secure. I love that you have unrestricted access to the heart rate monitor while the phone is still in the case. The card slots and hidden pocket are for two cards and a bill or two, nothing more. My complaint is that it seems to be very difficult to get the phone out of the case. I haven't been able to do it successfully yet. I want a more flexible hold, so that I can take the phone out and use my armband case in the gym.

I adore this case! The functionality is just what I was looking for. The fit is very secure, yet flexible if you ever need to take the device out. The strap provides extra security. The quality is great and the color is my favorite shade of pink. I am hoping that as I eventually buy more tablets, this case is available for every one of them.

I initially had my doubts about these sheets. Out of the package, they are very scratchy. I'm so glad to report that they improve with each wash. The seventh is the tipping point. By the 10th, the world has changed. I absolutely love them.

These work! If you have to choose between these and the produce keeper containers, get the containers. These crisper filters work, but to me not as well as the containers. I suspect how well the crisper filters work might depend on your refrigerator.I've had mixed success with these. In think it may because I was storing citrus and apples in the same drawer. I get better results when I remove the fruit from its packaging.  Still, these are worth the investment.My very minor complaint is that the suction cups are hit or miss. In both my crisper drawers, these hang by one cup. The second cup won't stay stuck, no many how many times I reposition the unit.

This product is amazing! I have all three sizes and the crisper filters. They work! The produce keepers work better than the crisper filters, but I really have no complaints when it comes to the money I'm saving.I did have an odd experience with the large model. I filled it with unwashed arugula and one day it smelled almost like sulfur. The arugula was packed in pretty tightly and the vents were closed. After that experience, I open the vent at least one day when keeping salad greens.I have used the large with washed and unwashed salad greens. As inconvenient as it is, I'd rather fill it with unwashed salad greens. If I get more patient with my salad spinner, I'll try washed greens again. (I just can't seem to get them bone dry with my salad spinner.)The medium and the small versions keep berries for what seems like forever. I purchased blueberries on a Monday or Tuesday. They were still perfect on Sunday -- unheard of in my house. The trick is to not wash the berries first. Also, make sure you don't put any damaged berries in the container. Moisture and juice are really not your friends. Be especially careful with blackberries and raspberries.Here are my complaints. They are significant to me, but the functionality of the product outweighs them: these are not dishwasher safe. Come on Oxo! Do better. The lids do not fit securely. Last night  I dropped an entire container or kale on the floor.

This product works as expected, but my preference is a baby oil or Neutrogena Sesame Body Oil. I think those products do a better job on dry skin. For years, my moisturizing routine has been oil on damp skin. The big pro of this product is that it's less messy than oil. It is great for travel and for those looking for a lighter version of the oil method for summer.

I'm taking "Workbook" in the book's title very seriously as I write this review. I am reviewing it assuming that others have the author's other book, Shirtmaking, in their libraries. For me, it's the know-how (Shirtmaking) and the design (Shirtmaking Workbook) that make a powerful combination.  I am a beginning sewist with dreams bigger than my present abilities. With that said, Shirtmaking can stand alone. The Shirtmaking Workbook is too advanced and not practical enough for my skill set. I also find it more geared toward men's shirts. However, that's the author's passion, so that's ok.The one thing I wish there was more of is information on cuffs, my favorite part of a shirt. Or perhaps, there aren't as many cuff variations as there are collar variations These are covered extensively.The online content is a wonderful idea and really enhances the value of this book. The way it's presented was a surprise to me, but I think content is still being added.If shirts are or will be your thing, you should get this book. If you are content with patterns as you find them, you can pass on this workbook, but the original Shirtmaking book could improve your results.

This product works as expected, but my preference is a baby oil or Neutrogena Sesame Body Oil. I think those products do a better job on dry skin. For years, my moisturizing routine has been oil on damp skin. The big pro of this product is that it's less messy than oil. It is great for travel and for those looking for a lighter version of the oil method for summer.

I was so impressed with this mattress, I had to write my review after the first night! I have the just mattress, I will be upgrading to a Serta Perfect Sleeper boxspring soon.  Please note:  if your bed frame does not have a center support, you will need to purchase a new one. Otherwise, the warranty will be voided.Let me start with the obvious, this is a tall/deep mattress. I now have to get into the bed a little differently. Since this is my first pillow top, I'll need new bedding to accommodate the extra depth of the mattress.Now for the good part! I could instantly feel the difference as I got into bed. This mattress hugs you!! It in no way restricts your movement, but you just don't feel the need to move around (even before falling asleep) It's really an amazing experience. The soft pillow top really does its job. The effect is that you really don't want to leave the bed. It's just that comfortable.The mattress does isolate movement. I am awed that something so stable and firm in that sense can still be so soft. The mattress is so supportive. It feels like it was made just for me. In the morning, I felt well-rested and refreshed. I went to bed a tad bit sore, but I felt great when I woke up.Night 3My serious complaint is that I get hot. The temps have been a little cool and I'm still hot. I'm using the same bedding, including mattress cover, I did on my old mattress. I'm definitely warmer with this new mattress. The foam pillow top really does envelop you and it is supremely comfortable, but it doesn't breathe like a typical mattress.Night 4Apparently, I have mastered tight turns from my left to right sides while sleeping. I am notorious for sleeping with half the bed full of books, magazines, etc. while nothing falls to the floor. After four nights and a and a truly lazy Saturday, the mattress is showing a little wear. This is my first experience with a pillow top, so I'm not sure how the foam is supposed to recover.I changed the orientation of the mattress, so the head is what used to be the foot. If I lightly pull up on the fabric where the indentation is, it stays stays slightly lifted for a moment. If feels like there's a little space between the fabric and the foam. On other parts of the bed, it's very hard for me to pinch any of the cover. If the same thing happens next week, I'll go down to three stars.Two-week updateSo, the foam did recover and the side that I used to sleep on looks smooth again.  As a precaution, I will rotate the mattress once a month. I'm also trying to fall asleep in different places in the bed.Cotton mattress coverI ordered a 100% cotton mattress cover and it has really made a difference! This is much more comfortable than my old polyester cover. I am less hot than I was before, even with the same sheets and comforter.In a nutshell, I love this mattress. I didn't realize that it would send me on a build-a-bed shopping spree to get to 'perfect' sleepTo Maintain the Warranty1. Bedrails with center support2. Serta Perfect Sleeper FoundationTo Combat Heat (Polyester is not your friend)3. 100% cotton (including fill) mattress cover4. 100% cotton sheets or 100% Tencel or 100% bamboo deep-pocket sheets

I put this to the test by carrying heavy boxes down two flights of stairs. It was more than an average workout!  Although I was sweating, I didn't feel like my clothes were stinky. After showering and changing clothes, I smelled the 'moving outfit' and I was pleasantly surprised! There was no sweaty odor; I just smelled the Downy Fresh Protect. This is a nice laundry addition for summer and workout clothes. Although it smells like fabric softener,it does not replace fabric softener.
Old app won't open without updating, but update won't install.

What a good idea! Functionally, these are just what you expect them to be. Perfect for tea bags or a lemon wedge. Unfortunately, Ribbon Rose is my least favorite of the Pip Studio designs in pink because it has so much red in it. I guess it's meant to be a bridge design so that you can mix in the reds like Chinese Rose as you build your collection. It just looks a little out of place to me because I'm going for as much pink as possible. I'll probably like it more once I get the sugar bowl and creamer.These aren't a must-have, but they are a very practical luxury.

These are the ultimate in girly sophistication. Those two things may seem opposed, but they come together so nicely in the designs featured on these tea cups and saucers.  Early Birds is my favorite Pip Studio design. These cups and saucers are beautiful and absolutely cheery.  They feel great in hand ad make sipping easy. You'll need to be gentle with these -- no microwave or dishwasher.

Works like a dream for my Breville Tea Maker! My tea maker is exactly a week old and I just couldn't take the tannin stains any longer. I think I'll be using this once a week going forward. It's really easy to use. As a bonus -- for those who have metal travel mugs for your tea, instead of pouring this down the drain, pour it into your travel mug and let it sit for five minutes. It will shine like new. Looking forward to seeing if this will work on porcelain and ceramic.

So this is what a smart TV should do! My HDTV isn't smart on it's own. I had been using a Blu-Ray player to get it a brain.  Wrong move. I think the manufacturer has stopped updating the device. At least with the Fire TV Stick, I feel like I'll be able to get updates as needed with Amazon.Thanks, Amazon, for a way to get Prime content on my TV. Thank you for including other apps like Netflix. Everything runs so smoothly!  Netflix on my other device stops and starts.  No errors with the Fire TV Stick.  I'm really enjoying what I'll call bonus content like the Gaiam Channel and other workout channels. These channels have a more on-demand kind of feel and are really nice. The game selection seemed a little weak.I have a Fire Tablet and I have downloaded the Fire TV app on other devices. The app works nicely as a remote; it's taking some practice to get my swiping just right. Voice search runs without a glitch.Having a Fire Tablet is a plus. I do like switching screens as I move about the house. I have developed the habit of looking up info about the movies and shows as I watched them.
