Unlike his earlier notes, this one was in small print.  He reached into his pocket and removed the glasses that they had never seen.  His acknowledgement of infirmity: Gentlemen, you will permit me to put on my spectacles, for I have not only grown gray, but almost blind in the service of my county reconnected them with the chief they had followed, reminded them of all they had fought for and saved civilian control of the military.  Thereafter Washington would be an advocate for those who had heeded his call one last time.I have seen reviews that claim that this book is too long.  Perhaps so for those seeking History Lite, but not for me.  This book is an extremely well research study of a little known but crucial moment in the early life of our country.  The text is only 293 pages but a lot is packed into them.  By the time I finished it I felt I had a much greater familiarity with military leaders who had previously been little more than names, a better perspective on the course of the war and an enhanced understanding of political environment in which nation and states were feeling their way into the future.  I had recently read Moses Robinson and the Founding of Vermont by Robert A. Mello (see my Amazon review).  The times of the two works overlap, a time when Vermont asserted its independence while fending off claims from neighboring states and indecision from Congress.  As I read about Vermonts tale I wondered about the relative status of state and the national government.  Swords in Their Hands touched on the same topics and struggles.  At the end of this book I felt that I had a much better appreciation for the process that accompanied our nations early, uncertain growth.  For that Swords in Their Hands is worth every page and every word.I did receive a free copy of this book for reading and review.

These Fleur De Lis dishtowels are large, stylish and take machine washing well.  They add class to your kitchen display.  They are adequate for drying but are not as absorbent as some with softer textures.  My recommendation is to use these for decor and occasional drying but keep others for behind the scenes drying.

Gallipoli is a little known battle in a poorly understood war and yet it holds a fascination for historians and students of the Great War, for it was on these beaches that Australia is said to have earned its nationhood and against its rocks that Winston Churchills career almost floundered.Gallipoli, is a reprint of Alan Moreheads 1956 classic that brings order and perspective to its subject for the novice and World War I student alike.  The battle of Gallipoli was the 1915 Allied attack on the Dardanelles and Gallipoli peninsula of Turkey intended to seize Constantinople and force the Ottoman Empire from the war.  Often characterized as Churchills first adventure in the soft underbelly of Britains German dominated opponents, it is here shown as having a deeper purpose and greater potential than the sad disaster that is commonly depicted.  Aimed to draw Turkish troops from the Russian Caucasus front and open the Dardanelles to the export of Russian grain and the inflow of Western aid, it was the largest amphibious attack up to its time.The initial phase of the offensive was an attempt by old ships of the Royal Navy to force the Dardanelles.  When that failed the task was assigned to armies as the British landed at Suvla Bay and Cape Helles, the ANZACS, Australian New Zealand Army Corps, at what has since been known as Anzac Cove and French troops across the water at Kum Kale on the Asia side of the Continental divide.  Failure resulted from a combination of dogged defense, lapses in coordination and execution, lost opportunities and, even to the end, indecision as to the commitment to the project: how much, how long, whether to withdraw.  At the conclusion the shortcomings of the invasion were left behind as a flawless, virtually bloodless evacuation withdrew virtually the whole force with negligible casualties, except of course lo the unlucky few to be personally involved.I am very glad that I read this book.  I know relatively little about World War I and my familiarity with British military figures is sparse.  During some early chapters I felt that I was missing something while trying to follow the generals mentioned.  As I progressed and the campaign took shape I developed an appreciation for the battle not dependent on identities of individual actors.  At its end I had a much greater understanding of how the story played out.  I enjoyed the glimpses of humanity amidst death and destruction as the Australian and Turkish troops traded courtesies and gifts, reminiscent of the Christmas Truce on the Western Front a few months before.  I am left with a sense of loss, of lives spent for no gain, and all the what might have beens.  With more resources, which were available, perhaps the invasion would have reached its goals, the separate German-Russian peace unnecessary and, a revolution avoided and the history of the balance of the Twentieth Century immeasurably altered.  We will never know but Gallipoli challenges us to appreciate, to analyze and to read more.  For this it is a excellent tome.I did receive a free copy of this book in the hopes, but without the obligation, to write a review.

The Silicone Gloves fit a variety of sizes and provide adequate protection from hot items.  The meat claws are a good substitute for a meat fork when lifting meat.  No one in our house marinades deeply so I was not able to test the injector.  This package does contain helpful items for the BBQ and meat preparation.

I was offered a free sample of this Becko Stick Tote Umbrella for testing and review and am glad that I accepted.  It is large enough to cover up to three.  Its black canopy is stylish and the foam covered handle make for a firm grip.  The push button makes for quick opening and the two wrap around straps enable easy storage.  I am very pleased with this umbrella.

I accepted the offer of a DBPOWER Digital Multimedia Portable EVD for review to see if I could improve my portable video experience.  I am glad that I did.  It has a larger screen than some DVD players.  The picture is sharp, the colors are vivid and the sound is excellent.  It is light enough for easy transportation and comfortable to hold on ones lap.  The screen rotates to permit placement in multiple ways and view from several angles.  As a DVD viewer this is an excellent choice.  I did not try to play games and could not get it to work for television or FM radio.

The Presidents Club is a fascinating introduction to that exclusive fraternity of men who have served as President of the United States.  It is a web in which political rivals unite to protect the office, serve their country and world and and find ways to make themselves useful.The modern club began when Harry Truman invited Herbert Hoover to undertake the task of food relief to war torn Europe.  Although Hoover resented being the scapegoat again in 1948 he was willing to help reorganize the Federal Government under both Truman and Eisenhower.The relationships have been as diverse as the members and party divisions have largely been left behind.  Truman was an irascible character who liked to be remembered, by some but not all of his successors, who did undertake at least one you-die I fly mission.  Eisenhower was an advisor and confident to Kennedy and Johnson in war and peace.  Johnsons club membership kept him quiet as Nixon adhered more to the Johnson policies than Democrats of his day.  Thereafter presidents became helpers and tricksters.  Nixons continued dalliance in foreign affairs and Carters globe-trotting and free-lance diplomacy produced tense moments in the West Wing and, on occasion, accusations of treason.  Perhaps the closest and most productive bonding was between the Bushes and the other brother, Bill Clinton.  President Obama, like his predecessors, has learned to employ the talents of those few who know what it is like to sit behind the desk and make the decisions that change history.What I found most interesting about this is the non-partisanship of the Club.  Truman and Hoover could work together better than Hoover did with Eisenhower or Truman with Kennedy.  Ike could be a stern father-figure for Kennedy and a confessor to Johnson, while maintaining a distant relationship with Nixon.  Nixon and Reagan would be rivals while Ford was troubled by both.  Carter would create havoc for Clinton and Clinton would become good friends with the Bushes.Authors Nancy Gibbs and Michael Duffy provide an insight into powerful personalities and their role in governance through the counsel each provides his successors and how recent presidents have learned to use their predecessors.  It is a worthwhile read for any student of the modern American Presidency.

It has been said that the history of the United States cannot be told until the history of every state is told.  Moses Robinson And The Founding Of Vermont places a key piece in the puzzle of American history.This book is part biography but mostly history.  Moses Robinson was major player in the early history of Vermont.  An early settler of Bennington in Southwestern Vermont, strong faith guided him to positions of prominence in the Church of Christ in Bennington while his skills in government drew him into political affairs.  Robinson would serve as a delegate to constitutional conventions, Governors Councilor, legislator, Vermont Supreme Court Justice, Agent to the U.S. Congress and U.S. Senator, to name a few of the many roles he played on historys stage.  The back cover says Moses Robinson may be the most important Founding Father of Vermont youve never heard of.  After reading this book I think I know why.  His importance is shown by the many positions he filled during his long career.  I believe that his anonymity results from his adherence to the Republican Party of Jefferson in a region and a state that turned into a Federalist stronghold.  Although wielding tremendous influence through his many positions, he served only one year as governor and less than one term in the U.S. Senate, in contrast to the long careers he would likely have enjoyed had he been a Federalist or lived in a Jeffersonian state.That is the biography part.  As I said, most of this work is history, and a fascinating and unique history it is. Contrary to what many Americans probably believe, Vermont was not one of the original thirteen colonies and states.  Contested by New Hampshire and New York and, to a limited extent Massachusetts, the early days of the Green Mountains was an era of conflicting land claims and vigilante justice during the specter of becoming a battle ground in a colonial Civil War overshadowed development of this northern land.  Often devoid of protection of the Continental Congress, the winds of war swept across Vermont during the French and Indian and Revolutionary Wars and the War of 1812.  Petitions for statehood were held up for years by conflicting claims of citizens, neighboring states and Britain.  Although adopting forms that we associate with state government, Vermont functioned as an independent republic from 1777 to 1791 while negotiating with Congress and, for a time, with Britain for a lasting association.  Admission to the Union as the fourteenth state in 1791 brought an end to uncertainty and ushered in a period during which Vermont would be the fastest growing state.Author Robert A. Mello has thoroughly researched his topic and skillfully woven the life of Moses Robinson into the history of Vermont from 1741 to 1813.  Returning to the first sentence of this review, the unique history of Vermont paints the portrait of early America more vividly than that of any other state.  How is it that American territory could be so hotly disputed by its sister states as to be excluded from the Union?  The confiscation of Tory estates is often presented as a retaliatory violation of civil rights but here it is shown as the only way that the Revolution could be financed.  Could even loyal Americans have seriously negotiated for British protection from New Hampshire and New York or were they just dangling lures to buy time and a truce?  How different was the independence of the Republic of Vermont from that of states under the Articles of Confederation?  It takes the Vermonts tale to frame these questions on early America.If you are a Vermonter, you will enjoy this Moses Robinson and The Founding of Vermont for its insights into your states origins.  If you identify with one of the other 49 states, read it for its window into the America of the Revolution, the evolution of our first parties and the tentative steps by which the States became United.  Either way you will be richly rewarded.I received a free copy of this book with the hope, but not the requirement, that I post a review.

This Pre de Provence Soap has a nice, soft, rose scent that is not overpowering.  It leaves the skin feeling clean, fresh feeling on the skin and a nice fragrance in the bathroom.  I am glad I chose to test this soap.

These towels are soft, absorbent and have a stylish, textured finish.  They do a good job at drying plates and glasses.  The bright colors, red, white and green are well are well suited for Christmas or Italian themed displays.  Very satisfied.

the Rise and Fall of Oscar the Magician is geared for 4-6 year olds.  The story is about two monkeys competing for the title of Magician of the Year.  One of the two main characters pursues the title by sabotaging the other characters tricks.  Although he is eventually caught, this presents values that should not be taught to children of this age. To the end the miscreant is claiming success in carrying out his crime.  Even though the wrongdoer gets arrested, there is insufficient emphasis on the triumph of good over evil to salvage this book.  If that is not enough, the vocabulary is above the target age. Definitely not recommended.

Women Remember the War is a fascinating collection of oral histories of 25 Wisconsin women who lived through World War II.  It consists of edited versions of interviews done in the early 1990s.The chapters are organized by the womens experience with some women appearing in multiple sections.  The factory worker, the single employed, the mothers, those who wore uniforms and they who waited for their men to return all have their tales to tell.This is not polished writing, but neither is it disorganized facts.  The subjects narrate their stories in their own words.  Editor Michael E. Stevens selects the passages and organizes them so as to maintain the readers interest throughout this 157 page tome.What I like best about this work is the way insights jump off the page.  You are reading along normally when suddenly something hits you.  It may trigger a memory, reveal an aspect of which you had never thought or incite an I didnt know that moment.Jane Heinemanns recollection of how her rendition of Begin The Beguine gave a wounded soldier the will to live reminds me of the spell it had over a woman of World War II age whom I knew. The inconvenience of rationing comes up again and again.  Rose Kaminskis practice of taking her main meal at lunch in the factory cafeteria to save the coupons for the family was a clever way of coping while  Marjorie Mileys comment that they had to save up their sugar coupons for a wedding cake, particularly one with icing, reduces the war to the very practical.  I have heard of  about conflicts between different ethnic groups and Emily Koplins description of the Polish, German and Italian neighborhoods rings true while her comments about the Germans speaking of what Hitler was trying to accomplish and the reluctance to bring up certain topics in some neighborhoods emphasizes the importance ethnic loyalties still played.  To me at least, Gene Gutkowskis fathers opinion that Irish are fine is personally reassuring.  WAAC Frieda Schurchs reminiscences of being stationed in an area where the mosquitoes were too bad for the POWs still stings, but there are also the downright humorous.  You have to chuckle at WAC Julie Davenports recitation of her response to Well, you know, Id like more potatoes with You know the rules, get going before looking up to see that she was talking to Eleanor Roosevelt.The subjects are all Wisconsin women but their experiences are common to American women from coast to coast. Whether you remember World War II, or just heard your mothers and grandmothers speak of it, Women Remember the War will be an enjoyable and rewarding read.  We are fortunate that the Wisconsin Historical Society has preserved these tales for us.I did receive a free copy of this book for reading and review.

I spent extensive time trying to set up this Wi-Fi Range Extender.  It gave a strong signal to my computer but that was all.  It asked to choose among drop downs identifying the signal from the Wi-Fi but no matter which one I chose it could not connect to the Wi-Fi.  That is unfortunate because it seems like it would be a help if would work but for me it has been worthless.  If I get it working I will revise this review but, to this point at least, it is definitely not user friendly.

The Truman Presidency is a thorough, unbiased examination of a crucial era of hot and cold war, peace, labor unrest, political scandal, Communists in government and third party movements.  It presents President Truman as a man who stepped into the shoes of a giant and filled them triumphantly.  It begins with a brief background biography stretching from Missouri farms to French battlefields through the Jackson County Courthouse and the Senate Chamber.The bulk of this work, naturally, centers on the almost eight years Truman spent working, although not always living, in the White House.  Someone too young to remember and who has not studied it will be amazed at the rapid fire challenges the administration faced.  From the first days of the United Nations and Potsdam Conferences, through the return to Independence Harry was riding the tiger and managing to hold on.Coming into office with the confidence of those who worked with him but not the nation at large, Truman had to secure the line of succession, complete the conquest of Japan, establish the parameters of Cold War cooperation and confrontation, stare down labor and management in the steel, railroad and coal industries and by trial and error release wartime wage and price controls.  For all this the Democratic Party suffered a crushing defeat in the 1946 mid-term elections.1948 brought Draft-Ike movement, a resurgent Republican Party, the Dixiecrat rebellion in the South and the Wallace liberal splinter in the north.  By force of will and dogged determination Truman pulled off the upset of the century.Second term travails included more labor trouble, war in Korea and the firing of Gen. MacArthur.  At its end, with determined spirit but minimal public support, Harry stepped aside and had to watch while he gracefully turned over the presidency to the General who barely concealed his low opinion of his predecessor.This book is thoroughly researched and well written.  Published in 1966, it is now dated and has been followed by works having the advantage of more available archives and deeper reflection.  History is not just made, it is written.  Readers get a better appreciation of historical characters by reflecting on how they are interpreted in varying eras following their exits from the world stage.  Author Cabell Philips gives us a view of the Truman presidency through the window of the Johnson years, after Eisenhower had retired and before the Great Society, Watergate and Vietnam turned the prisms through which we view all that went before them.  It should not be your introduction to the Truman Presidency, but it should be part of your library.

This Quilted Northern Ultra Plush Bath Tissue is soft to the feel and strong enough to resist tearing with a clean, white on white design.  The rolls are large enough that you do not have to change often but small enough to fit on the holder.  It is everything one can ask for in a bath tissue.

Harry Trumans pre-presidential career usually is covered fairly quickly in his biographies but it is the sole focus of Truman: The Rise To Power.  It covers the whole story from the Missouri frontier to school days, on the farm and through the War, the establishment and failure of his haberdashery and the beginnings of his political career up to the day of his presidential oath.It is quite a saga with a few surprising twists.  It is the story of a boy whose glasses kept him out of the rough and tumble and drove him into the library where he read every book.  Inspired by tales of great lives he sought military training in the Missouri National Guard that took him to France and World War I.  Having found a partner in Eddie Jacobson and experience with a successful regimental canteen they opened a haberdashery in downtown Kansas City catering to young men on the move and army buddies.  His dabbling in oil exploration and Savings & Loans and banks gave him contacts and life lessons and some money, but not enough to capture his career.  When all else had failed he was approached by the Pendergast machine to whom he represented a clean farmer with a sufficient network of connections weaving through work, the Masons, Battery D vets, relatives and friends to make him the ideal candidate to win the Eastern District judgeship on the Jackson County Court.  Although he recognized that Pendergast men overcharged on county projects and collected pay that they did not earn, he was an exceptionally good judge, building a road system that helped make Jackson County a model for the nation.  After disappointling his ambitions for Governor or Congress, Pendergast found him to be an acceptable candidate to take a U.S. Senate seat for the organization.  Upon arrival in the capitol the Senator from Pendergast gradually earned respect through hard work and his committees exposure of waste in war contracts until he became the Democratic nominee for Vice-President.Author Richard Lawrence Miller takes a different approach from the accepted Truman legend, that of the honest businessman who paid off his creditors even when he did not have to and the politician who, though surrounded by crooks, never used his position for personal gain.  While recognizing Trumans personal integrity, this work presents a man who had more obligations for his business debts than is generally recognized, who settled for fractions of amounts owed, relied on the fact that his salary as county judge could not be garnished for debt and who got some help in managing his loans but who, in the end, could not prevent foreclosure on the family farm.I have read several books by and about Harry Truman.  I value this one for its emphasis on his pre-presidential life and the realistic assessment of a businessman and politician who tried to advance and make ends meet while doing some things that might have been avoided by one anticipating a presidential run.  Like any book, its facts and conclusions are subject to scrutiny.  Contrary to everything else I have read on the subject, Miller concludes that FDR brought Truman up to date on the atomic bomb project when they met for lunch during the 1944 campaign.  I also question whether Truman really planned the quiet campaign for the vice-presidency that this book suggests.  Those misgivings aside, I think that it provides the reader with a well-researched introduction to the rise of a most significant character in the American Pageant.

I have enjoyed table tennis for a long time and am really impressed with these balls.  They bounce high, are difficult to dent and fly true.  Whether your game is laid back or fast and hard, the iPong Seamless Poly Pro 40+ Table Tennis Training Balls will make it an enjoyable experience.

This credit card holder is of a shiny stainless steel construction with a push button for opening and secured by a clasp.  It has slots that I estimate would hold at least ten credit cards.  Its outward appearance is quite attractive and would easily fit into a pocket or purse.  I have never known any information to have been stolen in the past so I do not know how to test that protection but it is a very nice credit card holder.I was provided a free sample for testing and review.

This Samsill Pop n' Store Medium Square Box is easy to pop up, sturdy, and attractive.  It would be good for use a gift box or storage.  The first thing to pop into mind is how great it would be for pictures.  If it is in view you will never have to worry about your guests seeing it.  I am glad that I selected this box.

The Dove Men Plus Care Everyday Gift Pack is a fine assortment for a man, whether as a gift or just to buy for yourself.  The distinguishing feature of this set is its Fresh Scent.  The Wash gives a fresh, tingling feeling to both body and face.  The shampoo and the deodorant continue the theme.  If you like the fresh feeling this is the pack for you.

This iGearPro Digital Voice Recorder is a multi-feature device.  It records well when dictating or just on the table to record a conference.  It has many options including the ability to record from a telephone or download music.  The play back feature is clear and of high quality, whether using earphones or the speaker.  It is very small and lightweight for easy transportation.  This product has everything I could ask for in a recorder.

Lincolns Boys is really a triple biography.  The two primary figures are John Hay and John Nicolay, the two young men who traveled from Illinois to serve as Lincolns secretaries and devoted much of their remaining lives to the promotion of his image.  The third character is Lincoln himself: Lincoln they man with whom they lived and worked and the Lincoln of legend.John Nicolay was a young Bavarian immigrant was a lively dancer and talented musician who served as de-facto executive director of the nascent Republican Party in Illinois while abhorring the mobs that he would encounter on the trip to Washington and daily in the White House.  After leaving the White House he would serve as a diplomat in Paris and as Marshall of the United States Supreme Court.John Hay was a more outgoing people person with the talents of an author and a poet who served in diplomatic posts in Paris, Vienna, Madrid and as Ambassador to Great Britain before concluding his public service as Secretary of State under Presidents McKinley and Theodore Roosevelt.Their life stories are interesting but what makes them worthy of a book is their association with Abraham Lincoln.  It was they who accompanied him to the telegraph office, were at his side as he wrote the Emancipation Proclamation, mingled with the press and politicians during the trip to Gettysburg and acted as his intermediator and buffer when dealing with members of Congress.As Lincolns intimates, Nicolay and Hay were entrusted with the creation of Lincolns historic image.  Having access to the Lincoln papers through their friend, Robert Lincoln, they wrote a ten volume official biography.  From it would come many of the legends of Lincoln Lore such as the incident in which Gen. McClellan returned home and went to bed while Lincoln waited to see him and the blind memo in which he got each cabinet member to agree to prosecute the war after the election and so that it would be won before the inauguration.I found insights in this book that I do not remember reading before, such as the idea that the visit to Gettysburg served political purposes and that Hay might have written the Letter to Mrs. Bixby, a Southern sympathizer who promptly threw it out.  It mentions that four score and seven years ago pointedly refers to the Declaration of Independence, not the Constitution that protected slavery as well as the virulent opposition to Lincoln during his lifetime.Much of this work is devoted to a study of the multi-faceted struggle for Lincolns image in which Nicolay and Hay were the scribes for the Lincoln family.  Lincolns former partner, William Herndon,  strove to tear Lincoln down as merely an ordinary westerner while his longstanding vendetta with Mary Lincoln was the source of the legend that she made Lincolns domestic life a misery.  Southern writers advanced the case that states rights and diverging economic systems and not slavery brought on the Civil War.  Lincolns Boys, with their aggressive Northernism, softened the role of Mary, kept the slavery issue front and center and portrayed Lincoln as a man whose humble background made his greatness even more impressive that it would have seemed in others.  As I was reading I was reminded of what I have been taught about the Gospels, that each evangelist chose the stories to include and to tell them in a way that would get across the message that he desired.  Lincoln seems to have been treated similarly.  Each biographer emphasizes and interprets facts so as to create his own Lincoln.Author Joshua Zeitz has made a valuable contribution to the Lincoln literature.  His readers will better understand the evolving role of Lincoln in our history.  He has crafted an easy, but not a light read, a fairly quick, but satisfying one.  Lincolns Boys is the perfect book to read as we close the Sesquicentennial of the Lincoln Presidency.

These Stable Pals are like paper dolls of old only the clothes and figures are magnetic.  They come in a self-contained box and are great for imaginative play.That is what the parent and teacher would think, but what about the girls.  We placed this before several 4 and 5 year old girls and they were fighting over it.  The loved it so much they did not even realize that they were learning.  It will do the same for your girl.

When I was offered a sample of this VINOMIO Wine Chiller for testing and review I thought that it might be an attractive alternative to the traditional ice bucket or wine sleeve.  It is.  You need to pour about a half glass to make room for the Chiller.  The frozen stainless steel rod keeps the wine cool while you enjoy your meal.  Naturally it works better when there is more in the bottle because more of the wine is in contact with the rod.  The spout makes for easy, drip free pouring. We look forward to using this at our next home party.

These bags are a good size, sturdy and the handles make for easy lifting and secure tying.  The vanilla-lavender scent is pleasant and long lasting.  We are glad that we found these kitchen trash bags.

I had never tried using a stylus before I was given this one for testing and review but it is very helpful.  The stylus tip is soft and easily depresses keys, even on keyboards where fingers frequently err.  The pen has a nice, fine point that, along with the stylish casing makes it worthwhile on its on.

When my old clock broke we searched for a replacement and ended up with the Crosley Deco Alarm Clock.  It is a nice size and its art deco design is more distinctive than most alarm clocks.  The dial is well lighted, a bit too bright but it does not disturb my sleep.  The alarm is loud enough to arouse without being irritating.  My one complaint is that turning off the alarm is a bit cumbersome.  Overall I am very pleased with this clock.

When we decided that our old electric heater was not doing it we tried the Honeywell Motion Sensor Ceramic Heater.  We have found it to be quite an improvement.  It heats quickly, has an adequate fan and blows the heated air over an extended area.  Whereas the old one would just warm one side of our table this one covers the whole breakfast room.  We are very satisfied with this purchase.

What can you say about a vacuum cleaner bag?  First of all it fit the vacuum sweeper.  I read the models in which it worked and I got it right.  We put it into our Electrolux,  swept carpets and hardwood floors, the dirt was picked up and ended up in the bag.  That is all one can ask for and the best one can say about it.

In the minds of many Americans John Wilkes Booth appears spontaneously as an accomplished actor standing outside of the Presidential Box in Fords Theatre which he enters, shoots Lincoln, jumps onto the stage and rides off to someplace where he is shot.  Fortunes Fool tells us the rest of the story.John Wilkes Booth was the scion of an acting family, son of premier Shakespearean actor Julius Brutus Booth and younger brother of Edwin.  Portrayed as a likeable, witty and outgoing young man, Wilkes career took him across America from the east coast as far west as Missouri.  This book provides a balanced account of its subject, showing, for example, that the claim that he was not the actor that his father was may reflect that he died at age 26, to early for his talents had time to mature.  His Maryland upbringing contributed to his pro-Southern sentiments, although Edwin was a Union man who voted for Lincoln in 1864.Roughly half of the book deals with Booths personal and professional life before transitioning, as did that life, into a fixation on politics, the Confederate cause and Lincoln.  Readers will receive an introduction to the antebellum thespian landscape.  Author Terry Alford places Booth in the context of his times and the movement.  He was far from the only Southerner who plotted to kidnap Lincoln to exchange him for some concessions to the Confederacy.  As Southern prospects faded and Lee surrendered Booths aim turned from kidnapping for an exchange to murder for revenge.  Drawing inspiration from his characters, Wilkes saw himself as a modern day Brutus who shed blood to save his country from a perceived tyrant.  Booth is portrayed as a true Southern patriot, one attached to the cause, not to its heroes.  He lost faith in Lee when he met Grant and saw himself as the one who would avenge Southern honor.  This tome progresses fairly quickly through the assassination itself and Booths desperate flight into Virginia to the rendezvous with the New York cavalryman who would kill him.  In death Booth remained a hero and fiend, buried in a grave both unmarked and frequently decorated.Readers must be aware that this book is a whole life biography.  While it devotes almost half of the book to the assassination, its preparation and flight, it is fit into the context of a life of the subject and that of a turbulent of a nation on the verge of reuniting.  What I appreciated most about it is its portrayal of the milieu in which Booth lived and acted. I find it amazing that there were so many plots, involving so many people and known of by countless others.  We read of Booth wandering into, through and out of this culture of intrigue amidst the targets of its actions.Readers seeking a detailed account of the Lincoln assassination would be better served by looking elsewhere.  This is a book for those wondering how Wilkes Booth developed into the man who would plot the attack and do the deed.  I acquired a better understand of the theatre of Booths day and the political climate in which he thought that he would achieve heroic status by killing the President and why, in the eyes of some, he did.

The 3-in-1 LED Flashlight with Magnetized Base by AYL is three tools in one.  It is a bright LED beam emitting from the front.  The second click turns on a handle panel of 18 white lights and the third lights the eight flashing red lamps in the handle panel and four in a plastic ring around the spotlight.  To top it off it has a strong magnet in the end.  Its thin, light weight construction makes it easy to grasp.This light has multiple uses.  It is a very good flashlight, particularly for one operating on three AAA batteries.  The white lights in the handle can illuminate a room or provide hands free lighting in those hard to see areas.  Either end provides a base and the magnet enables it to hang from any metallic surface, such as a car or a refrigerator.  The flashing red lights signal warning.My family and I are already debating where to keep it so we can find it during the next power outage.  I am definitely thinking about using the magnet to affix it the next time I take a look under the hood.  Lets not even think about the need for the warning lights but be glad that it is there if we need it.I am glad that I accepted the offer to test and review this light.  It has earned a place among our household equipment.

This "Common English Bible" was completed in 2011, with the help of religious scholars, ministers, and young people from around the world.  The language is accessible and contemporary, and it makes sense to read.  Each chapter starts with an introductory overview, and is followed by study or thought questions -- for the reader to think about while reading.  Great resource for anyone who wants to learn more about the stories in the Bible.  The language is not as elegant as the King James Version -- but it sure is easier to understand!  Highly recommended.

This attractive, functional heater is perfect for the basement -- keeps us warm and toasty.  It is reasonably attractive and kind-of sort-of could pass as a piece of furniture.  Does exactly what it is supposed to do.
Perfect every day jean, made of soft Japanese denim, with a nice cut and subtle aging.  These look broken in, but not distressed.  Love them!

I was excited to try this, cause I LOVE all things ginger.  This wasn't bad, it just didn't taste like ginger ale.  It tasted like sweet, slightly off carbonated water.  I even wondered if I got a bad or old sample because it was so flavorless.  If you're a ginger ale lover, I'd skip this.

This book was quite difficult to read, but hard to put down.  The main characters are one-dimensional and despicable, and it is difficult to fee anything other than antipathy toward him.  Fascinating blend of fiction and history.

For those who have difficulty telling whether the shower temperature is too cold or too hot by simply testing the waters, this special shower head may come in handy.  The digital temperature display reads blue when the water is below 80 degrees, purple when the water is between 80 and 110 degrees, and red when the water is over 110 degrees.  There are six different settings -- full spray, massage spray, full spray with massage, shape rinsing spray, shampoo rinsing spray with massage, and drenching spray.  I'm not exactly sure what "shampoo rinsing spray is," but I'm sure it will make your hair extra clean.  Actually this would be useful for bathing children, because you can tell exactly what the temperature is without any guesswork.

I would love to be able to say something helpful about the TrendNet TEW-820AP Wireless AC Easy-Upgrader, but I am an Apple MacBook user, and TrendNet seems to have done all they can to prevent their device from being used by Apple users.  It gave me flashbacks to the 1980s and the ancient era of Mac v PC when nothing was compatible.  I thought we had made it through that hard time.  But TrendNet provided a CD that did not appear to be readable by my MacBook.  Then I went on-line to download the Quick Installation Guide, but it came in a format that was unreadable by Safari, with a .pdf.download extension.  So, this mystical little device may be the greatest thing since sliced bread, but as an Apple user, Ill never know.

This was fun to use and worked fine, but I think the old-fashioned hand-powered nail file & buffing block is more effective at a fraction of the price.  I had heard great things about other Amope products so I jumped at the opportunity to give this a try.  I used it on both my hands and feet.  The product contains a wand with a vibrating tip -- kind of reminded me of an electric toothbrush -- and three attachments that slip onto the tip of the wand.  The attachments are for filing, smoothing, and buffing.  The filing attachment worked well and allowed me to get a very smooth edge on my nails.  I found it a little cumbersome on my hands, but easy to use on my feet.  The smoothing tip -- hard to tell what exactly it did.  The buffing tip did a great job of polishing my nails to a shiny luster, but it took some time to get that effect.  The high-luster buffed finish doesn't last long, and I felt myself wanting to buff again an hour later.  This kit was fun to use, but I doubt I will use it regularly, as a nail file & $5 buffing block, like  is easier to use and just as effective.  This might be particularly useful for someone who lacks manual dexterity or hand strength, or has a difficult time manipulating an old-fashioned nail file.

So glad I decided to give this book a try.  The writing is lovely, full of unique descriptors.  Interesting and tragic characters, particularly the narrator, who seems to be stumbling along through life yet oddly on top of things.  The first half was more fast-paced and intriguing than the last half, and the pace slowed down a bit about 3/4 way through the book.  The narrator and his father make scholarly and interesting references to Greek mythology throughout -- sometimes alternating between the nitty gritty Vegas life and the fantastic.  Interesting plot twists.  Recommended.

My little dog fell in love with this toy as soon as I got the pig out of the box.  Best boyfriend she's ever had.  As far as puppets and plush toys go, this seems to be very high quality and somewhat realistic looking.  I go back and forth between thinking its adorable and finding the odd black spots to be disturbing, especially the one over eye.  It is incredibly soft and huggable.  And fairly large.  Although it is labeled as a hand puppet -- it's really more like a plush toy with a hold for your hand to slip inside.  I couldn't figure out how to "animate" the puppet with my hand.  It takes a little bit of effort to make it squeal -- in a good way.  It's not at all an annoying noise maker.  I think toddlers would love this.  Toddles and lonely little dogs.

This is a great belt FOR THE PRICE.  I've been losing weight and my nice leather belts are all too large -- so this belt is a nice stopgap measure for a fraction of what I paid for nicer full-grain leather belts.  I have the black and it's held up just fine under light wear.  I am back to order the belt in some fun colors for spring -- I don't expect it to last forever, but for the price, I have no complaints.  The belt is very thick and the edges are finished.  I haven't noticed any color wearing off.

I no longer have to wipe my face constantly during my workouts -- this does a great job of absorbing sweat and keeping it out of my eyes.  I'm not sure how and why it works so well as it's not much more than a loop of very thin, stretchy fabric.  But it really works and is completely soaked at the end of the workout.  It's also very stretchy -- so no worries if you have a largish head.  It never feels too tight.

This book was a call to arms for Christians, to shift our focus from individualism and consumerism to that of building an outward-looking community in Christ.  There are glimmers of interesting ideas throughout the book, but it seemed to be lacking a coherent structure and was difficult to read.

They're bright and colorful and look festive in a pencil cup.  Aside from the bright colors, they look like standard wood pencils.  But they're certainly not made of wood -- more of some sort of plastic, as you can bend them quite a bit without breaking them.  I thought the lead was a little bit too hard and light for my taste.

This thing really works!!  I bought it for use at the gym.  I found myself wiping off my face every ten seconds to keep sweat from dripping into my eyes, and the headbands I found at Target helped a tiny bit, but weren't doing the trick.  This Sweatvac headband works great -- it keeps the sweat out of my eyes, and I find I am wiping my face just once or twice during a half-hour workout.  It would be ideal for working outdoors or in situations in which couldn't just grab a towel and wipe off at your convenience.  It fits me just fine -- but I've been told I have a large head.  If you have a smallish noggin, this might not be tight enough, and it isn't particularly elastic or stretchy.

Cure Fragrance-Free Comforting Lotion is the perfect lotion for dry, sensitive skin.  This lotion is thick and non-greasy, it absorbs quickly, and  -- at least by my nose -- is free of any perfumes.  It purports to comfort dry skin for over 24 hours with time-released hydration.  I have problems with dryness and itchiness and so far, this lotion has been very effective.  I'm not sure how "comforting" it is -- and I look forward to trying it during my next itchy spell to see if it is effective in that situation.

This book started out with a bang but started to fizzle about halfway through.  Cohen is a gifted writer, with a lovely way with words.  Her narrative is engaging and her story is fascinating.  She discusses all the seeming inexplicable learning and spatial difficulties she's faced in life -- and the process by which she is subsequently diagnosed with a lemon-sized hole in her brain.  Thank you Ms. Cohen for including illustrations -- so the reader can really envision what you are talking about.  Despite her brain disorder, Cohen seems to cope effectively, making it through a rather unique and largely self-directed degree program, maintaining friendships with her college classmates, and completing a graduate degree in writing.The second half of the book --- about Cohen's post-collegiate life, her bumpy relationship with and eventual separation from her boyfriend Charlie, her series of roommates in Oakland, and her efforts to obtain Social Security disability is just not as gripping or well-written as the first part of the book, and seems to lack focus.  Cohen's narrative becomes rambles and focuses on details that aren't particularly interesting or germane to her condition.  Second half of the book seems like a personal diary or journal that Cohen presents in its original form -- without any editing for public consumption.  It's as if she is wallowing and attempting to come to terms with her condition, but she shares a lot of esoteric information in the process.Overall, this started off as a fascinating read.  Cohen is a gifted writer, and

My husband had to darken his salt and pepper hair to look younger for a community theater role.  I suggested he use something non-permanent to avoid the stark roots after the role was over and after striking out at the local stores, we decided to give this a try. .  This effectively darkened his gray hair and looked very natural; it didn't at all create the "you must have just dyed your hair" reaction.  It did not turn his mostly-white hair stark black, but more of a darker gray.  The costume director said he looked younger, so mission accomplished.  It had the slightest blue/purple tinge, but it wasn't bad -- I was perfectly happy to be seen with my hubby in public.  I wouldn't recommend this for full gray coverage, but I think it would work well if you had just a few grays to cover or if you were looking for a temporary fix.  So far it has held up well through several shampoos.  Not sure how it will do in the long run.  Recommended.

This is an amazing belt -- love it and wear it nearly every time I wear my jeans.  The design is interesting but not too over the top, the shading gives it a nice vintage look, and the leather is thick and strong.  The little rivets add a bit of interest without being too clingy.  I wear it all the time and it doesn't show any wear -- other than the nice vintage effect.  Came back to buy a second belt as my old one doesn't quite fit any more and was disappointed to see the brown was unavailable.Don't hesitate to buy from Beltiscool -- the products I've tried all really nice.  I would caution you to go for the full-grain leather belts, even though they are a little pricier, because they hold up much better to frequent use.  I purchased a similar belt from Beltiscool that was not full-grain leather, and it showed wear around the holes much more quickly.

This beautiful case fits my phone perfectly and has protected it during several falls.  It appears to be of excellent quality.  I wasn't sure I would prefer the leather to my old hard plastic case but I've grown to love it.  It feels luxurious to hold.  Mud slide is a rich, deep saddle tan color in a pebbled texture.UPDATE on August 1, 2015:  The thin layer of purple leather has separated from the hard plastic lining on all four side of this case.  I may try to glue it back on, but I doubt it would work well.  This was a beautiful case, but I am disappointed with its longevity.  Also -- I dropped my phone on the hardwood floor from waist high while it was in this case and it cracked.  I realize this case isn't magical, but I did expect a little more.

Paleo diet = NO grains, dairy, legumes, eggs, nuts seeds, nightshades (tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, eggplant), coffee, alcohol, processed vegetable oils, or processed sugars.  Also no spices derived from nightshades, such as curry powder, chili powder,or paprikaPaleo diet = YES to meats, meats, and more meats, with extra credit for eating organ meats.  Bacon is front and center in several recipes, and bacon fat and lard (from pasture-raised pigs) is a "good" fat.  Also includes veggies, fruit, fats, and coconut products (like coconut flour)Paleo diet has been getting a lot of press lately for its purported ability to heal a leaky gut and help tame the symptoms of autoimmune diseases.  As someone who has one of those aforementioned autoimmune diseases, I'm always on the lookout for something that will help keep symptoms in check.  I would certainly try some, but not most, of the recipes in this book.  The photography is beautiful, and most of the food LOOKS good.  I first opened the book to what looked like a wrap or burrito with a creamy sauce and meat filling -- looks yummy -- but when I read the recipe, well, I'm just not going to go through the effort to cook, carefully peel, and shred two pounds of beef tongue to make Crispy Beef Tongue Wraps wrapped in collard green leaves.  Some of the recipes seem straightforward -- steak fajitas, seared lamb chops with garlic & herb whipped artichoke "butter", grilled beef skewers, guacamole, caramelized Brussels sprouts.  But many seem complicated and not particularly appealing.  How do you make BBQ sauce without tomatoes?  You use pumpkin puree, fish sauce, bacon fat, coconut amino, molasses, and a few other ingredients.  Salsa?  Use canned beets, pumpkin puree, and diced red onion along with lime and cilantro.I also sense that the Paleo diet doesn't limit fat intake, as long as it's an approved fat, and many of these recipes seem like they would be very high in fat.  Duck Fat Burgers with Mango & Avocado Spread, for example, or Sausage Benedict in Portobello Mushroom Caps, or Pork Bellies with Apples.  I realize that the Paleo diet does not claim to be a weight-loss diet, but as someone who has always struggled with her weight, I shudder to think of how many calories many of these recipes contain.  Oatmeal made from coconut flakes?  Yikes.  That recipe actually sounds pretty delicious to me, but dreadfully fattening.Some of the more unusual recipes:"Oatmeal" made from coconut and acorn squashChicken fried steak, dipped in a mixture of coconut milk and ground chicken (since egg is verboten) and breaded in plantain crumbsWarm Chicken "Grain" salad with roasted butternut squash, where apparently you process pieces of cooked chicken in a food process to make little rice-sized "grains"Banana-Carob Pudding, made from mashed banana and avocado, and topped with bacon and coconut cream.Rosemary Flatbread -- with the "bread" made from a dough of plantains, tapioca starch, coconut flour,Things that I would try:Chicken tacos, with jicama rounds as "shells", with blueberry salsa and avocado creamChicken & Bacon bites -- little chicken meatballs made moist with bacon.If you want to give Paleo a try, by all means take a look at this cookbook.  It is nicely-packaged and is full of tips on how to create interesting flavors within the confines of the diet -- like curry that doesn't use any forbidden curry powder.  Just be aware that this diet is certainly not for everyone.

Beltiscool sells a lot of interesting belts on amazon.com -- I've tried several of them.  Their full-grain leather belts are awesome.  This belt is made of bonded leather that just doesn't hold up.  It was pulling at the holes after several wearings, so I tossed it.  Cute design, though.  If you want something for light or infrequent use, this would be fine, but if you're looking for something sturdy that will last for a while, look at this seller's full-grain leather belts.  They are little more expensive, but if you plan on using the belt much, they're a much better value in the long run.

The one I received in March 2015 works just fine -- I can't tell any discernible difference between it & the one that came with my Wii originally (except it looks new).  My 11-year-old was using it about two minutes after it was delivered.  And the delivery was super-fast, within a couple days.  From reading the reviews, it sounds like these have come from different manufacturers over the years -- the manufacturer at the time of my purchase was identified as "Generic."  I would not hesitate to buy this again

I ordered a belt like this from beltiscool about a year ago and absolutely loved it.  AWESOME belt and great service from Beltiscool.  It was favorite belt to wear with jeans -- the leather was high quality, the design was interesting but not over the top, I liked the little metal rivets (and for more than a year now, they have held up), and the buckle was nice.  The old one was a little large, so I found my original order on amazon and came back to order the same belt in a different size.  Unfortunately, it was out of stock and I found this similar belt instead. This belt arrived immediately -- shipping was lightning fast.  I didn't like it as is much as the one I ordered previously, and thought that -- the leather is a little shinier, not as vintage looking.  Beltiscool customer service responded promptly and explained that this was a different style.FYI, if you're shopping around for belts on Amazon -- Beltiscool did make a similar design in bonded leather.  It's much less expensive, of course, but it doesn't look as nice after about three wearings, and it doesn't hold up nearly as well.  If you want something that will stand up to lots of use, make sure you go for the full-grain leather.

The "swirled mattifier" (step three), an ever-so-slightly green tinged primer/moisturizer, alone makes this system worth the money.  It gave my skin a beautiful matte finish and helped keep the greasies away all day.  Honestly, I got so many compliments on my skin when I used the mattifier under my makeup that I would buy this just for the mattifier.  It worked well and is so much less slimy than other under-makeup primers I've tried.  Caveat -- I am fairly fair-skinned, and when I first applied the mattifier, it left my skin looking a tad pale and chalky.  But with a little powder on top, I was good to go.  I can't imagine that the mattifier would work as well on tawny or chocolatey skin tones, but I can't exactly test it to find out.  To me, the mattifier did not feel particularly "moisturizing," but I imagine it might on oilier skin.  I think the mattifier might be more appealing to older acne and rosacea sufferers than to young tweens and teens in the same predicament.As for the deep scrub and spot zinger, I'm sure they work just fine, like similar products containing 2% salicylic acid.  I liked the feel of the scrub.  It was not too abrasive or drying, it did not burn or sting, and it left my skin feeling super clean and the tiniest bit tingly.  Likewise, no objections to the spot treatment, which comes with an applicator with a very narrow tip (think super glue) which really lets you pinpoint where you want to apply it.  As for the purported citrus mint scent -- hmmm -- it's no Yankee Candle.  To me, it had the slightest medicinal scent, though it was completely inoffensive.

This is a lovely razor -- it has a rubbery grip that is easy to hold, with a little indent in the handle for your thumb.  The razor has six blades, advertised on the packaging as "3x3 blades" (time for a refresher course in fourth grade math).  I'm not sure that six blades are better than five or four or two, but more is better seems to be the trend these days, and it does provide a smooth shave.  The razor head has a hinge in the middle, with three blades below the hinge and three blades above the hinge.  The head flexes at the joint about 45 degrees, and the head flexes up to about 45 degrees from the razor's handle, so you get tremendous you get tremendous flexibility and can really get around curves easily.The razor purportedly has a "moisturizing band", containing aloe, lavender, and vitamin E, but I didn't notice that it left my legs feeling particularly moisturized; and it is definitely no substitute for lotion or shaving cream.  I wasn't particularly impressed with the moisturizing strip.  It doesn't hold a candle to the Schick Intuition, which I really like.Blades are super easy to load and dispose of, with a single push of a button on the handle.  The razor is super easy to clean.  It is packaged with a little suction-cup holder can stick on your shower wall which hasn't fallen off yet -- though they usually do.  The razor is comfortable, works well, and is easy to hold and use, due to the rubbery grip.  I might pick up refills if they were on sale, but I think this is a little pricey for my tastes for everyday use.

I LOVE the taste of the  lemon Promax bars.  They're delicious -- lemony goodness covered in something akin to white chocolate, definitely like a sweet treat!  They're fairly filling -- but they taste so very good I don't want to stop after one.  I have also tried the Nutty Butter bars.  They're okay, but they have a more chewy sweet, candy barish but less distinctive flavor.  No risk of mistaking them for a Butterfinger, though.  These bars are large (compared to most bars) and pack a powerful protein punch -- 20 grams.  But it comes at a price -- high calories, at 290-300 calories a pop, and a ton of sugar, like 28 grams.  If you are just looking for the protein and don't mind the sugar and calories, you won't go wrong with these.  If you're looking for something less sugary, I would recommend Quest protein bars.  They're a little more expensive but they taste good and they're not loaded with sugar.  I will probably buy these again -- in the lemon flavor only -- but not for everyday use, more of a special treat.

This bracelet is very pretty, sturdy, and and appears to be very well made.  The cuff is silver and the clear stones are set in yellow gold -- so it will match anything.  It is perfect for stacking.  I have two and they fit together really nicely.  They are super comfortable and I hardly notice they are on.  I wear these almost every day.As a note, this 7.5" cuff fits very well on my larger wrist, much better than many  bracelets I've tried.  It might be a little too loose on someone with small wrists, but it works well on me.  Before I purchased these, I noticed that the price jumped around quite a bit, varying by as much as $20, so if you're thinking about purchasing you might want to track the price for a few days first.UPDATE:  I purchased two of these.  Within the first month, two stones fell out of one of the bracelets.  Fortunately, it was within the 30-day exchange period and Amazon allowed me to exchange it.  Just a few weeks later, I noticed that the new bracelet and the older bracelet are both missing stones.  I still think this is a very pretty bracelet, but I doubt I am able to replace the stones.  For the price, I would expect a little more durability.

I love Quest Protein Bars -- great flavors, low sugar, low in calories for the amount of protein -- and I thought I might branch out and try some of their other products.  These chips are high in protein and low in fat and sugar -- but thats about as far as their merits go.  They just don't taste very good at all.  They don't have a good mouth feel, and they seem to suck all the moisture out of my mouth -- like I'm chewing on a wad of paper towels or something.  These require a big glass of water as an accompaniment.  It is nice to be able to taste the salty/savory flavor a little bit, particularly if you've been snack-deprived, but the thrill wears off quickly.  I found the sea salt to be particularly flavorless, and green onion is my favorite.  Worth a try if you're looking for high protein/low carb munchies, but I doubt I purchase these again.  I'd rather spend my calories on chocolate chip cookie dough Quest Protein Bars anyway!

Winston (yep, named after the cigarette) lives with her grandma, and their pets -- a dog and a rooster-- in small town Florida.  Although Nanny has worked (and longed) for a wealthy restaurateur for many years, it seems she barely has two nickels to rub together.  Winston's mother, who goes by Skye Harper, ran off to California to pursue fame and fortune when Winston was quite young, and ended up as a substitute show girl in Las Vegas.  Skye has decided it is time to come home, so she asks Winston and Nanny to come fetch her in Vegas.  While her boss is out of the country, Nanny "borrows" his fancy motor home to embark on the cross-country trip.  Her boss's teenaged son, Steve, who is intrigued by the quirky Winston, hides in the RV and tags along on the trip.  And off they go to Vegas.  The journey brings new love, rekindled love, discovery, and abandonment.  The ending isn't quite believable but what the heck.I liked the "choppy" style and short chapters; they seem well-suited to the attention span of the intended young adult readers, and seem to more realistically convey the journaling style.  Winston occasionally sometimes seems very grounded and together and other times completely flaky.  She dreams of becoming  an Olympic swimmer, yet she is not on her school's swim team; she sneaks into the school pool to practice when no one is around.  She and Nanny are quirky but on the whole, likable.  This is set in the 1970's.  Much of it seemed very real to me, although I wonder if a tween reader would have sufficient context to make sense of the 70's references.
Horrible! It was messing with my touch screen. It was clicking on things randomly and/or would not read my touch. Had to take it off after an hour. My phone was back to normal after that.

The tip broke off a couple of times at the very beginning but it has stopped doing that now. This is a great color and liner. It really makes my lips look more defined.For lipstick, I used Revlon Colorstay Overtime in Unlimited Mulberry. These 2 colors are great together!

I love this thing! I now have it on subscribe and save. My favorite color is Unlimited Mulberry. Looks great on medium skin. I don't like the clear gloss that comes with it because it gets too shiny. But you need to put something over it to get rid of the sticky feeling. I just use lipbalm(any lipbalm - Burt's bees or chapstick) so it's not sticky and stays somewhat matte.I used Rimmel Exxagerate lip liner in Obsession(#064) color

Makes beautiful waves but it just doesn't get hot enough to get the job done quickly. I find myself redoing most of my hair. Might be fine for really thin fine hair that is easy to curl. So far, nothing beats the pink tapered remington curling rods. Those things are amazing... AND cheap! I'd return this if I still had the box but I threw it away. Please order something else. This just isn't worth your money.

I was surprised with how good this phone is. The flick of the wrist feature is kinda silly. I turned it off after only using it a few times. Swiping from left or from right seems easier. Amazon app store now has way more apps than 2 years ago... There really are a few android apps I can't download which is fine. The pre installed ameil and calendar app all sync with your gmail so that is a plus. The size is great and the resolution is fine. The battery, however, is questionable. My iphone 5s was over a year old and was finally showing a little on the battery life. It would go down to 50% with fair amount of use. But this fire phone was already down to 43% by 11am! Also, the charging port seems loose. I can't use it while it is charging. I tried all kinds of different USB cables and even plugged into different outlets but same thing was happening. I called Amazon and they were quick with replacing it with a new one. After about a week, I am convinced that the phones have issues, not my usb cables or my outlets. Hopefully, the issue doesn't get worse and I end up with a useless phone.

The shoes looks good. I ordered wide width but still felt snug. I figured it would stretch out after breaking it in. But the by the big toe hits my bone and rubs it wrong. It hurts too much to wear this more than half an hour. I think it will probably just sit there and not get used. Ugh. What a waste of money!
The fit is great but after a couple of washes, the stitches on the bottom started coming off. Would not buy again.
The picture and description is misleading. I ordered red but this is orange!
this is way too tight. I had trouble putting phone in and couldn't get it out. I had my husband pull the phone out of case. I will be returning this.

This is see through with a hint of blue. The laptop is black so you only see very little color. You also hear a snapping sound when you open the laptop coz the 2 edges touch in the back. To make it worse, this collects finger prints. Blah

I only give half a tab to my son. Full tab knocked him out that it was scary. I searched for sleep aid for children during a very rough transition to time when we came back from Asia. We are also at a phase where he just refuses sleep and could be up until midnight. This helps him fall asleep easier and now he is only waking up once at around 5:30am. I've been just leaving his baby gate at his door open so he can walk to our room and snuggle with us until it's time to wake up. He doesn't need this on days he didn't nap - only the days when he has napped and still is up and running late at night. This boy could be up until midnight if you let him. I do not want to rely on this to help my son sleep. We do our best to get him tired during the day - play outside, go for walks, play catch, etc, I had also set up an air mattress right next to his bed. and wait for him to fall asleep just to help him feel comfortable that someone is next to him, we do warm lavender baths, and we do music lullaby. This is last resort.
This made me cough all night. Had to throw it away.
Bad if you have any kind of allergy. I couldn't sleep when we had this on the hallway!
This looks too cheap. Save your money.

Used it about 4x and now it is no longer charging my phone. Useless. When it did charge my phone, it had to be when it isn't used or it will get so hot otherwise. That can't be good for the phone. I'd return this if I could but it is too late now.

This was impressive! It fit so much stuff. This lasted 2 international flights and 3 domestic SO FAR. Suitcases are heavy and you are probably only able to fit in like 45lbs instead of the 50lb limit. But this is so light and so thin that you can fit soo much. I wish it was a bit more stiff though but for the price, I can't really ask for more. I just made sure the zippers met at the top and I zip tied/cable tied? the ends of the handles. The handle strap is stitched all the way around the bag so zip tying this gave it more support. I wouldn't buy this as a primary luggage to use at every trip. I only bought this in case I need to carry more than necessary.

So comfy and kept my feet toasty on my cold kitchen floor! The sole and all the materials used were also thick enough to keep it's form. Finally a warm house slipper that will last me more than just a single season.

Did not work! Maybe only on little bugs/mosquitos or the ones sensitive to smell  If you have to go to a tropical place or the south, don't bother with this! My son and I had so many bites that swelled up a lot. This didn't work! I thought it smelled good though.
I don't know if this really calms my child down but it smells soooo good. I don't mind my entire house smelling like this.

It was so helpful having this especially if you have a toddler that likes to splash water and sand everywhere. My family and I went for a night dip on the beach(shallow water) and it was good to have this to light the area. The only thing that bothered me was the moisture inside that came from a teeny drop of water that got in when I opened this while the outside of case was still wet. You would have to let it dry before using it again. The moisture spreads in between the plastic and the screen.
They seem very sturdy and they are comfortable. I am buying every color available in my size since it is very hard for me to find shoes that are this comfortable.

I like it, it is cute and I like the attachment to turn it into a flashlight but it has never charged my iphone 5s all the way. I guess this is okay if I have a short errand to run but I would rather carry a bigger, heavier one when I travel
The screw on the back came off and the handle broke - all on the first 5 minutes of use. This is horrible!

Pls refer to the pictures. This charger melted and it ruined my phone. This says it is apple certified but this is carp! Now I am out of sub cable and my new IPhone 5s! Please, save the money towards a real apple usb! I posted pics so you can see.

This is NOT 350 lumen! This is just as bright as the free flashlight I got from Harbor Freight. When it is on, there is a bright circle at the center and the flood of light is very dim. Stungun works though - not sure how strong, I have not tried it on anyone.

I ordered the puppy neck pillow which is beige and brown but I got sent the blue puppy instead. I don't mind the color but minus one star for inaccurate pics. It's also too firm in my opinion so I can't even squish the area that goes on the back on the neck so my 16mos old can use it. This may be better for older toddlers. I'll have to just set this aside for another year or so.
These are well pigmented. My mom refuses to use them since it is not a known product and wants to stick with Loreal and Revlon. Believe me, Shany is way better.

I bought one that is a size bigger for my son but the ankles were still way too tight. I couldn't even get half of his feet in. Had to return them. But the quality looked superb, seemed warm and comfortable.
These are cute and comfortable. My put my son in these coz he likes to take his socks off, with these his feet stay covered. Ill be buying more. I think they fit perfectly.
This is super cute but I bought it to use to take notes in class. I have multiple typos in every sentence that I type because they keys are so small.

I bought a couple of these adapters for my recent trip to Australia. The adapters were too loose. The plug was wobbly and when I plugged them in, it sparked. I had to stop using them and just had to borrow adapters from hotel.
We had 3 books total and I just didn't have the time to read. Never finished even just one book. This is perfect. This has all the tricks and tips... Just press play and you're set!

This review is from: Cuisinart HM-70 Power Advantage 7-Speed Hand Mixer, Stainless and White (Kitchen)Packaging was fine. I did however notice that it looked like it is used. It had some smear of some something brown and the spatula was missing. What's going on?? The mixer wasn't well wrapped. It was just wrapped(half a*$ way) in a piece of plastic. Maybe someone returned this and you didn't even notice it was dirty and stuff are missing???
The valves are fine but the membranes do not work as well as original medela membrane. I washed them once and they don't lay flat on the valve which affects the suction.

I like the fact that this is already waterproof and you don't need to buy a waterproof crib sheet. It is however too soft. The plastic covering is what it makes it a lil firm but I feel like there is not enough padding inside. Please get something firmer for your baby. This is probably okay for a toddler but definitely not for younger babies. Also, if you have the Delta Kalani 4 in 1, this mattress is a bit small for the crib. I was worried my baby would get stuck in between the mattress and the crib. I am returning this tomorrow and getting one fr babies R Us. It's going to be a bit more expensive but at least we won't have to worry so much!

My baby is being breastfed but supplemented at night or whenever we are out. There were a couple of weeks during the holidays that we were out so much that I missed so many feedings and resulted in a drop of milk supply. I decided to try this supplement. I have taken Mothers More milk plus(or something like that) but I didn't like how they restrict you with water intake 20min before and up to 20min after. If you are breastfeeding, you know how breastfeeding Moms can get so thirsty. On day 1, I took 2 pills 3x a day and towards the end of day 2, I noticed I was getting engorged right before feeding time. By day 3, I decided to stop taking this, otherwise, id be leaking all the time! I hate hate HATE pumping so I decided to just stop taking it. oh and drink lots of water!!!
I want my money back. This didn't work.. Did everything it says on the directions. I even left it on longer.

I did my research and everywhere online says they are authentic but the bags are probably the kind that D&B rejected due to the bags not being up to par. when I received my bag, I noticed that the stitches inside where they stitched the handles were not neat looking. Other than that, it is a great bag. I just don't like that a part of the Logos are in black and you can only see the beige/brown stitches, you have to look at them at a certain angle to see the black stitches. I do love that it is a good sized purse and the pockets on the side can carry a bottle of water or a cellphone and keys.

I was very excited to use this since I like all Aveeno products. Like everyone says, it IS pretty thick and is like a light make up than a moisturizer. It went on smoothly on my skin since I had used ponds cream on my face before using this. It was a little shiny but nothing a little bit of powder can't fix. My face was looked nice UNTIL........I started itching by noon time. My forehead and cheeks and my whole face and neck started itching. I had to wash it off, my face was red! The next day, I noticed that my face felt like sand paper. I had very tiny bumps all over my face and neck and 2 days later, I started peeling off. So I had dry, red, bumpy, flaky face for like 4 days!!! I had to stop using face wash and only used ponds cold cream and a washcloth to clean and exfoliate my face.I give it 2 stars since it did make my face look nice for a couple of hours. But then I had a bad allergic reaction so I'll never buy this again.

This is a review based on first impressions, and on the use case for which we got the laptop.  I'll update if warranted.We got this as a secondary laptop for use by a teacher at an elementary charter school.  She will be using it for Internet browsing, email, and working on Word docs.  Possibly Excel docs in the future.  Nothing too demanding.Once I cleaned off the extraneous junk programs and got Office 365 installed and registered (free for a year), things worked well enough though slowly.  The keyboard is good.  What's left of the 32 GB SSD storage is enough for our purposes, especially if docs get stored in the cloud or on thumb drives or memory cards.  2 GB of memory is a tight limit; you won't do much multitasking.  But for browsing, email, and Word it's good enough.  The cheerful bright blue will fit in nicely at the elementary school.EXCEPT:  the touchpad is awful.  It simply does not respond properly to clicks and gestures, at least half the time.  We'll use a mouse instead.Windows 10 is an acquired taste, which we are in the process of acquiring.  At least it's better than Windows 8.  The jury is still out on the Microsoft Edge browser.

These are useful in the kitchen - microfiber really does work better than cotton for scrubbing and for picking up spills, and it is much cheaper and more ecologically friendly than paper towels.  There are three types of cloths in the set:  all microfiber, all scrub (one side) and striped scrub and non-scrub.  Effective for pickup and light cleaning, but I still prefer my Dobie pad for cleaning the stove and surfaces.They are washable and so far have not bled or shed.

I felt compelled to wait a few days after finishing My Name is Lucy Barton to see whether its impact stayed; sometimes a plainspoken book like this one turns out, in retrospect, to be just simple rather than "deceptively simple".But no.  The impact of Lucy Barton the character (and of her mother) and of the book stayed full force.  We follow Lucy Barton, a successful writer of (presumably literary) fiction through her life of emotional longing and outsiderness, starting with a nine-week hospital stay during which her mother visits for the first time since Lucy married.  The narration moves backward to childhood and adolescence and forward, eventually, to Lucy's ultimate success.  The reader has to keep her ears open; what  seem like throwaway details near the start of the book turn into plot points that echo throughout.  The book is a masterpiece of construction and slow disclosure - and welcome brevity.  There's more in these 200 or so pages than in many a saggy baggy modern novel (I'm looking at you, Telegraph Avenue, and at most of the work of Jonathan Franzen).Lucy is an off-kilter but deeply observant narrator, reminiscent of Lila in Marilynne Robinson's book of the same name.  Her story, and the mix of longing and love and distance between her and her mother will stay with you.

Here we have the last entry in The Science of Discworld series, where a Pratchett novella is interspersed with high-quality popular science writing that covers areas relevant to the novella.  Or perhaps vice versa.  In any case, there are two excellent science writers working with the one and only Terry Pratchett, from whom we will hear no more.  His daughter has stated that there will be no extensions of Discworld written by others, and that there are no abandoned manuscripts to be completed, and that the ideas in Sir Terry's files for new books will not be farmed out to others.If you've read the other SoD books you know what to expect here.  The theme is Priests vs Wizards for the control of Roundworld, which lets Pratchett and the scientists air their relgion-is-superstition-but-powerful views.  The latter-day sect of the Omnians do not distinguish themselves, even though The Great God Om makes an appearance.  If you remember Small Gods this bit has an extra kick.  The story is not top-drawer vintage Pratchett, but in 2011 - 2012 when this was probably written (originally published in 2013 in England) the man was still quite able though no longer at his peak.The science parts are not as lighthearted as usual, with some hard pushing of the logic-and-science-vs-supersition point.  The writing is fine at the sentence-and-paragraph level, but doesn't amount to a coherent view of a topic or small set of topics as the previous entries in the series were.Still worth your time and attention.  If you're a Pratchett fan you can always just give up and read the story sections.
