Unfortunately Itoya doesn't make the Profolio Professional any larger than 13x19 or 14x17. So if you need a larger sized Profolio then you will need to go outside the Professional line. If you need a Profolio that is 13x19/14x17 or smaller than I HIGHLY recommend going with the Professional line. Yes, they are a bit more expensive but they are absolutely worth the extra money.First and foremost the Professional line comes with a soft padded polyurethane cover, which has the appearance and feel of natural leather and is extremely resilient to wear and tear. All of the other lines come with hard polypropylene covers. This may not seem like a big difference to some but I couldn't possible disagree more. The padded polyurethane cover not only looks considerably nicer, it also ages much better than the polypropylene covers. Most importantly, the Professional's just feel so much better in your hands than the other versions. The padded polyurethane just has a great feel to it and ultimately it makes flipping through a presentation book a far more enjoyable experience. I have gotten so used to the padded polyurethane that when I go to my larger 18x24 books, which have hard polypropylene covers....well, they simply feel cheap by comparison. Fortunately I recently found a company that produces an 18x24 presentation book that actually has a cover that has a similar feel and appearance. Actually, its much nicer as its actually made with real leather. (Prat Start 4 Presentation Book for those that are interested).The Profolio Professional also comes with Itoya's PolyGlass sheets, which are the clearest & highest quality sheets Itoya makes. The only other line that carries these sheets are the Profolio Advantage books. The difference is that the Advantage line doesn't have the padded leather cover. So if the sheets are important but you have no interest in the leather cover, one could go with the Advantage line. If you want the best sheets and the best cover.....well, look no further. The Profolio Professional is the line you want. Regardless of which model you wind up going with, all of Itoya's presentation books are acid free and are 100% archival. So in that regard, there is no difference between the different models. The Profolio Professional comes with 24 sleeves so in total it can hold 48 pieces of artwork. I personally think its the perfect size as these things start to get a bit heavy when they are full. I have quite a few Professional 13x19 that are full and while they do have a bit of weight to them, they are still extremely comfortable to look through. I am not sure that would still be the case if they came with more pages.Bottom line - I have been a photographer for over 15 years and have tried more portfolios/presentation books than I care to admit. That said, the Itoya Profolio Professional line is easily one of the best products I have come across yet, especially when you factor in the price. Yes, there are better presentation books out there but they will cost you considerably more money. For the price, the Profolio Professional line is easily one of the best options on the market. I not only use them for my print portfolio's, I also use them for my lithograph/print collection. All in all I cant possibly give them a higher recommendation. Its just a great line of presentation books, for both artists and collectors alike.5 Stars!Edit.....Due to Itoya switching manufactures for these portfolios, the entire line of Profolio Professional portfolios have different covers now. Itoya was having serious problems with creasing in the Polyglass pages, a problem I can attest to personally as I had to ship 4 - 13 x 19 portfolios to Itoya for replacement due to this problem. From what I was told by 2 separate Itoya CS reps, they gave the manufacturer plenty of time to fix the problem and they were not able to do so hence they wound up switching manufacturers altogether.Instead of the smooth, leatherlike appearace of the old cover, the new cover has a textured look and feel to it. Basically, the new covers have a tiny diamond shaped pattern infused into the material, which gives it a textured look and feel. It also has slightly less padding so it doesn't have as much of a padded feel to it. I know quite a few collectors and artists who use these books and the inital reaction from most of them was that they didn't really care for the new cover and that they definitely preferred the older cover better. I myself had this same reaction after all, the cover was one of my favorite aspects to this line of portfolios. Yet as time wen't on, more and more of them began to really like the new cover. Its now been about a year since the new covers were introduced and everyone that I know that uses them has come to really like the new covers and that includes myself. It just took a little time to get used to the change.All in all, its basically the same quality cover, it just has a different look and feel to it. Actually, in regards to durability, I have found the new covers to be slightly superior to the previous covers. As I stated in my initial review, I use these portfolios for both print collecting and creating my own photography portfolios. Some of the portfolios I made are soley for shipping out to potential new clients. Shipping portfolios is really the single best test you can give a portfolio in regards to overall durability. Nothing wears a portfolio down faster than shipping them out to clients. Anyways, from my expereince over this last year, the new covers have a slightly better seam and the diamond texture is better at hiding scratches and scuff marks. Its not a signficant difference, but it was a big enough difference for me to notice.So to sum it up, the difference between the two covers, short of the small difference in durability that I noticed, are really just tactile in nature. Basically the new covers have a different look and feel, but the overall quality remains the same. So the change in cover really doesnt change anything in regards to my original review. This is still my go to line of portfolios and I still recommend them over all of the other portfolios in this price range. Basically, the new cover doesnt change anything in my book. In my opinion, this is still the best line of portfolios anwhere near this price range.

I initially ordered a set of these as I absolutely hated the kitchen towels we were using at the time. They just didn't soak up water very well at all. I swear it was almost as if they were resistant to soaking up water. Anyways, I had heard that flour towels were really great for drying dishes and wiping down counters so I decided to buy a pack. To say I have been blown away would be a massive understatement. These towels are like water magnets. One quick drying and you wont see any residual water left. They are honesty the best drying towels I have ever used, BY FAR!!One day, as I was cleaning our living room, I decided to try the flour towels for dusting. We have serious dust issues in my home and I hate using paper towels as they always wind up leaving small bits of dust or towel behind. I grabbed one of the flour towels from the kitchen, one that had a bit of moisture in it, and started wiping everything down in my living room, including my entertainment center and all the devices held within my entertainment center. I was literally in awe as these towels suck up dust as well as they suck up water. Again, its important to note that these towels work best, in regards to dusting, when they are a little bit moist. I have actually come up with a system that gets the towels to the perfect condition for dusting. I run water in my kitchen sink and then shut it off. I wait like 5 seconds for most of the water to run down the drain. Whats left are just the small drops of water all around the sink. I take the flour towel and I wipe the sink down until its 100% dry. I then run the water and get the sink wet again. Like before, I wait until the water has gone down the drain and then once again I dry the sink entirely. I do this 3-4 times and then wring the towel, like you do to get excess water out of a towel. Wringing the towel will help disperse the small amount of water you have in the towel. Basically you want the towel moist, but not to the point where you can wring any water out of it. If you can wring water out, you got it too wet. If you get it just right, it becomes the best dusting tool you will ever use. It is literally like a dust vacuum. Absolutely nothing is left behind. The surface you use it on will be absolutely 100% dust free. The best part about it is you don't need any cleaning solutions at all, just water and the towel.Fast forward 9 months or so and I now use these towels all over the house. I even tried cleaning our storm door, which is 100% glass from top to bottom. It gets pretty dirty as I have a bad habit of opening the door by pushing on the glass itself, which leaves fingerprints all over the glass. I feed the birds, chipmunks and squirrels on a regular basis and I usually hold the door open by using my hands on the glass. It drives my wife crazy as she is usually the one who cleans it. Anyways, just as a test, I figured I would try cleaning it using my moist flour towel method. I didn't use any glass cleaner at all, just the towel. It took a little more elbow grease but sure enough, it cleaned that glass door just as well as Windex with paper towel, which is the method my wife uses.Whats even more amazing is that I have now been using these towels for well over 12 months and the first 3 towels I pulled out of the package are still in amazing condition. I have no doubt that I will get at least another couple years out of this first batch of towels.All in all, these towels are nothing short of unbelievable. They dry items faster than any other towel I have ever used. They are the best dusting tool I have ever used, they are easy to clean, and last but not least, they appear to last forever. I have raved about these things to everyone I know and purchased an extra couple packages just to have on hand. Easily worth every last penny and then some.

I have been a big fan of "bad girl" art for a number of years. It was Michael Turner that initially got me interested in this genre of comic art, back when he was working at Top Cow, doing work on Witchblade and Fathom. I was actually in art school at the time, going for my B.F.A. with my focus in photography. I remember going over to a fellow students apartment to pick up some equipment and seeing a big lithograph of Witchblade #25 on his wall. That is one of the more iconic Witchblade covers, the one with Witchblade and Fathom standing in the pool of water next to the waterfall. It just immediately struck a chord in me as I had always loved comics and comic art but had never seen comic art like that before. I had seen "bad girl" comic art before but Michael Turner took it to a whole new level quality wise and all of his work was very tastefully done. I have always been a sucker for beautiful women, especially the innate beauty of the female figure. I even spent a semester at art school focusing on this subject matter (photographing the female figure). Of course, MIchael Turner went on to create the company Aspen Comics MLT and became one of the more popular comic artists of this generation and as I'm sure most people are aware, he passed away at a very young age due to cancer. Its extremely unfortunate as he was really one of the pioneer's of the modern "bad girl" genre and art style, which has really exploded in recent years.One of the main companies to come out of this explosion of popularity and growth was Zenescope, an independent comic company founded in 2005 by Joe Brusha and Ralph Tedesco. The company focused on re-imaginings of classic tales like Alice in Wonderland. Some of their more popular titles include Grimm Fairy Tales, Alice in Wonderland, Oz, Sleepy Hollow, Neverland, and Brimstone. To say they have been successful would be a massive understatement. They have gone from just a few titles, to having over 30 in 2013. There is even a Hollywood film being made, based off of their Monster Hunter's Survival Guide and will be starring Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson. The success of Zenescope is a testament to the explosive growth the "bad girl" genre has seen in recent years. The one thing your guaranteed with Zenescope, above all else, is amazing covers as they hire some of the best "bad girl" artists working in the industry today including EBAS, Mike Debalfo, J. Scott Campbell, etc. In fact, an argument can be made that these books are as much about the covers as they are the actual stories inside.All in all, this book exceeded all of my expectations and I have very high standards when it comes to the overall quality of art books, especially when the price is factored in. I was able to buy this book at 35% off the MSRP, which is basically the price of many of the individual "bad girl" prints/lithographs that I buy on a regular basis. So for me, this book was just a steal and worth every last penny I spent on it. If your a fan of Zenescope then this book should be your very next purchase. I for one cant wait for Volume 2.Hats off to Zenescope, just a remarkable job all the way around. This is how making a high quality art book is done!!!I am adding on to this review as I think its important to note that this is a limited edition release with an edition size of 2500. There is also a SDCC version, which has a different cover and is 2-3 times the normal price, which is limited to 250. These books also come with a limited edition 8x10 print. I do not know if the print is the same with the SDCC and standard version. I would tend to think not however. I would think they would use a different 8x10 print with the SDCC version, as then its edition size would be equal to the book itself, 250. In all honesty, 2500 is not a very large printing at all so if your planning on buying a copy, I wouldn't put it off for too long. Once these sell out, and they will sell out, your guaranteed to see prices go up by at least 25%, possibly more depending on just how popular this book winds up becoming.

I stumbled onto Manuka Honey a couple years back and I was really blown away by all of the claims that were being made about this honey. My family eats a lot of honey and we have really made serious changes to our diets in recent years. We no longer eat processed food, get all of our meats & produce from organic CSA farms and we are constantly on the look out for ways to further improve our diets. After reading about Manuka Honey, I simply had to give it a try. The brand I ordered was Wedderspoon Active 16+.To say that I was impressed is a massive understatement. It was the best honey I have ever had. On top of that, my wife used it when her eczema acted up and it worked better than her prescription lotions. We basically became die hard Manuka Honey fans and would panic when our supply started to get low. I recently went to Wedderspoon to place an order and I noticed they now had Organic Manuka Honey available. Well, it took me all of 2 seconds to decide to buy some. We try and buy organic every chance we get so this was a no brainer. I often describe Manuka Honey as liquid gold. Not only does it taste amazing, it also has anti-fungal and anti-bacterial properties. Now its offered in an Organic version. Food doesn't get much better than this.The first thing we did when we received it was a blind taste test. I gave it to my wife and she gave it to me. We were curious if we would be able to tell the difference between the two. We both wound up having to guess as the taste was identical. We simply couldn't tell the difference between the two. If you were to pour this into my regular Manuka Bottle, I would never have been able to tell the difference. Basically one of the best foods on earth just got that much better! If you like the non organic version of this honey then you will definitely like the organic version.I cant possibly give Wedderspoon Manuka Honey a higher recommendation and that goes for both the standard edition and the organic edition. Both are amazing products!5 Stars!!

These pants are hands down my favorite outdoor pants on the market. Every single aspect of these pants has been carefully designed and ultimately what you get is the best full featured outdoor pants on the market.First and foremost these pants are about as comfortable as pants can get. The cut, which includes a full-length inseam gusset and articulated knees, is outstanding and the weight of the fabric is just right, not too thin and not to thick. The waistline is lined with an extremely soft micro-chamois that feels great against your skin, even after long hikes carrying a 60 pound backpack. I have to give props to Mountain Hardware for going with an 11" inseam for the shorts. Too many convertible pants have shorts that are way too short. 10" would be fine too but anything shorter than that and....well, no thanks. Most of the other convertible pants I have tried had 8 & 9" inseams. Changing back and forth between shorts and pants couldn't be easier, which isn't the case with many convertible pants. The zippers work flawlessly and it only takes a few seconds to get them off or to put them back on. The pockets are actually one of my favorite aspects of these pants as there are a lot of them and they are big enough to hold a lot of gear.Some other important details include having a DWR finish, a UPF 50 sun protection rating, reinforced knees and seat, an integrated belt, and an adjustable drawcord in the leg hem. Overall these pants have everything that one looks for in a great pair of outdoor pants. In particular, the DWR finish is outstanding. On a recent trip to Rocky Mountain National Park, we got pummeled with 7 straight days of constant light misty rain and my legs never got wet. The pants continued to throw off whatever water mother nature threw at them. Some lower quality DWR finishes can become saturated over time and actually start to take in a bit of water. You dont have to worry about that with your Matterhorn's. Some of my Matterhorn pants are over 3 years old and the DWR coatings are still going strong.The only downside to these pants is they can get a bit uncomfortable in really hot weather. If your planning on going somewhere really hot then I would recommend using Mountain Hardware's Mesa convertible pant instead of the Matterhorn. The Mesa has lighter fabric thus more comfortable in really hot weather. In all honesty, I bring both my Matterhorn's and my Mesa's anytime I travel. Its a 1-2 combination that simply cant be beat by other companies.Bottom line - I have been wearing these pants for over 3 years and I really have yet to find their equal. I have worn them in just about every environment that one can find in the US plus some demanding environments outside of the US and they have performed flawlessly each and every time. If your looking for a high quality pair of outdoor pants then look no further. They are a bit more expensive than your average pair of outdoor pants but this is a case where you get what you pay for and its absolutely worth the extra cash.5 Stars!

Some people collect and some people are collectors. I am definitely a collector at heart and have been since I broke open my first pack of Wacky Packages back in 1978. Even today, when I see the new boxes of Wacky Packages at my local target, the kid in me just wants to buy a box and start opening them up. There is just something special about Wacky Packages and the fact that they are still around all these years later is proof to that fact.When I heard that Topps was going to be releasing a Commemorative Wacky Packages book....well, I couldn't wait to get a copy. As great as Wacky Packages are, these iconic images deserved a larger format, one that would really let people appreciate the art that made the cards so special. An art book was just a brilliant idea and in all honesty should have been produced years ago. That said, I was extremely disappointed when I learned the book was only going to be 6" x 7". In the art world, bigger is better and as nice as the book turned out to be, it could have been so much better had they gone with a larger book, 10" x 12" would have been perfect. So as much as I would love to give this book a 5 star rating, the size of the book prevents me from doing so.Even with the size issue, this is still an outstanding book. The design is clean, the paper is nice, the artwork is crisp and clean and the dust jacket is made from the same wax coated paper that Wacky Packages used to come wrapped in. If you have ever collected Wacky Packages or have any appreciation for this kind of art than I cant possibly give this book a higher recommendation. Even tho it had been well over 25 years since I stopped collecting Wacky Packages, I immediately recognized many of the images and for a little while at least, it made me feel like a kid again. All in all, this was a book long overdue and Topps and Abrams did a great job bringing it to market.Bottom line - While the format is too small imo, this is still a must buy book for all Wacky Packages fans, young and old alike.4 Stars!

I have been using rechargeable batteries for a very long time and I have tried a LOT of the different batteries that are on the market. Some were good, some were just ok, and some were downright horrible. I never really found a battery that I was 100% satisfied with, which is probably why I have tried so many brands, until I tried Eneloop batteries. Make no mistake about it, Eneloop are easily some of the best rechargeable batteries on the market and the new XX model, also known as Eneloop Pro, is just another step up for this fantastic brand of batteries.I could throw out a bunch of numbers that would prove just how amazing these batteries are but most people don't understand battery jargon anyways so I will simply say this: If your looking for high quality rechargeable batteries and your willing to spend a little more to get them...well, look no further. These are the batteries you should buy, period. I was so impressed by these batteries that I immediately purchased 4 - 16 packs and gave my regular Eneloop batteries to other family members. Not to suggest that my original Eneloop's weren't worth keeping. I would have kept them if not for the fact that I have been trying to get some of my other family members to use rechargeable batteries for quite some time, unsuccessfully I might add. So I figured the best way to show them was to give them my original Eneloop's. Given how many Eneloop XX I purchased, I simply didn't need them anymore.I do want to add that if your planning on buying a lot of them, I highly recommend one of the larger recharging stations, like the 16 battery stations you can find here on Amazon. Using the larger stations makes using rechargeable batteries a lot easier.Bottom line - Eneloop XX may cost a bit more but the additional cost is absolutely worth it. These are the best rechargeable batteries I have come across yet and even with the additional cost up front, they will save you buckets of money in the long term.5 Stars!!

I will make this short and sweet. If your looking for an adventure game, like the ones Telltale used to make (Sam & Max, Monkey Island etc..), then your going to be disappointed. Telltale has slowly but surely been changing from an old school adventure game company to a....well, I am not sure what they are now. Telltale's recent games are more cinematic experiences than they are gaming experiences and too their credit, this is exactly what they were trying to produce. I just have no interest at all in this hybrid style game Telltale is moving towards. Its extremely disappointing as I am a HUGE fan of old school adventure styled games and Telltale was one of the only companies left producing these kinds of games. So that makes these games doubly disappointing.When I first heard that Telltale had licensed both Jurassic Park and Back to the Future, I cant even begin to express how excited I was. The potential for these licenses in a classic adventure game format is almost limitless. Its obvious at this point that Telltale simply wasn't content making classic style adventure games. This is probably due to the fact that such a small segment of the gaming population actually wants to play this style game after all, classic adventure games have been dying a slow death the last 15 years for this very reason. In other words Telltale was no longer content being a niche market developer and the licensing of Jurassic Park and Back to the Future was all about selling to a larger audience and thus making more money. Telltale wants a bigger slice of the gaming pie. In all fairness, its their company and they certainly have a right to take their company in any direction they see fit. Its just extremely disappointing for classic adventure gamers who have followed Telltale all these years.There are probably a lot of gamers out there who actually enjoy these games, I am just not one of them. Don't get me wrong, I think its great that games have become more cinematic and that story is becoming a far more important aspect to gaming. Just look at all the amazing games we have had the last few years that took this more cinematic approach (Mass Effect, Red Dead Redemption, Assassins Creed, Uncharted, etc). Its taken gaming to a whole new level. Unfortunately Telltale's games have a lot of story but have forgotten about the great game play that needs to go with it, even from a classic adventure game perspective. This is simply not the kind of experience I look for when I am in the mood to play games, especially point and click games. I am not saying this is necessarily a bad game and some people may wind up really enjoying this game. I would just suggest renting before you buy. That way you know exactly the kind of game your getting. If you liked Back to the Future then you will probably enjoy this game as well.Telltale just licensed The Walking Dead (AMC's TV show) so its clear at this point that this is the direction that Telltale is taking from here on out, focusing more on a cinematic experience than an actual adventure game experience. Such a bummer....2 stars

I absolutely love fleece sweaters and jackets. Not the original fuzzy type of fleece that Patagonia became renowned for but the sweater quality fleece. The Better Sweater line, for both men and women, is a perfect example of this type of fleece. My wife is also a big fan of this style sweater/jacket and between the two of us....well, lets just say our closet is literally overflowing with fleece sweaters, jackets & hoodies from a slew of different outdoor companies including Marmot, Mountain Hardware, Alpine Lowe, 66 North, Cloudveil, Arc'terex, etc. All of these companies make quality outdoor clothing and all of them make multiple versions of this kind of sweater. With that being said, the Patagonia Better Sweater line (hoodie, regular jacket and 1/4 zip pullover) is the best line of this style fleece clothing that I have come across yet and my wife also shares this opinion.First and foremost this is the best knitting quality I have seen yet for fleece. It really does look and feel like a sweater. Its super soft and just has a great look to it. Best of all it stays that way, even after years of use. We have had some of our Better Sweater products for years and they are holding up amazingly well and this is really where this line distances itself from other companies. All fleece starts pilling eventually, even when the fleece is knitted into this style sweater/jacket. In my experience, Patagonia Fleece simply outperforms other companies fleece when it comes to pilling.The interior is fuzzy and soft, like the normal fleece that Patagonia makes and they use a micro polyester jersey fabric for the trim. These details just add to this jackets overall comfort. The fit of this line is absolutely perfect. If you buy the proper size, you should easily be able to layer underneath it. What really surprised me is just how breathable this line is. Its on par with a lot of my technical fleece jackets in this regard, not something I was expecting.Of course it would be criminal of me not to mention how great this entire line looks. Its one of the cleanest designs I have seen yet for fleece. Patagonia has released a lot of outstanding colors since they started this line a couple years back. In particular the Black Oak is one of the best black colors I have seen in a LONG time. I loved it so much I ordered 2 of each version in that color. Channel Blue and Stone Wash are 2 more that I really like from this years offerings. Patagonia can get a bit funky with their color selection from time to time but in regards to this line, the color selection has been outstanding year after year. The Hoodie version is my favorite version but I really do love the entire line and wouldn't hesitate ordering any of them.Bottom line - If your a fan of fleece jackets or sweater jackets then I cant possibly give the Better Sweater Line a higher recommendation. Its top notch in every regard. Then again, I expected as much as this Patagonia and that is exactly what I have come to expect from their clothing over the last 30 years. Its just a fantastic line, one I hope Patagonia keeps around for a very long time to come.5 stars!

Its just a fantastic line of fleece jackets, one I hope Patagonia keeps around for a very long time to come.5 stars!

I will openly admit that many of my favorite games are from past console generations. That's why I consider this HD remake trend to be the most exciting development in all of gaming right now. Beyond Good and Evil, Resident Evil 4, Resident Evil: Code Veronica...have loved replaying all of them. Now they have plans for Silent Hill and many others. Its like videogame nirvana. Its great for publishers as they get to make more money on a game that is already made, simply by doing a few upgrades. More importantly, its great for gamers as it gives fans of the games the ability to play the games again, with an HD upgrade. Of course, it also gives gamers that have never played the games a chance to experience them firsthand. Its just a win, win, win scenario all the way around...at least in my book.That brings me to Metal Gear Solid HD, which in my opinion is the best HD remake's done so far. Personally I purchased this for MGS 2 & 3. Peace Walker is just a bonus as I really didn't have much interest in playing it and have only had a few short sessions with it thus far. It is important to note, as others have already done, that Peace Walker was originally a PSP game so if you go in expecting a top notch HD experience on the same level of MGS2 or MGS3....well, your going to come out the other end disappointed. For what it was, the developers did a very good job bringing it to the 360 and PS3.Basically this package is exactly what it says it is, an HD upgrade of these games. The old style controls are still intact, which I am sure many people were hoping would be updated as well. I think controls should remain the same as changing the controls is changing the game itself and that isn't what the HD remakes should be about. Do you think the tension would be the same in Resident Evil: Code Veronica if it had an updated control system? Not a chance. HD remakes should be about preserving the games as much as they should be about updating them to HD standards. Thankfully that is exactly what we get with this package. In all honesty, I think MGS is one of the most polarizing games ever to hit store shelves. People either love them or hate them and this release isnt going to change any minds. The people that love these games will love this package and the people that hate these games....well, they will still hate them.As for how they look, I certainly wasn't disappointed. Personally I think that MGS3 benefited the most from this upgrade but that isn't saying that MGS2 looks bad. Quite the contrary actually as it looks great. Its just that MGS3's environments are better suited to the upgrade. MGS2's environments were small and confined compared to MGS3. In regards to the updated graphics I would rate MGS2 a 7/10 and MGS3 a 9/10. Again, I really haven't played Peace Walker enough to really say much about it, just that it looks good given that it was originally a PSP game.Bottom line - If your a MGS fan then you should absolutely pick this package up and re-experiences these titles. If you dislike the MGS series then skip it. This release certainly isn't going to change your opinion. For those new to the series, there really isn't anything else out there like MGS. You simply have to play it to understand what the fuss is all about. Hideo Kojima is a master storyteller. Things may get quirky from time to time and they might even be a bit difficult to follow from time to time but that's Hideo Kojima. Overall, MGS's stories/characters are some of the more interesting stories/characters to ever grace a videogame console and ironically some aspects of these stories have more relevance today than they did back when they were originally released. There is a reason that this series is one of the most successful in history.As for the developers - Keep the HD remakes coming!!5 Stars

First and foremost, I have to give props to the art department at Bethesda. The art direction for this game is so far above earlier titles that even comparing them to this game is utterly pointless. Its literally in a class by itself and this is evident everywhere you look. The most obvious and impressive improvement has to be the design of the clothing, armor and weapons. The intricate designs are truly breathtaking. Even the cheap equipment you first start off with is stunning. For example, one of the first shields your introduced to in the game is the Hide Shield and its absolutely beautiful. Large metal rivets circle the outer diameter and intricate designs adorn the leather. It even has the dents and nicks one would expect to see from a shield that has seen its fair share of battle. This attention to detail is seen everywhere and it goes right down to the bindings of the books and the crackle glazed dishes and pottery found adorning most tables and halls. When you add this to the significant improvement in graphics....well, what you get is a level of realism that simply blows earlier titles out of the water. This is hands down the best art direction I have ever seen from a video game and ultimately it gives this world a level of realism that we simply haven't seen before.The world itself is absolutely beautiful. One of the first open scenes I came across was a large flowing river that had huge rocks jetting up creating white water/rapids. Large mountains were in the background with wisps of clouds running all up and down the side of the mountain. It was absolutely stunning. I had to just stop and stare for a few moments. The draw distance has been significantly increased and the detail, as I wrote up above, is amazing. The landscape itself is just one big work of art. Traveling around and discovering the land for yourself has always been one of the big enjoyments for fans of this series. Well, Skyrim doesn't disappoint in this regard. In fact, this is easily the best title yet in regards to this aspect of the game. No other game series can compete with the size and scope of the worlds that Bethesda creates for this series and no other game in the Elder Scrolls series even comes close to matching what Bethesda has achieved this time around with Skyrim. They have significantly leapfrogged anything and everything they have done in the past.An issue I feel compelled to discuss is the huge improvement with the 3rd person perspective in this game. As I am sure people are aware, 3rd person perspective in Oblivion was pretty bad. Actually, it was awful. You could switch over for short periods but the game was pretty much unplayable from that perspective. Well, the improvement Bethesda has made in this aspect of the game is nothing short of amazing. Your character no longer looks like he is walking on air and your easily able to interact with your environment. Basically this game is now wholly playable from this perspective. I prefer playing in 3rd person perspective when I am just traveling around and its just really nice to see Bethesda finally take the proper steps to fix this aspect of this series. If your going to include it than at least make it playable and Bethesda has done just that.You can immediately tell that this is an Elder Scrolls game but dont let that fool you. There are a lot of changes behind Skrim. One of the most obvious changes is with the skill system. The skills themselves are pretty much the same. You have Alchemy, Illusion, Conjuration, Destruction, Restoration, Alteration, Enchanting, Heavy Armor, Light Armor, Block, One Handed, Two Handed, Archery, Sneak, Lockpicking, Pickpocket, Speech and a new one Smithing. The big difference lies in the fact that you now have specialty skills for each skill category and there are multiple branching paths one can take. For example, the Stealth skill has two different branches that one can take, one that focuses on stealth (Muffled Movement, Light Foot, Silent Roll, ect.) and one that focuses on blade skills (Backstab, Deadly aim, and Assassins blade). This ultimately adds a significant amount of depth to character progression and it also adds to the games re-playability factor as there are now so many different avenues one can take. On top of this there are no longer character classes. You still have the different races of character to choose from but choosing a class is history. What kind of character you become (Spellcaster, Fighter etc.) is solely dependent on the skills you choose to upgrade or in other words its dependent on how you play your character. Personally I love this new system as it doesn't lock you into a specific mold for your character and it leaves everything open for you to explore. Its just a far more organic system and ultimately I think its a significant step forward for this series in regards to character development.Another big change is with the menu system and this is easily one of the best changes made in this game. The new menu system is just far more intuitive. Basically the menu system has been broken down into 4 distinct categories. There is Skills, Items, Map, and Magic. You have to press the menu button to access the menu but once you do that, you no longer need to press buttons. Simply press the left stick in the direction of the menu you want and it automatically changes. Once you have done this, a new subsystem of selections will come up and pressing the left stick to the right will take you to the next menu and so on. No button pressing needed. Basically the left thumb stick controls all of your movements within the menu system, with no button pressing needed. I may not have described it very well but its hands down one of the best menu systems I have ever used. Again, its just a far more intuitive system and it just has a great feel to it. You never leave the main screen when accessing menu's. It just blurs out a bit and acts as a background to the menus themselves. This basically does two things, it helps to keep the menus from detracting from the game itself and it ultimately makes the menu system far more attractive. They have also updated the item menu with 3 dimensional representations of the in game items. You can now spin items around a 360 degree axis, both vertical and horizontal. Its a small detail but a very cool one, especially for the weapons and armor.I also have to mention the skill menu as the way they have graphically laid this system out is...well, its nothing short of stunning. Each individual skill is represented by a constellation in the sky and beautiful gaseous nebula act as a background to the constellations. The visual effect is gorgeous. You can cycle left or right through the skills/constellations and when you access the branching skill set associated with each skill, you suddenly zoom into the constellation itself and the different branching skills are suddenly represented by the individual stars in that particular constellation. Its kind of difficult to properly explain but trust me, the effect is not only stunning, its also nothing short of ingenious. Its EASILY one of the best, if not the best, molds of form and function I have seen yet in videogames. Words simply cant do this games art direction justice. It really has to be seen firsthand to be fully appreciated.Combat has also been overhauled and what we wind up with is a system that is far more fluid, and ultimately a lot more fun, than previous releases. Characters are now able to duel wield both weapons and spells and can even mix up the two. In other words, you can assign a sword to one hand and a spell to another hand or you can go with a staff in one hand and a spell in the other. You can mix it up anyway you want. This new system fits perfectly with the new character system (that being one with no character classes). By adding so many options in regards to how to approach combat, they have essentially added strategy to the mix, something that was entirely lacking in Oblivion. Well, short of actually picking what character class you were actually going to play in oblivion. Basically the combat is just far superior to what we had with Oblivion. Unfortunately you can no longer assign weapons and spells to the D-pad and this is really one of my only complaints with the game. I dont understand why Bethesda decided to get rid of this. They could have even split the D-pad field in two, to accommodate the dual wielding nature of the game. In other words, they could have made the 4 slots on the left for the left hand and the 4 right slots on the right for the right hand. That would still have given you 4 quick slots for each hand.There are lots of other aspects to this game that have been updated but I will leave the rest of them for the player to discover and while there are lots of new additions to Skyrim, fortunately there is also a lot that hasn't changed. Traveling is still done the same way. Once you have actually discovered a location you have the option to fast travel to that location. There are still lots of different factions that one can join, all of which have additional quests associated with them. You can still go about playing the game as you want. You still collect herbs and ingredients for potions. There are still hundreds of different books that one can read. I could go on and on and on and on. This is an Elder Scrolls game after all and Bethesda has kept the heart of the game intact and that is a very good thing indeed. I wont go into the story aspect of this game as I hate spoilers. I will just say that the main story line is fantatstic and is really the icing on the cake.Bottom line - I am a huge Elder Scrolls fan and I have been watching this game since it was first announced. To say my expectations were extremely high would be a massive understatement. With that being said, Skyrim is everything that I hoped for and then some. It hasn't just raised the bar, its launched it into the stratosphere. If your an Elder Scrolls fan then buying this should be a no brainer. This is the kind of game people buy consoles for and this is easily Bethesda's best work yet in regards to this series. They have just taken this franchise to a whole new level. Thankfully, I have lots of time in the coming months to discover all that this game has to offer and make no mistake about it, what this game has to offer....well, its limited only by the amount of time you spend with it.Outstanding, simply outstanding!5 Stars!

I initially purchased this after reading an article in a food magazine which highlighted the high fiber content. On top of that I absolutely love Coconut and am always looking for new and exciting products for the kitchen. Of course, Coconut flour just sounds good so I simply had to give it a try. I am glad I did as its really one of the more unique flours I have ever come across. First and foremost it is absolutely wonderful in homemade smoothies, as others on here have already suggested. It has a very subtle flavor and really compliments a lot of smoothie recipes perfectly. You can really up the fiber content of your smoothie without severely effecting the overall flavor.Another great way to use coconut flour is with chicken or shrimp. Simply dip the chicken or shrimp in an egg bath and then coat with coconut flour. We then brush on a little more egg and sprinkle some Red Bob's Unsweetened Coconut flakes on top. We then fry using coconut oil. Its important to note that we fry at a lower temperature so as not to destroy all the nutritional value of the Coconut oil. High temperatures really kill a lot of the nutritional value of oils so I recommend cooking at lower temperatures when using oils like coconut oil or olive oil.We also tried coconut flour in many other recipes including my families nutball recipe. The first attempts didn't work out too well but we eventually found a good substitution ratio and the results were really quite amazing. We have also made muffins, pancakes and even english muffins. What I have learned is that Coconut flour is truly a unique flour and with a little bit of experimentation and patience, it can really be an amazing substitute for more popular flours. It is a much dryer flour and as such you will have to compensate for that in your recipes. Many times this can be countered by adding more eggs. I have found that a good starting point is a substitution of roughly 20-30%. Its also important to note that most of the fat/oil has been taken out so Coconut flour is not a good source for people looking to get coconut oil into their diet. You need to buy the meat or the oil separately if your looking to put some coconut oil into your diet. The flour itself actually goes through processes that pull the oil out.Bottom line - Coconut flour really is a very unique flour. It has a light flavor and can really add magic to your recipes. On top of that its absolutely loaded with fiber. Coconut flour will make a magnificent addition to your kitchen cupboard. Again all it takes is a little experimentation and a little patience and you will quickly learn just how wonderful this flour really is. I cant give this flour a higher recommendation.

I absolutely love OXO Pop containers. As I have made clear in all of the reviews I have written here on Amazon in regards to these containers, I not only consider these the best storage containers on the market but I also consider them to be the best storage containers ever designed, period. The ease of use, the quality of the seal, and the sheer number of different sizes available easily make these the best storage containers I have ever used. The difference we have seen in regards to the freshness of the food we store in these containers, compared to our old storage containers, has been nothing short of stunning. With that being said, I was praying that they would come out with a stainless lid set and even emailed OXO on multiple occasions begging them to release such a set. My kitchen is largely detailed with stainless steel so stainless POP containers would go perfectly in my kitchen and of course, stainless lids would just make these containers that much higher in quality. When I actually stumbled onto the stainless versions of these containers at one of my local kitchen supply stores...well, lets just say I was absolutely ecstatic and immediately purchased a bunch of them.Basically these are the same exact containers they were before. The only change is that the lid is now stainless steel instead of white plastic. Everything else is exactly the same and that is a very good thing as again the original containers are outstanding in every regard. The quality of the stainless lids are exactly what I would have expected coming from OXO. They are top notch and just look great. What I would like to see now is the ability to just buy the lid as I already had well over 30 of the original containers and it would be nice to be able to update many of them with the stainless lid without having to buy the whole container. The 3.4 quart container is probably our 2nd favorite POP container as its perfect for whole boxes of cereal and we usually have at least 3-4 different types of cereal on hand at any given time. This is one area where we have seen the biggest difference in regards to freshness. Our cereals are now staying fresh 2-3 times as long as they were before moving to POP containers.Bottom line - OXO's POP containers are, in my opinion, the best storage containers on the market. They not only keep a perfect seal but they also look great and can actually save a significant amount of cabinet space. The new stainless versions just one upped the original version as the are just that much higher in quality and just look that much better, especially for people like myself that have a kitchen that already has a lot of stainless steel in it. A BIG thank you to OXO for coming out with this updated version of the Pop Container. Its everything I was hoping it would be.5 Stars!!
