I wouldve liked more of a distinction between the two and would give the narration a 3 while the story gets a 4 1/2. Even with that said, I've just restarted the audio because I can't face deleting it without listening one more time.

I know a secret. If you have too much stuff and its bugging you then get rid of it. All of it. Well, nearly all of it. Save a few things but only the things you absolutely love, the things that spark joy within your being (youll know it when you feel it, says the author) and dont bring more things into the house unless you love and/or need them. Dont think you can do that? Well, never mind then.This author wants you to be absolutely ruthless with your possessions and do it in one fell swoop. Dont dilly-dally and put certain unpleasant things off. Absolutely do not waste money buying storage solutions. Just get rid of your stuff and you wont have to store it or dust it or leave it there to feel bad for itself. Now, none of this is a bad thing (though the last might be a wee bit kooky) and honestly Im all for it. I had way too much crap lying about and it was driving me crazy. Broken crap, ugly crap, gifted crap, crap that had been there so long it was invisible to me. But this book has a problem and it is a BIG one that Im betting many of you here on this site may take issue with as well.Step #2, you see, is books. BOOKS! Step freaking two is BOOKS. As you can probably easily imagine, I am stuck here on step #2 because, well, its a call to action to rid myself of my precious books! Ive been collecting books since I was twelve years old. I have a lot of books but Im afraid I may love them all.#1 was clothes, shoes, accessories and that was a breeze. Who needs clothes taking up space that could hold a few books? This was easy, thought I. My closet was done in an hour or so. Everything culled, sorted and color coded and folded all nice and tidy-like. I could blow through this, thought I. A zen and clutter-free life was within my grasp. I had this. Then step #2 happened and I was instructed to rid myself of all of the books I have loved before (but may not love again) and all of the books I have not read yet. Uh oh. I was told to remove my TBR pile(s) from my life. Forever. And almost always. Shell allow you to re-buy digitally if you are pining away and dying of sadness for it. I was instructed to touch each one and see if it sparked that apparently not-so-elusive feeling of joy within me. Trouble is they all kind of did. I suppose I am broken. I tried folks, I truly did. I took pictures and even posted them online in an attempt to humiliate myself into following through. I even went so far as removing a gigantor bookshelf, stocked three piles deep, floor-to-ceiling, from my room as well as an armoire I no longer needed. I have to admit my room looks and feels calms and free and spacious. The bookshelf now neatly resides in my basement. I pulled off all of the books and starting sorting them but it made me incredibly sad to think about tossing them out of my house where they might potentially end up in a trash/recycle bin (according to the author everything has feelings so how could I allow this? Better they be a little lonesome on my shelf than DEAD, right?!). Instead of tossing them into bags, I started arranging them by color (which she wants you to do with clothes) and then I put all but a dozen or so back up on the shelves. They look happy and pretty and they brighten the back wall of the basement. I have decided that I am keeping them. They are my one and only vice and I work hard. They are not clutter.I think I shall pretend that step 2 was nothing but a fever dream.After I was revived with sniffing salts I got back to business. So next comes all of the other stuff which I can easily part ways with; the paper, the stuff no one ever eats, the gadgets (my days of bread baking are over), the broken things that weve been thinking well fix someday, the mementos, pictures and all the other useless crapola that has been residing in the basement since we moved in a million years ago. Ive removed countless bags of trash and several car loads of stuff and hauled them to Goodwill and I miss none of it. It is so much easier to clean my house now. I havent followed this plan as written, its difficult when you live with several other people, so we still have some bins and crud to get to but now I'm inspired to keep at it.This book will give you some unique tools and I do recommend it if you skip step two or perhaps save it for last, if youre anything like me. She has a nifty way of folding clothes that helped me fit everything into a few drawers and will keep me in check if I decide I need more yoga pants. You really do see just how much of each clothing category you own when you pile them all on the bed/floor and separate them into their own little categories. She doesnt declutter by room but by category. This stops you from getting stuck (on pictures or mementos which are left for the end) and forces you to deal with an entire category and actually finish the job so you never have to do it again. She also tells you to start with a clear vision of your end result. That bit of advice has helped me tremendously.The author clearly has an obsession with tidying. She does not deny this. Apparently, shes been this way since she was a wee, strange child and goes into great detail at the beginning of book about her childhood hobby of tidying. This makes the start a bit of a slog. I found some of her beliefs a little quirky and I will not be emptying my bag out each night so my stuff can breathe only to put everything back in come morning (what the?!) but if you can overlook some of the odd things she says, youll more than likely find something here to help you out.

3 1/2 Stars  Beautiful Creatures is a young adult fantasy novel about a sweet boy named Ethan who wants nothing more than to graduate high school and leave his small town life far behind.But then a new girl named Lena moves to town and life gets much more interesting for Ethan.They are drawn together despite their differences. Lena lives with her uncle who is the creepiest man in town and she drives his hearse. She is an immediate outcast despite her beauty. Her family is full of secrets. Ethan loves to read but is also very much a jock and does what he must to fit in. He cannot resist Lena and she cannot resist him. They can read each others thoughts and soon they are in deeply in love and enmeshed in a battle to save Lena from turning dark on her 16th birthday.So theres the gist. Its not bad and its not horrible but it sure is far too long. At least 100 pages too long. I mostly enjoyed it but I have to admit that I absolutely did not find the psychic link between them romantic in any way. But Im not 16 either. Honestly, though, would you want a love interest in your head, privy to your every thought? What if he wears some doofy hat to school and you dont know how to tell him? Guess you just did! What if hes a bad kisser and you couldnt shield your thoughts in time? Maybe Im just an awful person but I think Id spend most of my day wanting a sink hole to swallow me.So, if you have many hours to spare while youre doing dishes, supposed to be working or stuck in the car and you want to read about a boy who may or may not be too good to be true (Ethan takes his three aging aunties to church EVERY Saturday - he is such a good boy) you may want to check this out in audio. The production, eerie music and the narration are fabulous, even if the story may not have been.

Imagine this, if you will, you dont feel so hot and step into the rest room to take care of business. While you were away, the earth has been plagued by demonic hounds. You probably shouldn't have eaten so many hot wings but it looks like they may have saved your life this time around! So as these hounds are busy eating faces and humping legs (and other things) with their giant doggie parts, you are left stumbling about trying to figure out exactly what the hell happened. Fortunately you soon find a few other misfits and are off on a mission to find a statue and save the world!This book is most definitely bizarro. I usually have trouble finishing bizarro books because theyre too far out there for me but this one stayed grounded with some fun humor that kept me reading. It was bat s*** crazy, kind of gross in parts and a little too heavy on the non-stop action side for my personal taste. There are hounds from another dimension, warty dwarves, a monkey in a wedding dress, mer-people, a man-sized tribble costume and a whole lot more packed in here. Theres no way I can explain the plot and Im not even going to try. Ill just say that its a very bad idea to wear a tribble costume around a bunch of hung hounds and leave it at that.

I listened to this book as an unabridged audiobook read by Rosalyn Landor. She does a fine rather snooty job with the narration which fits the historical setting and a fabulous job with the heroine but when it comes time to do to the manly voices I cringed a little. I wouldve much rather had a male voicing the guy parts but they didnt ask me.Its been a bit since Ive read a historical romance and this one had a lovely leisurely setup that introduced the relationship between childhood friends Michael and Penelope by letters they wrote when they were children and via flashbacks to their friendship. It gave me high hopes for the relationship to come.As a young man, Michael lost everything in a moment of overeager stupidity and has spent the past decade working to reclaim what was once his. He disappeared from Penelopes life and hasnt been there when shes needed a friend. Because her daddy wants her married off, and soon, hes attached some very attractive land to Penelopes dowry. Land that once belonged to Michael, land Michael will do almost anything to get back . . .Can you see where this is going?So yeah, Michael suddenly re-enters her life and pretty much steamrolls over it to get what he wants. He doesnt seem anything like the Michael from the letters and that made me a little sad for Penelope who was so genuinely happy to see her old friend when they meet up again. But then he opens his mouth and ugly spew slips out and shes not so thrilled. Hes changed and hes a demanding ass who keeps secrets and strong-arms her into marrying him and then is all about The Revenge. He must get The Revenge! Even if it hurts those who love him.Ugh. Ugh. And ugh. I dont like this type of hero. Never will, Im sad to say. He does eventually realize the error of his ways but its all a little too little, a little too late. I am not a patient gal so I can only give this one a three. The writing was great; there was wit, sensuality and Penelope was not a push over and I will read this author in the future but I cant give this story any more than a 3 because of Michael. He is a jerk, he knows hes a jerk at least, but that does not change the fact that he behaves like a jerk for a majority of the story. His character flaw causes no end of conflict and though his fingers may have been magical, his nonsense had me wanting to strangle him a little.Im going to turn you from light to dark, from good to bad. Im going to ruin you. She didnt care. She was his. He owned her in this moment, with this touch. And do you know how it will feel? She sighed the word this time. Splendid.

Hmmm, I don't know if I received a different curtain from all of these 5 star reviewers here but I am not happy at all with the one I received. I can't help but wonder if they had used it less than a week before writing their reviews? It is super thin, super flimsy, has a magnet on the two bottom corners but they do next to nothing and it flops all around when the shower is running. It is also NOT mildew free which is the main reason I purchased it. I have had this in the shower for only a few weeks and the bottom 2 inches look as if it's been sitting there for a decade and I clean my shower nearly every day. I've scrubbed it, bleached it and cursed it and it still contains ugly stains that will not budge and their growing bigger every day. I'm throwing it away today because I am sick of fighting with it and losing and it makes my bathroom look dirty. I am so disappointed and would not recommend this to anyone unless you enjoy throwing your money away. I can find this same kind of cheapo liner at the Dollar Tree for less money.

Hmmm, how to rate that this one? I'll start with a 3 and see what I end up with once I spew out my thoughts.Bare-Knuckle love is a little too weird to be believable. Jason is out of cash, unemployed and agrees to lose a bare-knuckle underground cage fight. During the fight he spots an old high school crush in the crowd and his pride forces him to throw common sense out the window and he wins the fight.This isnt the weird part.The weirdness begins when it disclosed that the crush is the leader of a big, bad motorcycle club. Hes straight (or pretends to be) but then forces Jason to get on his knees and do a very naughty thing because hes so damn mad that Jason didnt throw the fight. Jason does what hes commanded because Jason has no self-worth. Hyde has filmed the whole thing and uses it against Jason. This is sad and a little strange but Im easy and went with it.But then, oh but then . . . Hyde (good name for him, really, kudos to the author) decides to take Jason home and it is here that the WTFery begins. Hyde, you see, is married to a lesbian whose lover lives in the same house all cozy-like. Hyde and his wife have a little boy. Hyde is allowed to have lovers but not make sexy noise within hearing range of the boy. Hyde lives a very normal life at home that is almost sweet. Into this little bubble of non-reality he brings an illegal MMA fighter without a second thought?! What on earth?Sooooo, tell me if this scenario makes any kind of sense or if Im just having a really bad comprehension moment.Hyde is basically holding Jason prisoner to his sexual whim (though Jason doesnt seem to mind the sex part) and hes also forcing him to throw another fight because he has that humiliating little sex vid of him. Jason does whatever Hyde demands because hes terrified of the video getting out and because he has no self-confidence. His inner monologue sounds like a beaten and bullied teen and it made me so sad.Jason, however, knows that this big bad MC leader is keeping a secret life that would destroy his standing in the MC and would destroy his life if word got out.Hmmm, Id say Jason WINS this smack-down by a landslide. Sadly Jason is not bright enough to realize this. Or hes too blinded by the sex and cant think straight.Anyhow, this is the premise which, if you ask me, is all kinds of terrible. Still, I read it to the very end and have to admit that it was kind of sexy in a completely awful way.2 ? 3? Im still on the fence. The writing wasnt horrible and I'd read this author again because despite my dislike of most of the story, it managed to draw me in. I very much disliked Hyde and felt that the Jason was too weak a character. He needed a hug and a nice guy. Instead he got stuck with Hyde. Ah well. Insta-lust will do that to you.

The first half or so of this book is heart-crushing. It may break your heart, even if you think you dont have one.Dan trains horses and he is one of the best. His life was bliss until a riding accident destroyed his world a year ago. Now his lover is in a coma and has been declared brain dead. Dan cant let go and wants to keep Justin around just to be near him. When he is forced to let Justin go (due to circumstances out of his control), he has to reluctantly rebuild his life. Oh my heart. This part is so painful.The rest of the novel is all about Dan attempting to start over with the horses he and Justin loved and forcing himself to slowly step into building new relationship.Its painful and its messy. Dont pick this book up thinking youre too hard-shelled to cry. You will. It may destroy you for a while. I had to take a few breaks from all of the sadness. But dont worry its not all grief and tears. Dan eventually begins to move on and meets a nice guy hes attracted to as well as a couple who are both attracted to him. Its a situation that Dan is certain he is not ready to enter but Evan and Jeff are gorgeous and Evan is very persistent. Jeff is older and he befriends and supports Dan as a friend when he needs it most.Im too old to think a broken heart is romantic. Awww, Jeff, he always knows just what to say.This book doesnt follow your typical m/m romance formula where two guys meet, fall in love/lust, have a few (usually silly) fights and live happily ever after. I never quite knew how things were going to end and if Dan would ever be able to open his heart to someone new. I liked the not knowing.The pace is rather leisurely and there is a lot of time spent on the day to day ins and outs of horse training. I loved all of it but you might not. It is character driven and I prefer those types of stories, when theyre written well, over an action driven plot/convoluted plot any day. The only action going on here is action of the sexy kind and it comes late into the book so hang in there if you think it wont ever happen. Its worth the wait.This book stands on its own and doesnt end with any huge cliff-hanger but it is the first in a series. Im looking forward to reading the other books in the series to see where these guys take things.

From the author who brought you Creamed by Cave Creatures (which I very much enjoyed).I don't know what this is but it certainly isn't erotica and it certainly is  not what I'd consider a five star read by any stretch of the imagination. There's stilted dialogue, stilted narration, beheading, town razing, more murder and rape. None of this is what I'd call erotic but, hey, whatever works for ya. Maybe it's just me. Terrible, ugly, non-erotic things occur and then it JUST ENDS! This isn't even a fully fleshed out short story. It's just a lead in to part 2. And from this snippet I want absolutely nothing to do with Part 2. Call me a wuss if you will. I can take it.I realize this was a freebie and who am I to complain, right? But my time is precious and worth something to me and reading an unfinished story makes me a little crazy. To top it off the rest of the story would cost me $$ for only 99 pages. I DON'T THINK SO.Serves me right. I'm sticking with monster erotica freebies from here on out. At least they have a reason for behaving like monsters!

This book gets points for its descriptions of an icy cold hell but, most to my dismay because I was truly looking forward to it, it never moved above a 3 star read for me. Ill try to tell you why.As you can guess from the title, a blizzard strikes. But this is no run of the mill blizzard. This blizzard brings with it things that destroy families for years to come.Now this is where my problems begin and end. The setup was pretty great, I was getting into the story and enjoying getting to know the many characters who were introduced and poof!, just like that, the story flash forwards twelve years and I have to play to catch up to remember who lost who, who was involved with who, who was a bit of a jerk. And many of them have moved on, as you will, and have hooked up with others. You get the drift. It was bothersome for someone who has such a lousy memory but wait because it gets worse. The people who went missing or died begin to inhabit the bodies of living people and then my confusion is upped to a whole new level. Oh my poor tired brain.It may be my fault for listening to this as an audiobook. I dont know. People seem to love this book but for me I felt like I was playing a frustrating game of Who was that again? throughout most of the novel and I lost interest in the story and the characters as a result.In the end, it reminded me most of a middle of the road Dean Koontz novel.

They fit, they're comfy and they have not shrunk or stretched out after several turns in the washer/dryer. They do not ride up on me as others have said but I mostly wear them with jeans. My only complaint, and really who cares, is that I did not receive them in the colors pictured on the site. Mine were pink and beige. I don't see any beige in this here picture! But it's not a big deal. Undies are undies and these are decent enough for the price.

I put this up in the kitchen where I wanted a little light to shine through (no shade beneath) and it does the job. The ties can be pulled up as high or low as you like which is handy, especially in a busy kitchen. It gives a nice victorian/romantic vibe and it didn't cost me a small fortune. If it gets stained or ruined which is highly likely in my house it won't be a major tragedy.

This is the second Sky Stars and Moon fire pit I've purchased because it looks so beautiful at night. It does what it should, is easy to assemble and the first one lasted about 5  years before the legs completely corroded and broke off. I'm only giving it four stars because the black paint rusts very quickly. I've had it about a month, used it only 2x's and left it outside. It rained, as it does, and now 1/4 of it is covered in rust. I should've protected it with a coat of sealer or paint but I honestly didn't expect it to start rusting so quickly :(

Juliet and Colton were once madly in love but Colton ruined it all when he decided to diddle the dog sitter (better than the dog, I suppose!). Juliet is fuming mad and who can blame her? When the story begins this is all fresh and told from Juliets POV. Her emotions are red hot as they are driving together to drop her off at her mothers and you really get her. Her husband is a selfish dolt. Bad luck befalls them as their car is sideswiped and Juliet awakens dazed to find herself shackled to a post and things only get worse from there.  Damn, and I thought my luck was bad!The best thing about Juliet is that she is not a whiner. She acts.The narrator is pure perfection for this tale. She conveys Juliets emotions extremely well as they range from simmering rage to pain, fear and full out anger. Id recommend reading it this way, if youre a fan of audio.I was gifted a copy of this audio from the author with no expectation of a review but I review everything I read and, if you know me at all, you know this in no way changes my thoughts on the book. If it sucked, I would tell you. But this book was cringe-inducing awesomeness with just enough sarcasm and snark thrown into the dialogue and thoughts to make me a very happy reader.

Im going to keep this short and as sweet as I can because everyone seems to adore this story and, sadly, I really didnt.  Before you beat me over the head with the fact that I am a moron who is too ignorant to follow a time-travel story, I have to say that I enjoyed both Stephen Kings 11/23/63 and The Time Travelers Wife so it wasnt the time-travel bits that put me off.  Those books worked for me because of the characters. Though this story has very strong characters and it was interesting to see how much Em changes as she matures, something about them just didnt grab me enough to become emotionally invested in their story.  Im sure its a case of its me, not you and Ill leave it at that.Were I you and considering this audio I would recommend opting for the paperback instead.  Something about the narrators tone, almost bordering on monotonous here and there, made it very difficult to get through and two of the characters, friends of Marinas whose names escape me, were cringe inducing. One sounded like an insipid moron and the other sounded like some snooty old socialite with some sort of strange accent and I believe she was only 16 or so. The rest of the voices were decent but those two? Those two were truly awful. It's a good thing they only played bit parts or this would've been a DNF because the voices bothered me so much.With that said, well, there's not much more to say. Everyone else loves it but I just thought it was okay.

Somehow I ended up with an abridged copy of this audiobook. I don't like abridged because I always feel like I'm missing something super important, usually characterization, but this abridgement wasnt too bad.This story is about a psycho attempting to create a family by abducting women through open houses.  It has tones of that horrible triple abduction story in Cleveland, where the monster kept three women imprisoned for his own selfish needs for over a decade. Truly a horrible, nightmarish true-crime. But this book was written years before Castro was exposed as a rapist and kidnapper which makes reading this all the more horrifying. This version doesnt linger too much on the damage inflicted on the victims and for that I am grateful. I had enough of that after watching Lifetimes Cleveland Abduction.  I cant speak for the unabridged version, however, so beware.When teen Lindsay is abducted, her mother Kara, distraught and heartbroken, takes action. When things go from bad to even worse for Kara she doesnt dissolve into a puddle of self-pity but keeps on keeping on with the search. As admirable as that is, it felt a little unbelievable and unnatural but Ill chalk it up to the four hours that were cut from this version and give it a pass. Kara quickly ends up joining forces with a man named Patrick, a widower and brother of a friend, and I found that bit rather strange and unnatural too considering the previous turn of events which I will not ruin.It should be noted that I figured out who the killer was pretty early on. It should also be noted that I am not at all good at these things. I can only assume that it was pretty darn obvious.The narration is done by Dick Hill and Susie Breck. I liked the fact that there were two narrators but Dick Hills voices werent very distinctive and his males all sounded like the same man, except for the killer. His killer voice was over the top, bordering on silly. Still, the story was definitely creepy and it was a page-turner so Ill give it a solid 3.5 stars.

When I started The Devils Detective I knew it might be a bit of a challenge. Its been described as bleak and has also been compared to Clive Barker and though Ive always adored Barkers work, Ive always had to give him my 100% attention because his stuff is rich with description and layer upon layer of dread.Im not going to lie. This book made me work. Its filled with a despair that I just cant put into words. The author painstakingly recreates Hell as a place youd never, ever want to visit but not because there is some evil entity setting your bottom on fire. No, in this version of Hell you dont even know why youre here so theres not even a sense of I was a monster. I deserve this. You arrive with no memory, are given a job and then youre not allowed to do it properly. Talk about an exercise in frustration! Your existence is one of despair, tedium and malaise. And thats all there is.The story follows an Information Man called Fool who is dispatched to investigate the dead bodies that turn up in Hell (it is Hell and overrun with demons, after all). Fool catalogues endless crimes and murders but no one follows up on any of it until one day he runs across a body whose soul appears to have been eaten. Deliciousness! But thats weird, even in Hell, so The Powers that Be get their ears all perked up and Fool is given a mission as well as a forbidden smidge of hope that maybe, perhaps this one case will be one hell actually get to solve.The best part about this book is the imagery. The characters, if Im being honest, are rather uninteresting. Theres a female or two and theyre pretty useless creatures, whining and wailing and lamenting and carrying on. Meh, go away. I have no patience for you. A livelier Fool wouldve made this one go down easier but hes too bland for my taste. The descriptions are 100% what kept me reading but at a bit of a snails pace. I never felt an undying urge to keep going to see if he solved the mystery but keep going I did. I dont regret it though because as I said the imagery and savagery is worth the time.He raised his head, feeling something that had to be blood roll down the side of his face. He lifted a hand to it, finding a short tear just below his hairline, another wound that would scar to a keloid ridge and add to the story of his time here, a story written across his skin in the language of Hell.

4 1/2 StarsI listened to this as an unabridged audiobook read by Flinty Williams who has the most lovely, lilting English accent. I read this cold and I think it best if you do so too so this is going to be super brief.It starts off a little weird and I like weird so I was hooked. It seems that children are being overseen by military men who keep them locked in cells, removing them only for their school lessons, but only after theyve been strapped into wheelchairs. Ummm, what the hey is going on here?Im not going to tell you. But when you figure it out its rather unsettling to say the least.The dulcet tones of Flinty Williams, along with the intriguing beginning, grabbed me but it was the humanization of the characters that kept me going even when some poo hits the fan and things started to get a little too bogged down in survival action for my personal liking.This was a fantastic story with a beginning I loved and adored though I do wish more time had been spent at the school and it has excellent characterization. Youll probably hate some of em though (but whats an adventure without a few baddies? BORING, thats what!).  From the beginning, you cant help but sympathize with Miss Justineau and Melanie and they are two characters who will linger with me for a while.Theres even some fun bits of sarcastic dialogue amidst all of the fear, anxiety and fighting for their lives. And who can't use a little sarcasm in their lives?I will leave you with my favorite line.Do I have to punch you in the head again?

4 1/2 Stars  Cool to the Touch combines two things that should never, ever go together. Zombies and sex. Yeah, you read that right. Zombie sex. Sex with zombies. Not exactly the stuff of which dreams are made.How consuming is love?Would you believe me if I told you this is a sensitive and eloquently written tale of love, loss, lust and utter hopelessness? You should because its true.I quite enjoyed it. Its not all up in your face gross as most of the monster porn Ive read has a tendency to be (not that there's anything wrong with that either!). Its sexy but not super explicit. Its .99 cents for 12 pages of terrible beauty and if this author decides to write a full out erotic horror novel Ill be the first in line to one-click buy it.Read it if this is your thing. I wont judge you. Come on. You know you want to. . .

I love tea tree oil. It has natural disinfectant properties and I always add a few drops to my homemade bathroom cleaner. My teen daughter, who has very sensitive skin, swears by it to keep her skin clear. She uses a "tea tree" cleanser from Trader Joe's and dabs a bit of this (just a wee bit) on any blemish that crops up and finds it to be much less irritating than the benzoyl peroxide that I swear by. She also adds a bit to her shampoo bottle to improve scalp conditions. She used to suffer from dandruff when using chemical laden products but no longer! She makes a hair mask by mixing olive & tree tea oil and believes it makes her hair soft and less brittle. I have to believe this is true because she bleached part of her naturally black hair to blonde and I feared it'd break off or look as if she'd stuck her finger in an electrical socket but the blonde is still healthy and strong with no breakage even after she left the bleach on for nearly 90 minutes (ouch). She uses this combo at least once a week and leaves it on for an hour or so.This is a super versatile natural option and a little goes a long way so this bottle will last us a good while even though we use it often. Next up is dabbing it on the dog beds to improve the scent (not that my dogs smell or anything . . . !) and to deter fleas as someone here mentioned. I dislike putting flea repellent on their skin so I'll give this a go. Keep your fingers crossed for us, will you?*I received this product from the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.

Well, these three claims were squashed the moment I opened the box. My dreams, they have been shattered."A stylish, classic design paired with old-school durability.""Self-healing all-natural cork surface and a thick fiberboard backing.""Attractive oak-finished, 3/4"-wide, mitered-corner frame."This is a cork bulletin board that would've been perfect except for the fact that it arrived with an enormous 4" split in the board as well as the wooden frame. Not a little "self healing" crack, mind you, but a noticeable from several feet away split all the way through the "thick fiberboard backing". It looked like it put up a valiant effort after The Hulk attempted to bend it in half in a fit of rage but alas it was just not "durable" enough to endure the torture unscathed. It was not salvageable, nor usable, which is a shame. I had to return it and I very rarely return anything. I hate to think of this HUGE thing wasting space in a landfill somewhere but it would've just spent the rest of its life in my basement and I don't exactly have money to throw away. I was refunded my cash after several weeks which was a  bit of a pain but I've learned a lesson. I will buy this type of product in person and pay closer attention to customer reviews.

This is a cute container that is perfectly sized for a homemade batch of ice cream made with my Cuisinart ice cream machine. It has a cute printed design on the front which is oddly left out of the description and the picture here. It took me aback when it arrived because I thought I was buying a plain white container but it doesn't bother me. I just wish I had known what it was exactly I was buying  beforehand. The cover, as others have said, does not provide an air tight closure. Fortunately, my kids usually eat it up before it gets freezer burned but not always. Vegan ice cream using coconut cream/milk almost always gets a little freezer burn if left in the freezer more than a few days. Thus I can only rate this a four. With a better lid, it would rate a five.

4 1/2 StarsSpun is a novella, 2 hrs 47 mins (or 140 pgs), and is a spin-off of a previous book called Spin. I havent read Spin yet (but plan to now) and had no problem following this story. I wish all attached stories could manage to do this.Amber is a former child star struggling to get her life together. She is the classic tale of child star turned wastrel. She fell in love with a bad boy, has been in and out of rehab for drug and alcohol addiction, has a strained relationship with her parents, ruined all but the lamest of career opportunities with her on-set bad behavior and instability and is now hounded by the paparazzi who want nothing more than to see her continued downfall.Amber has made a complete mess of her life and she knows it. She doesnt deny it, she doesnt get all poor me and she doesnt lay the blame on any one but herself. Shes trying to do whats right even though its probably the most difficult thing shes ever faced. This is why I liked Amber right away. She has managed to stay sober for two years and has avoided the former love of her life for over six months because he is her kryptonite. But then shes dealt a devastating blow to the heart, forced to face betrayal after betrayal and has a family who doesnt have any faith that she is actually sober. This story is about the roughest patch of Ambers young life.Amber is never unlikable, shes just a mess. At this point in her life, shes vulnerable and facing so many betrayals that you hope shes able to come out of it with her sobriety and her sanity intact. I really felt for her, even teared up once or twice, if you can believe that. Told from Ambers POV you see the entire devastating mess from Ambers POV and you really feel her pain. She even managed to maintain a self-deprecating sense of humor about herself and her life that always kept the book from being completely dreary as Amber struggles to deal with becoming a stable adult.I enjoyed this story and the breezy (but not immature) writing style. If youre into audiobooks and this sort of dramatic story, this is a great choice. The narrator drew me in and kept me. Her voice sounds world weary but still young enough and I never felt jolted or lost when other characters spoke.

This is a very basic body wash offered at a very decent price. It's thicker than most inexpensive body washes which is good BUT the cap isn't so great. My hands are kind of weak from years of typing and you have to really squeeze this sucker to get the product out. Not good. It also has a noticeably "unnatural" scent. This is why I can't rate it any higher than a three. It works fine, lathers up well, and gets you clean but its claims of being "natural" have me giving them the stink eye. It smells almost perfumey and not all like either carrots or melon or anything found outside of a lab so I will not be purchasing this again.

I bought this for my son who hung it on his ceiling.  I thought he was strange when he told me his plans but this, along with several other tapestries, and some mood lighting, have really changed the atmosphere of his room from stark and blah to calm and soothing. It's almost like stepping into another world. This particular tapestry is light weight, like most, and best for use as a wall hanging or thrown over your comforter for decoration but not as a replacement FOR your comforter. You'll be mighty cold on winter nights if you're  relying on this to keep you warm at night!  It would work as a unique table cloth too, I suppose, but I don't use those because the less laundry the better and my kids and cats are slobs. Thusly we have not washed this so I am unsure how well the color would hold up.

I burn through a lot of headphones because I have an evil cat who loves nothing more than to speedily chew through them If I'm dumb enough to leave them out for 30 seconds. So I refuse to spend too much money on them as he always manages to know when I've left them unsupervised. I've tried a bunch, I'm sad to say, but these aren't so great. They do the job well enough if you're walking around but if you attempt to run they slip out and that's a major pain. They also don't block out sound as well as some in this price range. The sound quality is average as well so I doubt I'll be buying these again when the inevitable happens.

The Ravenna cover will fit a square fire pit smoothly.  Just make sure the measurements are okay.  It is a sold grey cover with  little band of lighter gray stitching.  It is made of a tough durable material, that is sturdy enough to withstand the elements.  There are plastic fasteners to fit around the bottom legs of the pit but what is best about the fit are the cords at the bottom which can be tightened. There are also side flaps that allow air flow to keep mildew from growing.  It is easy to take one and off. Overall a nice secure cover but wish it came in a a different color, not that charmed with the gray look or the other brown shade offered.

I have lost several sunglasses in the past so I wanted a retainer to prevent the loss of my new Ray Bans. They have a thick frame tip though and many rope retainers would not fit over the ends.  The Chums worked beautifully.  I is a nice tight fit and it is secure.  No more concern about losing my sunglasses!

I was really hoping that the Healthful Home and Mold Bactria Cleaner would clean the mold in my bathroom. It didn't, not even a little. I don't like using bleaches but it looks like that has been the only agent that does the job.  This didn't.

Be aware, these are very small figures.  They have a nice golden color and are connected.  I like them. They have a pretty sheen and are small enough you can attach them to a key ring.  Just don't expect something bigger than what would comfortably fit onto your key chain.

This necklace and chain has a pretty rose gold shade. The pendant is beautiful with silver and gold and the filigree is lovely.  It is a nice size pendant.  I am not overly fond of the chain though.  It is shorter than I would like for this pendant, it needs a longer chain since this pendant is bigger.  Also the chain links are small too which would be better for a smaller pendant.  Overall I love the pendent but not the chain.

I have tried various "scrunch" sprays in the past.  Many just did not do a good job of scrunching and producing those beachy waves. I found Suave Sea Mineral Spray to be a great scrunch spray.  This gave my hair a wavy look and all I did was apply it generously to my wet hair and scrunch my hair with my fingers.  I did not even dry it with a diffused blow dryer.  When my hair dried, it had a nice wavy look.  This product is great to take to the beach or if you are in a hurry and want to have a wavy look without using a blow dryer.  Holds up in humid conditions too and nice fragrance.

These dangle earrings are really eye catching.  They are heavier, but not so heavy that they drag down my earlobe.  The filigree is delicate yet strong. They also are easy to put in and they stay secure.  Also very nice, is they are great for sensitive skin, I had no problems at all with them. I received several compliments when I wore them.

My shoulder length hair tends to be flat at the roots, especially in humid weather.  I hoped the Tresemme Root lifting cream would remedy that.  I t gave it a little more body but not a significant amount.  This product feels different than any gel or mousse.  It is much thicker and a little sticky.  You don't need much.  You rub it between your palms then start at the root and work your way around your scalp, concentrating on the roots.  I blew  dry my hair and noticed some extra body, although my hair was not as soft as when I use a gel.  The body did not last that long once I went out in humid weather, it certainly did not last all day.  This gives a bit of extra lift but I still needed some hairspray to keep body at the root.

So often when protagonists dislike each other, it is unbelievable that they would ever fall in love.  I personally have never met anyone who se hatred toward someone turned into love.  Sophie Jordan makes the I-dont-like-you-but want-you trope work because she explains why the leads fell out of like with each other and then she shows the reader how they fell back into like and love.Lady Aurelia is daring, too daring for a proper miss (this is the one aspect of her personality that goes a little too far for the time period, her escapades.)  She has no suitors and at first seems to be content to live with her brother and his wife in London.  Her main release from doldrums is to draw caricatures of the ton and leave them in opportune places to be discovered.Her family does not know of her drawings but Max, Viscount Camden, her brothers best friend does. Max and Aurelia are oil and water, they bicker constantly.  Neither one can hold their tongue and they lash out at each other, vitriol masks their desire for each other.  Both feel justified for their feelings but they dont really have insight into the others feelings.  Max has been hurt terribly by the death of his parents and Aurelia feels misunderstood and her art is not appreciated.This couple is explosive in almost every way.  They fight with passion and they love with passion.  The tension between them is palpable and the reader knows that they are sticks of dynamite ready to explode.  Nothing is done halfway.  In spite of their outward rantings about each other, their inner musings are more thoughtful and considerate.  The ending is a bit rushed and I wish this couple had shared more about their pasts.  Overall though a very entertaining read.

I am not usually a big fan of modern day romances.  They seem rushed (the couple is in an intimate relationship way too fast) and they lack the tension I usually find in historical novels.  The Hotter You Burn fortunately takes it time developing characters without losing the fine tension between the leads.  This is a wonderful story.Harlow was the mean girl in junior high and high school.  Hurt people hurt others and Harlow lived this out.  She has a reputation as a troublemaker, boyfriend stealer and all around bad girl.  She is older now in her mid twenties and wanting to make some changes in her life.  Some are forced upon her, like being evicted from her home in her small Oklahoma town.Residing in her home are three hunks who are as close as brothers.  The one she is most attracted to is Beck, a love-em-and-leave-em man.  Beck is as complex as Harlow, having grown up in the foster care system, he has some commitment issues.Beck is attracted to Harlow but she is elusive and he finds himself wanting to help her.  He actually develops feelings for her quickly and it shocks him.  He is protective and possessive but he hates change and he feels that Harlow will flip his world upside down.  He is right.I loved Harlow; she is a spunky woman trying to turn over a new leaf.  I found her admirable in so many ways.  She doesnt make excuses for past actions, just determined to become a better person through kind acts.  She wants a stable relationship, totally understandable in light of her unstable past.  She is insightful and understanding and so wants to establish real friendships.Beck is so torn, he vacillates between wanting Harlow for himself and trying to be nobly minded and let her find happily ever after with someone better.  Beck feels he is just too flawed but he doesnt see that Harlow accepts him because she is flawed too and together they can have a flawed messy loving forever.The dialogue in this novel is superb.  Showalter has a natural ear for writing funny little quips and deep feelings.  I adored the leads but not everyone else in this novel.  Jessie Kay the new friend was a bit too much, too opinionated, too just about everything.  I think she has her own novel coming up and I am not interested in her story.  There are other secondary characters who have a better personalities.  This tale is about Beck and Harlow a worthy couple who find love in spite of their wounded souls.  Together they create a loving cocoon that ultimately mends their broken hearts.
One out of five of the RJ11 connectors didn't work out of package, but the rest is working fine to extend/connect my phone lines.
Inexpensive and does its job. I have gazillion wireless phones, but you definitely want to have at least one corded phone around and this long cord comes in handy.

This is a very nice mouse at good value. The scrolling and clicking actions are quieter and smoother than several Logitech mouses I already own. The battery is definitely lasting longer than Logitech's since I've got mine over 4 months ago and it's still going strong. The mouse feels comfortable on my hand, and it is about the same size as Logitech M305 (which broke on me). I've just ordered another one since I like it so much, and I'm tired of replacing batteries on my Logitech M510.

I wasn't sure what to expect but the product is exactly what I wanted - plain dried squid, with a bit of sweetness (not more than the usual for shredded).  This is much better in price and taste than what I'm able to find locally at an oriental grocer. I can't stand the sweet/spicy ones that's prevalent and just wanted plain shredded squid that I can make into Korean side dishes as well. This fits the bill.

I bought this two months ago for my husband battling pityrosporum folliculitis caused after courses of prednisone and antibiotics. I researched and bought a lot of products at the time, but my husband didn't feel safe about using colloidal silver. Using oil of oregano and turmeric along with good diet helped to manage his condition and we didn't want to try too many products at once and not figure out which was effective. Husband's PF is not cured and occasionally still flare up but he is still reluctant even after I assured him he wouldn't turn blue (argyria) using the nano-sized silver particle solution.In the meantime, my dog recently developed ear yeast infection, and using Zymox ear cleanser didn't help alleviate the problem with her increasingly itchy and shaking head. While I was waiting for an order of Zymox OTIC for her to arrive (and ultimately vet visit), I thought why not try the unopened bottle of Sovereign Silver? The dog wouldn't care if her skin turned blue. After a quick research that this is safe, I put a dropper full into each of her ear, and massaged the base of the canals and then removed excess. She shook her head once immediately after, and that was it! I did that yesterday morning, and one application of the silver solution miraculously stopped all her symptoms of itching and shaking head. She slept soundly through last night and didn't wake us up as she did for few days. I wasn't entirely sure of the efficacy of colloidal silver, but this is remarkable and I'm sold at least on topical application. Once my husband has to stop his course of oil of oregano (hard on liver), he just may try the colloidal silver after seeing how effective it was on our dog.

1:03 MinsThis is one of the most life changing devices I've ever purchased, so I've decided to post a video review. Our high-strung stubborn Siamese mix cat Coco started doing misdeeds in the house after I attempted to toilet train him with CitiKitty toilet trainer. Initially the training went well, but once the toilet bowl hole got much larger, Coco decided he wasn't going to have any of it, possibly due to water splash sound. Even after I conceded and gave his litter box back, he decided that sinks, baths, and anywhere other than his litter box were better places to pee/defecate in. This was greatly disturbing and my husband and I've tried everything possible to deter him from urinating around the house, especially bathroom tubs & sinks.We were feeling pretty hopeless when my desperate research found the PetSafe cat barrier. I've actually once tried a dog shock collar (Innotek Contain & Train) on Coco when we were trying to prevent him from entering an unsafe loft area, but the dog collar didn't even make him flinch at the highest shock setting for an unknown reason. Our expectations were low, yet we still had to at least try something else. We've already tried ScatMats (own 3), motion detection sprays/alarms (we got sprayed more...), physical barriers, gazillion other litters and boxes, etc. so why not just one more?  Coco is a very intelligent, active, and predatory indoor cat, and although we love him dearly we just couldn't continue to deal with him urinating wherever he pleased and the problem was getting worse with him defecating in our kitchen and guest beds (when the guests would leave doors open). Either he was going to be locked up in confinement or else...The posted video was taken on 11/2014, and I wanted to wait before writing a review to see how the system performed in the long run. After the first shock on the video, Coco hid under a coffee table for 3 hours and then he didn't approach the kitchen area for weeks. The beeping sound was his devil and he scurried back the other way with just that one correction on the video. My husband and I were ecstatic and bought total of 3 PIRF-100 transmitters for our open concept home.  We noticed that he started testing his boundaries and knew exactly where he was allowed and not, and after 3 months he found himself in the kitchen yet again when the battery finally drained. Coco is no longer scared of the beeping sound as he has figured out that he only gets zapped when the beeping intervals get faster. It's important to make sure that a cat can't make a quick dash through a shallow signal range for a tempting reward on the other side. I saw him doing this once, and we adjusted the transmitter location to end the behavior.I love the RFA-188 battery and it lasts 3 months pretty much on the dot with Coco constantly testing his boundaries, and he is the most vigilant cat you can imagine. I've only seen him get shocked twice, so I don't know how long the battery would last on cats that don't make proper association and get shocked more often. Rechargeable batteries lose hold power and drain rather quickly (weeks at max), so I love not having to worry for months and I have the batteries automatically delivered through subscribe and save. The battery seems pricey for what it is, but I'd rather have a functional collar for many years than having to replace a degrading rechargeable collar in few short years (as with my dog collars). After 10 months of use, Coco has been a very well behaved loving cat after he got banned from kitchen, bathrooms, and guest bedrooms after we took away his options to make mistakes. Here are some observations and tips:* The transmitter signal works through walls. Proper placement is necessary to avoid undesired correction, but it can allow you to protect multiple rooms in range with just one transmitter.* I do wish the transmitter was smaller as I was surprised it was unexpectedly large at about 9 " in diameter. However, I like the fact that you can adjust the signal range through the adjustment dial, and capable of larger perimeter than my other dog's smaller indoor barrier transmitter without adjustment option. The transmitter uses about 5 watts of power on full signal measured through an electricity usage monitor. It is definitely noticeable, as people always ask "what's this?" but you can opt to hide it in a cabinet, etc.* Precise delimiter with visual association aids in training - place the transmitter so that a cat can associate the visual boundary along with the beeping sound at least initially. You should test walking around with the collar in your hand so that it'll beep as soon as a cat enters a room, etc. Coco had no problem figuring out his precise boundaries without visual cues later on, but he is a very quick learner. You can use the flag training method described in the manual, or use chalk lines, ropes, door entries, etc. for appropriate training based on your cat's temperament.* Coco has a very high pain threshold. He has had two cancer surgeries (cured) since we've rescued him and having experienced stomatitis & Bartonella left him quite pain tolerant. He wrestles and tumbles around with dogs and takes dog bites, brush off, and asks for more action. After seeing Coco's response to the shock, I simply cannot imagine any cat that wouldn't respond as long as the static correction level is set properly and the prongs make proper contact with the skin. I did trim his fur near the prong contact, but tried that  once on the first day after only reading the "Indoor Radio Fence" manual (with dog pic on the front) that comes packed with the transmitter, which is obviously also used for dogs and failed to mention anything about adjusting collar correction level other than checking batteries. I later found the instruction for adjusting the static correction level in a separate manual that was hidden/sandwiched in the hard-to-open plastic clamshell cat collar packaging. PetSafe needs to do a better job at incorporating manuals rather than including inadequate generic instructions for separate system parts that can frustrate people. Upon discovering the instruction, I prematurely raised the correction to max level 5 (level 1-5) for "High Energy" cat only because I was just about to return the product in defeat, and assumed the max level would still be too weak for Coco. I was wrong...* I was initially concerned with the possibility of Pressure Necrosis on his neck with constant collar prong contact, but so far there had been no problem with him wearing it 24x7 for over 10 months. I still do examine him often to ensure safety, and learned that his favorite thing in the world now is when I scratch or brush under his collar. This activity actually ended up increasing our bond and he seeks contact more often and purrs louder than he ever did.* Amazon doesn't always have the best price, so be sure you google search for PIRF-300C for the lowest price. Got mine through RadioFence with coupon at significant discount.I wish I had this device a long time ago. Some people may feel that shock collars are cruel, but misbehaving defiant pets could easily face much worse fate when owners give up. I've had subservient cats that behave with simple verbal corrections, but Coco and most cats are definitely not one of the few. I am extremely grateful how effective this device had been and it practically changed our lives. Coco doesn't have to get locked up when guests visit, and we no longer worry about leaving doors open accidentally whether to keep rooms sanitary or to keep him and other animals safe. We knew there had to be answers to our prayers to keep our beloved pet around with as much freedom for as long as we could. I hope the device would work as successfully for other pet lovers dismayed in similar conundrum.

If you own nonstick pans, you must absolutely get these.  I've been using ceramic nonstick pans for healthier cooking and it's been amazingly frustrating cleaning the stuck/burnt food off the white nonstick surface.  I've been using many other non scratching dish washing scrubbing sponges, and no matter how hard I scrubbed the burnt food mark remained on the pans. When I resorted to using Mr. Clean Magic Eraser, the burnt marks came off like magic, but so did the nonstick quality of the pans, ruining the pans.  I tried these after I replaced my ruined nonstick set, and OMG these are simply amazing!  The scourer doesn't scratch the surface, but the baked/burnt food came off without much effort! I couldn't believe what I was seeing so I tried with my old sponge on a burnt mart, and not much happened although I scrubbed as hard as I could. Tried the same mark with this cloth again, and the burnt mark came off without effort! This just blew my mind and I ended up immediately buying more and started gifting to family/friends. Just be aware that you'll probably receive products branded and packaged by different Korean companies, like my photo shows. I've been using a yellow one for about a month now and it's still going strong. My other sponges retained water and smelled like mildew no matter how much I cleaned and squeezed, but these are porous mesh and dry very easily with no funky smell. The cloth also makes it so much easier to remove dried food off plates before adding to dishwashers. I just can't recommend this product enough!!!  10 stars!

This is by far the best cleanser you can buy at drug stores. I've been using CeraVe for many years and I've never stuck to a cleanser for as long in my many decades (eh-hem) of living. I used to buy expensive brand cleansers and still do experiment once in a while, but I always come back to CeraVe for my oily and now aging combo skin. This cleanser is much more costly at retail stores, so Amazon's is definitely the way to go especially if you purchase through subscribe&save as I do. My husband has normal skin in his 50s and he also enjoys using CeraVe. This cleanser is gentle but it also cleans thoroughly. Be gentle with your skin. The more you scrub and aggravate it with drying agents and peels, the more sebum it'll produce to balance it out. What you eat also matters greatly, and healthy diet definitely contributes to healthier skin. Do NOT believe the scientific studies that say otherwise - for many decades the studies insisted there was no relationship and only recently the status had changed to unclear and under debate. My skin was most troubled and oiliest when I was using ton of products that supposedly help. The worst breakout I experienced was when I was eating fries and cheese almost everyday for lunch, and all that problem went away when I started eating healthier with limited sugar, which improved liver functions and ultimately better immune response. Although there are other factors such as hormonal, and body chemistry differences, the least you can do is to be kind to your body for best chance of healing. Although most people assume I'm decades younger than my age, I wish I had started exercising and eating healthier even earlier. It's not too late for you!

This is a good pair of multi-function scissors. I bought two sets of scissors by different brands at the same time, and initially hated the one made by More Cuisine since it arrived damaged and the scissors would not meet correctly for cutting. I contacted the seller G&G MKTG GR, and received a stellar service in receiving a replacement right away. Now the two brands perform (the other more well-known) exactly same and look almost identical except for the color. More Cuisine's is made with 100% pure silicone that's specified dishwasher-safe, while the other brand notes hand washing is recommended.  For some reason, the item didn't come with any instructions so here are the parts explanations. The scissors come apart for thorough cleaning when fully open near 90 degrees. I'm calling it part A for the scissor with the smaller hole, and B for the larger hole scissor side.1. Nut Cracker - between the handles2. Bottle opener - on top of A's handle3. Screw driver - on top of B's handle.  Useful for pry opening metal cans, lifting lids, etc.4. Bone cutter -  the blade indentation/notch on A's blade allows to cut small bones or wires without dulling blade5. Slicer -  A's blade. Not sharp enough for peeling apples or use as a paring knife, but ok for slicing lemons, open Amazon boxes, etc.6. Fish scaler - back of the blade on A. You probably won't use unless you buy whole fish.7. Peeler - the long hole on B blade. Useful for stripping herbs, such as cilantro, rosemary, etc. I found I can completely remove tendons off chicken breast tenders by pulling the tendon through the hole.8. Magnetic holder - this one is obvious. I have it attached to my magnetic dry erase board since it won't stick to brushed stainless refrige of mine. This is a nice bonus since it helps me to find the scissors...as long as I put it back.Kitchen shears are indispensable item in my kitchen. I use them to trim off chicken fats, tendons (especially those pesky ones on chicken breast tenders), cut open packages, and you simply can't have enough scissors around home, period. It's nice to have a pair that come with extra functions as bonus. You should be mindful handling these because one side will drop and possibly mar the floor if you only hold only one handle and allow them to open up - I know, because I've dropped it twice already...

I've been avoiding pre-diabetes for a long time and resorted to mostly avoiding carbs. However, I ended up looking very gaunt on my face due to my ketogenic diet and had to resort to adding some slow digesting carbs and beans. The steel cut oats are great for adding carbs to my diet since they have low glycemic index (42 versus 66 in instant oatmeals) to avoid blood sugar spikes. I love that they're much nuttier and chewier than instant oats, and they're very tasty with just adding cinnamon powders (reduces blood sugar) and fruits/berries along with a bit of coconut butter for healthy breakfast. I cook them in my rice cooker and the oats are cooked perfect and kept warm for whenever I want a quick meal.

I have a bunch of beautiful stainless steel steak knives that came as part of my flatware set, but my husband tried it once and never used them again. Although they work for cutting steaks, they're just not nearly as sharp as other [ugly] steak knives we always ended up using. I bought these all stainless Henckels knives and both my husband and I are very impressed with how sharp and functional they are while beautiful. Now my husband chooses to use these for setting up steak dinner table, and that speaks a volume.

This was my first grown hen feeder and I initially thought it functioned fine not knowing any better, but I quickly realized I needed a lid/cover to prevent water from wetting the feed through the top. Although the feeder was hung under a tarp on a run, windy rain often entered from sides of the run to spoil the feed. I then bought a larger Little Giant feeder (with my hand-made plastic bowl lid) and noticed it had curved-in lip on the base rim that noticeably reduced feed spillage in comparison to Harris Farms'. I now only use Harris Farms feeder as an occasional extra when I'm on travel, since the 1 1/4" shallow base without rim lip contributes to too much feed spillage compared to my other feeders.

The metal feeder is sturdy and my chickens like the wide feeding base with 2 5/8" rim clearance. I like the 2 1/4" base depth which is one full inch deeper than my older feeder, so it'll help with less spilled feed.  I couldn't find a lidded feeder of this quality at my local farmers coops or other feed/supply stores, so I'm very happy with the received product.

My HP Pavilion Slimiline s5280t PC was found dead one morning, and I was able to determine the problem was its toast power supply with burnt smell. Ordered this reasonably priced part and received the item quicker than anticipated - Kudos to the seller. Replacing the part was easy (I've never done this before and there were no instruction) as I've replaced cable connections one by one, and simply did not use extra cables/connections that came with the part that my original part didn't have. I felt proud when the computer turned on and I was able to resurrect the dead PC all by myself, but then noticed that the fan noise is a LOT louder than my original HP part. The part's fan runs as if the CPU is on 100% full usage while the PC is over 98 percent idle. I decided then it was time for me to do a thorough backup and look for a replacement PC for my 6 yr old PC.  The part allowed me to salvage my data, which I'm grateful for, but I can't have my office sounding like an IT server room indefinitely. Order this part if you're willing to deal with noticeably louder fan noise.

This is the best shelf instant udon noodle soup I've tried. I've had similar tasting store-bought udon noodles in the past, but they were found in the refrigerator section of asian grocery stores. I received the order on May 30, 2015 and they're labeled good until 02/23/2016, so I assume these have about 1 year shelf life without requiring refrigeration. I've purchased 6 for $15.99 so the noodles were definitely worth the cost at 2.67 dollars each for satisfying my cravings for real restaurant udon noodles, or even better than some mediocre restaurant udons. The dried flakes were very mushy when I followed the printed instructions, so I'd recommend that you add the flakes after microwaving.Update 8/2015: I've tried Nong Shim's Fresh Udon Noodles today and it was nowhere near as good as JFC's. Nong Shim's broth is primarily soy saucey with a bit of sweetness and it lacked the complex umami flavor of JFC's. Although JFC still uses MSG, it's the way to go if you want to satisfy your cravings for a real udon noodle soup in a pinch.

I've had the original Cling-A-Wing feeder for years and I enjoyed having it attract chickadees, golden finches, titmouse, and even occasional cardinals while deterring sparrows and other larger birds from emptying the seeds. Over the years, the clear plastic turned color to yellowish cast, and it unfortunately fell off the two story window to its demise. I've always felt the refill was tough because of its small opening, but decided to order another set. When I received the set of 3 feeders, I was surprised to see the new design with a frosted plastic cap on refill opening rather than the rotating clear plastic layer, and the refill opening still remained too small. Typical funnels won't help as the seed mass gets blocked easily and you'll need to find one large enough to match the diameter of the opening, or end up using a home-made paper funnel as I did. However, I began to hate it after a few refills, after the plastic cap weathered lightly on a east-facing window and got almost impossible to take off. I'm pretty fit and strong but I have to struggle to pull on at least 3 corners to to take off the unattractive cap to refill the seeds. Because of the difficulty, I now rarely refill the feeder and have 2 additional spares that I no longer use. Duncraft messed up on the newer design and I hope they go back to older design or at least make it easier to refill in the future.

I had a very low expectation for this order, but I needed a crate that I could transport easier than my large metal crate. I remained ambivalent even after receiving the product thinking that if my dog really wanted to, she'd rip through the cloth cage in seconds. I have been crate/potty training my recently rescued adult dog that I've known for about a month. After assembling the soft crate, I put a few treats inside and had her go in to get the treats. I closed the front mesh door zipper after a few times of treating/praising, and I gently corrected her when I saw the 50 lbs dog trying to push through the mesh with her snout. When she quit, I opened the zipper and praised her, and repeated this a few times. The order was received just a day before our planned trip, so I didn't have much time to reinforce her to get used to the new crate. I highly recommend that you measure the inside dimension of your car to make sure that you can fit the crate in it before ordering. Most large soft crates sold were too tall to fit in my SUV's cargo area, so I chose this product at 25" height although my dog's sitting posture height is at 30" to the top of the head, 24" to the withers and 35" long to her hip. She is still able to enter, turnaround, and lounge easily. I did not trust the crate for 4 hours long road trip so I had the dog buckled in next to me for the drive while my husband drove, but the real test came during the overnight stay at my husband's parents' house. I used the crate just as the metal crate back at home for her to sleep in at night, but she had to stay in a separate room (due to a family member's allergy) away from where we slept. To my surprise, she stayed in the crate without any incident and properly went to potty outside as soon as she was released in the morning. I was so proud of her for accepting the routine, fell in love with the crate then, and I was very happy that I took the chance at the low priced lightweight crate. I believe it is important that your dog is somewhat crate trained before attempting a soft crate, and I wouldn't yet trust the crate for daytime confinement when she's excited. I still use the larger metal crate in our bedroom but left this soft crate out in another room where I tend to stay, and she prefers to her nap in it as seen on the photo. I use a lightly padded fleece mat I previously found at Walmart for less than twenty dollars that happened to fit well, which adds to comfort and cleanup. I will have no concern the next time we travel or stay over at a hotel/friend's place, since she has accepted the crate as her den and part of her daily routine. At only fifty dollars, this was such a bargain!

I decided to give this safety belt a try for under five dollars but I must admit that I was very concerned that it'd get stuck on my car as some of the posters reported. I have two Lexus hybrids (suv and CT) and I had no trouble with it latching or releasing on the seat buckles. It worked beautifully through a long trip, and I was able to to readily adjust the length of the tether whether I wanted to allow for sitting, standing, or keep my 50 lbs dog in down position. I was also able to use it as a short leash as soon as I got the dog off the car, so I'm very glad that I took the chance in this unique item that I couldn't find elsewhere. btw, you MUST use a harness on your dog along with this seat-belt and never use it on neck collar.

0:04 Mins I have recently rescued a 50 lbs 2 yr old dog, so cleaning up the human sized landmines off my backyard became a necessity. She was not potty trained (now she is after a few weeks of basics) so it is imperative that I have a walkable area for her to foul the same grass range even through low visibility at night. The video shows my cleanup operation seconds after her rear evacuation. The ease of use is displayed. Viewer discretion advised, especially during meals.

This is a very well designed hummingbird feeder at great value. I purchased the feeder for less than nine dollars and it comes with its own ant moat and a hanger.  Maintaining the feeder is very easy with the wide mouth design and detachable firm lock-in base. The size is perfect since I have many feeders hanging on all sides of my house and I like to rotate out stale fermented nectar every 3-5 days depending on weather. This isn't the prettiest feeder of my over 2 dozens hummingbird feeders, but it is one of the most often used for the ease of maintenance.

I decided to try this feeder a year ago because it was less than ten dollars and it looked cute although I read many negative reviews of the bottom falling out. Well mine has not fallen out and hummer love it. I was pleasantly surprised with the little window hanger the feeder comes with. I am able use the hanger with my other small feeders and if you purchase a decent quality window hanger separately, you'll tend to spend in the upwards of $10, so it was like getting the cute feeder very inexpensively. The design allows for you to attach an ant moat if needed, and the feeder is easy to clean and refill. I tend to fill the feeder only half way since I like to rotate out stale fermented nectar every 3-5 days, so I'd advise you to do the same. I'd probably purchase another one just for the sake of having another window hanger plus the backup feeder, but I have too many hummingbird feeders already...

I have most of my hummingbird feeders on the windows of my house so I gave this window feeder a try while it was around ten dollars. Hummingbirds like the feeder and found it instantly. However, there's no way for me to add an ant moat to the feeder, and ants found the feeder on my second story sun room window within few days. The base does not come apart for ease of cleaning, so you'll need to soak it with vinegar to occasionally clean out black molds since there's no way for you to reach all the nooks and cranny with your fingers or brush. I have it attached to east facing window (no harsh afternoon sun), and I've been careful with the back plastic clips (which are known to be fragile) and the feeder is still functional after a year, but if you have ants around your yard, I'd look elsewhere for other window feeders. I still use it because hummingbirds seem to prefer it, but I have to keep rotating on different windows to deter ant trails, .

This a beautiful and functional hummingbird feeder. I have other beautiful glass bottle feeders but they're not easy to clean nor refill, so I tend to not use them. Someone has thought through the design of this feeder to allow for easy cleaning and refill with the wide mouth design without extreme curvature inside the bottle. If you're as crazy as I with the little flying jewels, and refill and clean your feeder as often as I do, you tend to care for the ease of maintenance.

This is no doubt a very beautiful hummingbird feeder and I love that it has a classic antique look. I have over 2 dozen hummingbird feeders and this is the most beautiful of them all, but it is also the least used. I now occasionally use it for decorative purpose on my front porch, but the feeder is not the easiest to fill nor clean. The bottle mouth is too small for reliable filling without a funnel, and the extreme curvature inside the bottle makes it difficult to clean well with my brush tool. In addition, I've gotten a deep cut on my index finger from cleaning the underside of the metal base that has the feeding ports. There's razor sharp metal ridge where the bottle mouth meets the base, so please be careful while cleaning or you'll end up with a painful cut on your finger tip that tends to heal very slow. If not for the ease of maintenance, I would've given this feeder as presents for many of my friends and relatives. Hummers are drawn to the bottle, and they often perch on the edge of the metal base rim although the feeder lacks visible perch. I own another red glass bottle feeder "More Birds 60 Classic Brands Red Vintage Hummingbird feeder" and I tend to use that feeder more often (albeit less beautiful but that could be subjective) for the ease of maintenance.

I got this after struggling with a PetsMart clicker that could only be pressed in one way (and I kept pressing the other end, missing queue), and only if you don't have long nails. The button style is the way to go, and the wrist strap makes it very easy to have it available at all time. When washing dishes, I raise the band up to my arm and it's a great alternative to not having to wear a clicker around my neck. I recommend these highly.

My Siamese is the world's most finicky cat. He won't touch any cat treats, canned food (gosh, I've tried soooo many), no meat/fish...nothing except some occasional properly cooked egg yolk (more of a weekend ritual for him). Before Purina Beyond, the only food he'd touch was Blue Buffalo (I used to think BB was the cat crack that ruined treats), but switching to Purina Beyond was surprisingly easy and the grain free food fixed the itchy skin problem. The only downside is that now I have to portion control him because he started gaining weight. I am so happy that Purina decided to offer higher quality grain free food at reasonable price that people can find easily locally. Please keep up the good work!

I've been feeding my dogs Purina Beyond Grain Free dog food and all of their skin allergy/itching and intermittent vomiting while on Blue Buffalo disappeared. I was very happy that Purina Beyond Grain Free was loved by my dogs and was less expensive than Blue Buffalo (they hated other premium dog foods, and I've sampled a lot), but ordered this to try after noticing that this grain free food is even less expensive per pound than Purina Beyond while rated higher on dogfoodadvisor site. I opened the received bag to have my finicky dogs sample some, and they went bonkers for it! Now they're turning their nose up at Purina Beyond and I'm having a hard time having them finish the remaining bag. I'm leaving this review prematurely because I've noticed some recent reviews noting that some recent batches are bad, but my bag received on June 26/2015 seems fine. I'm using the TOTW as training treats for now until the other food is gone. I'll update if I notice any difference, but Grain Free seems to be the way to go for us (I'm gluten-sensitive) and for our pets.

Just bought this today at a local grocery stores on sale for $6.99 for 10 oz and my two dogs absolutely love it!Individual treat pieces are about 3 inches long and they're soft enough for me to easily break them up into smaller pieces.My dogs are finicky and they turn up their noses on many training treats and hard to get them motivated, so I'm going to get more of these while on sale and cut them into 1/4 pieces to use them as training treats. The treats smell amazing like smoked/grilled teriyaki steaks, and made my mouth water. I envy my dogs...

This is a seriously overpriced item. I bought this to install it on a larger french mistress box, but the product really should cost no more than 5-8 bucks for what it is. You will need to drill about a 1/2" hole on your box to properly install the plate so that the tripod mount side is completely flush with the tripod plate for stability.
