I have been growing out my eyebrows for a few years now and they have finally taken to their natural shape, but I still have some areas (namely the front ends of my eyebrows) that are more sparse than others. I looked into Latisse to see if their product could help with my eyebrows' hair growth, but its price quickly turned me off. I came across this product - although it is advertised as an eyelash growth product, I found that it works just as well in accelerating hair growth on my eyebrows.It took a while to begin seeing results (at least 3-4 weeks) due to the time it takes for the follicles to stimulate hair growth, but after a month passed, I began noticing significant results. Whereas I previously had to draw and fill in the sparse areas of my eyebrows, those same areas began growing out hairs that would have taken multiple months to do before. For the past few days, I have not felt the need to draw them in, something I have done for years now. Instead, there are enough hairs for it to look natural enough if I just dust some light brown eyeshadow on top for added color and depth. I really hope that this new pattern of increased hair growth continues since my eyebrows are looking fuller and are starting to take on a much more natural appearance than they have before.This particular serum is great because it is much more affordable than Latisse and extensions. It is also incredibly easy to use - the pointed brush operators similarly to liquid eyeliner and allows me to apply it to more specific and localized areas rather than messily heaping it on everywhere. Additionally, I have very sensitive skin that often gets irritated or dried out by new or unfamiliar products, but have not experienced any irritation from this serum. My only critique is that it will take several weeks before seeing results, and some people may not have the patience for that. However, patience pays off with this particular product since I have personally gotten great results (fuller, thicker eyebrow hairs resulting in a more natural-looking appearance) from daily and consistent application over 3-4 weeks.I received a sample of this product for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

Great product that stands out in both quality and design. It was much easier to install than I expected it to be and was up and running within minutes of taking it out of the box. Very convenient to use and a must-have for bike enthusiasts as it is a well-designed and high-quality product. This light is perfect for bike riders who are looking for an affordable, easy-to-use product that can increase their safety by helping to make them more conspicuous to drivers and pedestrians.There are many bike lights on the market, but the stand out features of this product in comparison to its competitors would be the fact that it is 1) LED, 2) rechargeable, and 3) versatile. I have used bike lights that depended on batteries and therefore were pricey and inconvenient to use, but the fact that this one is rechargeable via USB makes it a winner. I typically charge the light after about 8-10 of my daily rides with my pups, and it usually takes approximately only a couple of hours to fully charge using my iPhone's USB adapter. The LED feature allows the light to be very bright when it is on its highest setting, and I appreciate that I can choose to put it on high, low, or strobe mode. I read that the strobe mode allots for 50 hours of run time, so I sometimes change to that setting when I am too lazy to recharge. Otherwise, the high setting allows for about nine 20-minute rides before having to be charged, which is perfect for my needs. Overall, I would definitely recommend this bike light as it performs well and is overall an excellent product.Sample provided by Blitzu for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

The price tag may seem a little hefty for some dog medicine, but this product works and is one of the few forms of glucosamine that my dogs have not turned away. I have two Siberian Husky pups, and unfortunately, their breed is especially susceptible to hip dysplasia. My 2-year-old male pup, Shiloh, is already showing signs of early onset - he slightly limps from what I assume is pain in his back right leg and will lay down after 10 minutes of playing with other dogs or in the middle of walks to avoid putting further pressure on it.Glucosamine in liquid form was previously the only thing he reacted well to, but since purchasing this product, he happily takes his medicine without running under the bed whenever he sees us open the bottle. The beef flavored chews are incredibly easy to use and give to him: we include it with shredded pieces of chicken and he eats up his medicine without any hesitation, a drastic departure from how he acted towards other glucosamine products we had tried.After consistently using this product for a little over 2 weeks, I am already beginning to see improvements with Shiloh's ability to put pressure on his right hind leg. He can climb stairs without stopping, hop onto the bed, and stand on his hind legs to greet me. Most importantly, he is a happy, well-exercised pup again - he can now keep up with other dogs and can go on 30-minute walks without beginning to limp or having to take a break. Overall, a great product that is easy for dogs to consume, is actually effective, and adds at least a couple of years to dogs' health/well-being in only a few weeks.Sample provided by Primed Paws for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

Very cool tripod stand that is a must-have for those who use their phone as their primary camera. I use my iPhone as a camera for everything, which is great for convenience purposes but has caused me to sacrifice image quality due to my unsteady hands. This tripod stand has helped me get higher-quality images and videos by allowing me to set my phone on a surface without it falling over.Best features of this product:+ Very lightweight yet durable at the same time. I was concerned that my phone would fall over the first couple of times I used this tripod stand, but have quickly discovered that the tripod can actually withstand quite an amount of weight and pressure that exceeds even that of my iPhone 6.+ Very versatile. The head can be adjusted in a 360 direction, and the legs can be bent or positioned according to how the angle and/or height that I want my photographs to be taken at. Probably the neatest feature of this product.+ The metal legs of the tripod are reinforced with foam and rubber, so they don't scratch any surfaces and allow the tripod to stand without potentially slipping or falling.+ Great value for the price. This tripod stand is high-quality and is so small/portable that I carry it around in my purse whenever I go out, so the amount of times I have used it have nicely justified its price tag (which is pretty competitively priced to begin with).Things to note before you purchase:- The tripod legs are shorter than they appear in the product photo so I am unable to attach it to many things, but I tend to straighten the legs out to place the tripod on a flat surface anyway, so it hasn't been an issue so far.I received this flexible tripod stand from RIF6 for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing. Overall, this is a nifty product that I would definitely recommend to those who use their phone as their primary camera and would like an inexpensive tool to help improve their picture/video quality.

A must-have product if you have multiple tech gadgets in your household. I have a specific outlet in my house that I use to charge all of my devices, but as you can imagine, it gets frustrating having to remove a certain charger every time I want to plug in a different device.This 4-port USB charger has turned out to be incredibly handy for accommodating the simultaneous charging of multiple products at one time. Instead of being able to charge only two devices at the same time, I can now charge my two iPhones, my iPad, and my boyfriend's iPhone simultaneously without having to wait for one device to finish charging before plugging in another. I expected that my devices would take longer to fully charge with this 4-port device because of the greater distribution of power, but they charge in the same amount of time as they normally did when plugged directly into a wall socket.Very useful device in terms of functionality, and very fun and sleek in terms of aesthetic appeal due to its lightweight composition and colorful yet subtle design. I have tried quite a few different USB chargers, all of which each have their own unique characteristics that make them better or worse than others, but overall I would definitely recommend this particular 4-port charger because it is competitively priced for the amount of convenience and practicality that it provides.I received a sample of this 4-port USB fast charger from RIF6 for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

I have tried quite a few different power banks ranging from all kinds of colors to all kinds of levels of charging capacity, but this one definitely stands out from the pack as the most attractive and most powerful one I have used to date.Best features of this product:+ Beautiful and classy-looking product from the get-go. The packaging is incredibly fancy and almost makes you forget that you purchased this product from Amazon. The charger itself is sturdy, sleek, and is made of the same exterior color as my gold iPhone, so the two complement each other very well.+ Powerful charging capacity. This is a 10,000 mAh power bank, which is insane considering some of the other high-quality power banks I have tried are less than 5,000 mAh. I have been able to fully charge my phone a ton of times with the amount of stored power that this device contains.+ Takes approximately 45 minutes to fully charge my iPhone 6, which is pretty impressive for an external battery charger that isn't hooked up to an electrical outlet.+ Unique and subtle way of indicating remaining charging power: there are four small blue lights on the top with each one indicating 25% charging power, so each light gradually shuts off depending on how much power you have left in the bank.Things to note before you purchase:- This device is quite heavy and not the most practical for portability purposes. I usually keep it in my car or put it into my suitcase so I don't have to carry it around in my purse. However, this is a small sacrifice to make considering the amount of charging power I get in return. Overall, this product comes highly recommended, and I also noticed that it is being offered at a pretty competitive price. I've tried less powerful power banks before that cost twice the price of this one from Haidue.I received this product at a discounted price for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

Great professional-grade nail clipper for dogs. I have two large Siberian Huskies who despise anyone touching their paws, so I decided to cut their nails myself instead of going to the groomers. I previously purchased a set of clippers from Walmart for a couple bucks less than this one, but it didn't cut cleanly through my dogs' thick nails and ended up causing one of my pup's nails to bleed. I did a little bit of research and came across these clippers by Boshel - this set in particular has a stainless steel blade that is made particularly for medium-to-large dogs, which was exactly what I was looking for.Best features of this product:+ Blades are powerful enough to cut cleanly through on the first try. The previous nail clipper created splits and left rough ends on my pups' thick nails, but this one cuts right through on the first try and leaves the nail short and smooth. I only have to cut each nail one time instead of having to make multiple cuts, which is a huge time-saver and gives the pups less of a chance to squirm away from me.+ Fits comfortably in my hand, and the non-slip rubber material on the handles allows me to have a tight grip to allow my other hand to securely hold their paws.+ Comes with a safety stop that prevents me from cutting the nail too deep. Great way to objectively determine the appropriate length of nail to cut off without risking injury to my pups.Things to note before you purchase:- If you haven't used dog clippers before, it will take some getting used to because you will undoubtedly be afraid of hurting your pup. Luckily, I found these ones to be quite self-explanatory and easy to use. Definitely recommend these nail clippers to anyone looking for a safe and high-quality nail clipper; it has really saved me a lot of money and grief now that I no longer have to bring my terrified pups to the groomers every month for a $5-10 manicure session.I received a sample of these dog nail clippers from Boshel for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

Yes, this sleep mask IS as silky and soft as it looks in the product picture. I've tried a few different sleep masks and have to say that this is amongst my top two favorites - it is incredibly soft and very comfortable for extended periods of usage, especially while traveling.Best features of this product:+ Mask is very soft and comfortable; it does not apply pressure nor cause discomfort to my face.+ Mask does not shift while in use. I often toss and turn in my sleep, but I always wake up to the sleep mask being centered on my face. A big plus is that the mask's elastic band does not pull on my hair when I move around during the night.+ Conforms well to the shape of my face. My biggest criteria for sleep masks is being able to forget that I am wearing one when it's on my face, and this one in particular has accomplished that.+ High quality and luxurious. I'm not a big fan of using flimsy-looking masks while traveling for business, but this sleep mask looks luxurious and is pretty enough to wear during red-eye flights.Things to note before purchasing:- There is a filling inside the sleep mask that is great for blocking out light and keeping the mask feeling plush and soft. However, I washed it once after a few uses and noticed that the feeling shifted out of place, so some parts are now lumpier than others.I received a sample of this therapeutic sleep mask from Fishers Finery for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing. Overall, this is a well-designed, high-quality sleep mask offered at a very competitive price.

Gluten-free and all-natural specialty product with a unique peppermint-flavored twist.Best features of this product:+ This deep dark fudge is reminiscent of dark chocolate - it is not too sweet and has that great subtle, bitter taste that is characteristic of darker chocolates.+ Perfect amount of sweetness for a chocolate fudge sauce. This is a delicate balance that is hard to achieve, but Sweet Carol Ann's does it well.+ The texture and consistency is great. It is not too thick and is easy to eat and spread.+ Versatile and multipurpose. It can be eaten out of the jar, as a food dip, on top of ice cream, with fruits, and so forth.+ Indulgent treat without the guilt. Since it is all-natural and gluten-free, it is accommodating of different diets.Things to note:- The peppermint flavor is quite strong and may not appeal to all taste buds. If you are a fan of the mint+chocolate combination, this product is perfect for you, but if you are on the fence about it like I am, then this might take some getting used to.I received a sample of this peppermint chocolate fudge sauce from Sweet Carol Ann's for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

I was in search of a more affordable, multipurpose alternative to my department store-brand serums, which are pretty pricey and only treat one area of concern, such as aging only or acne only. Although this serum is marketed as anti-aging, I really think that it should more so be noted for its acne-fighting abilities because it has proved to be one of the most effective serums for acne I have tried.+ Surprisingly very effective for acne. I have acne-prone skin and did not expect this serum to help clear up my face because I thought it was just an anti-aging product, but the glycolic and salicylic acids have truly helped to clear up my oily skin and dry out my often-red blemishes.+ Essentially multiple beauty products combined into one. As part of my beauty routine, I use a daily face wash with salicylic acid, a nightly pore refiner primer, a daily serum, and a weekly exfoliator, all of which can get pretty expensive. This serum combines all of those different products into one since applying it a couple of times each week has helped to unclog my pores, exfoliate my skin of hidden residue, and clear up my blemishes.+ Multipurpose. This can be used as an all-over serum if you have aging skin concerns, or as a spot treatment if you have acne concerns. Personally, my blemishes respond well to glycolic and salicylic acid as an acne treatment, but my sensitive skin dries out if it gets too much of those two ingredients, so I have started using this serum as a nightly spot treatment.* One thing to note before purchasing is that different skin types will likely respond differently to glycolic and salicylic acid. These are very effective but strong ingredients that may dry out skin, so be sure to only use this serum all-over a couple of times each week, or prepare to use it as a spot treatment nightly. I do both on a regular interval basis and have seen drastic improvements in the way my skin looks - my blemishes around my chin have cleared up, and my face looks radiant without getting oily or shiny throughout the day. Highly recommend this product, and that is coming from someone who has tried seemingly a million different acne products the last few years.I received a sample of this anti-aging serum from Sublime Beauty for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

Quality multipurpose oven mitts/pot holders. I intended to use this product to assist with draining pasta - I always have a hard time gripping the pot and pouring the pasta into the strainer because of the extreme heat, but these gloves have since made the process so much easier.Best features of this product:+ Water-resistant material. I have many oven mitts made of cotton fabric that always tend to get wet during the pasta draining process. These silicone gloves in particular are great for acting as a barrier against water.+ Plenty of control. The silicone material allows these gloves to be pretty thin in comparison to other super-thick kitchen mitts, which in turn provides me with plenty of control over my hands and fingers for gripping purposes.+ So much easier to use and clean. In addition to resisting water, these gloves resist stains, residue, etc., so I can just run them under the sink water once I'm done instead of having to laundry-wash them as I do with my cotton mitts.+ Nice, modern design. With the bright and fun color contrast, these gloves stand out amongst my other kitchen mitts.Things to know before you purchase:- Because these gloves are so thin, their ability to withstand heat is limited. It only goes up to 450 degrees, which is more than enough in most instances, but when I am gripping a hot pot or pan for an extended period of time, I can feel a bit of warm discomfort around my palms.I received a sample of these silicone oven mitts/pot holders from Love This Want This for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

Very cute and easy-to-use tea infuser. I especially appreciate its simplicity and subtle design as I've always used bagged tea and previously never needed a tea infuser. After receiving a set of expensive loose tea from a client, I was on the hunt for a simple and affordable tea infuser and came across this one by Comfify. It is an incredible price for the value - the tea infuser is made of stainless steel with a heat-resistant silicone base. Using it is as easy as placing some loose tea into the tea infuser and then submerging the tea infuser into hot water. The space for the tea leaves was more than enough to make one full, flavorful cup of tea. Keep in mind that the holes are a little bit big for smaller/finer tea leaves, but overall, this tea infuser got the job done and was competitively priced.I received a sample of this tea infuser from Comfify for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

If you have a Nexus 6 and are in the market for a screen protector, I would definitely recommend this tempered glass version as it offers much more protection than a typical screen protector film and protects well against water, dust, smudges, and minor scratches.Best features of this product:+ Tempered glass material allows it to withstand scratches up to 9H, which is great for everyday scratches and normal wear-and-tear you are bound to sustain if you keep your phone next to your keys, put it face down on the table, etc.+ Does not affect touch screen sensitivity. Many screen protectors tend to slightly inhibit sensitivity, but I have not noticed a change in how I use my touch screen.+ Crystal clarity. Many screen protectors I have tried have strange, tiny pixelation that distorts my image resolution, but this screen protection offers crystal clear resolution.+ Durable and offers more protection than typical screen protectors.+ Easy to apply. I have a minor case of OCD and hate having to install screen protectors, but found that this tempered glass version was very easy to align with and adhere to my phone.Things to note before you purchase:- This screen protector did not align perfectly with the Nexus 6. It was a little bit off on the corners, but not noticeable if you have a phone case on to cover those corners.- May not completely protect against high-impact falls. If you want it to 100% protect against high-impact falls, plan to look for something a little more heavy-duty, but overall, this tempered glass screen protector is great for everyday scratches/normal wear-and-tear and can withstand more impact than most screen protectors I have tried in the past. Definitely recommended.I received this Nexus 6 tempered glass screen protector from BLUBOON for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

I love how sleek and subtle Xtava's designs are and have been purchasing them for my mom's beauty salon, but since this one has a more playful tiger-stripe design, I decided to keep it for personal use. I typically use 2-inch wide flat irons but opted for this one since it doubles well as both a hair straightener and a curler for natural waves/loose curls.Pros:+ Lightweight and does not make my hand/forearm sore after half an hour of use.+ Heats up very quickly and is easy to switch between different temperatures.+ 1-inch size is great for dual usage of straightening and curling - it is small enough to wrap hair around for natural waves/loose curls.+ Swivel cord makes it easy to move the flat iron in all directions.+ Built-in automatic safety mechanism that turns off after 30 minutes of not being in use. No more forgetting to turn off the flat iron and coming home to a burnt smell wafting through the house!+ Leaves hair silky and straight.+ Comes with a heat-resistant case that is great for protective and portability purposes.Areas for improvement:- Would have preferred a more sleek design comparable to their other products, but the tiger stripes are adorable and fun as well!I received this flat iron/hair straightener for the purposes of testing and reviewing, and my overall opinion is that this product is a great value for the many features it offers. Definitely a very effective and functional styling tool.

The best thing about this particular brand, Xtava, is that their products all look so sleek and are incredibly well-designed for aesthetic appeal. My mom and I own a beauty studio, and we have been slowly introducing Xtava products because our clients tend to enjoy how cool and professional they look.Pros:+ LCD control display is stylish and easy to understand and use.+ 1-inch size is great for dual usage of straightening and curling if you have longer hair like myself. Because it is only 1 inch wide, it is small enough for me to wrap my hair around for natural waves/loose curls.+ Swivel cord makes it easy to move the flat iron in all directions.+ Built-in automatic safety mechanism. No more forgetting to turn off the flat iron and coming home to a burnt smell wafting through the house!+ Comes with a heat-resistant case that is great for protective and portability purposes.Cons:- None so far. This flat iron has so many cool features to discover that I have yet to find anything I don't like about it.I received this flat iron/hair straightener for the purposes of testing and reviewing, and my overall opinion is that this product is a great value for the many features it offers. I have flat irons from 6 other brands, and they were all pricier than this particular one without the same amount of features. Definitely a very effective styling tool that is both functional and aesthetically appealing.

Definitely a quality flat sheet that is comparable to department-store sheet sets.Pros:+ Very thin and cooling material. This flat sheet does not get hot and remains cool throughout the night.+ Microfiber material is very soft and breathable.+ Does not get wrinkled as easily as typical flat sheets, even after I washed and dried it.+ Exactly as described. It fit my queen bed well and the color is starch white, not that strange off-white that sheet sets often come in.I received this product for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing, and I think that some people (especially those in colder climates) may find this flat sheet to be a little too thin. However, as I live in Southern California, I found the thickness to be just right as this sheet will be perfect for the warm summer nights.

Very functional and strong hair dryer that looks sleek and stylish at the same time. I am a big fan of its design - the all-black with hints of blue is aesthetically appealing and fits in great at my mom's beauty salon. The heat and speed settings are easy to switch between, and I especially like how cold the air from the cool shot button is. Great for styling and quickly attaining that shiny sheen to clients' hair. The concentrator nozzles that come with the hair dryer are also efficient for faster drying on days when we are tight on time.Keep in mind that this hair dryer is compact and smaller than the typical hair dryer. This is both an excellent and poor component of its design. The great thing about its size is that it is very portable and easy to transport, and for how small it is, it is extremely powerful and effective at quickly drying hair. However, for its compact size, it is quite heavy, even heavier than the normal-sized blow dryer I previously purchased from this same brand, Xtava.I received this ionic ceramic hair dryer for the purposes of testing and reviewing, and overall, I think it is a great hair dryer, but not practical for extended use as its weight eventually puts a strain on the arm. Rather, it is more suited for only occasional use.

Well-designed, nifty product for those who prefer to dry their hair with a towel instead of a heat source. Definitely superior to the typical bulky towel that always seems to slip off and be more trouble than it's worth.Pros:+ Effective and dries hair faster than a typical towel.+ Lightweight and soft microfiber can absorb a good amount of water.+ Much lighter and less bulky than a regular towel, so it does put as much weight on my head nor slip off as easily.+ Just the right size for drying hair. My regular towels always tend to be too large or too small, but this one fits well.+ Does not leave my hair static-y or frizzy as I was expecting it to.Cons:- Works better on shorter hair than long hair. My hair falls to the middle of my back and I had a tougher time using this to dry my hair than my sister did (she has shoulder-length hair).I received this for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

Must-have tool for the avid gardener or outdoorsman.Pros:+ All around high quality, especially the stainless steel rust-resistant blade.+ Measurements on the blade are very helpful for planting and depth purposes.+ Straight edge on one side, serrated edge on the other.+ Multipurpose - great for gardening, hunting, digging, wedding, etc.+ Nice, leather sheath included with the knife.Areas for improvement:- Handle is beautifully made from wood, but can become painful after a few hours of consistently gripping and using this knife.I received this product for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing.

I switch to a new phone case every couple of weeks and have tried so many of them that I now know exactly what to look for in each new one. I received this iPhone 6 case by mogun for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing, and it is definitely one of the better ones I have tried because of its non-slip texture and perfect balance between thin and protective.Pros:+ Case is designed to fit the iPhone perfectly - it does not block any buttons nor intrude on the touch screen.+ Slim, sleek, and transparent; great for allowing the phone to shine through.+ Protects well against scratches, light bumps, and daily wear-and-tear.+ Less slippery and much easier to grip than other similar phone cases.+ Not so thin that any bump will affect the phone, but not so bulky that it takes away from the beauty of the phone either.Cons:- Not recommended if you want life-proof protection for your phone or are afraid of the possibility of cracking your screen. This case is meant to provide enough protection on a daily basis without being too bulky and taking away from the phone's aesthetic.

Really like these reusable K-Cup pods. I recently tried a different brand of K-Cups but found that these ones by Filip Coffee are a bit more superior as they are better-designed and more aesthetically appealing.Pros:+ Very versatile; can be used for coffee, tea, hot chocolate. Just fill the K-Cup with your choice of drink/blend each morning.+ Compatible with Keurigs.+ K-Cups are hard all-around, which makes it easier to grip.+ Functional, convenient, and easy to use.+ Cute dolphin cut-outs on the side; looks great in person compared to typical boring K-Cups.+ Great value for 3 reusable pods.+ Very fast shipping. It was at my door within 24 hours of my order.Cons:- No instructions included; it would have been very helpful.I received this product for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing, and my take-away is that these reusable K-Cups by Filip Coffee are definitely a cost-effective and environmentally-friendly alternative to pricey K-Cups. They are great for both my pockets and the environment.

Very interesting and unique idea that has made gifting so much easier.Pros:+ Beautifully packaged. Comes in a compact-sized box with two of each kind of flower seed/greeting inside.+ Great mix of flowers.+ Practical and thoughtful gift that will outlast a typical greeting card.+ Perfect for every occasion.+ Great value: essentially 10 greeting cards AND flower seeds for only $1.99 each.+ USDA certified, organic, and non-GMO.Cons:- Would be great if the packet resembled more of a greeting card, perhaps with a foldable card and the package of seeds included inside. These packets currently have the greeting printed right on them.My mom absolutely hates it when I buy her anything, but when I gave her these seeds of love, she absolutely adored them and thanked me for my thoughtfulness. I received this product for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing - would absolutely purchase more in the future as they make incredible gifts for loved ones, friends, coworkers, and so forth.

+ Great compact size. I was expecting it to be much bulkier, but it is about the length of my widespread palm. Comes with a small, compact remote as well.+ Quick and easy to seamlessly navigate/switch between the 3 ports.+ Clear picture and sound quality.+ Auto-detects which device is being turned on and automatically switches to it.+ High-quality and lightweight.+ Supports all of my TVs, including an LG one that is 3D.Overall, this is a must-have product if you have many devices for one display. I received this product for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing and found this HDMI Switch 3 x 1 by KabelDirekt to be incredibly convenient and easy to use.

Worse thing to put a coin battery in is a desktop PC. It worked once then the PC came up with the same configuration error. I researched it again, reseated the battery; still failed. I ordered ten Energizers and that took care of the problem. I didn't look at the expiration date; lithium batteries should have a shelf life of 10 years. They usually do; I've been buying 2032s for 30 years.I just discovered that I wrote another review of Sony batteries from another seller. I did not buy the Sony CR2032 from this seller. I'd delete it but I suspect both sellers may be unwittingly buying counterfeit batteries from the same supplier. If they were $8.00 for 100 batteries I'l buy them and let the granddaughter use them for her dollhouse tealights.

After 40 years of touch-up I finally repainted our picnic table. Dragged a half piece of 5/8" plywood up to the patio to slap together a cabinet for three large drawers I just bought and, whoops, can't beat up the picnic table as a work table any more. Bummer. Oh, wait, I picked up a set of bench dogs to fill a 'free shipping' order. Grabbed'em from the wood shop, dropped a couple of butt buckets (have to accommodate the local help; don't know why those kids smoke.) in the middle of the 'cross' and wow! That plywood didn't budge an inch. No more worries about trimming the edge of the picnic table. Then I realized that with a half inch of blade beyond the work, the table wouldn't get touched. (Not brave enough for that yet; it just doesn't seem right.

This is an inexpensive basic heavy weight steel. The shaft is 1/2" in diameter. Use it whenever you use your knife. I've reshaped some chrome and high carbon steel knives, like a Sabre and (don't laugh) and old Barlow OK but it won't touch a Victorinox blade; I've read that stainless blades don't deform like chrome and carbon steel knives. I've sharpened a couple of Victorinox blades with a smooth white Arkansas stone. This steel doesn't seem to have the same 'bite' as my good steels.

These are nice but thick enough for a 1 5/8" door. Most interior doors are 1 3/8". Instead of trying to reform the tip of the bracket I wedged a block of rubber in the back. There isn't much room to hang several hangers on these. Ordered on purpose because bi-fold closet doors are not designed to support much weight besides the doors. Wife likes'em.

Got a smallish bandsaw for cheap. The 1/8" blade might have been OK for scroll sawing wood. I ordered this 3/8" bi-metal blade for doing rough machining on soft metal and similar work on wood molding. The lighter weight bandsaw (and miter saw, table saw and grinder) let us set up a useful shop wherever we are building.

They fit 1/8" and our 1/4" pegboard. They'd likely fit thicker pegboard (never seen any) because the smaller hooks have lots of slop in 1/4" holes. We have a wall full of pictures on 200 sq. ft. of usable area, and we rearrange pictures almost weekly. Ordinary pegboard hooks small enough to hook into the back of many picture frames tend to fall out when you're repositioning pictures. We should'a ordered two packs.

Eastwood has done his job. Listening to the drive-by news media report on how a civilian was accidentally killed, you'd think combatants are sitting in safety while calling in air strikes; watching this movie gives one a little better perspective. I don't suppose the language can be cleaned up any, but it is disturbing. We are fortunate that warriors like Chris Kyle exist; fighting to protect your comrade is one thing, protecting squad after squad, mostly comrades in arms, but strangers nonetheless, takes a special dedication.  I didn't watch the end; he seemed like he was slowly recovering from his experience. (I already knew what happened.)

Sinus season seems to be year round now. My wife has an appointment with her allergist next week, but it has been necessary for me to wear ear plugs every night. (I had surgery.) Keeping my ears really clean is a necessity for nightly ear plug wear; I've managed it with cold cream for many years, but a proliferation of mites in the yard combined with the ear plugs has left my ears dry and irritated. Two or three days using Comfort Earx has restored my ears to normal. I use a bit of it daily now.

These have been great. We're saving the Sony brand for the granddaughter's tea lights... It is too much trouble taking a computer apart when the replacement battery fails prematurely. Energizers have never failed.

Bought one the first time; bought three this time. It also works for our 30 year old Bionnaire, and we've used the scraps fastened over our computer air intake vents. Cut to the width of the dirty filter; wrap it around the HEPA filter and overlap it some. The HEPA filter is important; vacuum it while you are changing the pre-filter. This only does one of our huge Honeywell air purifiers, but I've saved two strips to tape together for a seldom used smaller Honeywell air purifiers.

We only really needed one size, but who knows what size. Turns out three sizes will do it: one is a loose fit but works; one is the correct size; one 'just fits' but doesn't go the bottom of the hole, but it still works.

Wheat hypersensitivity leaves a little leeway (at least at this time), so I cheat occasionally. One thing I miss is Oreo cookies; not any more. These are every bit as satisfying, with the right texture, chocolaty goodness and even come apart right, to eat the filling first. I've put them on Subscribe and Save so I don't run out again.

First thing I look for is sodium: at 3% (4.5% for me) and compare it to other food values: 6% fat (ya' need fat); 8% carbs; 10% fiber. My sister-in-law found these for me and gave me some samples. 1.8 oz. got me through 4 hours of hard work until supper time. I've never reordered 'granola' bars ever. I used to like PB&J on whole wheat until they screwed up wheat. The digestive distress was bad enough, now I get a pimply rash after eating just a little wheat. But these are really good. I did ordered a single order before adding them on my subscribe and save; if the other flavors are as good as some reviewers say, or if I get tired of them you'll find this review amended.
Great file handle for files with really huge tangs: 18" to 22" is what we put on them. It comes with two inserts; one for smaller files and one that works great for holding a tool with a square tang.

Below is the file size:0 E 21528N 5 1/4 x 1 1/2 for 7/16" flat tang - 12" to 14" files. They make 00 and 000 size too.1 D 21526N 4 7/8 x 1 5/16 for 3/8" flat tang - larger files; too large for most rat tail files.2 C 21524N 4 1/2 x 1 3/16 for 1/4" square, 5/16" wide tang, what I'd call a medium size file 10" or so; big rat tail..3 B 21522N 4 1/8 x 1 1/16 for 7/32" wide tang, round and rat-tail files up to 12" or so, smaller flat tang.4 A 21520N 3 3/4 x 1 5/16 for 1/8" square tang, chainsaw files (I like a bigger handle). Smaller files tap into the wood.

Below is the file size:0 E 21528N 5 1/4 x 1 1/2 for 7/16" flat tang - 12" to 14" files. They make 00 and 000 size too.1 D 21526N 4 7/8 x 1 5/16 for 3/8" flat tang - larger files; too large for most rat tail files.2 C 21524N 4 1/2 x 1 3/16 for 1/4" square, 5/16" wide tang, what I'd call a medium size file 10" or so; big rat tail..3 B 21522N 4 1/8 x 1 1/16 for 7/32" wide tang, round and rat-tail files up to 12" or so, smaller flat tang.4 A 21520N 3 3/4 x 1 5/16 for 1/8" square tang, chainsaw files (I like a bigger handle). Smaller files tap into the wood.The holes are roughly round; larger ones rough to take different sizes.I've bought many on Amazon since the price is right.File tangs differ in taper; when I have a 10" file that won't fit on the handle that I want to use it with, it takes a few seconds to round off the corners or square up the tang to fit, ith a grinder. A proper round chain saw file would fit in a size A handle, but feels too small for me. Shaving slivers of wood with a knife or ax and pounding a round chain saw file into a larger handle feels better. The roughness of the holes these handles seem purposeful to me; it'll grip wood slivers if needed and helps fit files with huge tangs.

Bought two: an Irwin and a Stanley. Both are accurate and both are worthless unless your line is laser straight. To check, hang them on a short line and level the line. Next turn the level end to end and check it again. If the line measures level no matter which direction you hang the level it is dead on.

Here is the problem: mosquitoes seem to be most active at dusk and dawn; so we use a timer that turns the lamps on 3 hours at dusk and dawn. But the Octenol attracts them 24 hours (maybe a little less without the heat of the lamps). It's not really the fault of the Octenol bait... it is how we use the lamp. Without the lamps... and high voltage grid operating mosquitoes can enter the thing without getting zapped. We prefer controlling mosquitoes by draining ponding water and not leaving anything outside that catches water. We use Mosquito Bits in the bird bath.

Been using this for inflammation for 25 years. Well, no, I used gelcaps for about 10 of that. Someone gave me a bottle of Walmart's brand of tablets and I never changed back; couldn't see a difference. I rarely use more than 200 mg when my back is sore. Glucosamine for my knees for the past 10 years has helped my back as well. The first time I used it, it had just been made available OTC. A pharmacist recommended it for acute wry neck; I was there to fix the pharmacy database computer and didn't feel like I could finish the job after the part was delivered. I took 600 mg and felt like I had gotten a shot in the butt.

I built a full size catapult for scout camp 25 years ago; we used sponge balls meant for pool play back then. The newer sponge balls aren't even good for a weeks play; they fall apart. As scouts have begun overnight camping at an early age, the catapult has become less useful. I brought it home for repair and we gave it a try at a family picnic for 60 people. Even my son-in-law had fun with it. Since we were using it on my property we used these water balloons which worked great. Eight year old kids and everyone else were able to fill the balloons. When overfilled they broke when launched, but they make a great splash when landing, and break in pieces. I picked out the red, blue and green; the pink, yellow and purple were easy to find. We picked up after the party so play time wasn't shortened. I don't believe the bits left on the ground would be harmful to critters, but we didn't leave any.

These are shiny 605 knobs, not satin as they look in the picture. They come with an adapter ring so you can replace Kuikset passage knobs that only last 40 years. I pounded one in out 45 year old doors and the door split. Perhaps newer doors have a sloppier hole for the latch, or are softer wood. In any case, once you've chiseled out one, for the square latch plate, the rest go pretty quickly. Cut enough out at first and you won't get frustrated refitting it again and again. PS Our 12 year old Schlage knobs are getting loose, the latches need regular dry lube. Schlage will replace them; they replaced a passage knob that my wife's rings made a mess of. Customer service says the new finish is even tougher. PPS Schlage service is still excellent; they sent me an entire replacement keyed set when the  lock burst while I was rekeying it. I had ten to do and there was no reason for the one to burst.

These are shiny 605 knobs, not satin as they look in the picture. They come with an adapter ring so you can replace Kuikset passage knobs that only last 40 years. I pounded one in out 45 year old doors and the door split. Perhaps newer doors have a sloppier hole for the latch, or are softer wood. In any case, once you've chiseled out one, for the square latch plate, the rest go pretty quickly. Cut enough out at first and you won't get frustrated refitting it again and again. PS Our 12 year old Schlage knobs are getting loose, the latches need regular dry lube and my wife's rings are making a mess out of the finish. PPS Schlage service is still excellent; they sent me an entire replacement keyed set when the  lock burst while I was rekeying it. I had ten to do and there was no reason for the one to burst.

I bought this for our son-in-law... so I can't check to see if: the bars on the vial are calibrated for slope. I'm not a mason. You must pull the line absolutely straight or the level will be way off. Maybe the vial is plastic... then it wouldn't need a tiny window like the Stanley. To make the line level easy to find I removed the bubble plastic carefully, then stapled it to the cardboard back so it stays closed when the level is replaced. Line levels get lost easily and I suspect they are at the bottom of a tool box or drawer.

This looks like it will protect the vial better than the Irwin. They are both inexpensive and both accurate. Tip 1: The line must be pulled so that it is straight or you will be way off. Tip 2: Line levels get lost easily; keep the package and put a staple in one edge to secure it to the card.. (Some day I'll empty the 'masons' tool carrier and find them nestled in the bottom against one edge.)

Not quite as satisfying as chucking down a small handful of chocolate chunks, but certainly tastier, with twice as much cacao. The half pound bag you get is full of 'flat' chocolate chips. Tasty chocolate chips. You'd never guess that they are 74% cacao. So I'll be munching on these from now on (plus the dark chocolate covered Brazil nuts specially made for me) to help my cholesterol and hypertension and not develop kidney stones. The amazing thing is that this one bag came packed in a specially made insulated box with two ice packs. What a bargain.

We have several of these. You can lubricate the metal gears and they last 25 years. The weak part is the clock motor which has a plastic gear on the armature that softens over time. Clock motors are around $20.00. I ordered one to repair the timer that I am replacing. You can mount one of these in a plastic electrical box in the middle of an 'air conditioning' extension cord and have a handy portable timer for anything that can be plugged into an ordinary duplex outlet.

These are great. You can cut them to size without them unraveling. The best thing is - they don't stick to the wound. I had cellulitis with a 2.5 cm ulcer in the middle. Covered, exudate filled the bandage. Left open it burned intensely. With a piece of one of these pads, in one day the ulcer formed a dry yellow scab with no secondary infection and no burning. I suspect the breathable pad let the ulcer dry slowly. That was ten days ago; I now have a 2 cm thick scab with no infection; it looks like it'll be gone in another ten days.

Had to burn the thin redwood wren's nests from W******. They were hard to clean out and ended up with bird mites. Put these up and wrens began a second brood. I puffed a little Sevin into the nest, since it is likely the birds have the mites too. Second brood is gone and we have wrens, finches, song sparrows and all kinds of birds chirping all over the yard. These are on the corners of our patio; only wrens like to nest that close to people apparently. I too used a larger screw eye.

Same tablet, same enzymes as in a non-chewable foil pack. I stopped buying the chewable tablets because they contain Sorbitol. Don't have trouble with it, but I don't want to take a chance either. I chew them all; these are easier to chew and don't taste bad either. My daughter uses two of the regular strength (what these are); I still do OK with one for an ice cream cone, etc. First had trouble in 1988. At thet time you had to use liquid drops; yuck.

Heavy, solid brass hose nozzle. These should last as long as our fifty year old Nelson nozzles. Another reviewer had one break. The only way that is likely to happen is if water froze in the nozzle. Cast brass is not ductile; if water in the nozzle freezes below 20 any brass nozzle will break.

Low sodium and carbs, but made with real sugar. These are tiny cones. A four inch cone sounds pretty big, but much of that is in a tiny point. They're big enough for two small scoops of ice cream. The main thing is... they are not sugar cones, just a cake cone in sugar cone shape.

Much smaller physically than the capacitor we replaced. Start capacitors have a useful life. If you are fortunate to catch the failure of a start capacitor before it cycles your motor for hours and hours you won't end up needing a capacitor and motor. It is more difficult to discover a start capacitor that has slowly decreased in value, resulting in a damaged motor. I'm hoping that this physically smaller start capacitor will have a characteristic which results in a quick failure, rather than a gradual reduction on value which is more harmful to motors. With the dozen motors we have in use, 25 years seems to be a typical life for start capacitors.

I've always felt that Disney should be making special Tinkerbell toys or light sets or something; she flies and lights up... they ought to be able to create a desirable item with that. We have a Christmas tree in our train room with hundreds of cartoon figures: Disney, Simpsons, Barbie and more. It also has over a hundred illuminated cartoon figures. A Tinkerbell and Friends set of ligkts would be perfect since they light up already.I bought the Flutterbye the minute I saw one fly into a fireplace on Facebook. (We don't have a fireplace... just a granddaughter.) It looks fragile but is well designed and rugged. It wasn't the surprise we expected; our granddaughter already had one. But she was delighted that there was one at 'Grandma's' to play with. She didn't realize that a single depression would lower Tinkerbell slowly; she just knew repeated presses would bring it crashing to the floor. That was a useful lesson in itself.The toy is designed for a child's hand. A large adult size hand will cause it to fly too high. Our granddaughter, on the other hand, could make it hover above her hand pretty well, but it does have a tendency to end up flying against the ceiling. Our son in law was amazed that it could be controlled by the base and equally amazed that the toy can fly without Tinkerbell spinning around. It doesn't appear to have a gyroscope, but may have a motion sensor chip; they put them in so many things that the cost must be down to a dollar or son.I was considering 'weighting' the figure to keep it off the ceiling, but that depends on the state of charge of the batteries, so haven't done it yet. Don't fly it in front of an air conditioner or fan... or outside.

I'm glad I accidentally stumbled across Winehouse in a online video. I immediately bought CDs and this LP. Few pop, or whatever the heck they refer to as music these days, singers are enjoyable to me today. I'd really like to find something by Reading's own Taylor Swift that I like. She is a beautiful woman and smart businesswoman, but I don't like her voice; her early country better than recent music. Even Billy Holiday did nothing for me... or Janice Joplin. Aretha is in a class of her own. Blues from a white woman usually seem derivative to me. Amy Winehouse was one of a kind; they'll never be another like her. And she had to work at it. Listen to the outtakes of her work with Tony Bennett and you'll see that genius comes with a lot of hard work. Sorry she left us so early.

We've never fed suet after the weather turned warm... so I don't have any idea how woodpeckers would have been using the suet with nuts and berries in it; perhaps not any more than this. They're consuming a plain cake a week, but the squirrels may have stolen more than that. Now the squirrels are not chewing our two stainless suet cages at all. Flickers, downy and hairy visit it every day. Pileated woodpeckers are more common in SE PA too; we saw them in the winter only. I slit the plastic on the back so it is no mess at all, even in near 90 temperature. The package says refrigerate when it is over 70.

I put this in those little flat lids from bottled water; if you put it on concrete in hot weather it'll soak right into the concrete. It took two weeks for the queen to crawl out of the nest and die. The ants were imported from scout camp. Carpenter do not do well around here; we've had them around but they didn't invade our home. Red shale clay soil turns to adobe brick when it dries out. The imported ones bred about 200 - 300 before I detected them. I tried Advance granules first; they wouldn't take the bait because it was too dry.The native carpenter ants were wiped out as well as the new colony. Soil ants suffered as well; it took them a couple of years to recover.It is even drier this year. So dry that soil ants were finding it difficult to make nests in the hard clay. They found a hole in the bottom of a patio door. Frass piled up overnight. I checked outside the following night: soil ants (pavement ants). Put out a cap of Maxforce gel at each end of the door and no more frass. A little appeared in a week or two; it was just the 'sawdust' falling out as the door was opened and closed.

I used up my first bottle of 400 in about two years; the expiration date of my old bottle was 03/15. Most drugs that would not affect your health seriously can be taken years after the expiration date; if they look and smell OK (vitamin B always smells bad) it is probably OK to take them.  The recommended dosage as a sleep aid is 50mg, but I seldom use that much. If I want an antihistamine I use 4-6mg chlorpheniramine maleate at bedtime. The Kirkland brand has too many negative reviews, so I spent $1.00 more on the one that I have been using.

Anyone who has replaced a Ford 460 V-8 manifold knows what a tough job it is. ($1,600 at the garage that inspects my bucket truck.) The finish on this $5.00 wrench is rough... but it won't come off as one reviewer worried about. These are tough drop forged wrenches. The EGR tube has a 1 1/32" flare fitting; Ford has been using 1 1/32" fittings since the beginning. I tried a 27 mm wrench first; it was too loose. I thought I could beat this onto the flare nut (they deform with pressure); no good. I pounded and pounded on the box end, but I'll have to grind a few thousandths off to make it fit; I bought it just for this purpose. The thing is, these wrenches are so good I'm going to order all the wrenches bigger than my Craftsman set; the end I pounded on has no sign of my abusing it. None.

This is great; highly accurate for me. I've had some fatigue issues on and off for a few years. I'll have my thyroid checked during my next camp physical. I used to be able to charge up and down 40 flights of stairs a day; not any more. To really know how many steps you take in a day you need a new type pedometer. Turns out I'm doing 4,000 steps a day. That doesn't seem like much, compared to web sits that say 10,000 is a good target, but our kids seldom do 3,000 with sedentary jobs. I was happy to discover that it counts up and down stairs while in my pants pocket. It doesn't count at all sitting on the dresser; I need a way to remember to pick it up after I get out of bed. I tidy up, wash dishes, etc. until it is time for breakfast. That takes 500 steps. Maybe I'll remember and do 4,500 steps one day. Oh, it doesn't count shuffling around a retail store looking for something.
Slightly greasier than my genuine original Vaseline Intensive Care hand lotion. I don't know why they keep messing with the formula. The others are horrible though... so this gets five stars.

This tea maker teapot is a perfect way to prove how beautiful simplicity actually is.  The amazingly beautiful box and matching gift bag really do add so much class and beauty to what is already an amazing gift.  Being able to see what you are brewing helps you to create the strength of tea you desire, but it also offers a beautiful natural glow and color to this super set.  Tea's do come in many different shades and colors so you can even make a brew to blend in with the room or table setting if you want and this set will show off the perfection.Borosilicate glass is a wonderful and strong material that holds up in very high heat.  This pot won't crack or break from getting too hot.  Even the little cups ensure that your brew remains perfect.  Each cup is double walled to provide insulation, but in my opinion the double walls also make the cups even more attractive.  For brewing loose leaf tea, the removable filter is amazing.  The filter is also made from the same spectacular sparkling glass and has very fine slits in the bottom to keep your tea as clear and pure as possible.  The slits actually look like decorative etching to me.Each piece is naturally very light weight and the teapot handle is very easy to hold and pour with.  This set gives off a romantic and classy vibe.  I am actually using this set myself but feel this would be an extremely thoughtful and appreciated gift.*I was offered this set at a reduced rate in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I personally like this mascara quite a bit.  I seem to get great results even with just one coat.  It goes on smooth and creamy.  It says it is waterproof but I would go more with water resistant which is what I actually prefer since it comes off easier with my magic cloth and I seem to loose lashes if a mascara is too hard to remove.  I love the brush.  It assists in even coverage without much effort from me.  There was no clumping and it doesn't flake or smudge when I wear it all day.The black is a nice rich color that shows up really well on my extremely blond lashes.  I do have sensitive eyes as well and some mascaras cause irritation, itching, and make my eyes water.  I've not had any problems with this mascara.  I am happy with this product and I do recommend it to others.*I was offered this mascara for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This is an extremely beautiful piece of doll furniture.  In my opinion it is made just as nice if not nicer than some of the real human furniture I own! The hinges are well made and strong.  The woodwork is smooth and heavy duty.  The paint is lead free, done with precision, and the colors are gorgeous.  Even the back is painted in a beautiful fashion with pink and white.  The scalloped detailing, pink wooden hangers, see through doors, and collapsible storage basket, make this little closet look so sweet, realistic, and fancy.  I can hardly wait to give this to my granddaughter for Christmas.  It is so well made I'm sure she will be able to treasure it and keep it for her future children.Assembly time says around 15 minutes but once again we were a little slower.  I think my husband and I worked on it for 30 minutes.  It wasn't difficult at all.  I think the tiny screws are what slowed us down a little, (we have 54 year old eyes).  Otherwise, it was very simple to assemble.I mentioned this was going to be for my granddaughter but I also want to mention that my 2 1/2 year old grandson was here when the assembly process was done and he loves it.  He had all his little Army men and accessories in the storage basket and a 12 inch doll right inside the closet.  He was playing doll with his Army men.  When I told him it was for his cousin he cried.  Maybe this isn't a girl only toy...LOL!*I was offered this beautiful doll closet at a reduced rate in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I sure wish I wouldn't have gotten this snowman bath bomb with the intent to give it as a gift.  I opened up the box and was THRILLED with the aroma!  It smells so good that I can't even begin to explain how nice it is.  I can say that is smells of holiday memories and aromas.  I personally can smell pine trees, with a sweet hint of something simmering on the stove top.  The scent is wonderful but not over powering. My husband has used this with his iPhone 6 and has had the same good fortune and performance.  My callers have actually complemented me on the sound quality of the mic. sound and performance. I was provided a free Mpow Jaws Bluetooth Sports Headphones for testing and review and was asked only to give my honest review.

So much fun and such an awesome experience with texture.  I got these for my grandchildren and the 2 year old was the first to make one.  He LOVED it!  In fact, he wanted to create so many and play so long with it I was scared it was going to dry out.  Luckily it worked very well the entire 1 1/2 hours he worked with it! We had baby snowmen, flat snowmen, snow puddles, and funny snowmen that couldn't eat without a mouth.  We laughed and had a blast.The texture is nice. What a beautiful set of ceramic knives!  Not only are they pretty, they are very well made and extremely sharp.  The handles are wonderful! The slight possibility of chipping is another reason that it is wonderful to have such amazing covers!The quality and the presentation and looks of this set would make it an amazing and impressive gift!*I was offered this set at a reduced rate in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This is my first cast iron cookware and my first dutch oven.  I have always wanted cast iron so I was very excited to get this.  A few years ago our daughter's doctor said she was slightly anemic and suggested she cook with cast iron.  I had no idea that using cast iron actually increases the iron fortification in foods.  What a win win situation.Since getting this I've prepared a wonderful stew on the stove top and a great chicken casserole in the oven.  Both came out very tasty and cooked evenly.  The pan is very easy to clean.  Since it is enameled you just have to be sure it is completely cool when you wash it with warm soapy water.  It really came clean quickly using a sponge. 4:48 MinsThis is an awesome product that is very easy to assemble and operate.  I personally am using it to keep little critters from going under my front porch and multiplying.  I love animals of all kinds so this seemed like the most humane way to reduce the reproduction of kittens, gofers, and what ever else wants to sneak under there for shelter.  I can tell it is effective by the way my indoor pets reacted to it when I was testing it.  My dog hid and whimpered and my cat left the room and complained by meowing VERY loudly.  They are both fine now, but they sure didn't want to sniff it or get near it.There are 5 modes and depending upon the environment you can choose the one you feel is best.  It does go off fairly easily so if it needs to be set up in or close to the house where you can hear it, the alarm is sensitive and loud so trying a different setting first to solve the pest or critter problem might be the way to go.  If you have it set up further away, etc... then just choose which mode seems to work best.Turning it on and off is as simple as holding the button down a little longer.  Switching modes is done by shorter clicks.  It comes with aluminum tubes that can be hooked together and then to the main unit.  I am using mine in a small flower pot so I am using the stake.  This can get wet but it isn't to be submersed.  I took extra precautions by putting it a little ways under the porch overhang where it will get a little wet from time to time but usually not drenched.  I have also chosen to run an outdoor extension cord to it since mine is fairly close to the house, this is very easy to do in my particular case.The instructions are simple and set up is minimal.  I highly recommend this product.*I was offered this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

Ok, let's be honest here. I knew what I was getting into--a little erotic fluff. I didn't expect much. But even so, I was disappointed. I really wish I had read this on my kindle so that I could search the word never to see how many times it popped up. Because that's basically what this book is, a list of things Ivan did that Erin had never encountered. Never had a man looked at her like that. Never had a man made her feel so safe. Never had a man touched her like that. Never had a man been so enticing. Never had she had a man with such a big c*ck. Never had a man made her come so often (seriously, it's inhuman how frequently and with so little effort she can climax).Never, never, never and that's before we even get into Ivan's nevers. Never had he seen a a woman look so innocent. Never had he been so mysteriously attracted to someone. Never had he let his guard down. Never had he broken his own rules, never, never, never. And these two people are supposed to have known each-other for 8 hours.The whole book is so oversimplified and ham-fisted I honestly think the author could have just listed the tropes and comparisons she was using and the story would have been just as discernible. Tattoos equal violence. Big equals manly. Small equals feminine. Big eyes equal innocence. Drug addiction equals whore. Even the attraction is instant and unexplained. Literally, "The instant we made contact an electric zing arced through me. What? Why?Then, to top it all off (and this is a little spoilery), the author wimped out on Ivan's past. She spent the whole book talking up how violent he must be, because he has so many tattoos (and yes, I get that tats in the Russian mob are supposed to be symbolic, but one would assume this was within reason), then it turns out he's horribly ashamed of his non-murderous (and frankly not that bad) history with the mob, thereby invalidating all the buildup.Lastly there was the sex. I mentioned Erin's propensity to insta-orgasm. We'll just leave that one alone. I'm afraid I just didn't find the sex scenes in this book erotic. Nothing in what was done or the way anything was described appealed to me. It read like a Ikea kit directions sheet--insert this here, turn that there, etc. It all left me skimming (and that's unfortunately not a euphemism of anything good).

I suppose there will be an audience out there for this book. It's trying very hard to be Douglas Adams-like and plenty of people (myself included) love Douglas Adams' quirky humor. IMHO, this doesn't quite make it though, as a Douglas Adam's clone or on it's own.On a positive note, it's well written and surprisingly well edited for a self-published book. There are some interesting, odd-ball characters and had the whole thing been a set up for Katie and Chintz's last moment's, I'd have called it a success. But it's about 1/3 too long (if not more) for that to be the case.If I had to condense this review to a few carefully chosen words, they would be presumptuous and self-indulgent. The author's constant breaking of the fourth wall especially. As if the book wasn't quite quirky enough the author/narrator had to stick his two cents in too. It was annoying and broke up the story.It was this over the top quirkiness that eventually ruined the book for me. You have characters who speak in mixed up, nonsense for no apparent reason at all. You have POVs from the perspective of a cat. You have a narrative style dedicated to pointing out the absurd over the expected, which could have been great if not quite so over played. You have philosophy passed off as science and science of the hard-core hand waving variety. It was all too much for me.And that is a shame, because Boyd's descriptive ability is wonderful. I appreciated the distinct lack of alpha hero and the success of the socially anxious, nerd heroes. I liked that there was a strong female character (though I'm borderline on the fact that her sexuality caused such ruptions. I think the book skirted the cliche, but JUST BARELY). But there was just too much else crowding these good things out. In the end, I bored and just hoping to finish.

This was almost a winner for me. It had an interesting world, interesting characters, a convoluted plot, and people/fairies doing things for deeply personal reasons. And for the most part, outside of some repetition, the writing was very readable. It could have been really really good. Instead, it was ok.There were several reasons for this. One, there were about 4 billion characters, each with a plot thread of their own. It was too much and became confusing. Two, the narratives, from all these characters perspectives were often provided to the reader in very brief snippets. At one point we got about a page of one character getting sea sick and then jumped away again. It was jarring and not a particularly engaging way to read a story. (It made the book feel very long.) Lastly, the book, with all its many many plot points doesnt wrap up. So, youve been presented with multiple mysteries, none of which are solved. This is a BIG no-no for me.All in all, it has some fun fantasy characters and the beginning of what will probably be an intriguing storyline 1,000 pages from now. If youre willing to commit to the long haul its worth picking up. I dont know that I am.

I thought this was a sweet little story. It's basically about two men falling in love, that's it, nothing flashy or exciting, but it's sweet. What saves it from being boring is that the two men in question are the type of men who rarely make it as main characters, a 43-year-old drifter/chronically homeless man and a 33-year-old crippled man with a traumatic brain injury. And the book proves that readers (or at least this one) don't need infallible, godly gorgeous, alpha men as heroes. I adored Chase and Jimmy (Chase especially).It is a bit of an insta-love, which is unfortunate, because it's not really supported. I have no idea why Chase tried so hard to keep Jimmy around, but I'm glad that he did. I also thought it was a little on the predictable side. But again, it's a fairly straight forward romance, so it wouldn't have been overly realistic to have too many twists and turns. All-in-all, it was a book that made me happy to see the HEA (even if it did get a little sappy there at the end).

Bah, it was ok but not much more. Here's the thing, the writing seemed fine but everything was waaaaaay over described and nothing of significance really happened. Don't get me wrong, things blew up, the air ship almost crashed like 400 times, people ran around and said droll things, but in terms of an overall story arc it didn't really show up until about page 350. Yes, the leaders had been kidnapped and the crew was rescuing them, but that's not really much of a plot as presented here. It's just an excuse to be off doing things.So, even though I checked this out of my local library along with the sequel, I'm returning them both. I'm not going to bother with the second book. I'm just not interested enough and I have a strong suspicion that, if it takes 350 pages to finally present the real plot in this book, it's probably the same in book two, which means I'll likely finish it little more satisfied than I am now. It's just not worth it to me.
It's a bit dated, the original articles being published between the mid-80s and early 2000s, but still interesting and very readable.

This one ticked a lot of boxes for me. I have come to love Hassell's writing style and his basic....I don't know what to call it, tone maybe. Just the way everything I've read by him, regardless of the genre, has a certain feel to it that I love. It's gritty. It's real. It's maybe even a little nihilistic. It pretends happily ever after can't exist, even if a character gets it in the end. Maybe you'd have to read his stuff for that to make sense.In Stygian Hassell has created a host of seemingly unlikable characters. I mean all of these guys repelled me at some point, some so much I didn't think they'd be redeemable. But Hassell pulled that off too. The whole thing is as creepy and atmospheric as you'd expect a gothic style, Southern horror novel to be, with a villain that's maybe a little more complex than first appearances suggest.My only real complaint is that I didn't really feel the connection between Kennedy and Jeremy. A lot of it is pre-existing, based on events prior to the time frame of the novel. I definitely felt what Hassell is doing here, but I had to just take his word for it. As much as I liked Kennedy and Jeremy (and I did), the strength of emotion seemed sudden. (Though some of this feeling was ameliorated after reading the prequels.)Lastly, there had better be a sequel or I may have to go a little Annie Wilkes on Hassell. (Ok, not really, but please be a sequel.)

A fun, if shallow read. I enjoyed Reylene's OCD self-identified craziness. I loved the drag queen side kick and I thoroughly enjoyed that the vampire love interests was a little broken and vulnerableno alpha a-holes here.It was a little on the predictable side and the writing was nothing extraordinary (though perfectly readable). Basically, the book was a fun, fluffy vampire read.

I really quite enjoyed this. I liked that it wasn't all action and blowing stuff up. I liked that there was a 35-year-old, tired out mother as a heroine. I like that the son wasn't a sniveling baby, but also wasn't overly confident. I liked that people were smart and could read between lines and such. I enjoyed the alternative world and the basic story-line. I also just plain enjoyed the writing style.I did think it got a little slow at times and dragged a little here and there. I also would have liked to have known the fate of the City-crew after Briar and Zeke left and there did seem to be a number of convenient coincidences. But all-in-all an enjoyable read.

Another fluffy, easy read. As in the first book, I liked Raylene's OCDness and the way she was just so matter of fact about it. I liked her side kick. I liked her family-building, as well as the fact that romance is hinted at but never becomes part of the story. I also liked the writing and narrative style, which is surprising as it's first person and I generally don't like first person. I did think this one came across as a little juvenile. Mostly because Raylene was tasked with hunting down baculum, which requires 14 thousand references to penis bones and the likes. It because apparent that this was there for comic effect, but it also made me feel like a 15 year old would have appreciated it more. Despite that, if there were a 3rd book I'd pick it up.

I picked this up as a random audiobook from the library. While nothing about it amazed me, I was amused throughout the entirety of it. Kitty's 'I've always been weak' bothered me, but it was also always in context of 'I'm not anymore,' so I dealt with it. I did feel like the book didn't really accomplish anything significant. The smaller mystery was solved, but the primary conflict wasn't and the book felt a little like a randomly selected period of time. But as a basic fluff read, the book did the job admirably. My library has the next two. I imagine I'll listen to them at some point.

When I came to write this review is when I discovered that this is a second in a series. I wouldn't have picked it up if I had known that. I like to read series in order. But I don't think having read the first book would have made me like it any more. But I am always baffled why publishers don't put that information on book covers. It's freakin' important!Anyhow, this book was a fail for me. My overall impression was of overpowering almost unbearable cheesiness. Everything about The Slayers was too perfect. Sorren flashed cash constantly, bought Micah new clothes, pampered his cat, had an easy solution for everything, etc. As an example, at one point Micah demands $1,000 a night as a fee in order to accept a job. This is apparently the going rate for a skilled dancer. (I don't know.) The counter offer was an apartment in the five star building, food, living expenses (hair cuts, clothes, massages, sex are listed as examples), and $5,000 a show. Um....too good to be true and painfully unbelievable. But pretty par for the course of a book trying too hard to be like a fairy tale.But my main complaint was with the characters. There was no depth at all, no history, no development. And as much as I like the occasional growly alpha a-hole, Sorren was just a dick. Here's a quote: "No! I refuse to discuss limitations, or contracts. I am a Dom and in my dungeon, we go by my rules. I will push you to the edge and you will trust me to give you pleasure." That pretty much sums the book up. That's the level of trust and communication presented as the norm. Keep in mind that these men have known each-other less than a day and this is his response to Micah's request for boundaries.There's an earlier scene, in which they had known each-other less than an hour and Micah asks Sorren if he's into edge play, 'cause for Sorren Micah claimed to be willing to learn it. Micah had never done more than be spanked and they were no discussing kink, but hey let's throw this random one out as an invitation. No matter that less than an hour earlier he'd watched his best friend get his throat slit and been stabbed himself. Of course knife play is gonna be exactly what the reader expects him to be fantasizing about. WTF? What the actual f*ck?Basically, I found the plot anemic, the use of "I'm a Dom" to excuse and explain almost everything in life irritating and artificially highlighted, the cheesy 'Dom-speak' like sandpaper, the villain cliche beyond words, the events predictable, Micah was TSTL, and the whole thing (almost every aspect of it) rushed and underdeveloped. The actual writing itself was fine. The book is easy enough to read, but not much of what was written actually appealed to me personally.

Oh man, some serious mixed feelings on this one, but I loved it overall. I thought it was marvelously written, with vivid, gritty characters and identifiable character growth that never, ever got sappy. Plus, the alternative present was interesting. It really made me stop and think about how easily computers could creep into our lives in insidious and destructive ways.I can't say it all worked out the way I would have liked. I was sorely disappointed in Jim's dismissal and Desmond sure isn't a likable character (I honestly don't think he earned or deserved his happily ever after. I'm glad he got it though.), but that's kind of his defining characteristic and I so appreciated that. All in all, I really glad to have read Meatworks and will be greedily looking to snag more JCP books in the near future.

I obviously wasn't looking for a serious read when I picked this book up to listen to. I thought it might be silly and fun, and since I never saw the movie, I'd at least know the plot then. The problem is that I didn't realize that it is a novel based on the screenplay for the movie, as opposed to the book the screenplay is based on. Thus, it reads just as a movie would play out and any of the additional depth that makes a book preferable to the screen is missing.While I the occasional shadows of important themes pop up, not a single one is ever explored or expanded on. The book is action-packed, but not much else. All-in-all, there wasn't much to recommend it. At least the movie had some cool actors in it; all this had was an overly breathy, over-acted voice. Meh

**Spoiler alert**I'm not planning to give anything significant away, but I do plan to discuss the ending.3.5I have some real mixed feelings on this one, because some aspects of it I really loved and others not so much.
