And, best of all, you get a small remote control that you can use to turn them on, turn them off, and set an automatic timer to keep them on for 4 hours, 8 hours, or 24 hours, after which they will turn off.  They run on inexpensive batteries, which last forever, and put out zero heat - no fire hazard.  And, the look and light and flicking is incredible.  The only thing you don't get is a scent - but then again there are other ways to get that besides candles.  We love them, and the price is great.  Highly recommend.

I'm a HUGE fan of P.G. Wodehouse, one of the most brilliiant humorists of the last century - probably longer.  His Jeeves and Bertie books stand head and shoulders at the top of British humor fiction.  And he achieves all of this without a plot - just a series of misadventures.  Bertie and Jeeves never really change - but their dialogue and predicaments and odd quirks and...the list goes on, are knee-slapping funny.  Still great, but lesser so, are the Blandings books, Psmith, and a few others.  But many of his earlier books, and those that stray from the tried and true characters and settings, leave us faithful waiting breathlessly for the crackling humor and craziness of his core novels, and as good as they are, they don't quite meet the standard.  At worst they "drag" a little - you keep waiting for the crisp, laugh on every page writing that one has become accustomed to.  Cocktail time is not unfunny nor unreadable, but just don't expect "classic" Wodehouse.

This is either a long short story or a novella, easily read in one or two sittings.  While the plot is a litle contrived, it is eminently readable. The author knows how to turn a phrase, set up and describe a scene, and transition along at a good pace without bogging down.  It comes close (but no cigar) to being a "page turner," which is not bad for this price point.  It held my interest and, despite what other reviewers have written, I had no problems with the ending (i.e. "saw it coming", "unsatisfactory", etc.).  In a story this short you can't really delve into every character's psyche or motivation (in this case the "bad person"), so, again, it didn't bother me.  Probably perfect for a 2-3 hour airplane trip, or an afternoon read at the beach or cabin.

I am a little bit of an "over the top" person on flashlights - I have them stashed all over the house and garage, and I love the new LED models - they are infinitely brighter than the older models, and much smaller in size.  I was going to get an extendable inspection mirror with a led lights when I saw this LED flashlight, extendible with a flexible end section (about the last 3-4 inches can be curved as needed) AND it also has an attachable inspection mirror - two tools in one!  After receiving it, I can tell you the quality is excellent. The mirror attaches very securely and easily to the flashlight tip and stays there.  There are magnets at both ends of the flashlight - the back (so you could attach it to something without having to hold it while you're doing work) as well as on the lighted end (i.e. to both see and pick up metal items in tight spaces).  The perfect combination tool - a must for your toolbox.

I was asked to review "Jarrow Formulas Jarro-Zymes for Gluten Digestion Capsules, 60 Count", however, I am only instructed to review it on this product page. Which makes no sense.  So I have no choice but to leave a middle rating since I cannot properly review it.However, the gluten digestion product I have been taking as advised is a good product with no adverse effects.  I have had no stomach discomfort and trust that it does help with it's purpose as I feel less bloated and gassy when I normally would feel as such.  However, 30 days is not really enough time to evaluate the product.  But so far so good.  If gluten is a problem for you, it certainly would not hurt to try it.  I will continue to use it in the future.

I had a 30 day supply, and was asked to review this product before 30 days.  It is very hard for anyone to accurately review something in such a short period of time.  However, for the short time I have used it, I am happy with the fact that my skin feels healthy and not as sore after outdoor activity.  But I really cannot say this did anything beneficial.  Only thing I can say is that I had no negative reactions.  As someone that loves being outside in any weather, hiking, backpacking, camping etc. I would be interested to continue this regimen.

Pretty simple to use for quick touch-ups. Perfectly fine for clean sideburns and neck hair removal.  The three combs make the tool easy to use without error when maintaining your desired length of facial hair, but also cleaning up chest and other body hair without complete removal.  I've been using the mangroomer tools for removal of back hair and hard to reach places.  But is okay for daily use for your main areas of grooming.  The charge lasts quite a while.  I tend to charge it once a week, but it has never really discharged all the way yet.  It cleans well without worry of water damage.

I feel like we have been tolerating the same water pitcher for far too long.  Plenty of competition, but other that an LED light, which is not really that new, it's still an annoying water pitcher with a reservoir that is too small, and clumsy to use.  However, still a quality filter which does filter water well.  So it's basically down to selecting which water filter suits your needs and fitting into a pitcher that stores well in your fridge.  You replace the filter every couple months no matter what.  And I usually just toss the entire thing away once a year, hoping for improvements.  They are cheap enough, but still looking for something less bulky and easier to handle.  We have no found that yet.  In the meantime, this is fine with a an acceptable price point.

I like this invigorating feel it gives without leaving my hair feel dry. The scent is light enough, but fresh.  My scalp tends to get dryer in the winter, so this is perfect timing to get in the routine of a shower regimen to help curb dandruff and flaking.  Though it is made for men, it seems to be more about the scent, which would work for anyone.I don't understand the price point.  Unless it is an error.  But the list price at $25 a bottle is ridiculous.  Currently a list price of $155 for 6 bottles cannot be right.  However, it works well, and leaves your head and skin feeling fresh.

I enjoy Ocean Spray's sparkling water diet drink, so thought I would try this.  The sparkling is nice at night or with a meal. But the Pact waters are a refreshing choice for after a work out or other activity.  A little sweet raspberry and tart cranberry, but without sugar, so that is important to me.  It is best very cold.  Cranberries are a great antioxidant with cleansing abilities, and it's a great way to enjoy the benefits.  There are four flavors. I just wish there were a plain cranberry version as opposed to raspberry, pomegranate, mango etc.  But I like the raspberry.

This is a good buy based on how many you get and how long they last.  I started using them for simple tasks like dishes and cleaning bathroom etc. But also used them for raking and picking up leaves. But our true test was using them during our painting project over the past couple weekends.  We decided to see how long they would last and painted two rooms and a hall.  We only used about two pair between the two of us each day.  So tears or leaks, and hands completely paint free with no penetration.  I don't really have any chemical related tasks, but for these to protect and last so long with our uses is impressive.

After a few days of use, I am quite happy with this lotion.  I will follow up in about 30 days for results.I have been using this lotion right before I leave the house for a long morning walk.  It offers great SPF and firms well in the open air.  It has a bit of a scent, and I am very anti-scent, but this is tolerable, light and natural.  It applies easily and absorbs quickly. I almost want to apply another lotion on top, but after physical activity in the morning, I find that even with sweat, the lotion stays on well.  Apply on a clean face, and I merely rinse when I return.  I have been using it a couple times a day.  I would say it is fine for sensitive skin, as I typically need to choose that option.  No issues at all.The firming aspect is yet to be seen, that is why I will follow up. But I do feel is invigerates the skin slightly, and the quick drying nature makes sense. Does not dry the skin, just absorbs quickly.  So I put about 5 dots on my face and work in to get best coverage.  Burt's Bees have come a long way, obviously with company takeover, but still feels like a more natural selection for skin care.

Nice big bag of perfectly milled hemp for many uses of added protein.  I enjoy this in my smoothies.  I tend to do a cacao and PB2 blend with veggies with coconut water and ice, and also add chia, flax, and sometimes Maca.  I love a nutty taste and this certainly brings that out.  It blends well, no clumps, very smooth and easy.  I have also made protein pancakes with this product as well as added to oatmeal.  So many uses making it very easy to add more protein in your diet that does not always need to be a drink.  It's a big 3 pound bag that will last a while, and reseals.  This size is the most economical choice.

I'd rather just drink a gatorade, but admittedly, these a easy to pack in little envelopes.  They don't taste too great, but tolerable.  Do I notice anything from them, not really.  But nothing bad.Though I would rather drink Gatorade, not really.  It would be a last resort if I did not have fruit.  The corn syrup add to the high sugar count and nothing about the sugar and sodium is appealing.  Not for casual use. You better be ready to work it off.Unlikely I would ever buy these.  But I like the attempt.  I certainly would not pay their list price regardless.

Even at the list price, it's a pretty decent deal.  But currently on the date of this review, it's almost half off.  I have many air purifiers all over the house due to allergies. I have reviewed many due to my constant use.  So my 5 star rating is not based on the precise quality of cleaning, but the value for your money.The HEPA filtration is impressive. And the Ionizer option is great.  I remember wasting money on the Sharper Image Ionizer towers that did nothing.  Without airflow, it does not work.  This has both.  With three speeds, I find medium works perfectly in my office and any sound is hardly noticeable. I also like the compact nature of it as is fits well on top of my bookshelf without taking much room.Typically when a purifier is in this price range, they lure you in to be stuck paying high prices for filters that don't last long.  Though I have only had it a month, Holmes suggest changing the filter every 12-18 months.  That is amazing.  But the filters are very inexpensive.  So even if you had a heavy pollen or dust situation, you are not breaking the bank feeding this thing filters.  This takes an "A filter", but on this page it suggests or shows "Frequently Bought Together"... and that filter is fine, but there is a better updated one, and it's cheaper.  Ber sure to get the "HAPF30AT4-U4R".  The single pack is the one to buy, also, if you use Amazon's "Subscribe and Save", you could set it to send every six months, and save 15%.  And if you find you don't need it that soon when you are reminded, just choose a different date or "skip" that delivery.

So far so good. It's a heavier cream with glycerin and oils that remain while key ingredients are absorbed.  I have used it during the day when I know I will not be seeing anyone.  Just because it does shine a bit.  I do like the natural extracts and attention to less chemical ingredients put into the jar, as there are so many.I do have sensitivity to scents and perfumes, and this does have a flowery overtone, but not too bad.  At first I was afraid to put it on but stuck with it and ultimately wish it was not added.  There is no definition as to what the "parfum" is except that it is natural.  So maybe that's why it's not annoying me that much.I like to put it on at night, but not at bed time.  It will get on your pillow, so I want some time for it to absorb.  So a couple hours before bed I will apply.  It has a light invigoration to it, not unpleasant.  I exfoliate and cleanse before applying, so that would add to the sensation. The firming result is quite good.  For the short time I have had it (one jar) I am pleased with it, and will try other Burt's Bees extended line of products.

Yes the price points of these products are a bit obnoxious, however, once you start receiving compliments, you may rethink the value.The first time I tried this exfoliate, I wasn't very impressed.  I lightly washed my face prior to use.  Applied a generous amount to my face, scrubbed in circular motions, and left on for about ten minutes.  Rinsed off and applied my normal moisturizer.  I didn't feel or see anything different.  However, a few days later, I repeated the process, but got a phone call.  It was left on for at least twenty minutes, and I could start feeling the soft and natural oil result.  Before it just felt like a typical apricot scrub.  But with more time to sit, it really felt great.  It was also easier to rinse the second time.  Applying moisturizer felt like it was merely blending with my skin and not just layering on top.My skin appeared to me a bit more even toned and refreshed.  Obviously the scrub aspect bring out your color, but there was a definite change in softness and radiance.  But the true result were friends going out of their way to tell me how good my skin looks and asking me what I did etc.  That's pretty huge since I could care less and never asked them.  I did nothing different except use this exfoliate along with my normal lotion.I am highly sensitive to scents, perfumes and fragrance in general and the product did not bother me at all.  I am assuming the organic and natural ingredients were the reason I had no issue.  So for the price, it is most certainly a splurge or luxury product, but even if used prior to special events or occasionally, it would be worth giving a try and having on hand.  If they cut the list price in half, I would use it regularly and explore their other products.

Looking at it in the photos I'm sure you might think this piece of plastic is not holding anything.  But even in it's lightweight form, it is perfectly formed to secure substantial weight and keeping moving units safely put.  Though primarily made for a castor type wheel to keep from spinning, the block has several uses keeping poles secure, or other rolling objects in place.  We tried using it with success for stabilizing an awning pole, moped, small trailer, and a basic car tire block.  The bright orange provides further safety in case of breakdown lane situations.  For the price, it's quite obvious that buying about four would be a great set for many uses.

This took some time getting up and running because I didn't want to risk doing it myself.  I relied on a neighbor and his friend to help me out.  So I was lucky to get away with the cost of a case of beer, and a game or two in the future.  This is an invasive permanent installation, so you really have to commit to where this is going.  However, once you find the right spot, you are able to adjust viewing angles in all directions with ease.I have a 60" screen and never really trusted the thought of it being mountable in a movable form due to size.  But after seeing what when into the instal, I trust it is safe.  They obviously needed to mount to a stud, but he also reenforced with a an interior cross beam, basically connecting the parallel studs together.  All beyond me, but after a slight mess and worry, the mount was securely inserted and functional.The result is more like an unexpected feature since it appears flush like a wall hanging, but you can view from any direction without much effort with a very smooth glide in the direction you wish.  I can now watch from the kitchen from a distance if I wanted to.  The ergonomic design is well thought out and built to last.  I will be adding a frame around the opening and the wiring will be hidden inside the wall.  So that will require an electrician just for aesthetics for when it is pulled away from the wall.  But for now, it's fine.I have another 60" tv and will buy an additional OmniMount now that I see how it works and the quality function is has.  It saves a lot of room and looks great, like a art on the wall.  Very impressed.

A change of plans, as after measuring door frames, ceiling heights and room widths, we thought this would be no problem.  But, no.  This so large with no give to bending or maneuvering.  But, that just proves that it is a very sold piece of furniture.  Not a thrown together thing from a Swedish meatball shop.  So the change just meant this is never making it upstairs, therefore, it goes into the guest room downstairs. And that box spring goes upstairs.  Problem solved.  Sorta, Serta.A key factor, if you have a an ... uhmm... active bed, is that is makes no noise.  And as of now, it does not.  I truly seems solid and built to last exceeding it's list price value.  Issues I have had with box springs in the past have been the durability of the fabric.  Only having it 30 days, I can just guess it will last quite a while.  There is plenty of breathing mesh underneath and does not seem like it will tear easily.  You really have to pay attention to the seems of all fabric and the types used, not for comfort, but safety.  Since this is closer to the ground, it is your first risk of inviting bed bugs to your body buffet.  In other words, I don't see it to be a problem.It's a minimum of a two person job to get this anywhere.  Very heavy in the shipping (freight) box, but once out, it's only a movement issue as to where you want it.  Clear your walls of pictures etc.  Put towels on the corners to not mark the walls etc.  It is admittedly a mid-level quality choice, but at this price, it is quite the value.  Even if you ended up needing to buy another sooner than another brand, two for the price of one just means a cleaner life span.

I have never heard of the Adams brand, but I see no difference in quality and effectiveness.  It is easy to use and apply, no mess, and seems to do the trick.  Our backyard tends to get a ton of fleas and mosquitoes around this time.  We only have the one dog, but he has been flea and tick free since application of almost a month ago.  I like the applicator and the fact that it is reusable with refills.  I will need a couple months of treatments to fully evaluate.  But so far so good.

Right off the bat I have to say this stuff does not stink. It is such a huge thing with me as typically such bronzers or self-tanners etc. have a smell that I cannot tolerate. Super sensitive to chemical and fragrance. This smells like nothing.  Thank you.I want to point out that I am a man with lighter olive skin, stay away from sun and most all related products.  I don't care where I am suppose to use it, but I used it on my face, neck and arms first.  LIked the result, so used full body for shorts weather.  I do not see any glittery effect, but it certainly helps blend skin tone, and the glow is more about a fresh look.As far as the slimming effect, I don't believe it does anything alone.  If I had the line of products needed I could better review the result.  For what it is, it is expensive.  I would not pay more than 20 bucks for it, and that's only because I like the lack of respiratory problems.A regular guy like myself should not be afraid of the pink can.  But I think many should agree that the name "Fatgirlslim" is just ridiculously stupid.  Yeah, I get the dated reference. Not sure many would though, therefore, could prove insulting.  And alienating for my demographic.  "Hide and Go Sleek" however is very good and clever.

I am actually a long-time TheraBreath product user.  I have used their rinse, toothpaste and even their mints and gum.  However, just the normal original strength versions.  I don't use them every day.  Just on days where I want to be sure and confident that the breath is important.  This is about eliminating the causes of bad breath, not covering it up temporarily with a minty fresh flavor or alcohol based wash.This toothpaste is not normal in a sense of what you are used to.  You don't use water.  You brush as you would typical paste, however, you are not going to get the rabid foam dripping down your hand.  You are merely treating your breath with your brush.  Brush as you normally would, but don't expect invigoration.  Expect your mouth to feel naturally clean.The "PLUS" series is new to me, and I already love it.  The normal series is still great for regular but periodic use.  But I will be using the Plus version for events, parties, meetings and dates from now on.  It definitely has an extra boost of clean as a result, and lasts a bit longer to me.Yes, it is expensive, but used at periodic times, it will last quite a bit.  You don't need much product when using them.  A little goes a long way.  It will take some getting used to. But do a before and after with your mate to test the result.  You may just get a little more action than usual.A tip for you.  For $1 and free shipping, if you go to their web site and enter Coupon Code: BTVK100 (current on May 2015) you will get the travel kit which contains a sample of everything.  Mouthwash, toothpaste, mints, gum and even a tongue scraper.  They also include coupons.  I'm sorry if the code does not work when you read this.  If it does not, just google "therabreath $1", just pay attention to the search result to make sure it is their web site.  It's a good way to try everything since it would be costly to buy all the normal sizes at once.

It's not a curling iron.  It's a straightening device that happens to also curl.I've been a licensed cosmetologist since the 80's. My most popular in demand service was hair straightening.  And I never used chemicals.  I was all about blow out.  I could straighten any type of hair with a blow dryer and roller brush.  However, you pay for it, because I do it right and it can take over an hour depending on your hair.I'm not big on novelty devices or tools that eliminate your creative methods.  But I will try anything once.  This is well made, but for the home, a single person use iron.  The appeal with this device is that it does is correctly, and well, if you do it correctly and well.  People that brush there hair and just iron it is damaging the hair and it never looks straight.  If it is not straight, flowing and shiny, then the person that did it, if not yourself, did it wrong.  There is no reason why your hair cannot be straight without chemicals.  Since the only correct way to straighten is with roller brush and heat, this is very impressive tool to do exactly that, continuously roiling the hair with heat.  The roller goes in both directions at your desired level, and control of heat.  The incorporated brush sounds simply enough, but is the answer to getting the shine.The list price is okay, but my opinion is that is needs to be about 20% less.  But due to the quality and the fact you would pay this amount or more for a stylist to do it once, it is worth every penny.If you are not getting the shiny flowing straight hair result, you are not holding the hair tight enough.  Start as close to the root as possible and don't overload the chamber.  The length is there for wrapping.  Not straightening.  You should not be working more than 2" width of hair and keep the hair taught all the way to the end.  If you're hair is sagging at all during this, you will burn your hair.  If you have very long hair, you have a lot of work to do, and the length of your arms will be tough.  Just don't do a portion of a section.  If you cannot handle the length, you will need to get a friend to do it for you.  Someone that is not afraid of pulling your hair tight.  Your hair should not be wet when using the iron.  You should use a roller brush and blow dry your hair just a bit.  Then use the iron.  And finish by blowing with a roller brush again so the strands are loose and flowing.It's not a professional tool, to me, but close.  I'm not sure how long the ionic bristles will last, but for home use, it should last quite a while.  There are very important features that seem simple, but the fact the power cord is 6' long and swivels means you will not get tangled, and will be able to get to any angle easily.  The handle is comfortable and ergonomic which helps since this process takes a while.  But it takes half the time than just using a brush and dryer.  Use an alcohol free gel before ironing, and your work will last a few days.  Wear a hair net to bed, and not a hat or scarf as your hair needs to breath and sweat will ruin your work.  Extend it even more with dry spray shampoo.

Sadly I was among the few that received an advanced copy of the Mayor's book, and while reading it, he passed. It certainly brought a higher level of emotion as we examine how much the man did for so many, without one word of boasting.  There was a reason he made history winning a fifth term of my great city. He was loved.Mayor Menino was never about politics or party.  He was truly about the people.  From 1993, I remember my career in Boston just starting to take off and as he took office, you could immediately see the changes in employment, education and the quality of the city in general.  We had some really rough areas before he got into office.  So many high profile neighborhoods and business locations were dangerous.  Streets of filth, homelessness, drugs, violence, prostitution and the "combat zone". There will always be issues with homeless and crimes, but it certainly got better for many.  You never see crime in the city anymore.  You feel safe walking anywhere at night.  And the combat zone or porn theaters and sex shops are just plane gone.  What took over was our thriving theater district giving NYC something to look out for.  All really just a taste of the good he did for our city.Our thriving economy due to President Clinton can also be connected to Mayor Menino.  They worked well together, and everything was perfect until the bush years.  But even so, he pulled us through.  Jobs were threatened, but not the people.  A disaster was taking place across the country, but he kept our city above water.Massachusetts is proud to be the first state for marriage equality.  Such a controversial issue, but he showed the ignorant that love is love.  The support for the gay community is widely unappreciated.  There is so much acceptance in jobs and living in general in the city, and he so encouraged people to be who they are.  Nothing was about gay rights.  It was about civil rights.  He recognized the difference and it was never a gay issue.  Just equality.  He even officiated weddings and supported all students to have pride, no matter what lifestyle they lived.  It is such a great example of how he truly loved his city, the people, and expression.It's is upsetting to think about the Boston Marathon bombing.  Not only for the city to be in such shock and fear, but knowing the Mayor's health was failing.  He was in so much physical pain, but demanded to stand for his city.  It was horrible and extraordinary.  Governor Patrick knows the importance of the man, and I wanted to leave this quote:Mayor Menino started Monday morning frustrated he couldnt be at the finish line this time, as he always is, and then late that afternoon checked himself out of the hospital to help this city, our city, face down this tragedy.It's just one more example of how he was our rock.  Our anchor.  Our friend.This is not a memoir putting himself on a pedestal, even though we put him there. It is a side we never saw.  His true feelings of all the great experiences the city has seen, be it good or bad.  He reveals so much more about how he found strength to accomplish so much.I cannot even tell you the name of our new Mayor.  I don't even care to google it.  He was forgotten as soon as he took office.This is required reading for all leaders, or those who think they are leaders.  This is how it's done.

Fake leather. Smelly cheap vinyl. Poorly made China crap.  Can barely hold two cards of any kind, one being the useless ID slot.  The poor wallet it too tight and will not hold anything.  The fake red bookmark will fall off soon.  If this was found in a dollar store, it would be overpriced.

First off... perfect timing!  New England has been going through waves of extreme weather, cold winds and rain.  Just like today.  It's a mess outside.  Cold and damp inside.  So I opened the box, plugged it in, put the included Duracell batteries in the remote, and was up and running in a minute.  The controls are simple.  Power button, arrow up and down to select temperature, or select a temperature and set a timer.  I set it to 67, it went from 61 to 67 in less than five minutes, filling a room to a comfortable atmosphere.  You can hear the fan, but it's not an intrusive sound.  If playing stereo or TV, you don't notice.  In fact, in bedroom, the sound is a nice white noise.I was concerned with the air intake and it picking up dust etc, but there is a washable filter easily removed from the back from a flip-down cover.  There is no heat concern to the unit itself.  It's very safe and secure.An appealing aspect is that this is actually a nice piece of furniture.  Made of solid hardwoods and real wood veneers. A very heavy piece, however, the hidden casters makes moving it along the floor super easy.  From room to room, Grandma and move it with no problem, nor will she be confused on how to use it.  Scratch the wood along the way?  They were nice enough to include a matching furniture scratch marker.At 1500 Watts, I am not sure how the energy consumption will hurt the electric bill.  However, with the quick response in filling a room and automatic shutoff thermostat, I am confident this would help save fuel costs.  My primary heat is oil, and I am looking forward to using this unit in the coming months.  And it looks nice as opposed to an ugly space heater.The export area of heat is not one of those fake flames things.  It does glow orange in the opening, but doe not project light to distract.  It's a very comfortable unit that is easy to use, and would recommend to anyone looking for a secondary heater.

I've used a few variations of Maca before, and buying it is tough as not all are the same.  It depends on the variety which could be black, red, and in this case, yellow.  There are forms in capsules, but I like the raw aspect and finding various uses.  It is most certainly an acquired taste, as it really is it's own.  So I can only put it in a family of flavors based on nuts, harvest and cider.  To me, it's a perfect Autumn ingredient.  I go with what I taste and build on it, and it leads to a few different uses.For smoothies, it's an excellent additive.  Especially in a protein shake.  I enjoy a combination of ground flax, cacao, peanut powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, chia, coconut water, a slash of soy milk, agave and heaping teaspoon of the maca powder.  Blend with ice, and it's a nice wake up.The smell of this Maca powder is quite unique.  It inspired me to make a pumpkin soup.  Honestly, all the above ingredients except the cacao and ice, blended, with a bit more chia, add a little minced onion and parsley, heated, was a surprisingly tasty soup on the first try.I also tried broiling chicken breast by making a "breading" of flax flour, Maca powder and sesame seeds, dipping the chicken breast in soy milk and coating with the mixture.  Baking at 400 for about 15 minutes.  Quite good with a side of squash.The quality is top notch, and a generous supply.  Only a teaspoon needed per serving.

I'm not a big fan of the Pure Protein, but keep trying their products thinking it all can't be bad.  I've tried several of their protein bars in the past and all have been quite awful to the point of not being able to complete an entire bar, and wasting the rest.  So far "S'mores", "Peanut Butter, Caramel Surprise" and various "Chocolate Peanut Butter" types all have been intolerable.  I decided to give their canned shakes a try, and, well, yuck.  Frosty Chocolate (Pack of 12) and I managed to get down two in a couple weeks. It's nasty chalk water.  I used it for a smoothie base to not waste them, but it's so watery that it does not blend well.. and it's already blended.So this was my next attempt at this line with a small tub of protein powder.  Not sure where "Mixed Berry" comes into play, but it's okay as a base for a fruit smoothie.  Drinking on it's own is not so great, but blending with greens and frozen banana makes it more tolerable with less odd sweet aftertaste.  There are plenty of mixes and additives that make such drinks unpleasant.  But a protein shake should have the ability to be enjoyed with a simple mix with water.I didn't totally hate this product because it serves a purpose.  The protein source is good, and nutrient additives are fine.  It also remains low fat and sugars.  So it's not so bad if you are creative.  But when I get a protein powder, I want it to be easy to use and enjoy.

Corel has really stepped up to the plate in the last couple years. Wisely watching the missteps of Adobe, and not following their path.  But this pretty much gives them a home run. I have used Photoshop for many years, then, Adobe happened.  Basically tolerated it, but no more. Software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop etc. has been replaced by CorelDRAW, Paint Shop Pro and a suite of Corel editing and creation tools. Now their amazing Painter outdoes itself.  No subscription obligation required.First off, if you have a Wacom tablet, buy this software yesterday.  If you don't, you will want one after you play with this in a matter of minutes.  Though a tablet is not necessary with plenty you can do with your mouse, the control of a pen makes this absolutely perfect.This is obviously great for professional use, but it is also just fine for budding artists.  I actually also recommend getting this for children.  The creative freedom here is endless.  Also, if you give it to a 10 year old, you'll have someone to teach you!  Don't underestimate the child's mind.  I say this because once you begin the program you will be overwhelmed with so much, you might think it's over your head.  Beginners can simplify their fears and go at their own pace.  You will see the only overwhelming aspect is that there are a bazillion brushes and tools to choose from.  Just click and play around.  You can save your favorite brushes etc. for easy access.  You won't ruin any image.  If you make an error or something you don't like, you can undo anything or start over.  There is definitely a lot to learn, but you truly learn by doing here.I am using the program on my MacBook Pro 2012, 2.7 GHz, 16gb memory, Intel HD Graphics 4000 1024 MB. I have had the software for almost a month, and have been running the OS X Yosemite (beta and new) and having no problems, freezing or crashing.  Very fast response and no lag, so there is a flawless flow of brushing and drawing.The variety of brush categories are endless as there are sub categories as well.  But there are also many special effects giving you access to create with patterns and color mixes. Also playing with photos is fun with features like tracing paper and making a painting out of any photo. There are some software programs out there that just create painting effects on photos, but you dont have any creative input.  With Painters version, you still have access to all the brushes and the tracing paper allows you to be as detailed as you would like.There is an app in the Apple app store called Cinco for Painter by Corel, but apparently they have no plans on updating it for 2015 since its last update was 2012.  It would be great to have the mobile app.  There is supposedly and app specifically for Android, but I do not have access.  I have Kindle HDX and its not available.  Maybe its coming soon.  And so far no books that I can find for training.  But, again, you really do learn by just using it.  You teach yourself easily, but be patient.  There is a lot to see and do!

This infuser is specifically for the Autoseal West Loop travel mug line, and it's the perfect accessory for premium tea lovers.  No more teabags and mess.  The clever design is very well made and securely clicks under the mug lid.  The infuser is well made and includes a quality plastic cup cover.  You can use the cup to put the infuser in to stop steeping and catch drips.  If you are going somewhere that you have hot water, and just fill the infuser with tea and brew when you are ready.  You can also reuse the previous tea leaves to refill.  So there are many elements of travel use.  Feel safe to throw in a bag, or desk drawer etc.  Of course keeping it hot is key, and the mug needed it retains heat for about 4-5 hours. So it makes for a great pair.  The mugs come in many colors so the set would make a great holiday gift.  If just a diffuser, a perfect stocking stuffer.

Clever.  It reminds me of something that would be on Shark Tank.  But would they take it seriously?  Sure, why not?  However, this concept needs to be adjusted and improved.You get a lot of pieces, but essentially you are getting 6 caps for what is currently a list price of 20 bucks. 15 would be more acceptable.  10 would make it a known household item.  I am thinking doubling the content, getting rid of the useless bag, and a plastic tub to keep them clean.  But, with that said, the plastic pull tops do not feel like they are going to last. The quality of of dish detergent bottle is better in comparison.  So we are are paying for the legs so things stand up.  The point.All the pieces help you get the right fit for your ketchup, syrups, soaps and other things that would be easier to use if upside down.  However, I don't like the fact that the pull tops may touch the surfaces.  The legs need to be higher.  If anything, it's the legs that need to be adjustable.  Even if they flipped up and down.  So, I don't like using them with consumable items.  Telling us to boil them before use in the instructions was a bit odd as well.  They are supposed to be dishwasher safe, but I wouldn't.The last issue would be the washers (gaskets) that are merely styrofoam rings that will never last.  You slide them into the caps to help keep the liquid from leaking. There are extra washers included, but enough for one replacement each.  Clearly a rubber washer would have been the lasting choice. The price deducts a star, the questionable longevity another, and replacement pieces sold separately, the third star.I think anyone looking at this, in person, or even just the photos could not answer this question positively...would you pay over 3 bucks to cap one bottle of ketchup that probably will not last and will need replacement rings?No.This company makes drain stoppers, and they look interesting.  They are made of stainless steel with rubber gaskets.  Not THAT would make more sense for this product.  Plus it would give the item bottom weight. And they would last for years.  That is an item I would pay up to 8 bucks for each cap.  (hint hint)

I was not expecting much from a vacuum at this price point, but I am pleasantly surprised.  If you have a room or area that is hard to get to with your regular vacuum, then this is a solution.  Even if you don't have room for it in that area, it is so light that you won't struggle to get it there.  We are using it for a hallway entry that is annoying to clean with the regular machine.The most important thing with me personally is that it does not trigger my allergies.  And, it does not.  So far so good.  It has great suction and does not expel dust.  The unit requires bags (UD30010) and though I have not needed to change the bag yet, it is very secure and easy to discard without risk of spill.  However, it will still be removed outside.I would suggest that it would be a great machine for use in a dorm.  Not much space, and easy to use.  But maybe the bags would be a bad thing for students to deal with. But it's also a good choice for elderly that have mobility issues.  Once again, the unit being light is a major plus here, and it does a lot of work without much effort.Even at the list price, it is quite a bargain.  If it breaks, it not much of a loss compared to repairing or replacing a higher end machine.  The plastic aspect is actually appealing as it is clearly easier to recycle..

Keep in mind it's pretty small.  Smaller than a sheet of paper. But purposely sized to fit in a locker.  For what it is, it's fine.  But, let's face it. it's a cheap sheet of plastic (not a normal wipe off board) with a pen cup and "mirror".  The mirror is unbreakable as it's not exactly a mirror. But it is reflective and serves it's purpose.  It has a very strong magnet on the back.  I would have give this a higher rating, but I cannot justify this thing at 20 bucks.  It's an 8 buck item.

My Father is 71 and does not deal well with change.  He has been welding countless things of all types all my life.  Never as a primary business.  Mainly as an obsessive hobby.  Not only to repair or service machinery but also to create artistically in various forms mostly in sculpture.  I realized that I don't remember him ever using any other helmet except the one the same one that looks like it came out of a bad 60s sci-fi movie.  So I decided to get this because I knew he would hold nothing back and tell me how bad it was.When I first showed him the package, he laughed hysterically and went back to work. "Very funny".  Clearly thinking it was a toy and was humored by the flames.  But once I convince him to try it, I told him I would read the directions with him.  After a few mumbles under his breath putting the thing on, he took me to the garage.  He sparked up and had no idea what he was supposed to do and then instantly realized its doing it for him.  Amazed at the automatic darkening and he loved that he did not have to remove or lift it constantly.  A clear view when safe, and adjusts to all conditions to protect.  He loves that he can adjust to his preferences and I pretty much will never see it again.  I told him about the  solar power aspect, so he has it set on a hook near the window.The helmet looks pretty cool on.  If its your gig, its a must buy. Initially we were concerned about the lightweight feel and plastic aspect, but the thing is super durable, and the weight is obviously a big plus.  An easy to wear helmet customized to the user in every way, and clearly a lot safer that older helmets.  Well worth the money.

Dear GREENPEACE:I just want you to know that as a supporter of Greenpeace for decades, I have had just about enough of your ignorance and juvenile actions.  You no longer represent me or my beliefs.You are doing more harm than good by recruiting trolls exclaiming "rabble rabble rabble!" with no purpose, just to abuse the review and rating system of a cell phone.  You ignorant freaks send hundreds of these trolls to rate a product they do not own, and know nothing about WHY they are rating it as such. Talk about "dirty energy"!It is a discussion.  Not a freaking game.  Amazon and it's head staff, founders and developers have done more for the environment than Greenpeace has ever done.  If you got your heads out of your arses you would be able to see that.So continue your stupid slanderous campaign, as each day continues to devalue your organization and embarrass all that supported you in the past or present.  Clearly all these kids needed something to do with their time when not folding shirts at Hot Topic.I believe this is the end of your organization and you deserve every backlash there is that will bring you down.I regret every dollar and minute of my time ever devoted to your "organization".Amazon is surely going to address this abuse, the allegations and accusations.  I trust this company and it's ultimate purpose and they do not deserve any of this ridiculous harassment.Based on the plethora of negative reviews, I will now consider buying the Amazon Fire Phone, because I know Amazon stands behind their product.  I also know that if I am not happy in any way, they will always make it right.PROOF that Greacepeace is the cause of the negative reviews, due to a flooding campaign by David Pomerantz "Greenpeace USA Senior Energy Campaigner":us.greenpeace.org/site/TellAFriend?msgId=43061.2In case Greenpeace removes the page, here is all of the text reply you get after submitting your letter to Jeff Bezos that they wrote for you:-----------------------------------------------------------Friend -Thank you for telling Amazon's Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos to finally come clean about his company's energy performance and environmental impact. Making this information public is the first step to getting Amazon to clean up its act.And the more the company hears from its customers, the quicker it will happen. Let's take this to the next level by talking to Amazon in the one language we absolutely know it understands: product reviews!HELP flood Amazon.com with 1-star reviews for their first ever smartphone, the Amazon Fire.Why the Fire? The recently released Fire phone's major boast is its unlimited cloud data storage ... but there's a BIG catch. Unlike Apple's iCloud which is powered by 100% renewable energy, Amazon's cloud data centers are run on dirty energy like coal, gas and nuclear power.Amazon's Fire's reliance on dirty energy isn't cutting edge, and it's completely unnecessary. Storing our photos, music and messages shouldn't mean we are forced to damage the health of our climate and communities. Apple, Facebook, and Google have figured out how to store our photos and music with renewable energy, and so can Amazon. These reviews will show Amazon that it's time to move to modern energy sources and make a "smarter phone" supported by clean, renewable energy.Do you have an Amazon.com account? Great! Now, take these TWO easy steps to tell Amazon to shape up:1) Copy the following review (or just write your own):It's time to put out the Fire! It makes sense why the price of the Fire has dropped to 99 cents, when its key feature - unlimited photo storage in the cloud - comes with a hidden cost. The Fire's reliance on dirty energy like coal and gas to power its cloud is not a strong selling point, especially when competitors like Apple are using 100% clean, renewable energy. If Amazon can commit to using modern energy sources, then maybe I could consider giving the Fire a higher review.2) Click HERE to leave a 1-star review on the Amazon Fire Phone product page:Pssst ... don't forget to click "one" star when you paste your review. And you may need to log into your Amazon.com account first before accessing the review page.Thank you again for taking action. Time and time again we've seen that your support makes a big difference in getting companies like Amazon to embrace better policies. As an Amazon.com customer, it's important they hear from you directly.For a greener internet and future,David PomerantzGreenpeace USA Senior Energy Campaigner-----------------------------------------------------------

Excellent quality for instant photo printing.  The ability to print a crisp photo up to 8"x10" so quickly is impressive.  Take a photo with your ironed, use the app to send to your printer wirelessly and have it hanging on the wall in an 8"x10" frame in moments.  It also makes an awesome personal birthday card you forgot to buy.  Or a card for any occasion.Of course you can print standard paper documents.  I suggest setting the unit to monochrome to save the color inks.  The cartridge cost could add up quickly if you don't make sure you are not using the colors.The unit does not take much space at all.  Of course you have the ability to make document copies.  Or scan an existing photo to save as a file for uploading or printing the photo after editing or restoring.I love that I don't have to deal with my computer at all to use the unit.  Using a tablet or phone is cool, but printing from any desktop or laptop in the house wirelessly works flawlessly.  You can also print right to social media, but I prefer editing and uploading myself.The only cons are the ink cartridges.  Luckily you can buy black separately and have the option to just use black, but don't remove the color cartridges.  But the color comes in a set for about 40 bucks.  Just make sure you use black as much as possible to retain the color for photo use.  The other is the Fax.  I have not tried it because why would I?  Do people still fax anything anymore?

Definitely a unique, secure binder.  There is a canvas zippered core keeping everything together, but the rest is plastic.  The interior with seven sections.  These are not folders, just dividers.  So it is anything other than a standard size page, it could slide down and settle to the bottom.  I don't really care for that, but since it is zippered, I don't have to worry about anything falling out.  I got it for bills and important documents.  Paper and storage is becoming more useless every day, so I figured a simple accordion binder would do the trick.  It will serve it's purpose.  If I had a lot of checks to deal with, that would be an issue due to the lack of folder aspect.  But I can't remember the last time I wrote or got a check.  The separating tabs are peculiar.  They don't remove, but you can raise the yellow tabs to be higher than the others.  To serve as a reminder.  And when completed, push the tab down. Not really anything special.  There are paper inserts you will have to finagle recreating or overlapping labels.  No extras.  The red is helpful in ease of finding in case of misplacing it.  The colored part is a harder plastic, and the clear part is not as durable.  This is not something for a backpack in my eyes.  It's too big,would get crushed, and the weather and use will have this cracking with falling apart.  But for home use, it's fine.  It's actually fits just fine on the bookshelf leaving more space by getting rid of larger alternatives.

Herbal Essences has always been a safe choice for me as I cannot deal with heavy scents without reaction.  Otherwise, I try to find something with no fragrance.  But this unique mix of grapefruit and mint is very appealing and leaves your scalp and hair feeling and smelling fresh.  I have thick hair to begin with, but it is softer with a fluffy feel, but still manageable.  I ordered the volumizing souffle that accompanies this conditioner, but my order was cancelled as I believe they ran out.  But after trying just this product, I would be interested in the entire line, even if just this scent.  I tend to latch on to products that don't react on me.  My allergies are respiratory, not dermal.  And the slightest fragrance in soaps and detergents etc. can set me off.  So this was a pleasant, refreshing surprise.  I will attempt more of the "Naked Collection" in the future.

With only a little diagram card in a "no frustration" (plain) box, you are on your own to get these on right.  Luckily they go on easy and well made.  After cleaning and drying the phone, I also cleaned my fingers with alcohol. This will prevent fingerprints from the underside.  The protective sticky side peels off well with a handy tab.  Holding the strip on it's edges and folding slightly the long way toward the phone, placing it from top to bottom, you are pretty much going to have a safe landing the first time. I had to peel back a couple corners for minor bubbles.  Using the heat of your finger to push the from the inside out works well.  I do have an edge that just wont fully stick, but is not noticeable when I put the case on.  My 4 pack were 4 sleeves of two sheets each, so a total of 8 sheets. I don't know if that was a mistake, but if that is normal, it's a great deal for the price.  4 sheets for ten bucks, not so much.  But still does the job.

If you have limited space, would like a ton of printing abilities, and afraid of setup nightmares, this one is for you.  So easy to run with a quick start guide and connecting wireless is a breeze.Not just a printer, but scanner, photo copier, fax (as if we need it anymore), and not only can you print from any computer (I have both PC and Mac) you can even use apps to print from any phone or tablet.The scary thing about printer shopping is buying the ink.  You think you get a deal on a printer and then you soon find out they are robbing you with expensive cartridges.  The prices for this unit are not that bad. More importantly, the ink lasts longer that any compact printer I have had or tried in the past.  Just a tip,  remember to print everything in monochrome as black and white will cost less and last even longer.The controls are easy to understand with a helpful screen to assist you instead of figuring out what a dozen buttons are suppose to do.This is for home office use, and not a business buy.  It would meet all the needs of a small home business, ebay, etc. at a very reasonable price.

I'm a die-hard Grand Theft Auto fan.  So much so that I bought a new Playstation for each release.  I buy a lot of different games, and some are played once and never played again.  I just keep going back to GTA.  I don't consider myself a big gamers, but I have just gotten used to the mechanics of this type of game.Thankfully Watch Dogs feels like an extension of GTA, but not really.  It's unique.  Although the "cell phone" integration and "hacking" is a bit annoying at times.  But I enjoy the free roaming aspect, and hate limitations when I can't walk a free world setting.  You can walk around but need to complete missions to obtain various abilities.  So you are pretty much forced to play the game storyline... except there is not much of a story.  And driving is certainly not as smooth as GTA, but overall, it's worth buying when it gets to the "hits" price.  Not the list price.

There are definitely better and more elaborate bags and carts out there, but this is quite a bargain for it's durability.  Light but sturdy, and always a conversation starter.  Everyone wants it once they see it.  Very funny.As long as you are not playing in the woods, you are good to go.  Just because the "realtree" print is just that, real.  All pockets, zippers, wheels and straps feel built to last.  It's actually a great bag to drag around since it would not matter if it got dirty etc. It moves well, looks cool and sturdy.  It would make a great gift and a very reasonable price.  Even at the list price.

For years I have enjoyed my Bodum presses, like there was no other.  But never really enjoyed the cleanup process.This is far better than a Bodum for many reasons.  Not only does it make a great pot of coffee, but it keeps it hot, and it's a simple rinse cleanup.My only suggestion is that mornings tend to be cooler, therefore, steel would be cool.  Pour some of the boiling water in the carafe for a minute and warm it up.  Then dump out the water, and fill your coffee grounds, pour water in, and brew.I still like my Bodums, but I know I will be using them less now.  I am checking out other items by Francois et Mimi now.

I truly love theis mug. The Moscow Mule cocktail is delicious and it stays icy cold in this Moscow Mule Solid Copper Mug. There is a coating on the inside and out so that they don't tarnish but I've used this several times and it has stayed totaly prestine. I'm so glad that I did get to order this mug to try it out. I love the hammered finish as it sort of reminds me of medieval times. I'm an aromatherapy junkie. I love it and I love trying new scents. I never tried Bergamot and so decided I needed to add this to my massive collection of essential oils. Especially after I read up on it and found out the many uses for it. Since I'm getting ready for surgery tomorrow (Sept 3rd is my bilateral double mastectomy with reconstruction) I've been using Bergamot Essential Oil in my diffusers to help me relax, help me destress and help my anxiety. My Doctor did prescribe me an antianxiety medication but I hate taking additional medications so figured I'd try this to see how it goes. I'm surprised at the scent. It's definitely a cross between citrus and floral. I'm not too much of a fan of floral but there are certain floral scents I do enjoy like Lavender and Geranium.This is not a bad scent at all. In fact it was quite pleasing. It's also not at all overpowering and I love how I need only about 8 drops in my largest diffuser to invigorate the air with this scent. As I try and relax today the day before surgery I know that I will be okay and this is helping me keep from really stressing out or having to take any anxiety medication. That said it truly works fantastically.It also has some medicinal uses as an antiseptic for cuts. I did get a cut on the bottom of my big right toe and it truly worked great on that.I highly recommend this scent Bergamot for anyone who loves essential oils and who wants to destress. Even if you don't have a diffuser you can always boil a pot of water on the stove, let it settle then add about 5-10 drops depending on the size of the pot (I'm talking up to about a 2qt pot) and put a towel over your head and breathe it in. Works great this way too.I did get this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All of the opinions expressed within this review are 100% my own and I was not compensated in any other way.

I really love this Professional Cafe Luxe Milk Frother. It's very easy to use.  And it's made or real stainless steal NOT plastic. I absolutely LOVE this Portable Mini LED Speedlite. It's so easy to use. All you do is charge it with the USB Charging cord that's included in the box for about 60-90 minutes. Then you just plug it in the phone where your Headset Jack is at . Turn on the button on the left as you're looking at the LED Flash bulbs inside the flash and turn it on. You can keep the light on for about 60 continuous minutes. It's great when you're having a barbecue or party that's outdoors at night and you don't want to rely on the small dim flash of your smartphone. I have used this numerous times and I love that it stays on to give me extra light where extra light is needed and then I can just fit it back into my pocket when I'm done using it. This little device has 3 rows of 7 across LED Bulbs that when it lights up it is like having a mini spotlight on your smartphone. It even works great in conjunction with a selfie stick.To charge it is very easy it has it's own USB charger so you put the smaller end into the top of the device and the USB into any USB charger be it a laptop, or car charger or even a power bank to recharge it. It takes about 60-90 minutes. The first time I charged mine after running it down,(it came charged) it took me 73 minutes to fully charge it up, not bad at all since it did last me 64 minutes being continuously lit. (I did this to see how long it would take before the "lights went out".).I'm very pleased with this device and how it handles etc. This is perfect for camping trips, hikes, vacations, or just about any time you want to take a picture with not the ideal lighting. This will definitely bring the colors to the forefront.This is one of only a handful of items I would give over a 5 star review if allowed to do so . It is that wonderful an item and one that everyone with any sort of digital camera, smartphone, etc should have in their accessory kit!I was given this product free, in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All of the opinions expressed within this review are 100% my own and I was not compensated in any other way.

I love my Armband for my Samsung Galaxy S5. It even fit my old Samsung Galaxy S3 and fits my son's iPhone 6 ..It did NOT fit my daughter's iPhone 6 Plus though .What i do like is the fact that my phone is well protected while I work out. That If I have to use the touchpad instead of just using my bluetooth or headset or even my portable bluetooth speaker to answer my phone the plastic is thick enough to keep the sweat and moisture away from the phone, but thin enough I can actually use the touchpad as needed. A lot of these armbands' plastics are so thick that it makes it very hard to use the touchpad , and I'm happy to say this is not the case with the URPPOWER Armband. I also like that I can put my locker key or lock key into the key spot on the armband though it will NOT fit most modern day car keys.If you're not using a set of bluetooth headphones it also has a way to fit it into the armband so that it's not all over the place.This I found is not only great for when I'm at the gym, but it's also great for camping, hiking, and even while walking around those amusement parks. Keep in mind that while it is sweatproof it isn't waterproof so please don't think you can go to the beach or pool and swim with this on your arm. All of the opinions expressed in this review are 100% my own and I was not compensated in any other way.

These scrabble tiles to me are like education and money in the bank! I don't use them to replace scrabble tiles per say. NO. I use them to get my grandson interested in learning! He's now beginning to read and doing a great job! He thinks it's funny when we make rhyming words : Rat, Fat, Cat, That, Hat, Sat, Mat, Pat, Nat, Bat. He is at the age where bodily function sounds are funny to him too! EX:When we play operation it's the new version and instead of a funny bone there's water on the knee that sounds like a dripping faucet and there's a toilet flushing sound and a fart sound. He thinks this is hilarious! So....What does Nana Sunni do? I taught him how to spell  with rhying ...Tart, Cart, and of course what else? Fart!!! He thinks that's hilarious too and he is reading .Then what do we do with the numbers on the bottom of each tile? We add them together! Now in addition to reading and learning to spell he's adding and we're also learning to subtract! He thinks it's all a game but this Nana Sunni knows better! He's learning something that will take him into the future. It's a skill. Learning doesn't have to be boring..I'm showing him it can be FUN!!! Feel free to use these techniques with your children or grandkids. To me it's probably one of the best $10 you will spend as the results of his / her learning will be priceless!I did get this at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All of the opinions expressed in my review are 100% my own and are based on my own experiences with my grandson Vincent using this product. I was not compensated in any other way!

This car mount is miles above the competition. First of all I love how long the neck is and how durable it is as well. Secondly it plugs right into the outlet charger in your car so that you dont have it wasting space on your windshield, your dashboard or pulling down the vent slots on the a/c vents in your car. While other Car Mounts do the same thing that's the end of the similarities. Now for the differences. This one in addition to being magnetic also has 3 USB slots on the Base of where you plug it into the car charger in your car. This way you can charge your phone AND also two additional USB Devices. Be it a tablet , another cellphone, or an MP4 player, digital camera or more you can charge any 3 devices at once. I love that they give you the option of a plate that's totally magnetic or one that has a tape to put on the back of a phone or phone case in order to hold it to the magnetic part of the adapter. This truly is a wonderfully crafted device and one that is very durable and will last. Plus you're not putting any wear and tear on your vent slots.One other ting I like about this car mount is that it has blue indicator led light when you plug it into the car charger so you can see it  in the dark . It's always helpful when they have a blue indicator light.One safety feature I truly like is that it has an over voltage and over current protection so that it won't break out in a fire. That's what I call safety first.I did get this product free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.  All of the opinions expressed in this review are 100% my own and are based on my own experiences with this product and I was not compensated in any other way.

These are a really nice pair of cutting utensils. I like how I can use one end to literally open a bottle cap if I need to. I have several TaoTronics electronics and I'm a huge fan. I love their scanners for my ex-husband's business. 6:09 Mins This Coolife 4way Garden Hose Splitter is by far the best I've EVER used in my life. I love how the housing is made of a rubber NOT a cheap plastic. I really like this G.G. Martinsen 32 GB Mini USB Port Slim Small Multi-lingual Selection 1.78 LCD Portable MP3 Player , Video Player , Music Player. I haven't been able to get the MP4 player to work yet but I'll figure it out. I was able to download some books from my Kindle Account to this player so I'm happy about that. Quite honestly I didn't think I'd be able to do it. One thing I like is that you get DOUBLE the amount of songs to be able to download onto this for listening. Many more then you'll ever really need as it can hold up to 10000 songs! WOW!What really confused me was the chartreuse button in the middle of the wheel. I thought when I pushed that it would SELECT what I was looking for but it did NOT do that. If I was listening to music it would increase the volume and that's basically all it does. The Menu button is your select button and the two arrows on the side are the up and down buttons. Hope this helps those that were as confused as I was figure it out.That said, for under $40 it's a great little player with good quality sound. The video is very clear which truly surprised me for a player in this price range. It's by no means as fantastic as some of the better known brands but for the money it does a great job.The only thing I haven't been able to do and doubt I will be able to do with this particular model is "shuffle" the songs up. There's no way I was able to see to do that. If you want that feature you may have to spend more money to be able to do that.This is a great item for the price and it would make a great gift especially for a teenager. Before spending a ton of money on one of the fancier models I'd want to be sure that my teen could keep up with something like this so this is the perfect "test" mp3 player.I also like the chartreuse colors.  It's like a greenish yellow/gold and this is the color they call green! But it's really more of a chartreuse color  (greenish yellow ).I also love the fact it has a voice recorder as I have a habit of parking my car and forgetting where I put it.The only drawback to this MP3/MP4 player is that the earbuds are really pretty poor. They will work in a pinch but I'd highly recommend investing in a good set of earbuds or a good quality headset because the overall quality of the player is diminished when using the ones included with the package. Other then that this is a definite 5 star product which is why I'm giving it the 5 star treatment!I did receive this product at free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. The opinions within this review are 100% my own and are based on my own experiences with this product. I was not compensated in any other way.

This is the perfect wine or champagne opener set for anyone with RA (Rheumatoid Arthritis) or limited use in their hands. THis was very easy to use. All you do (after taking it out of the package and washing it in warm soapy water and rinsing it in clean water) is to open the arms of the wine opener (as if they're about to do some jumping jacks). Then use the handle and turn it till the screw part (also known as a worm) catches onto the cork itself. Keep going until the worm is totally or practically totally embedded into the cork itself. Now lower the "arms" of the wine/champagne opener and the cork will come out. I've owned a few different models but the same style as this one previously and this one is by far the most oiled machine in the bunch. It was the easiest to use.I also love that it comes with a vacuum wine stopper so that you don't lose the left over wine which is often the case. To use the vacuum wine stopper just put it into the bottle and pump it till it forms a great seal . That's it. Done.For anyone with RA, Arthritis, or limited mobility in their hands nothing gets us more frustrated when we go to use something and it doesn't work as advertised. This one works exactly as I described it would work. At least it did for me. If it doesn't do it for you either you're not doing it correctly or you might have gotten a defective one. In that case contact the seller so they can make it right for you.I did get this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All of the opinions expressed within this review are 100% my own and are based on my own experiences with using this product. I was not compensated in any other way.

I absolutely LOVE this Calendula Foot Butter. It's like being at a spa. It makes my feet feel so smooth and refreshed. I love that it's all natural made with aloe vera , tea tree oil and oilive oil. It even had Bees Wax in it to really make your feet feel smooth as butter. I know they call it a butter and I can see why. It's a souffle that just keeps hydrating the feet. I love it. I actually use my jar in the following way:I soak my feet in a massage bath (I've got one of those electric massagers that you put water in w/ some epsom salts). I add Lavender Epsom Salts to it and let my feet soak for about 20-30 minutes on a low vibration.I then take them out of the bath and pat them dry.I then take a pair of soft socks and place them over a pot of hot water so that they get slightly damp and then place in my dryer for about 5-10 minutes till dry (This makes them nice and warm and allows the foot butter to really get into the deep crevices of my feet).Next I take a silicone brush and paint my feet lightly with this wonderful Calendula Foot Butter and then delicately place my feet into my warm socks and leave them on overnight. I do this 3-4 times per week and my feet have never looked or felt any better. I always try and make the swirls go in the same direction as the way it was in the jar when it first arrived. A tiny little bit does go a very long way with this butter.I did get this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All of the opinions expressed within this review are 100% my own and are based on my own experiences with this product and I was not compensated in any other way.

I love to jump rope and I'm having fun teaching my 5 yr old grandson how to jump rope too. I show him how I jump rope, then I adjust the length of the rope so it fits perfectly for him. I turn my back on my grandson and have him say the "magic words" "one to three..make it for me"And voila it's his size!So far he's learned how to do the jumping to "one two buckle my shoe" and he's loving it. 9:48 Mins This is an awesome headlight and tail light set from Sunspeed Cycling. What's really neat is how easy it is to install. This is perfect for those who are like me, inept in installing anything that requires so much as a screw.The batteries which are CR 2032 batteries for the tail light are already installed and they give you a second set included with this kit at no extra cost.On top of that the headlight comes with a sleeve that will fit 3 AAA batteries which are NOT included BUT they DO give you 2 18650 Lithium Ion Batteries AND a recharger that you can use. The first time it will be a fast strobe light, the second push is a slower strobe light, the third push is a steady tail light (in red) and the 4th push is what turns it off!To operate the flashlight / headlight if mounted on the handlebar , You push the back side of the light that is closest to you. The first push is a strobe light , the 2nd push is off, the third push is a steady headlight (White light) and the 4th push is once again off and than it repeats the same sequence.I was quite impressed on how much light it gave off. This is a very well-made leather wallet for men , though I'm inclined to actually use it for myself. Again all the slots are lined with the RFID protection lining.Finally you have a slot that has a clear plastic front that folds up from the left side of the credit card slot to hold your identification or your driver's license and yes this too has the black and white RFID protecion in the lining.This wallet is also backed by a 100% Guarantee. As many of you already know I have RA (Rheumatoid Arthritis) in both of my hands and chopping tends to hurt. There are so many uses for peppermint oil. I've been using it for quite a while and I absolutely love it and can't seem to keep enough of it on hand.Here's a fraction of the uses that I've used Peppermint Oil for:#1- I use it to help with headaches and migraines. I suffer terribly from migraines and so there are so many ways to use this to help. Depending how debilitating they are. If minor I'll put about 8 drops of peppermint oil and about 3 drops of lavender oil into my cool mist humidifier and lie down to relax. If they're bad but not too bad that I don't feel blinded or the need for a dark room and I can stand up I'll boil a pot of water over the stove and let it sit so it's no longer boiling but hot and add about 10 drops per medium pot and put a towel over my head and breathe slowly in and out. (This also works for congestion or a really bad cold).. If it's really super bad and I need to lie down in silence in a completely quiet and dark room I'll put about a splash of Peppermint Oil on a dry washcloth and put it onto my forehead. The scent will travel to the nose as its very potent and it helps relieve it by seeping into my skin on my forehead too.#2- I love to use it in a spray bottle with water. About 10-15 drops only. I spray this along the window bases and the baseboards of my home. This keeps mice and spiders away. (In fact sometimes I'll go outside my home and spray the plants with it (very lightly) and it won't hurt the plants and I've kept spiders away too. Living in the suburbs on over 1 acre of property w/ over 200 ft of woods that I own behind my home and backyard tends to bring in mice this helps keep them totally at bay. Mice do NOT like the scent of peppermint (I've done my research some say it doesn't work but I've yet to have another mouse enter my house since using this method so I truly believe it works. I have had one mouse in over 14 yrs of living in my home. It entered after Jimmy past away .. I was getting ready to leave my home for a friend's in home party when I picked up a sealed bag of chips-Jimmy's favorite- and some fell out of the bottom. Looked and saw where a mouse nibbled the bottom to get into it. Funny since I never had a mouse enter my home till after Jimmy past away...Well I freaked out and grabbed my laptop. It said to try this so I did. No mice since. I have since named that mouse Jimmy).#3- Congestion and Colds...use about 10 drops per medium pot of hot water. Take a pot of water and boil it. Let it steep till it's no longer boiling but still extremely hot. Then add 10 drops of Peppermint Oil to the water and stir. Grab a towel  and start breathing in slowly. This well help any congestion and colds break up mucus.#4- To relax in bed and help go to sleep mix 5-6 drops of Peppermint Oil with 3-4 drops of Lavender oil in a cool mist humidifier.#5-  To help rejuvenate  you just do about 8 drops in a cool mist humidifier.#6- Great Makeup Remover .. Add 3-4 drops onto a piece of gauze or cotton ball and remove makeup. No more scrubbing or adding chemicals to your face. (works great with Lavender Oil too).#7- It's also great for the face and scalp. Prior to washing your hair use a spray water bottle mixed with 10 drops of peppermint oil and water. Shake well and mix and put on scalp. Will help with dandruff. For the face helps with acne.  And it feels wonderful. I put some in the fridge for about 5 minutes prior to using to get that "wakeup now " feeling.There are many more uses that you can use Peppermint Oil for. If you just Google "Peppermint Oil" you'll get tons of articles on it and all of it's many many uses!ArtNaturals is 100% Pure and Organic with no added fragrances , colors or preservatives and is made here in the USA so you can feel good about the quality of this product. I love that ArtsNaturals keeps all of their Therapeutic Grade Oils in dark bottles so it won't degrade during shipping or while in your home and that they include a GLASS Dropper instead of a cheap plastic one. The plastic ones are okay but you can't wash them and use them in another bottle as they tend to maintain the scent and odor of the previous oils. The glass ones you can wash thoroughly and they will NOT keep scents so you're not mixing them when you do not want to mix.I did receive this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All of the opinions expressed within this review are 100% my own and are based on my own experiences with this product and I was not influenced in any other way.

Chakra comes from Sanskrit meaning Wheel and there are basically 7 wheels or energies in our body. When one of our "Wheels" isn't well this can often lead to illness. Another way to look at it instead of a "Wheel" is an "energy center".. If the energy center in our body isn't working to its fullest potential this can lead to us getting ill.The first Chakra is the Root Chakra and it starts at the base of our spine or tailbone. It is the representation of us being grounded and is our foundation. It is the Red Jasper in the set.The Second Chakra is the Sacral Chakra and is located Lower abdomen, about 2 inches below the navel and 2 inches in. The second Chakra gives us a  connection and the  ability to accept others and new experiences. It also has to do with one's feeling of sexuality. This is represented by the Orange Carnelian stone in this Chakra Set.The Third Chakra is the Solar Plexus Chakra and is located Upper abdomen in the stomach area. It is thought to give us our sense of Self-worth, self-confidence, self-esteem. It is represented by the Yellow Jade.The Fourth Chakra is the Heart Chakra or our Ability to love. It is located by the center of chest just above heart.The Green Adventurine stone is what represents the 4th Chakra.The Fifth Chakra is the Throat Chakra and effects our ability to talk or communicate. It is located on the throat. It effects not only communication but also the ability of self-expression and the truth. It is represented by the Blue stone called a Lapis Lazuli.The Sixth Chakra is known as the Third Eye Chakra and if effects us being able to read into things and see the big picture. I really like this body butter a lot! What I like is that #1 it is NOT heavily scented! It IS very lightly scented with a fresh and inviting scent.
