What happened to the stalker? Did Jessica shoot him? I went back and re-read the last several pages because I was sure I had missed something, but I hadn't. It was just sloppy writing on Tracie Peterson's part, and equally poor editing.Overall, this book was very sloppy. It didn't feel cohesive. It felt very much like a first draft. I recently read another one of Tracie Peterson's books, A Steadfast Heart, and had almost identical feelings. I feel like Peterson's more recent books are of very poor quality, as if she isn't spending enough time on them. I'm not sure why that is. I would hope she would want to write a book that she could be proud of, that she could say she gave 100 percent to. But I just don't see how she could have given this book her all. She definitely didn't, and her publisher didn't either.My recommendation would be to not bother reading this book. But if you love Tracie Peterson or want to finish the series, then I would suggest getting it from a library. I just don't think this is a book worth paying for.

With her family no longer able to support her, Hannah needs a way of supporting herself. She thinks that God is sending her that support when she sees a catalog requesting God fearing women to travel to a small Western town, where it is hoped that the women will bring morality and stability to the wild town.When Hannah arrives, she is instantly drawn to Samuel, but Samuel is fighting heartbreak and troubles. Can Hannah reach his heart? Or will Samuel lose out on a loving wife?This was a cute, clean, ok story. It will only take about forty minutes to read. There was nothing wrong with it per se, but the story is very quick and I found that to be disappointing. The characters developed in the blink of an eye and before I knew it the book was over and all the conflict had been resolved.  If the story had been fleshed out a bit, perharps to double the length so as to be a novella, I think I would have liked it much better and given it four or maybe even five stars. The author writes well, and I think she's more than capable of making the story longer.In it's current state this book felt too rushed. It was ok to read for free, but I don't think it's a book I'd pay for, even for only 99 cents. I want just a little more bang for my buck.

The Traitor's Wife is the storty of Benedict Arnold's betrayal of the Colonial Army to the British, and the impact his wife, Peggy, had on said betrayal.There are 2 main characters in this book: Peggy Shippen Arnold, eventual wife of Benedict Arnold, and Clara Bell, personal maid to Peggy. There are also two very big problems in this book, them being..... Peggy and Clara.I had a lot of issues with the two main characters. For starters, the author portrays Peggy as nothing more than a spoiled,  immature, selfish, manipulative, conniving witch. While she did come across as smart enough to commit treason, she didn't come across as dedicated enough and educated enough in politics to actual commit the act. Someone determined to commit treason would have to know the smallest details about the war, it's leaders, etc. But never once does the author mention Peggy reading a newspaper to find out the latest on the war, or discussing politics with people at social events, etc. And when she finally does start communicating with the British, she's not smart enough to realize that John Andre was returning her communication with as coded response. She had the stupidity to think that he would write about treason in plain terms. So overall, at least based on the way Pataki describes Peggy and her actions, there's no way Peggy could have been so influential in regards to Arnold's treason. I would assume that in real life she was more educated regarding the details of the war. Also, I didn't like that the author portrayed Peggy has having absolutely zero redeeming qualities. The best villians are the ones that you feel just a tiny bit of sympathy for, but Pataki's version of Peggy evoked no sympathy from me. Apparently in real life, Peggy was a very devoted mother, a trait that would have made Peggy's character more well rounded, but Pataki portrays Peggy as a callous, uncaring mother. And Peggy's character never changed or developed throughout the novel.I was also very disappointed in Clara's character. While Clara was kind and sweet, I found her to be too kind and naive. It isn't until the very last pages of the book that she finally develops a backbone, but for me it was too little too late. And unfortunately there is little to no character development of Clara either. But my biggest problem with Clara is that she never existed. Yes, Peggy had a personal maid, but there is zero proof that her maid had any knowledge of the Arnold's treasonous plot, nor did a maid provide such knowledge to the Continental Army. The idea the Peggy and Benedict would discuss their treasonous plots in front of Clara, and take her with them on their rendezvous with the British, is ludicrous and totally implausible. There is no way the Arnolds would have willingly allowed Clara to be privy to their plot.I also don't understand why Pataki would stray so far from historical truth and omit so many details. For instance, the novel makes it out that Clara's knowledge of the plot and her informing Caleb Little, and in turn, the Continental Army, of the plot was what lead to the discovery of Arnold's betrayal. But at the end of the book, in the section entitled, "A Note on History and Sources", Pataki herself admits, and I quote, "Since Caleb Little is a fictional character, so too is the role he played in the apprehension of John Andre following his meeting with Benedict Arnold. The true credit goes to militiamen John Paulding, David Williams, and Isaac Van Wart. I apologize for omitting them and not giving them their proper due for the role they played in saving the American Revolution." End quote. This is just one example of historical facts that Pataki decided to omit, or in this case completely change, in what I would assume is her attempt at making her novel more entertaining. Well, I found the inaccuracies frustrating and to be frank I didn't find the book entertaining in the least. I couldn't get passed the blatant lies that Pataki was telling.If you don't care about historical accuracy and giving credit where credit is due, then you might enjoy this book. But even then, considering how poorly the characters Peggy and Clara were portrayed and developed, I would think it would still be hard to like this book.Overall, not a book I would recommend.

The summary of this story was so cute, but I was very disappointed. There were so many problems with this book. For starters I found it extremely boring. I also didn't like Gwen's character. She was childish and immature. Two of the characters share the same name, Owian, and I can't understand why any author would give two characters the exact same name. Do they want us to be extra confused? The writing was poor. It was hard to tell who was speaking or doing the action. There were lots of typos.Overall, not a book I would recommend.

Four and a half stars"Twice Loved" is the "sweet/clean" version of "Shades of Honor", so if you have already read "Shades of Honor, Grayson Brothers, Book 1", then you have already read this story. Personally I thought this story was very good as it was, and didn't feel that there was any need for any sex scenes. In fact I think sex scenes would have greatly detracted from the book and my opinion of its characters.The summary: Evelyn is engaged to Kyle Grayson, her childhood best friend. While she doesn't feel romantic lovr for him, she knows he will provide for her and her aging father. But when Radford Grayson, Kyle's older brother, returns to town, things go haywire. Grayson has avoided his family ever since he returned from the Civil War. Tortured by things he saw and did in battle, he struggles to form relationships. And he has difficulty figuring out how to care for his young daughter Rebecca.But Evelyn somehow manages to get through to both of them. She quickly takes on a mother role for Rebecca. And before she knows it she is forming a strong bond with Radford, a bond she has never been able to form with Kyle. Should she stick to her engagement and marry Kyle, or should she give herself the chance to fall truly in love?This was a very good book. The characters were well developed and the plot believable. I liked the Civil War details that were included. Radford clearly had post traumatic stress disorder following the war, but at the time this was not recognized and not understood. But I love how Evelyn didn't judge Radford, but was warm and caring and eager to help him.Little to no typos also made this a great read.Overall, I really liked this book. I recommend it.

I used this to make homemade eyeshadow. A little arrowroot powder added to it makes a nice violet color. If even more arrowroot powder is added, it becomes a light, more lavender shade. I even mixed it with blue mica and the two colors together make a gorgeous indigo shade. I am very pleased with this product.

I used this to make green eyeshadow. The apple green description is very accurate. Picture the color of the green apples you see in the grocery store and this is it. Worke nicely by mixing with a little arrowroot powder.

Twenty year old Mildred has her life turned upside down after a fire destroys her family's home. With her mother dead and her father severely injured, she is now responsible for the well being of her thirteen year old brother Joseph and her fifteen year old sister Ruth. To make matters worse, she suspects that someone deliberately set fire to the house. But who would try to kill them, and why? Mildred is grateful to have the protection of deputy Mitchell Moore, and before she knows it, she's falling in love with him. But how can she marry when her family so desperately needs her help?I have to say I was very disappointed by this book. It had a decent premise and some potential, but after the first few paragraphs all of that came to a skidding halt. I was able to finish the book, but I only did so in order to provide the most thorough review possible.My first issue with this book is that a lot of it didn't make any logical sense. In the beginning of the book, the author describes the devasting fire that destroys their home. The three children make an attempt to save the house and to save their parents from the burning building. They even go so far as to hitch a wagon and pull the wagon up to the window of their parents bedroom so that they can lower their parents down safely. The reality is that a house made out of pure wood, which is how the author describes it, would go up in flames and collapse in mere minutes. There would have been no time to hitch a wagon and no time for the siblings to argue about how to save their parents. They would have been lucky to escape with their own lives. Thus the fire scene that the author describes was completely unbelievable. The house would have burned to the ground way before the scene was finished. The other thing that didn't make sense was that according to the author, Mildred hadn't been to town in over a year. She says the reason for this is that even in a wagon it takes an entire day to travel to town and back. But if that's the case, why does the author talk about Ruth having friends in school? If town is that far away, she wouldn't have gone to school. She would have been educated by her mother at home.I also didn't like any of the children's characters. Joseph was only 13, but he acted way, way more mature than a 13 year old boy would act. Meanwhile, at age 20, Mildred was too immature. She let her brother, seven years her junior and still just a child, dictate her actions and make serious decisions for the family. And Ruth was a total brat and extremely selfish.Additionally I had issues with the way the author describes emotions, particularly after the fire and the death of their mother. The author's attempts at putting these emotions to paper was juvenile at best. The emotions described came across as forced and unrealistic. It was hard to take the characters' feelings seriously when the writing was so poor.My biggest issue with this book was the writing in and of itself. The author doesn't have a clue in terms of the proper use of a comma. She has commas randomly inserted into her sentences in places where a comma doesn't belong. As I mentioned, the writing style is very juvenille and the sentence structure is so simple that there are so few sentences in this book that actually require a comma. But there are thousands of commas in this book, all improperly used, and it drove me crazy! I had to try and remember that if I saw a comma to just keep reading straight through and not pause briefly like you're normally supposed to. The writing was so bad that I wonder if English is the author's second language. Either way, this book needs a very, VERY thorough editing.The reality is that the issues I mentioned are easily fixed, and that the story itself could probably be considered four stars if those issues were fixed. I hope the author takes my thoughts into account and uses them to improve and update her book. If she made changes it would be a book I would recommend. But as it currently is, I cannot recommend this book. It wasn't worth it to read it for free,  and it's certainly not worth the $2.99-$4.50 I've seen the author charging for it.Overall, not a book I would recommend in its current state.
This book was slow, boring, and at times I found myself confused because I felt like the author didn't provide enough historical detail. Like a previous reviewer, I was unable to finish reading it.

Typical AAA alkaline battery that is being billed as eco friendly because it has up to a 3.8% recycled content.  Somehow, 3.8% doesn't seem like much to me but I guess it gives us 3.8 batteries per 100 made without using any more resources and every bit helps.Batteries fit properly, had the stated voltage as measured with a DVM and passed my acid test with flying colors (two in an old fashioned style flashlight but a regular bulb, not LED).  The held up for almost exactly the same amount of time as a Duracell Ultra.  Shelf life is extended for up to 12 years according to the packaging but really, do people keep batteries unused for 12 years.  I'd put a couple away to test again in 12 years but chances of remembering them are slim to none.Why not 5 stars you ask?  The whole "eco advanced" thing when only recycling a maximum of 3.8% kind of rankles me.  Better than zero but not enough to make it seem like it's a major step forward in saving the planet.

Compared to the other series by this author, this book was mediocre at best.  Way too much time establishing the character, like 2/3 of the book and frankly it wasn't that interesting of a story in the final analysis.  I doubt I will bother with the next installment but will continue to look forward to new books in the other series.
A camo water shoe that looks almost dressy.  You can wear them with casual slacks and appear quite well dressed.  Almost no arch support but that's really to be expected.

Just horrible.  Sounds if so-so but volume control insufficient for those of us that are hearing impaired.  Everyone I talked to with it commented that I sounded like I was in a well.  Returned for a refund.

Super easy to install although the self-install didn't work with Comcast (go figure, something not working with Comcast!).  Once they provisioned it online, everything went well.  BTW, this is being used on a Comcast BUSINESS class service using a dynamic IP addressing versus the static IP's of their business modem.  Stop paying Comcast $12.95 a month if you don't need five static IP addresses.  It has been up since day one, not one dropout,no resets and it must do firmware updates in the dead of night because it never loses the connection.

Hands down, best cookware we have ever owned and that includes some very high end products.  The non-stick coating is extremely durable and as slick as anything you could ever want.  Every conceivable size and shape is provided, handles are attached properly and every touch surface stays cool.

We've bought several of these over the years and are always amazed at the quality and functionality.  The finish is impeccable, installation a snap and they tell you upfront how to remove the annoying "water saver" feature so that you actually get a nice strong shower.
We bought a whole series of this Moen line to update two bathrooms and couldn't be happier.  Very sturdy, easy to mount and literally half the price of the big box store.  What's not to love!
Easy to install, makes a very finished look to our conversion from chrome to brushed nickel.  I did need a new and longer screw, readily available from Lowes.

The big plus is that this is not a tension rod but actually unscrews to tighten it as tight as you would ever need.  If you need to shorten  the rod, use a tubing cutter, it will make a smooth and even cut.  The finish is extraordinary considering the price range.  This was all a part of a remodel of a couple of bathroom and I couldn't be happier with the product.

I bought the Stick because it's the only android based device that has the ability to run Kodi TV even though there isn't an official app for it on the Stick (but it is in the Amazon app store for other android devices?).  With a little bit of searching, it's easy to find out how to install Kodi which provides a huge range of content.We have exceptional wifi - 105mbs so buffering or delays are never a problem with this device.  Amazon Prime video is intuitive and you can actually view your watchlist on this device unlike the Amazon app on our Vizio TV.I hope that as the TV industry moves towards al la carte TV, Amazon will keep pace with the available streaming options.  I think we are only a year or two away from being able to buy only those 10-15 cable channels you actually watch for a very reasonable price and then streaming them via a device like this.  No more paying for 200 channels you never watch because of devices like this.I'm curious at this point if the voice activated remote works well on the regular Fire TV.  While the one that comes with this is simple to use, it does take some time if you have to fill in a search box using the old point and click on screen keyboard.  In fairness, you can avoid all that with the TV app on your Kindle or smartphone and it works quite well but a voice controlled remote that actually understood speech would be so convenient.

I already own the "standard" version of the Bissell PowerFresh steam mop and have found it to be superior to the others I've tried over the years.  So, when I got a chance to try out the "Pet" version, I jumped on the chance.  Not quite sure what makes it a pet version but it certainly is the deluxe version compared to the standard edition.First and foremost, in floor cleaning mode, it works as well as the original, maybe even a little better because I think it might make a bit more steam but that could be because my old one is going on three years old and may be losing some oomph.  It is more difficult to fill with water because of the removable steam chamber - not sure that could have been done differently so it is what it is.It comes with a LOT of attachments, some of which seem to be just different colors of the same option (green, blue and black brushes, all exactly the same).  It comes with a nice drawstring bag to keep all those attachments, and the extension hose, in.  The steam chamber releases with one button and a good tug and then the attachment hose plugs in.  I really like the small "carpet" cleaning pad setup only I used it on kitchen counter tops and it works fantastic.  The little brushes are great for getting into tight spaces, especially in the kitchen.  Do let the whole thing cool down before making changes - steam is hot and it makes the cloth pads hot.The only negative (and it's not really a negative) is that removing the adapter from the steam chamber takes a little bit of muscle but it has to because it must have a very tight seal to not leak steam.  I do wonder how durable the attachment hose is going to be - seems a bit flimsy but that just may be that it's actually very flexible for ease of use.So, if you have a lot of tile/wood/vinyl flooring, kitchen and bathroom counter tops and like to clean without harsh chemicals, this is the device for you.  Again, not sure what makes it pet specific - perhaps you're supposed to train your dog/cat to operate it for you.
Inexpensive way to get universal Yamaha keys.

My wife bought this and it gave me great pleasure to make fun of her when she was wearing it (all in good fun).  It really does look odd to have it coming up the middle of your face and that coupled with the hot pink color really did look odd.  Then she talked me into trying it (and made even more fun of me) and darn if it doesn't work.  She swims for exercise, 45 minutes non-stop and this snorkel has made a huge difference for her.  I don't think it would be a good snorkeling snorkel but in a pool for continuous use, it works exceptionally well.  Still looks funny, but works :~)

In the interest of full disclosure, this was a free product, provided for evaluation purposes.  Even at free, it's not a shaver I would own for a number of reasons.  The most important reason, and the whole idea behind an electric shaver, is the low quality of the shave provided.  It takes a lot of strokes and angles to get even a decent cut.  But, this has been typical of foil shavers for a long time and the main reason I'm a rotary shaver fan.It is also not ergonomically designed - the handle has an odd shape to it, not one that easily fits your hand.  It wouldn't matter if it was a one stroke shaver but given that it's not, changing angles and directions is more uncomfortable than it needs to be.  It's also fairly heavy given its performance, again, not a comfort feature.The pop up trimmer works well as they all seem to these days.  The shaver is low end, not having any information available to the user other than the charge light.  I've come to expect my shaver to give me some idea of shaves/charge remaining.

If you cannot get wi-fi throughout your house, this is a fantastic product.  It uses the electrical wiring to act as an Ethernet connection and as long as you plugged directly into the wall outlet and not a power strip it works fine.  But, here's the problem I encountered - it cut my speed by at least 25% over my wireless connection - exactly the opposite of what you would expect.My wi-fi is a 5G, I get a 85-90% signal strength to my router and I have 105mbs service.  At my wireless desktop, I consistently get the 105down/12up.  Using the Powerline setup, that speed drops to around 70/10 and I suspect it's because the signal over your electrical wiring isn't clean and error checking is slowing down the process.  Now the good news - at the furthest point in the house, the wi-fi signal drops off to 40-50% strength and speeds get down into the 50/10 range.  With this Powerline, I can plug directly into it and get back to at least 70/10 and I may try running a wireless range extender through it to see if it maintains those speeds.So, for the money, you can basically extend your wired network as far as you wish and then convert it back to wireless or just hook directly to the Powerline.

Quite the departure from previous books in the series and maybe, in the long run, that is a good thing and I'm just a spoiled reader.  Not very many of the characters from previous books appear, the new ones which are introduced are a lot more shallow and in one case, an odd choice to render aid and comfort to.The story line itself is a bit disjointed and out of context with who Jesse is supposed to be.  However, the writing continues to be crisp and grabs the reader quickly.  Stinnett has some very good proof readers and editors as his books seem to always be very readable without the annoying grammatical issues that many independent authors present us with.While I've rated this a three, it's still better than most of the indie books out there.  I will still look forward to the next book in the series and remain a loyal, albeit slightly disappointed, fan.

Like so many environmentally friendly products, this one disappoints.  I understand the need to protect the environment, only use "safe" chemicals around the house and allow for the complete lack of responsibility of many parents.  But, there comes a time when you need a product that actually cleans using harsh and dangerous chemicals, but, unfortunately, most of them have been moved over to the commercial market and are no longer available to the average consumer.  We are left with these citrus based products that try hard to be what we want but in the end, are nothing more than very, very light duty cleaners.This product does not attack grease even though it is heavily touted as doing so. It simply smears it around, making the situation worse than when you started.  It does seem to work acceptably on clear vinyl but since you have to thoroughly rinse clear vinyl before rubbing anything across it, likely 90% of the cleaning is done by the initial rinsing and not by this product.  If you just spray this on dry vinyl, you'll end up with some interesting swirl patterns from rubbing the grit all around the surface.Rather unfortunate because I am a 303 protectant devotee - easily the best vinyl treatment on the market.  I expected the same level of excellence out of any of their products and was severely disappointed.

Unfortunately, I appear to have bought the last one as it now show unavailable.  That's a shame because it's a seller branded belt but obviously made by one of the major manufacturers.  Fit perfectly, performs flawlessly and was quite a bit cheaper than any other belt anywhere else.  Mine went on a Yamaha G22.

I have used 303 for twenty years, ever since I owned a business selling  marine items and boats.  It lasts longer and keeps vinyl looking nice better than any other product I've tried and trust me, I've tried them all.  This will not attack cotton threads like armor-all does and actually provide some UV protection.  It even brings back faded black vinyl, albeit temporarily.  It leaves a nice matte patina when applied, not the glossy bling of other products.  Best of all, the price on Amazon is the best I've ever seen for the gallon size delivered - I've always paid over fifty dollars for it so forty-two is a real bargain.

Perhaps the most technically incorrect/deficient novel I've ever read.  The whole premise of the novel is built upon false information and just ruins the storyline.One does not simply steal a drone and start flying it.  Even if you had the correct console (which is never mentioned as part of the theft), you must have the proper encryption for a particular drone.  The encryption is changed on a regular basis and must be changed at both ends - programming is sent to the drone itself from one source and to the control station from another.  The drone and the station must then handshake to authenticate.  These encryption schemes can be changed independently of each other making both unworkable.There is also an over command function in every drone we are currently flying.  That function allows a pair of senior officers to authorize the release of the drone from its primary control and handing it over to command and control with all weapons systems disabled.  It can only be RTB flown at that point.The final safeguard is a self-destruct feature that is operated via a totally different communications channel using a different encryption method.  While it is there primarily to insure that if there is a mechanical failure in a deployed unit, it can be destroyed so that technical data cannot be salvaged when the drone goes down, it can actually be activated for other reasons, given the correct set of commands.All of these things (and probably more that are even more closely guarded) would have prevented the scenario presented in this novel.But assume for a moment that they would find a way to overcome all these safeguards.  Now you have to suspend reality and believe that a separate device released from the drone, called remoras in the book, can track down a jet capable of super-sonic speeds and incredible acceleration under full military power.  And yet these remoras, released at a MAXIMUM speed of 135 but with no capability to increase its acceleration can track down a sophisticated military fighter jet is just ridiculous.  And forget completely the aerobatics the drone itself is capable of - the writer has obviously never flown aerobatic certified aircraft as he would realize that the gyrations being described are not possible given the known configuration of existing fixed wing aircraft.I can suspend reality with the best of them when it adds to a story but when it becomes the whole basis of the story then it makes the work unreadable.  The author is actually a pretty good writer (thus two stars) so perhaps some of his other books are more in the realm of reality than this one.

I wish these were scored deeper to make separating them easier.  You will end up using a pair of side cutters to deepen the scoring which then deforms the weight, making it harder to apply.  You get more weights, better separation and for less money from your local HF store.

Ellsworth has a natural writing ability and good thing because he needed every bit of it to make this novel work, barely.  It is a convoluted mess that he manages to hold together with bailing wire and duct tape and, in the end, produces a decent story.  It's the furthest reach into fiction that the author has made yet, tip toeing at the edge of incredulity.  Seriously, waterboarded 150 times!  Navy Seals break after 3 or 4 sessions but not our little heroine.Then there is the annoying writer about whom the story is loosely (very loosely) constructed.  The "excerpts" from her book are distracting at best and annoying at worse.  And ultimately the story has almost nothing to do with her so the book is hardly aptly titled.The book was headed towards a solid three star effort and the last 30-40 pages pulled it up by the bootstraps to make it a weak four star.  Just too far off the beaten path for this reader, let's get back to high courtroom drama and intelligently crafted characters that are likable.

This is our second stone, first one lasted two years of weekly pizza baking at 500F.  Very well made, finish is very nice and slick enough that it doesn't require grease.  However, the finish will wear over time, requiring greasing the stone for ease of pizza removal.  The finish still seals the stone properly.We like this because of the size, the helpful side handles and the durability.  If you want best pizza ever, use this stone, your outdoor gas grill and you will be amazed.  Do NOT preheat the stone on the grill, it gets hot at exactly the right rate to crisp the bottom without scorching or burning it.
Fits perfectly, has magnetic wake/sleep function and seems to be very well made.  Only fits the 4th gen Kindle 7.

Holy Cow!  I thought I was getting Velcro - fuzzy side (loop) and plastic side (hook).  Boy was I mistaken.  This is industrial grade velcro - both sides are plastic, they press together for a TIGHT fit and once together, are going to stay together.  Then there is the adhesive!  It's only good once, so get it right.  Properly clean your surface (I like denatured alcohol), put it in place, wait about an hour and you pretty much have a permanent bond.  Put in place with the proper procedures, this is going to hold just about anything to anything.  I didn't even know this type of industrial reclosable fastener existed but I suspect that is where most of it gets used, in an industrial climate.  But, if for some strange reason, you want to hang bricks from your ceiling and not worry about them falling on your head, this is your stuff.

Does exactly what it's supposed to do and that's to protect our club's laptop in a public lab environment.  My only complaint is that the window for the combination is on the side, forcing you to lift and tilt the laptop to get a proper view of the window.  Otherwise, very functional, now sure how much it would stop a determined thief but at least your device won't grow legs and casually wander off.

Stinnett has hit on a formula that works for both him and his readers.  Lots of action, good plot line, really likeable and enjoyable characters and just enough violence to make it all realistic.  This chapter in the series is no different and the characters continue to be fresh and new ones are introduced that only add to the depth of the work.If you like this authors work as much as I do, get on his mailing list.  There are some perks for doing so but you also get advanced notice of new releases.

If you're looking for the good old FTL from yesteryear, good luck.  These are imported from Honduras and are beyond cheap.  Thin material, not much elastic in the waistband, fit is nothing like the old style.  The old style had the sewn in label and was made in Mexico of much better material and cut to a better standard.  These are just poor quality and are, unfortunately, the same as being sold at wally world.  I'm not sure where to go to get the Made in Mexico ones if they even still make them down there.  If this is the only choice, I've got to change 66 years of underwear buying habits and find another brand.

Back a long time ago, White wrote for his readers.  His writing was crisp, entertaining and moved rapidly around a central story line.  Characters came and went but always with a good understanding of why the entered the narrative.Fast forward to present day and I think White writes only for his publisher.  These books are nowhere near as polished, plot lines meander without seemingly any purpose, the characters are becoming very one dimensional and Doc Ford is evolving (devolving?) into something other than the original character.Oddly enough, I was one of only three people on the waiting list at the e-library.  I remember when it took weeks and weeks to finally work my way up the ladder but then, that's when I enjoyed reading this author and would savor each book.  I finished this one only because I don't like not completing tasks.  Sad.

This thing really works, makes microwave popcorn a much cheaper proposition and you can control how much oil and salt is used.  As mentioned in many of the reviews, the recessed external bottom of this bowl gets HOT as in burn your skin hot.  Somehow the construction of the bowl focuses the heat into the bottom of the bowl which is what makes it so effective but be careful, it will burn you.  If you're sharing your treat with the kids, dump it into another bowl before serving.
These last as long as any non-pro Duracell that I've ever used so suspect the whole procell thing is pure marketing.  They hold up a long time and are cheaper than the store brand at Costco.

This is a low end product to be wearing the T-fal name but it is serviceable.  Heats evenly, the vented lids are nice and they clean nicely.  However, they are not recommended for the dishwasher but that's where they are going.  I don't do wash cloths and drying towels in this day and age and so any set of cook wear needs to be able to pass that simple test.  Even hand washed, I'd be surprised if these lasted more than a few years of daily use.  The ceramic coating is nice but really should not be all that fragile - ceramic is a very hard, albeit brittle, substance.  Properly bonded and treated, a true ceramic coating should last through just about anything except a hard fall.

I go through a lot of nitrile gloves while working on a variety of hobbyist automobiles.  In the past, I've gone to the discount tool store and purchased their brand but got lazy this time and just clicked on these through Amazon.  Am I glad I did!  Frankly, the ones from HF have gone down in quality over the years and would tear far too easily.  These, while not appearing to be any thicker, are of a much better grade of material and hold up extremely well.  Before they too change, ordered a couple of extra boxes to last me a year or so.

If this was the first book I'd ever read by this author, sure it would have been four stars but knowing what he is capable of, this was far from his best effort.  It took an enormous suspension of reality to even accept the premise of the book but then it fell into a very predictable pattern.  Plus, there was just a bit too much of the whole Marine brotherhood in this book.  Yes, we know it exists, we know it's important but when overplayed, it becomes a cliche and that's what is happening in this effort.

Lots of positive reviews here and I think in a home or small office environment, it's probably a good choice.  However, if you are running any kind of extensive wide area network, you may wish to think twice.I run a computer lab for our technology club.  9 ethernet wired computers, 4 ethernet wired printers with reserved addresses, 1 wireless printer and 1 wireless laptop plus 5-20 wireless users at any given time.  TP-Link themselves said it could handle the traffic.  We run a Comcast 100mps business account with five static IP addresses and never lose Internet on any of the other devices.This router drops out about once every five days.  Drops the Internet and the WAN and doesn't recover until it's unplugged and repowered up.  Even then, it takes as long as 20 minutes to reconnect the entire network.  Our old Netgear router that was six years old NEVER dropped the connection - not once in six years.  Unfortunately, it died and this was our first choice.TP-Link support is a person with a heavy accent reading from a script.  I begged and pleaded to be connected to a real engineer who understands WAN's and static IP's.  Finally submitted a written ticket and now waiting for some type of reply.  I freely admit I may have something set incorrectly - I'm not a computer engineer, far from it.  I pretty much followed the same setup for this as our Netgear had - same security, DHCP  settings, static IP settings, reserved IP addresses and what not.If we can get it running right before the return deadline, I will update this review, otherwise it's going back and we're going back to Netgear.  Shame because when it's working, throughput and range are excellent.Update 02/28/15 - I'm starting to wonder why anyone would deal with TP-Link.  Their latest "solution" is to limit concurrent users to 5-10 - LOL.  My off brand home router that is eight years old handles 12 clients with a lot of video downloads and never misses a beat.  To think in this day and age that an AC router could only handle a maximum of 10 clients is just ludicrous.  If I don't hear directly from an actual tech/engineer today, it will be in the mail back to Amazon Monday.

These books have become far too formula for me.  I've grown from enjoying the characters to actually disliking them.  While the main character remains somewhat three dimensional, the supporting cast has grown very flat with the same lines repeated from previous books.

Bought this set because it was inexpensive and we were off to Maui for ten days and snorkeling was high on our list of to-do's.  I was somewhat skeptical about the short fins but they turned out to be great for our purposes.  If you're into free diving, they fins would be horrible but for paddling around on the surface, they were very comfortable.  The mask seals well and the dry tube snorkel actually works.  The set is compact enough to get into your luggage and that was a big plus for me.The only downside, and thus a four star rating, is the snorkel tube is round and the attachment clip for the mask slides up to the top too easily.  There is a nub on the tube to prevent this but when the mouthpiece is not in your mouth, it invariably rides up the tube and then you have to align the nub to get it back down to the proper position.  A minor inconvenience but wish they had made the clip a tighter fit with a push button release to reposition it.

This author baffles me completely.  72 hours and Stranger Beside You were outstanding books, this one almost the polar opposite.  The writing style is off almost like there was a ghost writer involved.  Lots of short, choppy sentences like you might expect in a first semester creative writing class.  The story develops slowly and without much depth.  The end is disappointing which just puts the cap on a book I wished I hadn't wasted my time reading.

I've not noticed any change in mood or relaxation levels with this product but it perhaps takes longer for it to build up in the bloodstream and provide some tangible benefit.  I've used many of the Doctor's Best products and always been happy with them so will continue to try this one out and update my review should my experience change.

Too bad there isn't an option for more than five stars, this book is that good.  Probably one of the best 100 books I've ever read and that's saying a lot.  I first read Sea of Crisis by this author because it was free for a day or two on Amazon and that book was exceptional in its own right - this one might even be better.There are very few authors who can jump from one genre to the next and maintain the quality of writing but Steere has proven he has that ability in spades.  I generally dislike love stories and historical novels and yet this book is both but so much more.  It's a coming of age novel, a war story, a love story and a thriller, all rolled neatly and nicely into one book.Do yourself a huge favor and buy this book.  Then do yourself another favor and write a review so that perhaps we can encourage this incredible author to continue plying his trade.  He writes so much better than many of the so called "best selling" authors out there, it would be shame if he never achieved the level of recognition he deserves.

Wow!  This is one of those unexpected gems that you pick up and realize that there is a lot of hidden talent out there that the independent publishing world has given voice to.I read a LOT, probably 50-75 books a year, mostly fiction, mostly action/adventurer/thriller and have to say this is one of the best books I've picked up in quite a while.  The writing is knife edge sharp with fantastic editing (thanks to whoever took the time).  The storyline is so very original and yet so very timely.  Yes, the protagonists might be a bit bigger than life but so what - it works and works really well.The last 10% of this book kept me up long after my normal bedtime because the book had already fully drawn me in but now it was forcing me to keep reading.  And what and ending it is!!!!I'm pleased to see the author has written at least on other book which I immediately ordered.  Hopefully a talent such as this will continue to produce books that are unforgettable.  I have 971 books on my Kindle or in the cloud, 78 of them I've classified as exceptional and this was the 79th book added.  I've given that list over time to a lot of fellow readers and received many an Amazon gift card as a thank you so I'm fairly confident in bestowing that accolade upon a book.And allow me to end this review with the way it started - WOW!

As fate would have it, the canopy that blew off my plane while 400ft high and about 1/2 mile away was discovered by another member the day after this one arrived.  It's exactly the same as what came on the Radian and cheaper than ordering it anywhere else if this is all you need.

Works as good as the name brand bags and less than half the price!  The rolls are too large to fit into the dispenser on my foodsaver so I took a piece of 1" PVC and used that as the inner roller and rolled half of each roll onto these and now they fit perfectly and the PVC rollers will last forever and obviously you could use 3/4" but I happened to have some leftover 1" which is the same size as the cardboard tube that comes with the bags.  I'll be reordering these as needed as they work perfectly and save me even more money.

I have ordered this identical bathrobe in the past from a certain well known specialty online retailer at a cost of $70+shipping.  Of course, this one doesn't carry the prestigious label but it is the same robe.  I'm a big guy and "one size fits all" robes look like doll clothes on me.  Even most XL's aren't long enough and with enough shoulder room for my frame.  This XXL is big, comfortable, soft, colorfast, pre-shrunk and an overall bargain.  I'll be ordering a couple more to have in storage in case Amazon stops carrying this particular brand and size.

Baldacci started his writing in the late 90's with really good books like Absolute Power and Total Control - these were standalone novels that ranked with the best thrillers being written.  After a series of these standalone novels, he started entering into formula writing with the King & Maxwell series, then branching into the Camel Club.  With each of these iterations, he has gotten further and further from that which made him an outstanding writer and now with this Puller series, he has truly fallen into a cesspool of mediocrity.I tried reading this book twice.  First time, I got about 25% into it and just didn't see the point.  While the premise was interesting, the execution was simply boring.  Put it away and went on to read a couple of really good independent authors but I kept coming back to the reviews on Amazon and with 2400 people LOVING this book, felt like I had really missed something or was just in the wrong mood for the book so I picked i up again.This time I got to 55% of the book and could simply take no more.  It was dull, uninspired, moving lethargically towards a conclusion that I frankly, was not all that interested in.  This time the book went down for good and it the last Baldacci book I will buy - that's why we have libraries.Obviously I'm in a very, very small minority in my review of the book.  Equally obvious is that all those 4 and 5 star reviews are seeing something I completely missed.  But I still felt compelled to write this, only in the hopes that someday we may get another Absolute Power out of Baldacci instead of canned and processed writing.  I really wish I could have been in the majority that loved this book but sadly, after two attempts, I'm just going to have to be in the "didn't like it category".

I read this for the first time many years ago and just downloaded to read it again on my Kindle.  I've always liked this authors work, especially those that deal with the southwest.  Her books move along nicely, don't include gratuitous sex or violence although it's there when it's appropriate.  The stories are always well thought out, not particularly challenging to read and make for a nice way to pass a rainy weekend.  Try her books, you won't be disappointed.

Almost perfect!  It hold my Keurig on top, the drawer opens and closes easily and it holds a nice supply of k-cups.  The one deficiency is that there needs to be dividers running perpendicular to the existing ones.  This would create a neat little compartment for each cup.  As it is, once you've used a couple of cups out of a row, they start falling over.  Now, you can turn them upside down for more stability but then you can't really see what is in the pod.  I have not seen one with individual compartments and so I'm happy with this one until I do.

I've owned, but will never own again, so called "bagless" vacuum cleaners and hated every one of them.  You can spend more on all the special HEPA and micro filters than you would on bags for your bagged cleaner.  Bags really only have to do a few things:  Not burst, not let dust escape, not decrease dramatically in efficiency as they fill and, as a nice optional feature - somewhat clean the air.Well, these bags do all of the above and quite nicely.  Regular bags, after a couple weeks in the machine, seem to develop a stale odor.  These are treated so as to prevent that smell from developing.  They capture dust very well - no exhaust at all.  They also seem as if they will last longer than the "plain" paper bags we've been using.If I have any complaint it's that they are a little harder to install.  The paper is thicker than normal and pushing it onto the exhaust pipe inside the bag is just a touch more difficult but hardly worth downgrading the bag for.  All in all, I will continue to use these as the house does seem to smell better after a good vacuum (especially important in that we own a dog that sheds in copious quantities).

Well, the Shakespearean ripoff finally comes to an end but what a bloody violent end it is.  While the entire series has been masterful, Sutter leaned way too hard on the violence angle in act VII.  Was there some minimum body count required per episode?  How about a shocking level of gore?  Maybe lots and lots of gratuitous sex scenes?  Whatever the requirement was, it was certainly met!If I sound harsh, it's only because seasons 1-6 were truly good drama while season 7 seemed to be out to shock the viewer more than entertain.  And, it ends pretty much the same way Shakespeare ended the play(s) of a similar theme.  Still one of the best series to ever appear on TV and well worth the viewers time as long as they are not easily offended by violence, sex and gore.

This is an absolutely incredible wax for show car purposes,mediocre at best for that daily driver.  The problem is in the durability - there is little to none in the blazing Arizona sun.  However, the dept of shine is unmatched by any products I've used.  It gives an almost wet look to the car with an incredible depth to the paint.  You will need to claybar your paint first if you want best finish as there appears to be zero cleaners in this wax - it is truly a wax.I did one half of my single stage paint car (no clear coat) with this and the other  half with my standby, Turtle Carnuba/Cleaner wax.  The butter wax side was noticeably deeper and shinier and you could tell it had "fed" the paint because that side had more color depth and luster.  Unfortunately, one week of daily driving and the butter wax side was fading noticeably.  I can usually get three months out of the Turtle here in the desert southwest.So if you're trying to win that car show, impress friends then it's an excellent wax for that.  Not particularly difficult to apply or remove so waxing won't be an all day job.  Just don't look for it to provide much in the way of long term protection.

All of Ellsworth's books are enjoyably readable and while not particularly heavy in subject matter, hold the readers interest quite well.  His courtroom/legal descriptions are excellent and geared towards the layman, not other attorneys.  I would suggest to new readers that they start with book one and work their way through as the books chronicle the life and times of the protagonist - Thaddeus Murfee.  Knowing how he go to where he is in any given book just makes them that much more enjoyable.  One of the few independent writers where I pre-order the book!

Not being used for the intended purpose but rather as wing protection on model aircraft gliders than land without benefit of landing gear.  Once stuck to the foam, it stays there forever and provides tremendous protection.

Our association uses these for webcasting our board meetings and we suggest any residents who wish to participate virtually use them as they eliminate the echo effect.  We also use them on all the computers in our lab since we don't want speakers bothering other users.  Clarity is excellent and the voice function works very well.  I do wish the voice boom wasn't so flexible - a stiff shaft would have worked better IMHO but hard to beat the quality of these for the price.

I hate to bad mouth a product that I received for free but then the whole idea of the Vine program is to generate honest reviews so here goes.I've been a Norelco user for 50+ years, through the good (made in USA) to the bad (made in China) and the in-between (now made in China but in a plant owned and managed by corporate).  My current model gives a very close shave and I have a heavy beard.  That gives me some basis of comparison.I was sent the gone hunting model which is kind of silly in itself.  I guess if you're really into camo and hunting, it has some appeal but it's just window dressing to the real issue and that is how closely and comfortably it shaves.  Sadly to say, it fell short in the closeness area compared to its more well known competitor.  It was comfortable enough but I suspect that's because it wasn't providing a close shave, just kind of gliding across my beard rather than cutting it.It was so bad the first time, I kept checking to see if there was some plastic protectors on the shaving heads that I had not removed but no, it was just not providing a good grooming experience.  Then I tried it wet and while it seemed to perform somewhat better, if I'm going to go to all that trouble, I might as well take up a blade.  I like electric shavers because they are quick and I can move around somewhat while shaving.  I've never gotten into the whole lather up my face and take a nice bladed razor to it - to me shaving is more of a chore than an "experience".If I was going to spend this kind of money on an electric, I'd just get the top of the line competitor and get the closest possible electric shave.  If I want to show off to my hunting buddies by having the only camo shaver in camp, this is it - of course, real hunters don't shave during hunting season.I see by all the rave reviews that I'm in a very small minority so perhaps the reader should take that into account when making a buying decision.  Fortunately, Amazon is so good about customer service that if you buy it through them and are unhappy, it's very easy to return.

This is a very nice edition to the Pines series and is a nice reflection on the way the Pines author, Blake Crouch, has allowed others to build on his trilogy - truly a unique idea in writing.My only caution is that you DO NOT read this book before reading the Pines series (or at least the first book in the series).  If you read this in advance, some of the surprise and suspense of the first Crouch book will be lost and you do not want that to happen.

I'm not sure what marketing strategy Amazon is following as they seem to take away content with each successive generation.  This gen is lacking the mini-hdmi port out that was on the 1st generation Fire.  Probably not a big deal to many folks but I often give presentations from it using an HDMI cable to a big screen TV.  It also really bugs me that I've got to inevitably buy a new cover for each generation but I guess that's a great way to keep selling covers.At the current price of 109 (black Friday weekend), it certainly is an inexpensive tablet that is quite capable.  At some point, I do wish Amazon would make the battery serviceable since it will last about two years with daily use and then not hold a charge.  That's why this one was purchased and I'm sure in another two years, I'll need another just because of the battery.

Mr. Meighan,It should be apparent from all the negative reviews here that the "downgrades" to the Deluxe version have greatly alienated a lot of very loyal customers.  The mere fact that you've had to write an open letter and respond to so many reviews should tell you something.When I started using TT in the late 90's, there weren't a lot of other choices but I was happy with your product and remained a customer since that time.  I'm also a dedicated Quicken users and like the fact the two programs can "talk" to one another.  FWIW, I also taught college in Fredericksburg, Va. and had dozens of your employees come through my classes and hopefully provided them with some additional business management skills to benefit Intuit.  All this is background to let you know they don't come any more committed then me, even though I'm usually angry when I'm forced to upgrade my Quicken periodically but I always bite the bullet and do so.Now I'm ready to start the initial work on my 2014 taxes, come to Amazon to download TT and as always, research what others have experienced.  Now I'm hearing things like "reduced functionality" or "hey, you can still mail it in with those schedules".  Well, who mails their tax returns when they are using software to prepare them?  Plus, I wish to file online to take advantage of the Amazon 10% gift card bonus, something I don't believe I can do if filing my mail.Just my own opinion, but when almost half the early adopters of the 2014 software are slamming it for these changes, it is perhaps time to look inward and consider that perhaps Intuit has made a huge error and take steps to correct it.  Perhaps you need, as a corporation, to bit the bullet and pull Deluxe from the market and offer the Premier edition for the remainder of the tax season at the same price as Deluxe.  Will it hurt profits?  Sure.  Will it build customer goodwill - you betcha!  Will it insure returning customers keep returning and keep referring others - Absolutely!If you continue down this road of answering negative reviews with what is basically a "you can make it work - sort of", you are going to maximize short term profits at the expense of long term customer retention.  If I taught your employees anything, I hope it was that a customer is the most valuable commodity a company has and don't ever, ever loose them over foolish, and preventable, reasons.  It costs WAY more to get them back then it does to keep them.Thank you.Update 03/18/15:  Fairness works in both directions and so I must acknowledge that Intuit finally recognized the error of their ways and corrected the problem.  Better late than never certainly applies here and it looks like they've already committed to next years product returning to the old one we all knew and loved.No doubt from the reviews here that Intuit did a great deal of corporate PR damage.  Much of it is, unfortunately, permanent and those customers will never return, especially since they have since purchased a competitive product, been happy with it and will now be able to easily export this years data into next years return.

WTH, this is supposed to be a newer generation then my first one and yet it lacks cameras!  It only ordered it because it was recommended by the customer service agent as a replacement for my 2nd gen Fire that had the battery fail after two years.  It went back in the mail as a return the same day it was received.Amazon needs to address their battery technology.  I get about two years out of my Kindle batteries and now it looks like the same expectation for the Fire products.  Two years is not good but hey, at least make the darn things serviceable so that a user can EASILY and INEXPENSIVELY replace the battery every two years.  Don't make me buy new devices every two years or I will find alternatives.

I'll always give almost any book a chance to enthrall me and in this case, I hung in for 25% of the book and then flat gave up.  There is no excitement, no drama, no real courtroom action, basically a whole lot of character development that was leading nowhere.  Reads very much like a book that was due to the publisher by a certain deadline and was cobbled together for that reason alone.  If I did not know Grisham is capable of far, far better writing, I might have rated it higher but for someone with his talent, this is a lackluster attempt at best.
